Capeletti Memorial Ramp & Jose Regueiro Avenue in Miami-Dade County; directs Department of Transportation to erect suitable markers, etc.

6.last_action: Died in Committee on Civil Justice & Courts Policy (CCJP)

6.description: Creates Florida Firearms Freedom Act; provides legislative findings & definitions; provides that specified firearms, firearm accessories, & ammunition for personal use manufactured in state are not subject to federal law or regulation, etc.

7.last_action: Died in Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council
7.title: Parole for Adolescent Offenders
7.description: Designates act "Second Chance for Children in Prison Act"; provides that adolescent offender who was younger than specified age at time of offense & sentenced to life or 10 years or more in prison is eligible for parole if incarcerated for minimum period, has not previously been convicted of or adjudicated delinquent for certain offenses, & did not commit or threaten to commit act of violence during current offense, etc.

8.title: Temporary and Concurrent Custody of a Child [SPSC]
8.description: Provides that parent assigned to military service on orders in excess of specified period may designate person to exercise time-sharing on parent's behalf; limits who may be designated; provides for expedited hearings; requires servicemember & nonmilitary parent to cooperate to resolve issues & share information, etc.

"Skip" McDonald Memorial Highway & Trooper Charles Eugene Campbell Memorial Highway in Taylor County, Frank Pasquarella Way, Bob Arbetter's Way, & Don Shula Drive in Miami-Dade County, Captain Chad Allen Reed, Sr., Memorial Highway in Dixie County, & Trooper Ronald Gordon Smith Memorial Bridge in Citrus County; directs DOT to erect suitable markers.

10.title: Public Education [SPSC]
10.description: Prohibits district school boards, administrative personnel, & instructional personnel from taking affirmative action that infringes or waives rights or freedoms afforded by First Amendment to United States Constitution in absence of certain consent.

11.description: Increases penalty imposed for second or subsequent offense of selling, giving, or serving alcoholic beverages to person under 21 years of age within specified period following prior offense; provides defense.

12.description: Prohibits deficiency decrees in final judgments in foreclosure actions on homestead property; specifies deficiency decrees as unenforceable.

13.description: Creates "Florida Ban on Texting While Driving Law"; prohibits operation of motor vehicle while using wireless communications device for certain purposes; provides for enforcement as secondary action; provides for assessment of points against driver's license for unlawful use of wireless communications device resulting in crash.

89.description: Terminates administration of FCAT to students in grades 9 through 12; requires PSAT/NMSQT to replace grade 10 FCAT for purposes of measuring student's knowledge & skills; requires students to take PSAT/NMSQT in grade 10 & earn passing scores to qualify for standard high school diploma; requires State Board of Education to designate passing scores; requires use of student performance on PSAT/NMSQT for school grading purposes, etc.

90.last_action: Died in Full Appropriations Council on Education & Economic Development
90.title: Juvenile Justice
90.description: Authorizes conditions of preadjudicatory release for certain children; permits child to be taken into custody for violations of preadjudicatory release conditions; provides that child taken into custody for violation of preadjudicatory release conditions must appear before judge within 24 hours; provides that detention care under specified provision does not require risk assessment, etc.

91.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
91.title: Congressional Vacancies
91.description: Provides for special election to fill vacant U.S. Senate position; provides circumstance under which Governor is not required to call such special election; repeals Governor's authority to make temporary appointment to U.S. Senate vacancy.

92.title: Child-Restraint Requirements
92.description: Provides child-restraint requirements for children 4-7 years old; provides exceptions; redefines term "motor vehicle" to exclude certain vehicles from such requirements; provides grace period.

93.title: Immigration
93.description: Prohibits agencies from entering into contract for contractual services with contractors not registered & participating in federal work authorization program by specified date; provides procedures & requirements with respect to registration of contractors & subcontractors; provides for enforcement; provides schedule for phased compliance, etc.

94.last_action: Died in Economic Development & Community Affairs Policy Council, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 971 (Ch. 2010-223)
94.title: Drowsy Driving Prevention
94.description: Creates "Ronshay Dugans Act"; designates Drowsy Driving Prevention Week; encourages DHSMV & DOT to educate law enforcement community & public about relationship between fatigue & driving performance.

95.last_action: Withdrawn from Health Care Services Policy (HFPC); Health Care Appropriations (CGHC); Health & Family Services Policy Council; Withdrawn prior to introduction -HJ 00027
95.title: Protection of Children
95.description: Revises definition of "child care personnel" to include persons who work in summer 24-hour camps; requires summer day camps & summer 24-hour camps to be licensed by DCFS & requires employees thereof to undergo level 2 background screening; repeals exemption from fingerprinting requirements for summer camp personnel.

96.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 2272 (Ch. 2010-211)
96.title: Controlled Substances
96.description: Requires AHCA to contract with multistate electronic prescribing network to provide certain agencies with access to certain controlled substance information; revises requirements for registration of pain-management clinics; requires DOH to refuse to register pain-management clinics under certain circumstances; specifies additional grounds for disciplinary action against certain licensed practitioners & community pharmacy permittees, etc.

97.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
97.title: Programs to Assist Victims of Violence
97.description: Requires that additional or increased court cost or surcharge be assessed against defendant who pleads guilty or nolo contendere to, or is found guilty of, regardless of adjudication, certain specified criminal offenses; provides for proceeds of additional or increased court cost or surcharge to be deposited into Rape Crisis Program Trust Fund or Domestic Violence Trust Fund.

98.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Policy (EPC)
98.title: Statewide Assessments
98.description: Revises provisions relating to schedule for administering comprehensive statewide assessments to provide exception with respect to certain religious holidays.

99.last_action: Unfavorable by General Government Policy Council, laid on Table; YEAS 6 NAYS 8 -HJ 00408
99.title: Vessel Safety
99.description: Revises certain requirements for operating personal watercraft; prohibits operation of such watercraft by certain persons except under adult supervision; revises requirements relating to boating safety course required for leasing or renting personal watercraft from livery.

100.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 814 (Ch. 2010-190)
100.title: Lifeline Telecommunications Service
100.description: Authorizes commercial mobile radio service provider to offer Lifeline services; authorizes DCFS, DOE, PSC, & Office of Public Counsel to exchange information with telecommunications carriers & mobile radio service providers so carriers & providers can identify & enroll eligible person in Lifeline & Link-Up programs; requires PSC, DCFS, Office of Public Counsel, & each eligible telecommunications carrier to convene Lifeline Workgroup.

101.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
101.title: Efficiency in Procurement and Contracting
101.description: Establishes Advisory Committee on State Procurement for purpose of evaluating state procurement process & carrying out legislative policy; provides policy of Legislature with respect to procurement of goods, services, & facilities by state; provides for membership, organization, staffing, duties, & powers of committee; requires state agency cooperation, etc. APPROPRIATION: $3,500,000.

102.last_action: Withdrawn from Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA); Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC); Economic Development & Community Affairs Policy Council; Withdrawn prior to introduction -HJ 00028
102.title: Volusia County
102.description: Directs board of county commissioners to issue certificate of public convenience & necessity to applicant for licensure as basic life support or advanced life support service that will operate in municipality within county which has population greater than 30,000, upon request of municipality, under specified conditions.

103.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
103.title: Standards of Conduct
103.description: Expands definition of term "public officer"; creates additional prohibitions against doing business with one's agency, accepting unauthorized compensation, having conflicting employment or contractual relationships, lobbying, or consulting; revises construction of code of ethics for public officers & employees; provides criminal penalties for code violations.

104.last_action: Substituted CS/SB 436; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 436 (Ch. 2010-23) -HJ 00637
104.title: Community Colleges
104.description: Amends specified provision re educational institutes; conforms provisions; renames Central Florida Community College as "College of Central Florida," renames Lake City Community College as "Florida Gateway College," renames Palm Beach Community College as "Palm Beach State College," & renames Seminole Community College as "Seminole State College of Florida."

105.last_action: Withdrawn from Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP); Criminal & Civil Justice Appropriations (CGHC); Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council; Withdrawn prior to introduction -HJ 00028
105.title: Driving or Boating Under the Influence
105.description: Authorizes law enforcement officer to arrest person without warrant when there is probable cause to believe person has committed any of specified driving or boating under influence violations.

106.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
106.title: Special Risk Class Retirement Benefits
106.description: Prohibits certain members of Special Risk Class from being reemployed or contracting with same employing agency from which member retired; extends period of time during which certain Special Risk Class members may participate in FRS DROP, etc.

107.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
107.title: Clinical Perfusionists
107.description: Specifies financial responsibility requirements for clinical perfusionists; requires supervising physician to be qualified in medical area in which clinical perfusionist performs; prescribes duties of clinical perfusionist; requires clinical perfusionist to convey that he or she is clinical perfusionist to patient; authorizes clinical perfusionist to perform medical tasks & services within certain protocol, etc.

108.title: Community College Student Fees
108.description: Authorizes community college boards of trustees to establish transportation access fee; limits amount of fee; provides timeframe for fee increase & implementation of increase; prohibits inclusion of fee in calculating amount student receives under Florida Bright Futures Scholarship Program awards.

109.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 1271 (Ch. 2010-225)
109.title: Wreckers
109.description: Revises provisions for exceptions to vehicle weight limits applicable to wreckers; provides that specified license tax provisions apply to wreckers used for certain purposes.

110.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 704; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 704 (Ch. 2010-120) -HJ 01166
110.title: Capital Felonies
110.description: Provides that it shall be aggravating circumstance for purpose of determining sentence if capital felony was committed by person subject to injunction or protection order against petitioner who obtained that injunction or order or any of certain related persons.

111.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 200; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 200 (Ch. 2010-95) -HJ 01169
111.title: Parole Interview Dates for Certain Inmates
111.description: Extends from 5 to 7 years period between parole interview dates for inmates convicted of violating specified provisions or serving mandatory minimum sentence under specified provision.

112.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-82; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 971 (Ch. 2010-223)
112.title: Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles [CPSC]
112.description: Requires application form for motor vehicle registration or renewal of registration to include language permitting applicant to make voluntary contribution to Prevent Child Sexual Abuse; requires application form for original, renewal, or replacement driver's license or identification card to include language permitting applicant to make voluntary contribution to certain nonprofit organizations, etc.

113.last_action: Died in Finance & Tax Council, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)

113.description: Tolls statute of limitations relating to proceedings involving tax lien certificates or tax deeds by period of intervening bankruptcy; requires property appraiser to physically inspect property upon request of certificateholder; provides that county or municipal governing body authority to grant ad valorem tax exemptions may be renewed for multiple 10-year periods upon approval by referendum, etc.

114.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
114.title: Culpable Negligence
114.description: Creates "Officer Jose Somohano Assault Weapons Act"; provides that person commits felony of third degree if he or she stores or leaves assault weapon within reach or easy access of another person if that person obtains weapon & uses it to inflict injury or death; provides exceptions; defines "assault weapon."

115.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA)
115.title: Vanpools
115.description: Creates exemption from tax on sales, use, & other transactions for leases of passenger vehicles for commuting purposes; defines term "vanpool lease."

116.last_action: Withdrawn from Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA); Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP); Rules and Calendar Council; Economic Development & Community Affairs Policy Council; Withdrawn prior to introduction
116.title: Offenses by Public Officials or Others
116.description: Prohibits engaging in certain activities to deprive another of his or her right of honest services; provides for construction in accordance with specified federal law.

117.last_action: Died in Committee on Energy & Utilities Policy (GGPC)
117.title: Water and Wastewater Utilities
117.description: Provides for recovery through surcharge of costs for water & wastewater system improvement projects; requires PSC approval of surcharge; limits surcharge amount; provides requirements for surcharge billing, reconciliation, & adjustment; provides project eligibility criteria; provides requirements for notice, maintenance, & availability of certain records.

118.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
118.title: Insurance Coverage for Prescription Drugs
118.description: Prohibits limiting, reducing, or denying prescription drug coverage under health insurance policies or health maintenance contracts for individuals under specified circumstances; preserves insurer or HMO authority to make specified uniform changes; requires insurers & HMO's to notify insureds of such changes; specifies nonapplication to Medicaid managed care plans.

119.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 907 (Ch. 2010-199)
119.title: Alimony
119.description: Allows for award of more than one type of alimony; revises factors to be considered in whether to award alimony or maintenance; provides for award of bridge-the-gap alimony for limited period; provides that such award is not modifiable; provides for award of rehabilitative alimony, durational alimony, & permanent alimony in certain circumstances; provides for modification or termination of such awards.

120.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
120.title: Data Destruction
120.description: Requires all public agencies & private entities that collect personal information to adhere to specified procedures when destroying such information; requires such agencies & entities to maintain copy of such procedures; requires all state agencies to submit sampling of sanitized media to third-party vendor for verification of data destruction; requires DMS to adopt rules.

121.title: Communications Services Taxes [WPSC]
121.description: Authorizes dealers to report credit for bad debt by netting credit against tax due; authorizes dealers to use proportionate allocation method or other reasonable method in determining amount of bad debt attributable to state or local jurisdiction; provides for retroactive operation; specifies that act is remedial in nature & not basis for refunds of tax.

122.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 2440; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 2440 (Ch. 2010-27) -HJ 00745
122.title: Liability Releases
122.description: Redefines term "nonspectators" to include minor on whose behalf natural guardian has signed motorsport liability release; provides that motorsport liability release signed by natural guardian on behalf of minor participating in sanctioned motorsports event is valid to same extent as for other nonspectators, etc.

123.last_action: Withdrawn from Health Care Services Policy (HFPC); Government Accountability Act Council; Health Care Appropriations (CGHC); Health & Family Services Policy Council; Withdrawn prior to introduction -HJ 00031
123.title: Homelessness
123.description: Requires DCFS to create lead agencies for homeless for certain purposes; transfers responsibilities & powers of local coalitions for homeless to lead agencies for homeless.

125.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
125.title: Provider Contracts
125.description: Proscribes specified fee setting provisions in patient services contracts between health care practitioners & health insurers, prepaid limited health service organizations, or health maintenance organizations.

126.description: Includes within DOH's environmental health program investigation of food service programs of domestic violence centers & group care homes; excludes domestic violence centers from definition of term "food service establishment" under certain conditions.

127.last_action: Died in Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council
127.title: Vehicle Crashes Involving Death
127.description: Requires that defendant arrested for leaving scene of crash involving death must be held in custody until brought before judge for admittance to bail in certain circumstances.

128.last_action: Withdrawn from PreK-12 Policy (EPC); Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA); PreK-12 Appropriations (CEED); Education Policy Council; Withdrawn prior to introduction -HJ 00031
128.title: Extended School Day Programs
128.description: Creates pilot program in Miami-Dade County that authorizes school districts to enter into agreements with county recreation department for purpose of using facilities for extended school day programs in approved middle schools & high schools.

129.last_action: Died in Full Appropriations Council on Education & Economic Development
129.title: Locksmith Services
129.description: Creates Florida Locksmith Services Act; requires licensure of locksmith services businesses & locksmith referral services by DOACS; requires fingerprinting & background screening of owner & certain other persons affiliated with locksmith services business; disqualifies certain persons from performing locksmith services based upon background screening, etc.

130.title: Real Estate Appraisers/Appraisal Management Co. [CPSC]
130.description: Revises membership of Florida Real Estate Appraisal Board; requires appraisal management companies to register with DBPR; specifies application requirements & procedures; requires application, registration, & renewal fees for appraisal management companies; requires fingerprinting & criminal history records checks of, & provides qualifications for, certain persons who control appraisal management companies, etc.

131.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1152 (Ch. 2010-125)

131.description: Revises term "legally authorized person" for purposes of Florida Funeral, Cemetery, & Consumer Services Act.

132.title: Water Protection and Sustainability Program
132.description: Revises requirements for expenditure of funds provided pursuant to program; specifies authority for Northwest & Suwannee River Water Management Districts to use such funds for additional purposes.

133.title: Violations of Injunctions for Protection
133.description: Adds circumstances that violate injunction for protection against repeat violence, sexual violence, or dating violence.

134.title: Debt Settlement Services
134.description: Provides powers of OFR; authorizes FSC to adopt rules; provides exceptions from applicability of provisions regulating debt settlement services; provides an exception for attorneys representing clients; requires debt settlement organizations to be registered with OFR; provides registration fee; requires background screening of applicants & control persons, etc. APPROPRIATION: $475,705.

135.title: Adoption [SPSC]
135.description: Prohibits adoption agency or entity from making suitability determinations based on, requiring disclosure relating to, or restricting lawful possession, storage, or use of firearm or ammunition; provides additional requirements for child-placing agencies; provides additional rulemaking requirements for DCFS; creates additional grounds for denial, suspension, or revocation of license.

136.title: Threats [SPSC]
136.description: Revises provisions relating to sending of or procuring sending of letters or inscribed communications containing certain threats of death or bodily injury; includes electronic communications in provisions.

137.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
137.title: Medical Expenses/Inmates/County or Municipality
137.description: Requires that payments made by county or municipality to provider for certain services for an arrested person be made at state's Medicaid rate.

138.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-232; companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5 (Ch. 2010-230), CS/CS/HB 1033 (Ch. 2010-233)
138.title: Road Designations [CPSC]
138.description: Designates Veterans Memorial Highway & Sergeant Ricky Lord Road in Gilchrist County & Anthony J. Perez Street, Orange Bowl Way, John Torrese Family Road, Manuel Capo Way, Manuel Capo Boulevard, & Lt. Colonel Charles Brown Memorial Highway in Miami-Dade County; revises designation of Jose A. Marques Boulevard in Miami-Dade County; directs DOT to erect suitable markers.

139.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA)
139.title: Use of an Electronic Communications Device/Driving
139.description: Prohibits composing, sending, reading, or viewing text message on electronic communications device while operating motor vehicle; provides exceptions; provides for construction; provides penalties.

140.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-80; companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5501 (Ch. 2010-163)
140.title: Uniform Traffic Control [WPSC]
140.description: Preempts to state use of cameras to enforce traffic laws; authorizes counties & municipalities to use traffic infraction detectors under certain circumstances; creates Mark Wandall Traffic Safety Program; authorizes DHSMV, county, or municipality to use traffic infraction detector to identify motor vehicle that fails to stop at traffic control signal steady red light, etc. APPROPRIATION: $100,000.

141.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 1196 (Ch. 2010-174)

141.description: Revises definition of term "developer" to exclude bulk assignee or bulk buyer; revises jurisdiction of Division of Florida Condominiums, Timeshares, & Mobile Homes to include bulk assignees & bulk buyers; creates "Distressed Condominium Relief Act"; specifies responsibilities, liabilities, duties, & limitations of bulk assignees & bulk buyers; provides for transfer of control of board of administration, etc.

142.last_action: Unfavorable by Civil Justice & Courts Policy (CCJP), laid on Table; YEAS 4 NAYS 9 -HJ 00273
142.title: Condominium Foreclosures
142.description: Requires certain condominium unit tenants to pay moneys owed on behalf of unit to association; provides liability; provides tenant's obligations to association; provides condominium associations with certain powers; requires mortgagee to request estoppel letter from association prior to filing foreclosure action; authorizes association to charge fee for production of estoppel letter, etc.

143.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
143.title: Child Pornography
143.description: Revises definition of "child pornography" to include visual depictions in which it appears that a minor is engaging in sexual conduct; provides that proof of identity of minor is not required; includes possession of child pornography within specified offenses.

144.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA)
144.title: Use of Cellular Telephones
144.description: Prohibits use of cellular telephone while operating motor vehicle except when using headset or hands-free device; provides exemptions; provides penalty; provides for enforcement only as secondary offense.

145.title: Tax on Transient Rentals
145.description: Expands description of specified business activities relating to transient rental accommodations subject to specified transient rental taxation requirements; requires specified persons to register with DOR & report & remit tax on specified transient rentals; provides requirements, procedures, & limitations; requires DOR to provide amnesty for specified unpaid taxes, penalties, & interest, etc.

146.last_action: Died in Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council
146.title: Condominiums
146.description: Provides requirements for notice of delinquency; prohibits condominium association from imposing certain penalties for delinquency during notice period under certain conditions or while objection made within such notice period accompanied by proof of payment of certain assessments or charges is unresolved.

147.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
147.title: Elections
147.description: Requires acceptance of federal write-in absentee ballot for voter registration when ballot contains certain information; requires counting of absentee ballots cast by overseas voters in election if received within 10 days after election & legal; revises printed instructions which accompany absentee ballot, etc.

148.title: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center & Research Institute [SPSC]
148.description: Revises provisions relating to establishment of institute & specifies primary responsibilities; conforms provisions relating to agreement by Board of Governors & not-for-profit corporation for use of facilities; specifies that corporation & its not-for-profit subsidiaries shall conclusively act as instrumentalities of state for purposes of sovereign immunity, etc.

150.last_action: Unfavorable by Finance & Tax Council, laid on Table; YEAS 3 NAYS 12 -HJ 00341
150.title: Alcoholic Beverage Regulation
150.description: Provides exemption from specified taxes on alcoholic beverages provided by distillers for spirituous beverage tastings; provides Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco with certain requirements regarding registration of brands & labels, fee payments, & notices; authorizes distillers to conduct spirituous beverage tastings under specified conditions, etc.

151.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
151.title: Criminal Justice
151.description: Provides criminal penalties for certain violations of standards of conduct for public officials in addition to existing penalties; defines term "under color of law"; provides for reclassification of offenses committed if commission of offense was furthered or facilitated by person acting under color of law; provides exception; defines term "willfully", etc.

152.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Policy (EPC)
152.title: School Food Services
152.description: Provides that district school board policies for operation of school food service programs include requirement that schools provide & post nutritional information for daily meals; requires each school district with summer nutrition program to provide such information.

154.last_action: Died in Committee on State Universities & Private Colleges Policy (EPC)
154.title: Charter Technical Career Centers
154.description: Creates Charter Technical Career Center Associate in Applied Science & Associate in Science Degrees Program; authorizes charter technical career centers to submit proposals to State Board of Education to offer specified degree programs; authorizes centers to offer degree programs through partnerships with community colleges or direct authority; provides requirements for funding & implementation.

155.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Appropriations (CGHC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 742 (Ch. 2010-188)
155.title: Public Safety Telecommunicators
155.description: Includes dispatching as function of E911 service; includes fees for certification & recertification collected by DOH in authorized expenditures for E911 services; revises applicability of disciplinary actions & penalties; redefines "emergency dispatcher" as "public safety telecommunicator"; provides requirements for training & certification of public safety telecommunicators, including fees, etc.

156.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted SB 1150; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1150 (Ch. 2010-124) -HJ 01134
156.title: Registration of Farm Labor Contractors & Employees
156.description: Defines term "timely application for renewal" for purposes of federal certificates of registration as farm labor contractors & employees; requires renewal of farm labor contractor & employee certificates of registration; requires DBPR to suspend, revoke, or refuse to issue or renew certificates of registration under certain circumstances.

157.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
157.title: Workplace Safety
157.description: Requires public employers to submit by certain date injury & illness data to Division of Workers' Compensation in Department of Financial Services using specified form; authorizes division to adopt rules; requires division to compile data from reports & make data available on division's website; requires employer to retain reports for 7 years, etc.

158.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 998; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1237 (Ch. 2010-132), CS/CS/SB 998 (Ch. 2010-122) -HJ 01166
158.title: Trust Administration
158.description: Limits personal representative's entitlement to payment from trust of specified estate expenses & obligations; specifies application of specified criteria in making payments from trust; specifies application of additional provisions to liability for specified estate expense & obligation payments from trust; deletes notice requirements relating to court review of trustee's employment of specified persons, etc.

159.description: Prohibits specified acts done with intent to assist career offender in eluding law enforcement agency that is seeking to find career offender to question career offender about, or to arrest career offender for, his or her noncompliance; makes prohibitions inapplicable to career offenders incarcerated in or in custody of specified facilities.

160.description: Prohibits mailing or delivery of unsolicited checks; provides exception; provides penalty; exempts credit card bearers from liability for unauthorized use of such checks.

161.last_action: Died in Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 808 (Ch. 2010-121)
161.title: Murder
161.description: Provides that murder in first degree includes unlawful killing of human being which resulted from unlawful distribution of methadone by person aged 18 or older when such drug is proven to be proximate cause of death of user.

162.last_action: Died in Committee on Economic Development Policy (EDCA)
162.title: Enterprise Zones
162.description: Authorizes county governing bodies to apply to OTTED to amend boundary of specified enterprise zones; authorizes OTTED to approve amendment application subject to specified requirements; requires OTTED to establish amendment effective date; authorizes Martin County to apply to OTTED for designation of enterprise zone; authorizes OTTED to designate enterprise zone in Martin County.

163.last_action: Withdrawn from Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC); Health & Family Services Policy Council; Withdrawn prior to introduction -HJ 00037
163.title: Pain-Management Clinics
163.description: Prohibits person from owning or operating pain-management clinic unless he or she is physician with clear & active license to practice in Florida; provides that pain-management clinic may not be owned by, employ, or contract with certain physicians or certain persons; prohibits person from prescribing or dispensing any medication on premises of pain-management clinic unless he or she is licensed physician; provides exception for licensed pharmacist.

164.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
164.title: Regulation/Hoisting Equipment
164.description: Requires applicant for building permit to submit certain information to local building official; requires radio communications between certain crane operators; requires certain preparations for hurricane or high-wind event; requires preparedness plan for certain cranes; requires that hoisting equipment be secured in specified manner under certain circumstances, etc.

165.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
165.title: Nursing Services
165.description: Requires hospitals to establish nurse staffing collaborative councils; requires council to produce annual hospital nurse staffing plans; requires chief nurse executive to communicate with council to ensure appropriate implementation of nurse staffing plan; requires council to conduct semiannual review of nurse staffing plan; requires nurse staffing plan to be reviewed with nursing personnel.

166.title: Prohibited Discrimination
166.description: Prohibits discrimination based on sexual orientation & gender identity or expression; defines terms; substitutes references to "disability" for references to "handicap"; revises & conforms terminology.

167.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
167.title: Community Redevelopment
167.description: Expands definition of term "blighted area" to include land previously used as military facility.

168.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
168.title: Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program
168.description: Provides that prekindergarten instructors in school-year prekindergarten programs delivered by private providers & public schools must meet new professional credentialing requirements beginning July 1, 2013; repeals provisions relating to aspirational goals for professional credentials of prekindergarten instructors.

169.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
169.title: Municipal Elections
169.description: Provides circumstances under which candidate without opposition due to specified vacancy in candidacy shall be declared elected to office without having to reopen qualifying period & hold municipal special election.

170.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA)
170.title: Child-restraint Requirements
170.description: Provides child-restraint requirements for certain children ages 4 through 7; redefines term "motor vehicle" to exclude certain vehicles from such requirements; provides grace period & exceptions.

172.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information held by public transit provider for purpose of facilitating prepayment of transit fares or acquisition of prepaid transit fare card or similar device; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

173.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 644; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 644 (Ch. 2010-98) -HJ 01165
173.title: Direct-support Organization/Military Affairs
173.description: Authorizes direct-support organization for DMA to support processing of requests from Soldiers & Airmen Assistance Program or similar programs; authorizes president of direct-support organization to appoint all members of board of directors; requires direct-support organization to operate pursuant to contract with DMA; requires direct-support organization to submit its annual budget & financial reports to DMA, etc.
