174.description: Defines term "mental injury" with respect to offenses of child abuse & aggravated child abuse; requires expert witness who testifies regarding child's mental injury to have certain credentials; provides affirmative defenses to offenses of child abuse, aggravated child abuse, & neglect; redefines term "crime" for purposes of crime victim compensation to include additional forms of injury.

175.title: Motor Vehicles [CPSC]
175.description: Requires applications for motor vehicle registrations & applications for driver's licenses to include language permitting applicants to make voluntary contributions to Blind Babies & Blind Youth Services, to Senior Vision Services, for services for persons with developmental disabilities, or to Ronald McDonald House; provides for distribution of funds collected from voluntary contributions, etc.

176.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176), SB 1136 (Ch. 2010-173)
176.title: State Fire Marshal
176.description: Revises & creates various provisions of law relating to State Fire Marshal, including building & equipment inspection duties, establishment of Fire Code Interpretation Committee, requirements for nonbinding & binding interpretations of Florida Fire Prevention Code, firefighter eligibility, examination, training, level, certification, employment, & supplemental compensation requirements, etc.

177.last_action: Died in Economic Development & Community Affairs Policy Council, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 631 (Ch. 2010-198)
177.title: Derelict Motor Vehicles and Mobile Homes
177.description: Revises requirements for disposition of motor vehicle, recreational vehicle, or mobile home that is sold, transported, or delivered to salvage motor vehicle dealer or secondary metals recycler; requires certificates of title to conform to specified provisions, etc.

178.last_action: Died in Committee on Civil Justice & Courts Policy (CCJP)
178.title: Public Meetings
178.description: Expands public meetings exemption for private meeting between governmental entity & entity's attorneys to discuss pending litigation to which governmental entity is party before court or administrative agency; revises & provides additional conditions precedent to such private meetings; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

179.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
179.title: Student Voter Education
179.description: Requires each district school board & county supervisor of elections to jointly provide voter-education program to high school students who are eligible to register or preregister to vote; requires education to consist of mandatory presentation by supervisor of elections to public high school students; requires presentation to be made available to nonpublic high schools upon request; provides guidelines for program content.

180.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 492; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 492 (Ch. 2010-97) -HJ 01166
180.title: Garnishment
180.description: Increases amount of wages of head of family that is exempt from garnishment; provides form that must be used for agreement to waive exemption from garnishment.

181.title: Child Care Facilities
181.description: Provides for certain household children to be included in calculations regarding capacity of licensed family day care homes & large family child care homes; provides conditions for supervision of household children of operators of family day care homes & large family child care homes; revises advertising requirements applicable to child care facilities; provides penalties.

182.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1307 (Ch. 2010-180)
182.title: Defined Contribution Retirement Program
182.description: Changes name of Public Employee Optional Retirement Program to Public Employee Retirement Investment Program; limits option of enrolling in State Retirement System's defined benefit program or defined contribution program to certain employees; requires certain public employees to enroll in defined contribution program, etc.

183.last_action: Died in Committee on Civil Justice & Courts Policy (CCJP)
183.title: Termination/Residential Rental Agreement
183.description: Provides that purchaser of residential property in foreclosure may terminate tenant's residential rental agreement; provides exception for immediate purchaser intending to sell to buyer who intends to occupy as primary residence; specifies contents of termination notice to be given to tenant, etc.

184.last_action: Died in Full Appropriations Council on Education & Economic Development
184.title: Collective Bargaining
184.description: Redefines term "legislative body" for purposes of collective bargaining impasses with respect to employees of certain county constitutional officers; requires board of county commissioners to provide supplemental funds to such county constitutional officers under certain circumstances; provides that resolution of certain impasses is binding on all parties; specifies parties required to approve certain collective bargaining agreements.

187.title: Seminole County Port Authority, Seminole County
187.description: Codifies, amends, reenacts, & repeals special acts relating to district; provides for warrants by chairperson, treasurer, or certain other persons; provides that authority may hold books open for period after fiscal year; provides that authority shall comply with general law for cost of construction & supplies; provides for execution of documents & examination of claims, etc.

188.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
188.title: Motor Vehicle and Cargo Theft
188.description: Redesignates Florida Motor Vehicle Theft Prevention Authority as Florida Motor Vehicle and Cargo Theft Prevention Authority; revises provisions relating to board of authority; revises & provides powers & duties of authority; provides for removal of members; provides cap on administrative costs; provides for semiannual fee on motor vehicle insurance policies & certain self-insurers; provides for collection & deposit of funds, etc.

189.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
189.title: Motor Vehicle/Cargo Theft Prevention Authority TF
189.description: Creates Motor Vehicle and Cargo Theft Prevention Authority Trust Fund within EOG; provides for source of moneys & purposes; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

190.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
190.title: Sexual Offenses Involving the Internet
190.description: Prohibits persons convicted of certain sexual offenses involving Internet from accessing Internet or maintaining or contracting for Internet access; provides employment exception.

191.title: Peace Creek Drainage District, Polk County
191.description: Abolishes district; provides for transfer of district assets & indebtedness; repeals special acts relating to district.

192.last_action: Died in Committee on Civil Justice & Courts Policy (CCJP)
192.title: Negligence
192.description: Defines terms "negligence action" & "products liability action"; requires trier of fact to consider fault of all parties to accident when apportioning damages in products liability action alleging additional or enhanced injury.

193.title: Marketable Record Title [SPSC]
193.description: Revises exceptions to marketability by including any right, title, or interest held by Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund, any water management district, or United States; conforms provisions to changes made by act; provides requirements for recorded notice to preserve claim of right.

194.title: Contingency Fee Agreements/DLA & Private Attorneys [SPSC]
194.description: Prohibits DLA from entering into contingency fee contract with private attorney unless AGO makes written determination prior to entering into such contract that contingency fee representation is both cost-effective & in public interest; requires written determination to include certain findings, etc.

195.title: Disability Awareness
195.description: Requires district school boards to provide disability history & awareness instruction in K-12 public schools; requires certification of individuals delivering instruction; requires Governor's Commission on Disabilities to initiate study on disability awareness training, to be conducted by private nonprofit entity, & oversee statewide disability awareness training provider & certification program, etc.

196.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
196.title: Public Works Projects
196.description: Creates "Florida Reemployment Investment Act"; requires certain state agencies & private sector contractors utilizing state funds or federal funds administered by state for certain purposes to employ specified number of Florida residents as onsite employees; provides application; provides retroactive effect & period for compliance for projects begun before enactment of act, etc.

197.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Policy (EPC)
197.title: Interpreters and Transliterators
197.description: Requires Florida School for Deaf & Blind to designate entity to issue credentials to interpreters & transliterators who provide services for persons who are deaf or hard of hearing; requires person who provides interpreting or transliterating services to possess credential issued under act; requires that credentialing entity establish Interpreters for Deaf & Hard of Hearing Advisory Board.

198.title: Pretrial Detention and Release
198.description: Requires all pretrial release programs to facilitate release of defendants from pretrial custody to conform to policies & restrictions established in act; preempts local ordinances, orders, or practices; requires every pretrial release program to provide first appearance court all pertinent information about defendant, including defendant's ability to pay for surety appearance bond, etc.

199.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176), HB 7217 (Ch. 2010-141)
199.title: Property Insurance
199.description: Revises provisions of property insurance law relating to exemption of medical malpractice insurance premiums from emergency assessments, additional surplus requirement for domestic insurers, consumer advocate, OIR, insurer rights, reinsurance or financing costs, filed rates, rate filings, transparency in rate regulation, cost of reinsurance, comprehensive consumer information program, Citizens policyholder surcharge, etc.

200.title: Sanctions for Certain Court Pleadings [SPSC]
200.description: Prohibits monetary sanction against represented party for claim that is presented as good faith argument but that is found to not be supported by application of then-existing law to material facts; prohibits sanctions against party or its attorneys by court on its own initiative if case has already been settled or voluntarily dismissed by that party.

201.title: Space Florida [CPSC]
201.description: Revises provisions for governing board of Space Florida to terminate existing board & replace it with new board; provides for membership, organization, meetings, & actions of board; provides for reimbursement of expenses; requires members to file disclosure of financial interests, etc.

202.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
202.title: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
202.description: Creates "Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Prevention & Education Act"; provides purposes; requires DOH to establish COPD prevention, education, screening, & diagnosis program & to coordinate statewide summit on COPD; provides for department-initiated COPD public awareness strategies; provides powers & duties of State Surgeon General with respect to securing funding to implement act.

203.title: Municipal Water and Sewer Utilities
203.description: Exempts municipalities in certain counties from applicability of provisions limiting rates they may charge consumers outside their boundaries for provision of water or sewer utility services.

204.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
204.title: Low-income and Moderate-income Homeowners
204.description: Authorizes counties to establish fund for providing no-interest loans to assist low-income & moderate-income homeowners in paying homeowners' insurance premiums; authorizes governing authority of county to levy surtaxes on building-related permits to finance assistance fund; limits amount families may receive from fund in any year; requires loans to be repaid if homestead is sold or refinanced, etc.

205.title: Employment for the Homeless
205.description: Specifies order for applying tax credit for employment of homeless; provides tax credit for corporation that hires homeless person residing in transitional housing facility; specifies information that must be provided to DOR when applying for credit; provides for carryover of unused credits; provides penalties for fraudulently claiming tax credit; limits total amount of tax credits that may be granted per calendar year, etc.

206.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Appropriations (CEED)
206.title: Student Achievement in Fine Arts Courses
206.description: Revises basis for designation of school grades to include performance of students who are enrolled in fine arts courses; requires that DOE, in coordination with Florida professional arts education associations, develop assessments, subject to available funding; requires that field testing of assessments be completed & results of testing be reported within specified period after funding becomes available.

207.title: Homestead Tax Deferrals
207.description: Authorizes homestead property owners to elect to defer portion of increased ad valorem taxes & non-ad valorem assessments resulting from property improvements; provides methodology & limitation; provides for granting deferral upon application approval; requires annual notification to taxpayers entitled to homestead exemption; specifies notice statement, etc.

208.title: Public K-12 Education [SPSC]
208.description: Provides that comprehensive health education taught in public schools shall include component on teen dating violence & abuse for students in grades 7 through 12; requires district school boards to adopt & implement dating violence & abuse policy; requires DOE to develop model policy; requires school personnel training.

210.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
210.title: Debt Negotiation Services
210.description: Provides additional definitions relating to debt negotiation services; provides that attorney providing legal representation is exempt from debt negotiation organization requirements; prohibits certain acts by debt negotiation organization; provides penalties; provides insurance requirements for debt negotiation organization; provides requirements for debt negotiation service contracts.

211.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Policy (EPC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 4 (Ch. 2010-22)
211.title: Public School Education
211.description: Revises statewide student assessment program beginning with 2014-2015 school year; discontinues use of FCAT; requires use of subject area assessments in grades 3 through 5, subject area assessments & end-of-course examinations in grades 6 through 12, & diagnostic assessments in grades 6, 8, & 10; revises high school graduation requirements to include measure of overall academic performance, etc.

212.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA)
212.title: School Speed Zones
212.description: Creates "Shaye Patrick Martin Safety Act"; establishes transitional speed areas before & after slowest speed in school zone; requires installation of vehicle speed cameras in school zones to record images of driver & license plate of motor vehicle exceeding speed limit; provides for such cameras to be included in DOT's uniform system of traffic control devices.

213.last_action: Died in Committee on Civil Justice & Courts Policy (CCJP)
213.title: Domestic Partnerships
213.description: Sets fees & costs for dissolution or registration of domestic partnership; provides applicability for state tax laws; requires DOH to examine certificates of domestic partnership & dissolution reports; requires clerk to transmit declarations of domestic partnership; authorizes DOH to issue certified copy of certain vital records to domestic partner; includes domestic partnership within domestic violence provisions, etc.

214.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 962; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 962 (Ch. 2010-207), CS/HB 91 (Ch. 2010-31) -HJ 01170
214.title: Driver License Records
214.description: Revises authorized uses of license identification information maintained by DHSMV & released to DCFS; authorizes use for certain adult protective services investigations; provides conditions for such information to be used for verification of identity in determination of eligibility for public assistance & for certain fraud investigations.

215.title: Tax on Sales, Use, and Other Transactions [WPSC]
215.description: (THIS BILL COMBINES H483 & H469) Specifies period during which sale of books, clothing, & school supplies is exempt from tax. APPROPRIATION: $250,304.

216.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 312; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 312 (Ch. 2010-171) -HJ 01165
216.title: Pub. Rec./Public Defenders/Regional Counsel
216.description: Creates exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying & location information of current & former public defenders & criminal conflict & civil regional counsel & spouses & children of such defenders or counsel; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

217.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Appropriations (CGHC)
217.title: Licensing Standards for Child Care Facilities
217.description: Creates "John F. Serrano, Rachel Lou Napier, & Alexandra Ali Safety & Accountability Act"; provides minimum licensing requirements for window blinds & other window coverings; authorizes DCFS to provide certain information regarding window blinds & window coverings.

218.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
218.title: Public Corruption
218.description: Provides for reclassification of criminal offenses committed under color of law.

219.title: Teaching Nursing Homes [SPSC]
219.description: Revises term "teaching nursing home" as it relates to implementation of teaching nursing home pilot project; revises requirements to be designated as teaching nursing home.

220.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA)
220.title: Transportation Facilities
220.description: Revises criteria for evaluation by DOT of certain public-private project proposals; provides that determination that project is in public's best interest be evidenced by business case prepared under specified provisions & submitted to Council on Efficient Government; deletes provision authorizing DOT to lease existing toll facilities through public-private partnerships.

221.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
221.title: Employment of Children/Entertainment Industry
221.description: Provides regulations for employment of children in entertainment industry; provides responsibilities of employers & parents or legal guardians of such children; provides duties of Division of Regulation within DBPR; provides limitations on working hours of child performers; provides certification requirements & duties of teachers of child performers, etc.

222.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 926; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 926 (Ch. 2010-172) -HJ 01166
222.title: Estates and Trusts
222.description: Provides additional delegable investment functions for fiduciaries relating to life insurance contract administration; revises notice requirements & criteria for delegation by fiduciary of investment functions to investment agent; specifies activities trustees are under no duty to undertake relating to administration of specified contracts for life insurance, etc.

223.title: Illegal Immigration
223.description: Prohibits restrictions on reporting of certain immigration status information by public employees; prohibits certain local government restrictions concerning communication or cooperation with federal officials concerning immigration law enforcement.

224.last_action: Died in Committee on State Universities & Private Colleges Policy (EPC)
224.title: State Universities
224.description: Redefines term "continuing contract" as it relates to construction costs in order to increase certain cost thresholds; authorizes university boards of trustees to establish renewable energy fee under certain circumstances; limits use of fee; establishes renewable energy fee committee; provides for referendum on continuing or discontinuing fee; authorizes university to reestablish fee, etc.

225.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Appropriations (CEED)
225.title: Expenditures for Classroom Instruction
225.description: Provides minimum requirements for expenditures for classroom instruction at school district & school levels; specifies requirements for uniform calculation of district operating expenditures that support classroom instruction; requires annual reporting of expenditures; requires DOE & district school boards to analyze expenditures; provides for technical assistance in budget preparation & analysis, etc.

226.title: Blood Establishments [SPSC]
226.description: Prohibits local government from restricting access to or use of public facilities or infrastructure for collection of blood or blood components from volunteer donors based on certain criteria; prohibits blood establishments from determining price of blood or blood components based on certain criteria; revises definition of term "wholesale distribution" to exclude certain drugs & products distributed by blood establishments, etc.

227.title: Collier County
227.description: Creates independent special district to provide children's services in county; provides for governing board, membership, terms, powers, & duties; authorizes reimbursement for per diem & travel expenses; requires certain reports & audits; specifies fiscal year; provides financial requirements & budget procedures; authorizes levy of ad valorem assessments & provides millage cap; requires surety bond of certain persons, etc.

228.title: Mobile Home Park Tenancies
228.description: Directs Florida Housing Finance Corporation to provide technical assistance to mobile home owners in purchasing their mobile home park; provides legislative findings; revises procedures for mobile home owners being provided eviction notice due to change in use of land comprising mobile home park; revises application; requires certain notice to homeowners' association.

229.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
229.title: Reproductive Health Services and Family Planning
229.description: Creates "Prevention First Act"; provides duties of licensed health care practitioners & facilities relating to treatment of rape survivors; requires AHCA to provide for enforcement & impose penalties; requires licensed pharmacies to dispense certain forms of contraception without delay; specifies conditions under which pharmacy may refuse to provide contraceptive.

230.title: Compact/Educational Opportunity/Military Children [SPSC]
230.description: Abrogates future repeal of Interstate Compact on Educational Opportunity for Military Children; deletes provisions relating to disclosure of information & records & closure of meetings by Interstate Commission on Educational Opportunity for Military Children; provides for future legislative review & repeal of compact.

231.title: Florida Civil Rights Hall of Fame [SPSC]
231.description: Provides for establishment & location of Florida Civil Rights Hall of Fame; provides for selection of hall-of-fame members by Governor upon recommendations by Florida Commission on Human Relations; provides criteria for such recommendations; authorizes commission to set time periods for nomination & selection of hall-of-fame members; assigns responsibility for certain hall-of-fame costs.

232.title: Statutes of Limitation for Sexual Battery [SPSC]
232.description: Eliminates statutes of limitations to institution of criminal or civil actions relating to sexual battery of child if victim is under 16 years of age at time of offense; provides applicability.

233.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 1152; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1152 (Ch. 2010-125) -HJ 01130
233.title: Florida Funeral, Cemetery, & Consumer Services Act
233.description: Prohibits issuance or renewal of license to applicant with certain criminal records; revises Board of Funeral, Cemetery & Consumer Services; authorizes fees for certain inspections; authorizes requirements for online submission of applications; authorizes fees for paper applications; requires applicants to disclose certain criminal offenses & pleas; authorizes limited licenses for out-of-state licensees, etc.

234.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
234.title: Pub. Rec./Ombudsman Employees and Volunteers
234.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying & location information of any certified ombudsman or employee of Office of State Long-Term Care Ombudsman within DEA & spouses & children of such ombudsmen or employees; provides for future review & repeal of exemption; provides finding of public necessity.

235.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176)
235.title: Firesafety
235.description: Abolishes special state firesafety inspector classifications & certifications; provides for special state firesafety inspectors to be certified as firesafety inspectors; authorizes State Fire Marshal to develop advanced training & certification program for specified firesafety inspectors, etc.

236.last_action: Died in Committee on Energy & Utilities Policy (GGPC)
236.title: Testimony Before the Public Service Commission
236.description: Requires each person offering testimony at meeting, workshop, hearing, or other scheduled event of Public Service Commission to disclose any financial or fiduciary relationship with any public utility; requires such disclosures to be filed in writing with office of commission & with office of Public Counsel before testimony is provided to commission; provides penalty for failure to make such disclosure; provides procedures for appeal of penalty.

237.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
237.title: Sexual Exploitation
237.description: Designates act "Florida Safe Harbor Act"; provides legislative intent & goals; provides for presumption that placement of child alleged to have been sexually exploited in short-term safe house is necessary; provides requirements for findings in shelter hearing relating to placement of allegedly sexually exploited child in safe house; requires assessment of certain children; provides for use of such assessments, etc.

238.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
238.title: Practice of Dentistry
238.description: Requires persons who apply for licensure renewal as dentists or dental hygienists to furnish certain information to DOH in dental workforce survey; requires Board of Dentistry to issue nondisciplinary citation & notice for failure to complete survey within specified time; provides notification requirements for citation; requires DOH to serve as coordinating body for purpose of collecting, disseminating, & updating dental workforce data, etc.

239.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
239.title: Pub. Rec./Dental Workforce Surveys
239.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for information contained in dental workforce surveys submitted by dentists & dental hygienists to DOH as condition for license renewal; provides exceptions to exemption; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption under Open Government Sunset Review Act.

240.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
240.title: Sealing and Expunging Criminal History Records
240.description: Authorizes court to seal or expunge criminal history record of person who had prior criminal history record sealed or expunged in certain circumstances.

241.last_action: Died in Committee on Agriculture & Natural Resources Policy (GGPC)
241.title: Dangerous Dogs
241.description: Eliminates prohibition of breed-specific local government regulation of dangerous dogs.

242.last_action: Veto Message received -HJ 00009; Veto Message referred to Rules and Calendar Council -HJ 00016
242.title: Residential Property Sales [CPSC]
242.description: Repeals provision requiring disclosures of residential property windstorm mitigation ratings to purchasers in wind-borne debris regions.

243.last_action: Died in Committee on State Universities & Private Colleges Policy (EPC)
243.title: University of South Florida St. Petersburg
243.description: Authorizes Board of Trustees of University of South Florida to increase aggregate sum of activity & service, health, & athletic fees to exceed 5 percent cap on annual increases for purpose of increasing activity & service fee at University of South Florida St. Petersburg; requires that revenue from increase be used to construct & operate multipurpose campus center on St. Petersburg campus, etc.

244.title: Performing Arts Center Funding
244.description: Requires DOR to distribute amount annually to certified performing arts centers; requires OTTED to screen applicants & approve or deny applications for certification as performing arts center for funding purposes; requires OTTED to adopt procedural rules; specifies certification requirements for OTTED; specifies public purpose uses of specified funds; requires OTTED to notify DOR of performing arts center certifications, etc.

245.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-130; companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7085 (Ch. 2010-116)
245.title: Pub. Rec. & Meetings/County/Complaints on Conduct [EPSC]
245.description: Revises exemption from public record & public meeting requirements for complaints & related records in custody of & proceedings conducted by county or municipality with established local investigatory process to enforce more stringent standards of conduct & disclosure requirements; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions under Open Government Sunset Review Act; provides statement of public necessity.

246.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
246.title: Sale of Alcoholic Beverages
246.description: Creates "Point-of-Purchase Messaging about Alcohol and Pregnancy Act"; requires certain warning signs to be displayed on premises of alcoholic beverage vendors & manufacturers; requires DBPR's Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco to produce & distribute signs; provides for fee to cover costs of producing & distributing signs; provides display requirements; provides penalties; provides for enforcement.

247.title: Tangible Personal Property Tax Transparency
247.description: Authorizes persons who rent specified heavy equipment to collect tangible personal property tax recovery fee on heavy equipment property rentals for specified purposes; requires disclosure of fee in rental agreement; specifies rate for fee; limits total fee collected at each business location; provides for refund or credit of amounts collected in excess of tangible personal property taxes levied on such equipment.

248.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
248.title: Local Government Revenue Collections
248.description: Authorizes local governments & tax collectors to enter into contracts with private attorneys or collection agents to collect specified taxes & other financial obligations that remain unpaid for 90 days after due date; provides that collection fees, including reasonable attorney's fees or other costs, may be added to account referred for collection; prohibits such fees & costs from exceeding 40 percent of amount owed, etc.

250.last_action: Died in Committee on Energy & Utilities Policy (GGPC)
250.title: Public Service Commission
250.description: Revises provisions relating to ex parte communications; requires that communications between commissioner or commission staff & representative of utility be made available to public & advance notice be provided to Public Counsel; prohibits former commissioners & employees of PSC from lobbying legislative or executive branch of state government for 2 years after termination of service or employment & provides applicability, etc.

251.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Services Policy (HFPC)
251.title: Assault and Battery
251.description: Provides for upgrading of degree of specified assault & battery offenses committed against specified persons based on their position or employment; provides for sentencing; provides for additional imprisonment in certain circumstances; prohibits gain-time & discretionary early release for offenders; provides exception.

252.last_action: Veto Message received -HJ 00009; Veto Message referred to Rules and Calendar Council -HJ 00016
252.title: Solid Waste Disposal [EPSC]
252.description: Authorizes disposal of yard trash at Class I landfill if landfill has system for collecting landfill gas & arranges for reuse of gas; requires DEP to develop & adopt methodology to award recycling credit for such use; requires landfill to obtain minor permit modification to its operating permit before receiving yard trash; specifies which entities of local government may accept incidental amounts of yard trash at landfill; provides applicability.

253.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
253.title: Sale of Event Tickets
253.description: Requires original seller of event tickets to keep charges from ticket sales until event occurs & return charges to purchaser under certain circumstances; provides exceptions.

254.title: Physician Assistants [SPSC]
254.description: Deletes requirements that physician assistants file evidence of certain clinical experience before prescribing or dispensing medication; authorizes electronic submission of physician assistant license applications & other required documentation.

255.last_action: Died in Committee on Economic Development Policy (EDCA)
255.title: Drug Testing/Unemployment Compensation
255.description: Creates Drug Deterrence Pilot Program within AWI; provides legislative intent; provides scope of eligibility for benefits; defines terms; provides for screening of individuals to determine which individuals must be tested; provides for notice; provides terms of disqualification for benefits; requires agency to supply information concerning drug treatment programs, etc.

256.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Services Policy (HFPC)
256.title: Community Residential Homes
256.description: Requires sponsoring agency to notify local government when request to locate home with 6 or fewer residents that otherwise meets definition of community residential home has been submitted; requires agency to provide additional information in notification.

257.title: Admissions Tax
257.description: Reenacts exemption of admission charges to specified events to continue exemption; provides for retroactive operation.

258.last_action: Withdrawn from Civil Justice & Courts Policy (CCJP); Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC); Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council; Withdrawn prior to introduction -HJ 00054
258.title: Mortgage Foreclosures
258.description: Specifies limited statute of limitations for specified deficiency judgments; requires claims for deficiency connected with foreclosure actions to be filed within specified time after foreclosure sale; provides exception for participation in Florida Mortgage Foreclosure Diversion Program; provides exception criteria; establishes Florida Mortgage Foreclosure Diversion Program, etc.

259.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Appropriations (CGHC)
259.title: Medicaid
259.description: Requires that funds repaid to AHCA by managed care plans that spend less than certain percentage of capitation rate for behavioral health services be deposited into Medical Care Trust Fund; provides that such repayments be allocated to community behavioral health providers & used for Medicaid behavioral & case management services.

261.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
261.title: Voting Conflicts
261.description: Designates act "Restoring Trust in Government Act"; prohibits members of Legislature from voting upon or participating in legislation inuring to personal gain or loss of member or his or her relative, etc.

262.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
262.title: Health Insurance
262.description: Establishes minimum loss ratio for health insurance forms & long-term care insurance policies; revises loss ratio for specified health insurance coverage & for Medicare supplement policies issued on or after specified date.

264.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 747 (Ch. 2010-57), CS/HB 889 (Ch. 2010-34), HB 5311 (Ch. 2010-161)
264.title: Health Care
264.description: Establishes Office of Public Health Nutrition within DOH; removes provision limiting number of breast & cervical cancer screenings based on Medicaid expenditures; renames ch. 385, F.S., as "Healthy & Fit Florida Act"; requires DOH to support creation of public health programs at state & community levels; authorizes department to advance funds for program startup; authorizes state agencies to conduct employee wellness programs, etc.

265.title: Open House Parties
265.description: Provides that person who violates open house party statute second or subsequent time commits misdemeanor of first degree; provides that person commits misdemeanor of first degree if violation of open house party statute causes serious bodily injury or death of minor; provides criminal penalties.

267.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Policy (EPC)
267.title: Public School Transportation
267.description: Authorizes district school boards to designate & use certain elementary schools as transportation hubs; provides for district school board policies that authorize private advertisements on school buses; provides for payment of advertisement fee & use of fee; requires State Board of Education rules relating to display of advertisements; revises provisions relating to hazardous walking conditions, etc.

268.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 1058; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1058 (Ch. 2010-192) -HJ 01168
268.title: Cooperation Between Schools & Juvenile Authorities
268.description: Requires that specified school personnel be notified when child of any age is formally charged by state attorney with felony or delinquent act that would be felony if committed by adult & be notified of disposition of charges; provides for release of student's education records to parties to interagency agreement for specified purposes without consent of student or parent, etc.

269.last_action: Died in Committee on Agriculture & Natural Resources Policy (GGPC)
269.title: Water Resources
269.description: Requires water management districts to assist independent special districts in determining certain adverse effects on Outstanding Florida Waters under specified conditions; authorizes independent special districts to use funds for mitigation of such adverse effects.

270.title: Tax Credits for Research and Development
270.description: Provides for tax credit against corporate income tax for specified research & development expenses; provides eligibility requirements; provides limitations regarding eligibility; provides amount for such credit; provides maximum amount of credit that may be taken during single tax year; provides that any unused credit may be carried forward for specified period; authorizes sale or assignment of unused credit to specified taxpayers, etc.

271.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted SB 488; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 488 (Ch. 2010-186) -HJ 01170
271.title: Motor Vehicle Registration Application Forms
271.description: Requires motor vehicle registration application forms to provide for voluntary contribution to Florida Network of Children's Advocacy Centers, Inc.; provides for use of such funds.

272.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
272.title: Attorneys' Fees in Workers' Compensation Cases
272.description: Provides that finder of fact & law is not bound by provisions of state law relating to provision of indemnity or medical benefits for employment-related accidents or injuries when awarding attorney's fees in cases involving first responders; requires that finder of fact & law consider certain factors when awarding attorney's fees in such cases; provides statement of important state interest.

273.title: Insurance Rate Filings
273.description: Deletes authorization & procedures for use & file rate filings; revises requirements for making rate filings for all classes of insurance, for motor vehicle insurance, & for filing rate plans by joint underwriters & joint reinsurers.

274.title: Substantial Assistance [SPSC]
274.description: Permits state attorney to request sentencing court to reduce or suspend sentence of convicted felon who provides substantial assistance in identification, arrest, or conviction of any accomplice, accessory, coconspirator, or principal of that felon or another felon; provides that arresting agency be given opportunity to be heard in aggravation or mitigation, etc.

275.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
275.title: Mining and Extraction Activities
275.description: Provides that financial responsibility for mitigation for wetlands & other surface waters required by permit for activities associated with extraction of limestone are subject to approval by DEP; authorizes mine operators mining or extracting or proposing to mine or extract heavy minerals, limestone, or fuller's earth clay to apply for life-of-the-mine permits, etc.

276.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
276.title: Screening Tests for Newborns
276.description: Authorizes DOH to collect Medicaid payments from specified health care providers for newborn screening tests.

277.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
277.title: Credit and Debit Card Crimes [SPSC]
277.description: Provides that seller or lessor is prohibited from imposing surcharge on debit card transactions; defines "debit card"; provides that provisions do not apply to offers of discount for purpose of inducing payment by cash, check, or other means not involving use of debit card; prohibits possession of stolen credit or debit card in specified circumstances, etc.

278.title: Instructional Materials for K-12 Public Education
278.description: Includes electronic textbooks in definition of term "adequate instructional materials"; requires each district school board to provide technology as needed for its educational program; authorizes use of certain funds for purchase of electronic textbooks by district school boards; provides for purchase of electronic or computer hardware under certain conditions.

279.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
279.title: Voter Information Cards
279.description: Requires that voter information card contain address of polling place of voter; requires supervisor of elections to issue new voter information card upon voter's change of address of legal residence or upon change in voter's polling place address; provides instructions for implementation by supervisors of elections.

280.last_action: Died in Full Appropriations Council on Education & Economic Development
280.title: Transitional Services for Youth
280.description: Defines term "transition to adulthood"; provides legislative intent concerning transition to adulthood services for youth in custody of DJJ; provides for eligibility for services from both departments for youth served by DJJ who are legally in custody of DCFS; provides that adjudication of delinquency does not, by itself, disqualify youth in foster care from certain services from DCFS, etc.

281.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted SB 1136; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1136 (Ch. 2010-173), CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176) -HJ 01129
281.title: Firesafety Inspections
281.description: Provides exceptions to specified local government firesafety inspection requirements; specifies inspection requirements for fire hydrants owned by governmental entities; authorizes local government utilities to comply using designated employees; specifies responsibility for ensuring qualification of designated employees to make inspections.

283.title: Human Trafficking
283.description: Specifies documents that must be possessed by person providing or offering to provide massage services in certain circumstances; requires presentation of such documents upon request of law enforcement officer; requires operators of massage establishments to maintain valid work authorization documents on premises for each employee who is not U.S. citizen; requires presentation of documents upon request of law enforcement officer, etc.

284.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Appropriations (CEED)
284.title: Florida School for the Deaf and the Blind
284.description: Requires that salaries for full-time instructional personnel at school be increased annually according to average of certain comparable salaries; requires annual negotiation of salary schedules; provides for implementation based on funding.

286.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Policy (EPC)
286.title: Public School Student Progression
286.description: Provides process by which retention of third grade student who exhibits reading deficiency may be appealed; provides for exemption from mandatory retention through successful appeal; requires DOE to establish appeal process; specifies circumstances recognized as justification for granting appeal; requires assessment & evaluation.

287.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
287.title: Schemes to Defraud
287.description: Reclassifies certain offenses relating to schemes to defraud on Offense Severity Ranking chart for purposes of Criminal Punishment Code.

288.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5 (Ch. 2010-230), CS/HB 321 (Ch. 2010-232)
288.title: State Road Designations
288.description: Designates Miss Lillie Williams Street, John Torrese Family Road, Manuel Capo Way, Manuel Capo Boulevard, & Lt. Colonel Charles Brown Memorial Highway in Miami-Dade County; directs DOT to erect suitable markers; revises designation of Jose A. Marques Boulevard in Miami-Dade County.

290.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
290.title: Use of Law Enforcement Photographs, Images, Etc.
290.description: Prohibits commercial use or distribution of law enforcement photographs, images, or video recordings of deceased person or that show person's extreme, severe, or acute injuries, which are confidential & exempt from public records laws; provides that such photographs, images, & video recordings remain confidential & exempt from public records laws when used or transmitted under certain circumstances, etc.

291.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
291.title: Public Records/Law Enforcement Photographs, Etc.
291.description: Provides exemption from public records law for investigative or crime scene photographs, images, or video recordings of deceased person, part of deceased person, or any part of person's extreme, severe, or acute injuries held by law enforcement agency; provides exceptions; provides for certain access thereto & requirements therefor; exempts specified proceedings; provides for future legislative review & repeal, etc.

292.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 1158; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1158 (Ch. 2010-2) -HJ 00329
292.title: Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services
292.description: Exempts department's Division of Licensing Trust Fund from legislative authorization for unappropriated cash balances in fund to be transferred to General Revenue Fund or Budget Stabilization Fund.

293.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
293.title: Correctional Probation Officers
293.description: Revises definition of "emergency rescue or public safety worker" to include correctional probation officers in provisions relating to certain communicable diseases suffered in line of duty; revises provisions relating to death benefits to include correctional probation officers.

294.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Appropriations (CEED)
294.title: Corporate Income Tax Credits
294.description: Establishes Florida Public School Tax Credit Program; provides for credits against corporate income tax for contributions to public schools for specified purposes; authorizes public schools to determine how to use undesignated contributions; requires public schools to report specified information to DOR; limits total annual amount of credits, etc.

295.last_action: Died in Committee on Agriculture & Natural Resources Policy (GGPC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
295.title: Water Management Districts
295.description: Deletes requirement that district governing board delegate its authority to take final actions; deletes restriction against reviewing delegations by board under Administrative Procedure Act; requires board to provide process for referring certain delegated actions to governing board for final action.

296.title: Surplus Requirements/Mortgage Guaranty Insurers [CPSC]
296.description: Authorizes Commissioner of Insurance Regulation to permit temporary exception to specified minimum surplus requirements under specified circumstances; revises authority of OIR to take action against noncomplying insurers.

297.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-176; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 713 (Ch. 2010-106), CS/HB 1035 (Ch. 2010-110), CS/CS/CS/SB 846 (Ch. 2010-99), SB 1136 (Ch. 2010-173), CS/CS/CS/SB 1196 (Ch. 2010-174)
297.title: Building Safety [CPSC]
297.description: Revises provisions of law relating to elevator safety, home inspection services, mold assessment & remediation, & building code inspections & enforcement; provides for effect of expired, lapsed, nonrenewed, or revoked building permit; revises Florida Building Commission authority; exempts specified structures from Florida Building Code requirements, etc.

298.last_action: In returning messages; Died in returning Messages
298.title: Affordable Housing [EPSC]
298.description: Provides housing finance authority with additional purpose for which it may exercise power to borrow; revises provisions relating to local comprehensive plans to authorize inclusion of element for affordable housing for certain seniors; provides for disposition of real property by local government for certain purposes, etc.

299.last_action: Died in Committee on State Universities & Private Colleges Appropriations (CEED)
299.title: Florida Bright Futures Scholarship Program
299.description: Requires student to reimburse educational institution for award amounts received for certain courses dropped by student or courses from which student has withdrawn; requires reimbursements to be refunded to DOE; requires institution to notify DOE & student of amount due within specified period.

300.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Appropriations (CGHC)
300.title: Cigarette Surcharge Revenue Uses
300.description: Reduces amount of cigarette surcharge revenues deposited into Health Care Trust Fund; appropriates portion of cigarette surcharge revenues to DCFS for specified purposes; prohibits use of such portion to supplant allocated general revenue funds to DCFS.

302.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA)
302.title: Driver's License Restrictions
302.description: Restricts number of passengers under age 18 permitted in vehicle operated by person under age 18 unless accompanied by driver at least 21 years of age; provides exceptions; provides for secondary enforcement; provides citation procedures for violation of such restrictions.

303.last_action: Died in Finance & Tax Council, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 2126 (Ch. 2010-24)
303.title: Taxation
303.description: Recreates annual intangible personal property tax at specified rate; provides for application of specified collection, administration, & enforcement provisions to taxation of specified leaseholds; authorizes DOR to adopt emergency implementing rules; prohibits specified deductibles for specified water's edge group members for corporate income tax purposes, etc. APPROPRIATION: Indeterminate.

304.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
304.title: Advanced Registered Nurse Practitioners
304.description: Redefines term "practitioner" for purposes of Florida Comprehensive Drug Abuse Prevention & Control Act to include advanced registered nurse practitioners.

305.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
305.title: Challenging a Person Desiring to Vote
305.description: Prohibits elector from being challenged on basis of certain documents; prohibits certain persons from submitting formal challenge to elector's eligibility to register to vote or vote in any election under certain circumstances.

306.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Appropriations (CGHC)
306.title: Epidemiological Monitoring Systems
306.description: Authorizes DOH to collaborate with & disclose certain information to CDC for specified purposes.

307.last_action: Died in Committee on State Universities & Private Colleges Policy (EPC)
307.title: First Generation Matching Grant Program
307.description: Authorizes certain independent colleges & universities to participate in program; requires institutions to raise specified funds before Office of Student Financial Assistance may reserve proportionate allocation for institutions; provides for allocation of state matching funds beginning with 2011-2012 fiscal year.

308.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA)
308.title: Cellular Telephone Use
308.description: Prohibits use of cellular telephone while operating motor vehicle in school zone; provides enhanced penalty.

309.title: Negligence [SPSC]
309.description: Provides that if person slips & falls on transitory foreign substance in business establishment, injured person must prove that establishment had actual or constructive knowledge of condition & should have taken action to remedy it; provides that constructive knowledge may be proven by circumstantial evidence, etc.

310.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 982; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 982 (Ch. 2010-100) -HJ 01128
310.title: Underground Facility Damage Prevention & Safety
310.description: Prohibits municipalities, counties, districts, & other local governments from enacting certain ordinances or rules relating to underground facilities; revises responsibilities of excavators & underground facility operators, procedures for notification through Sunshine State One-Call of Florida, Inc., violations, citation procedures, hearings, & penalties; provides jurisdiction to DOAH for disposition of certain violations, etc.

311.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
311.title: Construction Bonds
311.description: Requires surety to record in public records payment bond for public works construction projects; requires bond number to be stated on first page of bond; prohibits issuing authority for building permit or private provider providing inspection services from inspecting specified improvements until filing of payment bond or statement that contract is exempt from payment bond requirements, etc.

312.last_action: Died in Committee on Agriculture & Natural Resources Policy (GGPC)
312.title: Senator Jim King State Reserve
312.description: Designates act "Jim King Outdoor Life Act"; designates certain lands located in Marion & Putnam Counties as James E. "Jim" King, Jr., Senator Jim King State Reserve; requires that Office of Greenways & Trails within DEP develop multipurpose recreational opportunities & provide for care, maintenance, & beautification of such reserve; authorizes Division of State Lands within DEP to acquire property adjacent or contiguous to such reserve, etc.

313.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
313.title: Entertainment Industry Economic Development
313.description: Revises entertainment industry financial incentive program to provide corporate income tax & sales & use tax credits to qualified entertainment entities rather than reimbursements from appropriations; revises definitions, creation & scope, eligibility, & application & approval processes; delineates duties of OTTED, OFE, & DOR regarding award, election, transfer, audit, & revocation & forfeiture of credits, etc. APPROPRIATION: $98,127.

315.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 1964 (Vetoed by Governor); Laid on Table -HJ 01162
315.title: Design Professionals
315.description: Limits liability of architects, interior designers, landscape architects, engineers, & surveyors for construction defects resulting from performance of contract; prohibits such contract from limiting liability of design professional; specifies that provisions do not apply to certain claims; provides that act does not apply to contracts or agreements entered into, or professional services performed, before specified date.

317.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Appropriations (CGHC)
317.title: Alzheimer's Disease
317.description: Directs Department of Elderly Affairs to develop & implement public education program relating to screening for Alzheimer's disease; provides criteria for awarding grants; requires grant recipients to submit evaluation of certain activities to department; authorizes department to provide technical support; requires report, etc.

318.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted SB 1264; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1264 (Ch. 2010-9) -HJ 00367
318.title: International Banking Corporations
318.description: Expands application of state banking laws to include specified international banking corporations & trust companies; revises requirements for carrying on banking business to apply to specified additional financial institutions; revises requirements for licensing international banking corporations; includes requirements applicable to specified trust representative offices; increases specified net capital account requirements, etc.

319.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 318; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 318 (Ch. 2010-185) -HJ 01162
319.title: Wildlife Regulation
319.description: Revises provisions relating to sale, use, release, exhibition, & possession of nonnative wildlife; provides prohibitions relating to certain reptiles; revises captive wildlife penalty provisions; provides civil penalties for violations relating to certain reptiles; provides for deposit & use of civil penalty proceeds; requires FWCC to submit annual report to Legislature; directs FWCC to evaluate revising list of certain reptiles.

321.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-106; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176), CS/HB 7129 (Ch. 2010-182)
321.title: Department of Business & Professional Regulation [CPSC]
321.description: Assigns certain programs to regulation by DBPR's Division of Professions; specifies that DBPR is responsible for regulation of certain professions & administration of certain examinations; authorizes DHSMV to issue reproductions of driver's licenses to DBPR; revises certain licensing & continuing education requirements; authorizes temporary licensure of spouses of active duty service members, etc.

322.title: Health Services Claims
322.description: Authorizes insurers to offer voluntary wellness or health improvement programs that provide rewards or incentives; provides for medical verification for nonparticipation in such programs; provides that such rewards or incentives are not insurance benefits & do not constitute violation of unfair methods of competition & unfair or deceptive acts or practice provisions, etc.

323.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
323.title: Procurement of Contractual Services/State Agency
323.description: Provides definitions & intent with respect to certain requirements relating to provision of outsourced human services related to mental health, substance abuse, child welfare, or juvenile justice; requires acceptance by state agencies of national accreditation of providers of such human services in lieu of, & as substitute for, specified agency licensing, administrative, & program requirements, etc.

324.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Services Policy (HFPC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 2014 (Ch. 2010-210)
324.title: Child Care
324.description: Revises provisions relating to standards that child care facilities must meet to obtain & maintain Gold Seal Quality Care provider designation; requires DCFS to notify specified accrediting associations upon adoption of additional or revised Gold Seal Quality Care program standards; revises minimum age requirements & establishes minimum education standards for child care personnel; revises minimum staff credential requirements.

325.last_action: Withdrawn from Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA); Transportation & Economic Development Appropriations (CEED); Economic Development & Community Affairs Policy Council; Withdrawn prior to introduction -HJ 00066
325.title: Veteran License Plates
325.description: Provides for issuance of license plates free of charge to veterans of Armed Forces of United States; provides for military branch in which veteran served to be displayed on plate.

326.title: Postsecondary Education [SPSC]
326.description: Authorizes state universities & community colleges to waive tuition & fees for certain public school classroom teachers for undergraduate courses approved by DOE; requires State Board of Education rulemaking; prohibits cause of action against state university for actions or decisions of state university student government, etc.

327.last_action: Died in Committee on Energy & Utilities Policy (GGPC)
327.title: Municipal Electric Utilities
327.description: Provides that certain municipal electric utilities are not exempt from specified provisions regulating public utilities; provides that PSC has authority to enforce provisions of act; provides rulemaking authority.

328.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
328.title: Onsite Sewage Treatment and Disposal Systems
328.description: Requires owners of onsite sewage treatment & disposal systems to have such systems periodically inspected; directs DOH to administer inspection program & specified grant program; requires DOH to adopt rules relating to such programs; establishes filing fees for specified inspection reports; revises specified application, permit, inspection, & registration fees; provides for distribution & use of fees.

329.title: Practice of Tattooing [SPSC]
329.description: Prohibits practice of tattooing except by person licensed or registered by DOH; provides for licensure of tattoo artists & temporary registration of guest tattoo artists licensed in jurisdictions outside of state; requires tattoo artists to complete DOH-approved education course & pass examination; exempts certain personnel who perform tattooing for medical or dental purposes from regulation under specified provisions, etc.

330.title: Uniform Commercial Code [CPSC]
330.description: Revises & provides provisions of Florida Uniform Commercial Code relating to electronic documents of title, warehouse receipts, bills of lading, & other documents of title to conform to revised Article 7 of Uniform Commercial Code as prepared by National Conference of Commissioners on Uniform State Laws.

331.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
331.title: Public Participation Plans
331.description: Requires applications for comprehensive plan amendments or development orders to include public participation plan; specifies required time for plan implementation; specifies plan purposes & required plan information; specifies requirements for target area for notification; specifies that notice requirements are in addition to other notice requirements of law; provides applicant authority for plan implementation, etc.

332.last_action: Died in Committee on Civil Justice & Courts Policy (CCJP)
332.title: State Judicial System
332.description: Construes application of common & statute laws of England to state; expands list of recipients required to be provided specified annual report of Florida Supreme Court; specifies required use of such report; requires Supreme Court to develop plan for civics promotion & judicial branch education purposes; requires annual plan implementation report; specifies report recipients & uses, etc.

333.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal & Civil Justice Appropriations (CGHC)
333.title: Fiscal Stability Trust Fund/State Courts System
333.description: Creates Fiscal Stability Trust Fund within state courts system to be administered by Supreme Court; provides for fund revenues; provides for administration of trust fund & use of moneys in fund; requires balances to remain in trust fund at end of fiscal year; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

335.last_action: Died in Committee on Economic Development Policy (EDCA)
335.title: Unemployment Compensation
335.description: Defines terms "alternative base period," "good cause," & "member of the individual's immediate family"; redefines term "base period"; revises requirements for eligibility to receive benefits; prohibits determination of ineligibility based solely on number of weekly hours unemployed individual is available to work when those hours are comparable to number of hours individual worked during majority of base period of his or her claim, etc.

336.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
336.title: Restrictions/Business Entities Doing Business/Iran
336.description: Places restrictions on business entities doing business with Iran; provides definitions; prohibits state from entering into, awarding, or renewing contract or purchasing agreement for commodities or contractual services with, or receiving or soliciting proposals for acquisition of commodities or contractual services from, any business entity doing business with Iran, etc.

337.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
337.title: Public Records and Public Meetings
337.description: Clarifies temporary exemption from public records requirements for sealed bids or proposals received by agency pursuant to invitations to bid or requests for proposals to specify applicability of exemption to invitations to bid or requests for proposals relating to public-private transportation facilities; revises duration of exemption; redefines "notice of a decision or intended decision," etc.

338.title: Treatment of Diabetes [SPSC]
338.description: Revises Diabetes Advisory Council membership; prohibits school districts from restricting assignment of diabetic students to certain schools for certain reasons; authorizes student to manage diabetes while at school, at school-sponsored activities, or in transit to or from school or school-sponsored activities with written authorization from parent & physician; provides for indemnification of specified employees, etc.

339.last_action: Died in Committee on Select Committee on Seminole Indian Compact Review, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 622 (Ch. 2010-29)
339.title: Gaming Compact/Seminole Tribe & State of Florida
339.description: Provides for distribution of funds used for purposes of offsetting impacts of Tribe's Facilities on operations of local governments.

340.title: Automatic Renewal of Service Contracts [CPSC]
340.description: Requires sellers that sell, lease, or offer to sell or lease any services to consumers pursuant to certain contracts to disclose automatic renewal provisions; provides disclosure requirements; provides exceptions to disclosure requirements; provides that certain violations will render automatic renewal provision void & unenforceable; provides definitions & applicability.

341.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
341.title: Monroe County
341.description: Provides exceptions to requirements of DEP regarding minimum casing for injection wells used by facilities that have specified design capacity; provides requirements for injection well used as backup to primary injection well.

342.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
342.title: Notices of Nonpayment
342.description: Revises requirements for notice of nonpayment for labor, services, or materials served by claimant under contractor's bond, by claimant under surety bond for construction or maintenance contracts, or by lienor under payment bond; deprives claimant or lienor of rights under bond for furnishing false or fraudulent notice of nonpayment; revises prohibition against claimant actions against contractor or surety, etc.

343.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
343.title: State Reciprocity in Workers' Compensation Claims
343.description: Exempts certain employees working in state & employers of such workers from Florida's Workers' Compensation Law under certain conditions; provides requirements for establishment of prima facie evidence that employer carries certain workers' compensation insurance; requires courts to take judicial notice of construction of certain laws.

344.title: Northern Palm Beach County Improvement District
344.description: Revises procedures for election of, & qualification & residency requirements for, members of district's board of supervisors; updates obsolete language; revises application of definition of "electors"; excludes certain lands from those for which landowner is entitled to vote at landowners' meeting.

345.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal & Civil Justice Appropriations (CGHC)
345.title: State Attorneys
345.description: Deletes provisions that require state attorney to report why case-qualified defendant did not receive mandatory minimum prison sentence in cases involving certain specified offenses; repeals provisions relating to criteria to be used when state attorneys decide to pursue habitual felony offenders or habitual violent felony offenders, etc.

346.last_action: Withdrawn from Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC); Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA); General Government Policy Council; Withdrawn prior to introduction
346.title: Outdoor Advertising
346.description: Prohibits outdoor signs advertising any gaming activity not expressly authorized by state law; provides penalties.

347.title: Animal Protection [SPSC]
347.description: Revises veterinary licensure exemption pertaining to certain persons practicing temporarily in state; provides circumstances that render inapplicable veterinary licensure exemption pertaining to part-time & independent contractors; prohibits specified acts relating to horsemeat for human consumption; provides penalties; increases classification of offenses related to horsemeat for human consumption, etc.

348.title: Discretionary Sales Surtaxes
348.description: Deletes limitation upon imposition of indigent care & trauma center discretionary sales surtaxes by specified counties; requiring referendum approval for the surtax in specified counties.

350.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
350.title: Insurance
350.description: Prohibits insurer that issues motor vehicle insurance from using rate, rating schedule, rating manual, or underwriting rule that is not contained in rating manual & is determined in whole or in part on basis of specified characteristics of insured, etc.

351.last_action: Died pending review of CS, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
351.title: Environmental Control
351.description: Provides requirements for claiming certain site rehabilitation costs in applications for contaminated site rehabilitation tax credits; revises DEP reporting requirements regarding site rehabilitation; transfers certain authority over expedited permitting & comprehensive plan amendment process from OTTED to Secretary of Environmental Protection, etc.

353.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Services Policy (HFPC)
353.title: Supervised Visitation/Exchange Monitoring Programs
353.description: Adopts state standards for programs; provides for modification; requires standards to be published; requires each program to annually affirm compliance; provides priorities for court or child-placing agency to consider when referring cases for supervised visitation or exchange monitoring; specifies training requirements for persons referring to or providing services, etc.

354.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
354.title: Prevention of Obesity
354.description: Authorizes DOH to require certain food service establishments to display number of calories in food items for sale; provides exemptions; provides immunity from liability; provides conditions under which such nutritional-information requirements may be superseded by federal law, rules, or regulations; provides applicability.

355.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
355.title: Procurement/Commodities and Contractual Services
355.description: Provides that agency, county, or municipality that is required to make purchases of commodities or contractual services through competitive solicitation must provide vendors option to submit competitive sealed bids through uniform secure electronic interactive Internet system; requires specified notification in invitations to bid, etc.

356.title: Child Abduction Prevention [SPSC]
356.description: Designates act "Child Abduction Prevention Act"; authorizes additional persons to move to have certain restrictions placed in parenting plans upon showing of risk that one party may violate court's parenting plan by removing child from this state or country or by concealing child's whereabouts; authorizes courts to impose certain restrictions in parenting plans upon specified finding, etc.

357.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
357.title: Rulemaking
357.description: Requires state agencies to provide written notification to small-business owners of any proposed agency action or implementation of any agency action affecting small businesses; provides for small-business owners to petition state agency for hearing under certain conditions; requires administrative hearing officers to consider certain information when making determinations, etc.

358.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
358.title: Emergency Health Care Providers
358.description: Provides legislative findings & intent; provides that certain emergency health care providers are agents of state for purposes of sovereign immunity when acting pursuant to specified statutory obligations; requires certain indemnity for state from providers.

359.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
359.title: Cardiology Services
359.description: Requires EMS providers to transport certain cardiac patients to most appropriate facility; requires each medical director of EMS provider to develop & implement certain protocols for cardiac patients; provides exemption; requires DOH to provide opportunities & resources to EMS providers to secure appropriate equipment for cardiac patient identification, etc.

360.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-107; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 971 (Ch. 2010-223)
360.title: Penalties for Violation of Traffic Laws [CPSC]
360.description: Provides for person charged with noncriminal traffic infraction to make periodic payments to pay civil penalties & fees; provides for certain persons cited for specified offenses to provide proof of compliance to designated official; provides alternative citation disposition procedures for certain offenses; provides for removal of habitual traffic offender designation upon proof of compliance by certain offenders.

362.last_action: Died in Committee on State Universities & Private Colleges Policy (EPC)
362.title: Victim Advocate Services
362.description: Requires postsecondary educational institution to provide advocate to assist students who are victims of violent crime; requires advocate to complete certain training & enlist assistance of various agencies & groups; requires advocate to be made available on campus that provides student housing or has minimum number of full-time students.

364.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
364.title: Marion County

Rippe Parkway in Lee County; designates Doolittle Raiders Highway in Okaloosa & Walton Counties; designates Beach Highway in Walton County; designates Seminole Way in Seminole County; designates Judge Perry Wells Highway & Vernon Bridge in Washington County, etc.

APPROPRIATION: $146,677.

471.description: Defines term "best practices" for purposes of comprehensive, statewide tobacco education & use prevention program; revises program components & requirements; revises membership of Tobacco Education & Use Prevention Advisory Council; provides applicability of public meetings & state ethics requirements to council meetings; revises council duties & responsibilities, etc.
