473.description: Provides exemption from sales & use tax for sales of specified tangible personal property for specified period; provides exception for sales within public lodging establishment, theme park, entertainment complex, or airport; provides appropriation. APPROPRIATION: $315,905.

474.description: Requires driver of vehicle involved in crash that results in serious bodily injury to stop & remain at scene until he or she has fulfilled specified requirements; directs court to order restitution; revises mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for person who was driving under influence & fails to stop & fulfill such requirements at scene of crash that results in death of any person, etc.

475.description: Designates H. William Heller Hall at University of South Florida St. Petersburg; directs university to erect markers.

477.description: Requires DBPR's Division of Hotels & Restaurants to adopt rules; authorizes division to enter certain buildings; provides for variances; exempts certain elevators from specific code update requirements; provides phase-in period for such elevators; specifies additional acts by registered elevator company or certificateholder which are subject to discipline, etc.

478.description: Designates act "American & Florida Laws for Florida Courts Act"; declares choice of foreign law provisions void if foreign law would not grant parties same fundamental liberties, rights, & privileges granted under United States & Florida Constitutions, etc.

480.description: Establishes school-to-work program to be operated in school, DJJ facility, or charter school; creates endowment fund within Florida Endowment Foundation for Florida's Graduates; provides for investment & deposit of funds in foundation's operating account; creates Florida Endowment Foundation for Florida's Graduates as direct-support organization; establishes board of directors to administer foundation, etc.

483.description: Provides for use of specified city-owned property for recreational & commercial working waterfronts; provides for use of revenue from specified city-owned property; provides for development of specified city-owned property consistent with Florida Coastal Management Program, Waterfronts Florida Program, etc; provides for preservation of referendum requirement of use of certain city-owned property, etc.

490.description: Revises membership of Suicide Prevention Coordinating Council; requires that district school boards provide access to suicide prevention educational resources to all instructional & administrative personnel as part of school district professional development system.

491.description: Designates act "Born Alive Infant Protection Act"; provides that infant born alive subsequent to abortion is entitled to same rights, powers, & privileges as child born alive in course of birth that is not subsequent to abortion; provides standard of care to be exercised by health care practitioners toward such child; requires health care practitioners to report violations, etc.

493.description: Revises provisions relating to rural infrastructure projects; revises percentage of total infrastructure project costs for which OTTED may award grants; authorizes OTTED to award grants for certain percentage of total infrastructure project costs for certain rural areas of critical economic concern; requires that funds from purchase of certain lands by state or state agency be appropriated into Rural Infrastructure Fund.

500.description: Requires corporation to achieve actuarially sound rates by specified date; requires corporation to take specified actions to achieve actuarially sound rates; provides requirements for determination of actuarially sound rates; requires corporation to file plan of withdrawal by specified date if corporation does not achieve actuarially sound rates by specified deadline; establishes criteria for actuarially sound rates, etc.

504.description: Authorizes municipal governments to levy assessment to fund law enforcement services; provides for methodology to charge parcel in reasonable proportion to benefits it receives; requires that ad valorem taxes be reduced; provides limits on amount of reduction in certain circumstances; provides for increases in assessments in future years, etc.

Tate Florida Prepaid College Program; requires prepaid contract plan to provide for advance payment for eligible services for qualified beneficiary & investment plan to provide for investment of funds by benefactor for qualified beneficiary, etc.

567.title: Sewage Disposal Facilities
567.description: Requires entities that divert wastewater flows from facilities discharging wastewater through ocean outfalls to meet specified reuse requirements; provides for recalculation of specified reuse requirements for facilities from which such flows are diverted.

568.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 2014 (Ch. 2010-210)
568.title: Children's Services
568.description: Revises membership of councils on children's services; requires governing body of county to approve purchase of real estate or construction of building by council on children's services; requires submission of tentative budget & proposed millage rate to governing body of county; requires governing body of county to take public testimony on council's tentative budget & proposed millage rate, etc.

569.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
569.title: New Markets Development Program
569.description: Revises definition of term "qualified active low-income community business" for purposes of New Markets Development Program Act; extends period within which qualified community development entity may cure investment deficiency; limits number of corrections permitted for qualified equity investments.

570.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
570.title: State Employee Benefits
570.description: Provides for separate benefit plans & different levels of state contributions for employees exempt from career service; provides exception for State University System employees; subjects premium levels necessary for full funding of state group health insurance program to specified requirements.

571.title: Educational Plant Surveys
571.description: Authorizes extension to school district educational plant survey submission deadline; provides restrictions; provides requirements for submission of request for extension to DOE & requires department approval; provides restrictions on school district construction during extension period.

572.title: Enforcement of Traffic Laws
572.description: Prohibits use of traffic infraction detectors & cameras by county or municipality to enforce traffic laws unless expressly authorized by general law; preempts to state authority to use traffic infraction detectors to enforce traffic laws.

573.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-132; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 998 (Ch. 2010-122)
573.title: Probate Procedures [SPSC]
573.description: Imposes additional duties on lessor of safe-deposit box; authorizes lessor to charge fees for performing such duties; revises requirements relating to filing caveat; revises provisions relating to notice; revises provision relating to right of election; provides that decedent's spouse may elect to take interest in homestead as tenant in common rather than life estate; provides that such election is irrevocable, etc.

574.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 1118; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1118 (Ch. 2010-208), CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147) -HJ 01129
574.title: Docks
574.description: Authorizes placement of roofs on certain residential single-family docks; authorizes DEP to adopt rules that include special criteria for approving certain docking facilities in shellfish harvesting waters; authorizes DEP to maintain list of projects or activities for applicants to consider when developing proposals in order to meet mitigation or public interest requirements & to expand online self-certification & authorization, etc.

576.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5201 (Ch. 2010-155)
576.title: Determination/Resident Status for Tuition Purposes
576.description: Conforms terms to match official names of Florida's higher education systems; revises residency requirement for certain dependent children; provides requirements for recognition of classification of student as resident for tuition purposes by institution of higher education to which student transfers.

577.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
577.title: Criminal Prosecution of Juveniles
577.description: Provides additional circumstances for direct filing of charges against certain juveniles; provides criteria for determining when case against juvenile should be recommended to court to be transferred for criminal prosecution; provides criteria for consideration of child's request to adult court to return criminal case to juvenile justice system.

578.title: Hillsborough County
578.description: Authorizes Division of Alcoholic Beverages & Tobacco of DBPR to issue alcoholic beverage license to Children's Museum of Tampa, Inc.; provides that license may be used only for special events; provides for payment of license fee; prohibits sales for consumption off premises; authorizes transfer & provides for subsequent reversion of license under certain circumstances.

579.title: Lee County Sheriff's Office
579.description: Provides that sheriff has burden of proving just cause in appeal of disciplinary action; provides that certain retirement health insurance benefits shall not be available to employees commencing employment after specified date.

580.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
580.title: Lottery Operations
580.description: Adds limited liability companies to list of potential vendors DOL must investigate; provides that no contract for major procurement may be entered if managing member of potential vendor has felony conviction, with specified exceptions; deletes requirement that contracts in excess of specified amount provide for liquidated damages for breach; removes cap on percentage of any one type of minority retailer that DOL may contract with, etc.

581.title: Continuing Care Facilities [CPSC]
581.description: Revises provisions of law regulating continuing care facilities; increases threshold amount for businesses that must be identified in application for provisional certificate; revises financial information required annually for each certified facility; requires annual report to reflect changes in accounting principle terminology; authorizes provider to assess separate, nonrefundable fee for processing application for continuing care, etc.

582.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Policy (EPC)
582.title: Code of Student Conduct
582.description: Requires each district school board code of student conduct to include explanation of student responsibilities with regard to appropriate student dress; requires each district school board to adopt dress code policy that prohibits student from wearing clothing that exposes underwear or body parts in specified manner; provides disciplinary actions for violation of dress code, etc.

583.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
583.title: Indian River Mosquito Control District
583.description: Revises powers of board of commissioners relating to employment of certain persons; specifies provisions of law governing election of commissioners & removes obsolete provisions for staggering of initial terms; requires district to pay for surety bonds required of commissioners prior to their assuming office, etc.

584.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
584.title: Hospice Care
584.description: Authorizes licensed hospice to provide palliative care to person with life-limiting illness who is not admitted to hospice & to person's family; provides that act does not mandate or prescribe additional Medicaid coverage.

585.title: Grade K through 12 Schools
585.description: Requires that locker rooms in K-12 schools be locked when not in use by students or other authorized persons & be directly supervised by faculty or staff when in use by students.

587.last_action: Died in Committee on Energy & Utilities Policy (GGPC)
587.title: Renewable Energy
587.description: Requires electric utilities to collect monthly systems charge from residential, commercial, & industrial customers; provides for deposit of collected funds into Sustainable and Renewable Energy Policy Trust Fund; creates direct-support organization for Florida Energy Office; requires contract between office & direct-support organization; provides for use of funds; requires annual audit, etc.

588.last_action: Died in Committee on Energy & Utilities Policy (GGPC)
588.title: Sustainable and Renewable Energy Policy TF/DEP
588.description: Creates Sustainable and Renewable Energy Policy Trust Fund within Florida Energy Office of DEP; provides for sources of funds & purposes; provides for annual carryforward of funds; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of fund; provides contingent effective date.

589.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-225; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
589.title: Transportation [CPSC]
589.description: Authorizes counties within or under interlocal agreement with regional transportation or transit authority to levy discretionary sales surtax for transportation systems under certain conditions; provides that county commission may apply proceeds from charter county transportation system surtax to planning, development, construction, expansion, operation, & maintenance of on-demand transportation services, etc.

590.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA)
590.title: Metropolitan Planning Organizations
590.description: Revises provisions for designation of metropolitan planning organizations, jurisdictional boundaries, transportation plans & improvement programs, congestion management, ozone or carbon monoxide nonattainment areas, project priorities, public review, & unified planning work program; provides for redesignation of M.P.O., resolution of overlapping boundaries, & public participation plans.

591.title: Sellers of Travel
591.description: Provides that exemptions to pt. XI of ch. 559, F.S., Florida Sellers of Travel Act, do not apply to sellers of travel offering or selling prearranged travel, tourist-related services, or tour-guide services to any person traveling directly from Florida to terrorist nation; provides definition; provides for retroactive & prospective application.

592.title: Assessment of Property for Back Ad Valorem Taxes [EPSC]
592.description: Provides for nonapplication of retroactive assessment & collection of ad valorem taxes on property under specified circumstances; provides criteria.

593.title: Loan Origination [CPSC]
593.description: Reenacts reference to certain federal laws for purposes of incorporating rules adopted under such laws; specifies application of disciplinary procedures to principal loan originators for actions of loan originators; specifies nonapplication of specified limitations to licensed loan originators operating solely as loan processors; prohibits acting as loan processor unless licensed as loan originator, etc.

595.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
595.title: Cadmium in Children's Products
595.description: Prohibits person from using or applying cadmium in excess of specified amount on any item of children's jewelry, toy, or child care article sold in this state; provides exception; provides criminal penalty.

596.last_action: Died pending review of CS, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 5101 (Ch. 2010-154)
596.title: Education
596.description: Designates act "High-Performing Teacher Bonuses Act"; requires that each school district allocate 100 percent of funds received for instruction for IB Program, AICE, & AP Program; requires that such funds be expended solely for administrative costs associated with such programs & teacher bonuses; revises provisions relating to distribution of bonuses for teachers who provide instruction to such programs, etc.

597.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal & Civil Justice Appropriations (CGHC)
597.title: Money Laundering
597.description: Defines term "proceeds" for purposes of provisions relating to money services businesses & money laundering; revises provisions relating to criminal penalties for certain offenses; provides for aggregating transactions for purposes of determining grade of offenses; provides legislative intent for provisions relating to offenses concerning racketeering & illegal debts; provides for criminal forfeitures for violations of Florida RICO Act, etc.

598.title: Domestic Violence Fatality Review Teams [SPSC]
598.description: Deletes requirement that Governor's Task Force on Domestic Violence provide information & technical assistance to local domestic violence fatality review teams; provides that information & records acquired by team are not subject to discovery or introduction into evidence in criminal or administrative proceedings in certain circumstances, etc.

599.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 1306; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1306 (Ch. 2010-209) -HJ 01174
599.title: Public Assistance
599.description: Revises terminology relating to food stamp program & WAGES Program to conform to current federal law.

600.title: City of Lauderhill, Broward County
600.description: Extends & enlarges corporate limits of City of Lauderhill to include specified unincorporated lands; provides annexation effective date.

601.last_action: Substituted SB 2470; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 2470 (Ch. 2010-212) -HJ 01190
601.title: Northeast Florida Regional Transportation
601.description: Creates Northeast Florida Regional Transportation Study Commission to prepare report, including findings & recommendations, on regional transportation elements & submit report to Governor & Legislature by specified date; provides for assistance of Jacksonville Transportation Authority; provides for funding of commission, etc.

602.title: Issuance of Licenses/Certifications/Registrations
602.description: Creates "Florida's One-Stop Business Connect Act"; requires Governor to establish One-Stop Business Workgroup; provides for membership of workgroup; authorizes workgroup to consult with other agencies & use consultants; provides duties of workgroup; requires that workgroup submit plan for establishing business licensing portal to Governor & Legislature by specified date, etc.

603.title: Violations of County Ordinances [EPSC]
603.description: Authorizes county to specify by ordinance penalties for violation of certain county ordinances.

604.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
604.title: Agency Inspectors General
604.description: Revises provisions for appointment & removal of agency inspectors general; requires Legislature to establish line item category for inspector general for each state agency describing designated use of appropriated funds as provided in General Appropriations Act.

605.title: State Financial Matters [GPSC]
605.description: Provides for excess account balances in Public Employee Optional Retirement Program when employee transfers to defined benefit program; establishes forfeiture account in Public Employee Retirement Program TF; requires that SBA create audit committee for specified purposes; requires that contract for investment advisor or manager include standard of conduct, etc.

606.description: Requires law enforcement officer who has probable cause to believe that defendant has committed retail theft to issue notice to appear in lieu of arresting defendant; authorizes state attorney to establish retail-theft diversion program to divert defendants from criminal prosecution if defendant meets certain criteria; provides eligibility criteria for participating in program, etc.

607.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
607.title: Small Businesses
607.description: Authorizes small businesses to submit bids, proposals, & replies for portions of bundled contracts; authorizes agencies to award separate contracts for portions of bundled contracts; authorizes agencies to award contracts to small businesses that submit bids that exceed lowest responsive bid; requires agencies to give preference to bids, proposals, & replies submitted by small businesses, etc.

608.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
608.title: Pub. Rec./Publicly Owned Performing Arts Center
608.description: Defines "publicly owned performing arts center"; creates exemption from public records requirements for any record or information that reveals name, address, or telephone number of donor or prospective donor of funds or property made for benefit of publicly owned performing arts center if donor desires to remain anonymous; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption under Open Government Sunset Review Act, etc.

611.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
611.title: Governmental Retirement Systems
611.description: Designates act "Public Employee Retirement Preservation Act"; requires certain public employees to contribute an additional specified percentage of their gross income for certain purposes; provides requirements for certain retirement system or plan actuarial reports & experience studies; provides for closing of certain plans; provides maximum retirement benefit for certain retirement system or plan members, etc.

613.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
613.title: Evidence of Crimes
613.description: Designates act "The Enhancing Crime-Solving Potential and Reliability of the Criminal Justice System Act"; provides that governmental entities only required to maintain evidence for potential DNA testing for specified serious crimes; provides that only portion of piece of evidence that is likely to contain biological evidence must be retained & other portions may be disposed of when retention is impracticable, etc.

614.last_action: Died in Committee on Agriculture & Natural Resources Policy (GGPC)
614.title: Aquatic Preserves
614.description: Revises provisions relating to boundaries of aquatic preserves; declares described state-owned submerged lands in specified counties as aquatic preserves; creates Nature Coast Aquatic Preserve; clarifies exemption.

615.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Services Policy (HFPC)
615.title: Forensic Mental Health
615.description: Provides additional responsibilities for certain DCFS contractors; authorizes DCFS to make certain training available to correctional personnel; provides for requiring certain involuntary outpatient patients to take medication; requires that certain adults receive forensic mental health transition plans; provides timeframes for competency hearings for defendants adjudicated incompetent, etc.

616.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 1842 (Vetoed by Governor); Laid on Table -HJ 01170
616.title: Transportation Projects
616.description: Directs DOT to notify local governmental entities of certain proposed projects before design is finalized; requires local governmental entity to receive & review public input regarding effects of project on local business & to provide comments to department; directs department to consider comments in final design of project.

617.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
617.title: Corporate Income Tax
617.description: Provides additional criterion to definition of term "adjusted federal income"; imposes restrictions on deductibility of specified intangible expenses, interest expenses, & management fees; requires corporations to add to taxable income specified expenses & fees; provides exceptions & nonapplication of such exceptions; provides additional requirements & limitations; specifies required information to be provided to DOR, etc.

618.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal & Civil Justice Appropriations (CGHC)
618.title: Offense of Sexting
618.description: Provides that minor commits offense of sexting if he or she knowingly uses computer or other device to transmit or distribute photograph or video of himself or herself which depicts nudity & is harmful to minors, or knowingly possesses such photograph or video that was transmitted or distributed to minor from another minor, etc.

619.title: Nursing [SPSC]
619.description: Authorizes disclosure of certain confidential information required of nursing license applicants to certain persons; provides & revises definitions; revises requirements for graduation from certain nursing education programs for nursing license applicants seeking to take licensing examination; revises restrictions on nursing graduates who may use certain titles & abbreviations, etc.

620.last_action: Died in Committee on Agriculture & Natural Resources Policy (GGPC)
620.title: Honeybees
620.description: Revises powers & duties of DOACS for purposes of Florida Honey Certification & Honeybee Law; specifies that DOACS has exclusive authority over regulations, inquiries & complaints relating to beekeeping, apiaries, & apiary locations.

622.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
622.title: Public-Private Partnership Infrastructure Projects
622.description: Provides for state agencies & local governments to receive or solicit proposals to enter into public works infrastructure project agreements with private entity, or consortium of private entities, to build, operate, or finance public works infrastructure project; provides criteria for selection of project & private entity; requires all reasonable costs to state related to project to be borne by private entity, etc.

623.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1307 (Ch. 2010-180)
623.title: State Board of Administration
623.description: Provides for additional members of SBA; specifies experience requirements for board members; requires SBA to create audit committee; specifies audit committee membership & member requirements; specifies committee duties & responsibilities; provides committee authority; specifies response requirements of executive director upon receipt of committee reports or recommendations, etc.

624.last_action: Died in Committee on Economic Development Policy (EDCA), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
624.title: Florida Biotechnology Investment Matching Grant
624.description: Creates program; designates existing committee, or subcommittee within Enterprise Florida, Inc., for specified purposes; provides deadline for processing applications; requires reports to Governor & Legislature; provides eligibility guidelines for applicants; provides for program administrator; provides responsibilities of program administrator; provides for program administrative costs; designates fiduciary entity, etc. APPROPRIATION: $4,000,000.

625.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
625.title: Protection of Public Employee Retirement Benefits
625.description: Revises legislative intent & application; revises scope of limitations & conditions on investment of assets of any covered local retirement system or plan.

626.last_action: Died in Committee on Elder & Family Services Policy (HFPC)
626.title: Automated External Defibrillators
626.description: Requires certain entities to notify local EMS directors of location of AEDs & requires local EMS directors to maintain AED registries; directs State Surgeon General, with assistance of DMS, to adopt rules to establish guidelines for appropriate placement & deployment of automated external defibrillators in places of public assembly; provides exceptions; provides for construction.

627.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
627.title: Public Procurement
627.description: Provides that public servant who fails to advertise, publicly announce, or electronically post solicitation for commodities or contractual services when required & under certain circumstances commits second degree felony.

628.last_action: Died in Committee on Public Safety & Domestic Security Policy (CCJP)
628.title: Detention by Licensed Security Officers
628.description: Authorizes certain licensed security officers to detain certain individuals until arrival of law enforcement officer; provides limits on such detention; requires that such security officers notify appropriate law enforcement agency as quickly as possible; requires transfer of alleged offender to custody of officer, etc.

629.last_action: Died in Committee on Agriculture & Natural Resources Policy (GGPC)
629.title: Regulation of Vessels
629.description: Removes restrictions on county & municipality regulation of certain vessels not in navigation.

630.title: Postsecondary Student Fees [SPSC]
630.description: Clarifies exemption from fee requirements provided for student who is or was at time he or she reached 18 years of age in custody of relative under Relative Caregiver Program or who was adopted from DCFS after specified date; provides that certain exemptions include fees associated with enrollment in career-preparatory instruction; deletes exemption associated with completion of college-level communication & computation skills testing program, etc.

632.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
632.title: Florida Endowment for Vocational Rehabilitation
632.description: Removes provision that requires SBA to invest & reinvest moneys in endowment fund for Florida Endowment for Vocational Rehabilitation; requires that specified percentage of remainder of all civil penalties received by county court pursuant to specified provisions be remitted to DOR on monthly basis for deposit in fund, etc.

634.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)
634.title: Prostate Cancer Awareness Program
634.description: Revises structure & objectives of Prostate Cancer Awareness Program within DOH; revises program purpose & requirements for program implementation; requires DOH & UF Prostate Disease Center to establish UF Prostate Disease Center Prostate Cancer Task Force to replace Prostate Cancer Advisory Committee; provides for appointment of task force members by State Surgeon General upon specified recommendations, etc.

635.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
635.title: Motor Vehicle Franchise Agreements
635.description: Revises provisions governing franchise agreements between motor vehicle manufacturer, distributor, or importer & motor vehicle dealer; prohibits DHSMV from renewing license of manufacturer, factory branch, distributor, or importer unless licensee complies with specified provisions; requires such licensee to provide affidavit to department regarding provisions of its existing franchise agreements, etc.

636.title: Telecommunications Companies [EPSC]
636.description: Repeals provisions relating to: rates, tolls, contracts, charges, rules, regulations, performance of service, & maintenance of telecommunications facilities; fixing rates by PSC; consideration of directory advertising revenues when establishing rates; changing rates, tolls, rentals, contracts, or charges; schedule for implementation of price regulation; procedures for interim rates, etc.

637.last_action: Died in Committee on Government Operations Appropriations (CGHC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 2176 (Ch. 2010-175)
637.title: Warranty Associations
637.description: Revises prohibited acts by service agreement companies, home warranty associations, & service warranty associations; authorizes reduction in returned premium by claims paid on agreements or contracts; authorizes OIR to order specified entities to cease using specified forms; deletes requirements to file specified financial reports; makes permissible periodic department examination of specified licensees, etc.

638.description: Authorizes various governmental entities to publish or advertise legally required public notices & advertisements on publicly accessible website; defines "publicly accessible website"; provides conditions for utilization of publicly accessible website for such purposes; provides for optional receipt of legally required public notices & advertisements via first class mail, etc.

639.description: Requires courts to appoint pro bono attorney or guardian ad litem for children or youth in out-of-home care who are pregnant; establishes Specialty Guardian Ad Litem Pilot Program in Fourth Judicial Circuit to serve specified children & youth who are pregnant; requires program to be reviewed by Statewide Guardian Ad Litem Office; requires report; limits expansion of program under certain circumstances, etc. APPROPRIATION: $205,000.

640.last_action: Veto Message received -HJ 00010; Veto Message referred to Rules and Calendar Council -HJ 00016
640.title: Petroleum Contamination Site Cleanup [EPSC]
640.description: Requires DEP to utilize natural attenuation monitoring strategies to transition sites into long-term natural attenuation monitoring & evaluate certain costs & strategies; prohibits local governments from denying building permits under specified conditions; establishes low-scored site initiative; requires DEP to issue certain determinations & orders; provides funding for payment of preapproved costs, etc.

641.last_action: Died in Economic Development & Community Affairs Policy Council
641.title: Ad Valorem Tax Assessments
641.description: Provides that participation in informal conference is not prerequisite to administrative or judicial review of property assessments; requires petition before value adjustment board challenging ad valorem assessment to contain specified information relating to property & petitioner; prohibits VAB from extending specified deadlines; requires persons representing property owners for compensation before VAB be licensed brokers, appraisers, etc.

642.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-226; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 969 (Ch. 2010-222)
642.title: Space and Aerospace Infrastructure [CPSC]
642.description: Designates act "Space Transition and Revitalization Act"; authorizes use of specified amount of resources for projects to retain or create high-technology jobs directly associated with developing more diverse aerospace economy in state; authorizes Enterprise Florida, Inc., to waive eligibility criteria for projects receiving funds from Quick Action Closing Fund which would mitigate impact of conclusion of space shuttle program, etc.

643.title: Space Business Inv. & Financial Services TF/OTTED
643.description: Creates Space Business Investment & Financial Services Trust Fund within OTTED; provides purpose of fund, sources of funds, uses for fund, for balance in trust fund to be carried forward at end of each fiscal year, & for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

645.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Policy (EPC)
645.title: St. Lucie County
645.description: Requires calculation of school district weighted average grade for School District of St. Lucie County to include individual school grade for Florida Atlantic University K-12 Charter Lab School in St. Lucie County.

646.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
646.title: City of Vero Beach, Indian River County
646.description: Provides that city utility is public utility for certain purposes & subject to jurisdiction of Florida Public Service Commission; requires that city set fair, just, & reasonable rates; prescribes criteria for establishing revenue requirement; provides that PSC has authority to enforce provisions of act.

647.title: Export of Goods of Value to Foreign Countries [CPSC]
647.description: Prohibits state agencies from issuing certain forms of documentation for any good, commodity, or thing of value to be exported to certain foreign countries.

648.title: Sarasota Manatee Airport Authority
648.description: Authorizes attendance & participation at specified emergency meetings of Sarasota Manatee Airport Authority by teleconference under specified circumstances; provides for quorum; provides for compliance with public meetings requirements.

650.title: Talent & Economic Advancement Matching Grant Prog.
650.description: Establishes Talent & Economic Advancement Matching Grant Program; provides for program administration by DOE; authorizes businesses to partner with eligible institutions to provide grants to students to enroll in educational programs; authorizes DOE to match private contributions; requires participating institutions to certify to DOE contributions received by businesses for grant purposes, etc.

651.title: Foreclosures [CPSC]
651.description: Provides requirements for officers, directors, & agents of timeshare owners' association; authorizes managing entity to bring judicial & trustee actions to foreclose certain liens; renames title of part III of ch. 721, to conform to changes made by act; establishes procedure for trustee foreclosure assessment liens & mortgage liens; provides for appointment of trustee; provides recording requirements for such liens, etc.

652.last_action: Died in Committee on Civil Justice & Courts Policy (CCJP)

652.description: Provides for creation & revision of Florida Marriage Handbook; creates Marriage Education Committee; provides for membership on committee; specifies content for handbook; requires committee to be reconstituted once every 10 years for purpose of reviewing & updating content in handbook; requires committee to submit report to Legislature by specified date.

655.last_action: Died in Committee on Roads, Bridges, & Ports Policy (EDCA)
655.title: Personal Transport Devices
655.description: Revises definition of term "electric personal assistive mobility device" for purposes of Florida Uniform Traffic Control Law.

656.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)

656.description: Revises provisions of code of ethics relating to standards of conduct, conflicts of interests, filing public disclosure forms, reporting of gifts, & civil penalties; establishes criteria for qualified blind trusts for certain public officials; adopts "actual malice" standard when determining if fees & costs shall be assessed against complainant, etc.

657.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 551 (Ch. 2010-130), HB 7085 (Ch. 2010-116)
657.title: Public Records and Meetings/Commission on Ethics
657.description: Provides exemption from public-records requirement for determination by Commission on Ethics regarding information or written referral of alleged violation of pt. III, ch. 112, F.S., Code of Ethics for Public Officers & Employees; provides exemption from public meetings requirements; authorizes commission & staff to share investigative information with criminal investigative agencies, etc.

659.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Services Policy (HFPC)
659.title: Behavioral Health Services
659.description: Provides exemption for certain providers from participation in community-based managing entity that provides behavioral health services.

660.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)
660.title: Annuity Contracts
660.description: Requires insurance companies to include provision in annuity contracts entered into with senior consumers authorizing senior consumers to terminate or liquidate contract without penalty upon being admitted as resident in specified long-term care facilities.

661.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal & Civil Justice Appropriations (CGHC)
661.title: Adult Guardianship
661.description: Provides purposes for & construction of jurisdictional provisions; provides for treatment of foreign countries for specified purposes; provides for communication & cooperation between courts; provides for jurisdiction; provides for determination of whether court is an appropriate forum, etc.

662.last_action: Died in Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council
662.title: Pub. Rec./Petitions to Determine Incapacity
662.description: Creates exemption from public records requirements for petitions to determine incapacity; lists persons to whom clerk of court shall allow access to petition; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

663.last_action: Died in Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council

663.description: Creates exemption from public records requirements for reports of examining committee members in proceedings to determine incapacity; lists persons to whom clerk of court shall allow access to reports of examining committee member; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

664.last_action: Died in Committee on State Universities & Private Colleges Policy (EPC)
664.title: Postsecondary Education
664.description: Authorizes program for doctor of dental medicine degree at FAMU.

665.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC)

665.description: Creates "Internet Poker Consumer Protection & Revenue Generation Act of 2010"; provides for intrastate Internet poker to be provided to public by cardroom operators through state Internet poker network operated by Internet poker hub operators; provides for administration & regulation by Division of Pari-mutuel Wagering of DBPR.

667.last_action: Died in Committee on Agriculture, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5 (Ch. 2010-230)
667.title: Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services [EPSC]
667.description: Designates official state agricultural museum & "Bronson Animal Disease Diagnostic Laboratory"; provides for agreements among DOACS, FWCC, & DEP for uniform regulation of pesticides applied to waters of state; authorizes temporary deviations from certain DEP rule provisions for certain pesticides; requires water management districts to give priority to agricultural use of certain parcels for purposes of management of such parcels, etc.

668.last_action: Died in Committee on Insurance, Business, & Financial Affairs Policy (GGPC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176), CS/CS/SB 1736 (Ch. 2010-90)
668.title: Insurance Fraud and Abuse
668.description: Designates act "Comprehensive Insurance Fraud Investigation and Prevention Act of 2010"; revises when vehicle crash report is required; requires certain health care clinic licensure & exemption documents to include certain notice; provides for reports of suspected health care clinic licensure violations & information sharing; provides that clinic violations are grounds for disciplining health care professionals, etc.

669.title: Parental Notice of Abortion
669.description: Revises notice requirements relating to termination of pregnancy of minor; provides exceptions to notice requirements; revises procedure for judicial waiver of notice; provides for minor to petition for hearing within specified time; provides that in hearing relating to waiving requirement for parental notice court consider certain additional factors; provides procedure for appeal if judicial waiver of notice is not granted, etc.

670.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Policy (EPC)
670.title: Study of School District Costs
670.description: Requires DOE to contract with out-of-state postsecondary educational institution to conduct study to analyze Florida's district cost differential amenities index & to develop cost-of-education index; requires report & submission of report to Legislature & Governor.

671.last_action: Died in Committee on PreK-12 Policy (EPC)
671.title: Student Assessment
671.description: Requires DOE to adopt grade-placement assessments for grades 1 through 8 to determine grade placement for student previously enrolled in private school, parochial, religious, or denominational school, home education program, or private tutoring program; requires school districts to administer assessments; provides for use of assessments; provides parent responsibility.

672.title: Misrepresentation of Military Status [CPSC]
672.description: Prohibits person from falsely representing himself or herself as member of or representing U.S. Armed Forces or National Guard for purpose of solicitation of charitable contributions or participation in charitable or sponsor sales promotion; prohibits person from wearing uniform of or any medal or insignia authorized for use by members or veterans of U.S. Armed Forces or National Guard, etc.

673.last_action: Died in Committee on Economic Development Policy (EDCA)
673.title: Advanced Clean Energy Development Tax Credit
673.description: Authorizes business to receive tax credit for project to conduct clean energy research in development within territory of John F. Kennedy Space Center; specifies credit amounts; requires business to apply to Space Florida for eligibility to receive tax credit; requires qualified applicant to receive credit to execute & deliver written agreement to Space Florida, etc.

674.last_action: Died in Committee on Energy & Utilities Policy (GGPC)
674.title: Energy Economic Zones
674.description: Authorizes specified tax credits & other incentives for pilot energy economic zone communities; provides requirements for provision of such incentives; provides that designated energy economic zones shall be considered transportation concurrency exception areas; provides requirements for calculation of land required to accommodate anticipated growth for specified purposes; defines term "clean technology industries & technologies," etc.

675.last_action: Died in Committee on Energy & Utilities Policy (GGPC)
675.title: Study of Alternative Energy Resources
675.description: Requires Century Commission for a Sustainable Florida to contract with professional organization to study alternative energy policy for state & develop renewable energy & economic development investment plan; sets forth subjects to be studied by contracting organization; requires contracting organization to submit final report to Governor & Legislature.

676.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
676.title: State and Federal Relations
676.description: Revises legislative intent regarding Office of State-Federal Relations; provides for CFO, Governor's Office of Federal Revenue Maximization, & LCIR to have direct access to staff of Office of State-Federal Relations; requires Office of State-Federal Relations to cooperate with CFO, Governor's Office of Federal Revenue Maximization, Legislature, & LCIR, etc.

677.description: Reduces ad valorem millage cap, subject to referendum; specifies that authority is housed within City of Pinellas Park for administrative purposes; increases & revises authority membership; increases term for each member; deletes provisions requiring secretary & treasurer to be elected & treasurer to post surety bond; deletes provision relating to insurance premiums; provides for referendum on millage cap.

678.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)

678.description: Revises definition of term "health access settings" for purposes of provisions regulating practice of dentistry; revises scope of practice for dental hygienists; revises locations at which dental hygienists may perform dental charting; authorizes dental hygienists to perform certain duties without supervision by dentist.

680.title: Manatee County
680.description: Revises legal boundaries of City of Anna Maria to remove land that is currently included in boundaries of City of Holmes Beach & to include submerged lands; exempts Manatee County from certain regulations of City of Anna Maria; revises boundaries of City of Holmes Beach to include unincorporated land owned by DOT.

681.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
681.title: Citrus County
681.description: Codifies, amends, reenacts, & repeals special acts related to Citrus County Hospital Board.

682.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
682.title: Pasco County
682.description: Provides that any deed restrictions affecting real property located in county which require persons in single-family homes to use specific solid waste collection services are void & unenforceable; provides exceptions.

684.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
684.title: City of Weeki Wachee, Hernando County
684.description: Limits rate of ad valorem taxation on real property; prohibits levy of ad valorem taxes on tangible personal property.

685.title: Spring Hill Fire Rescue & EMS Dist./Hernando Co.
685.description: Revises Spring Hill Fire Rescue and Emergency Medical Services District boundaries.

687.title: Spring Lake Improvement District, Highlands County
687.description: Deletes obsolete & repetitive language; provides minimum charter requirements; amends board, election, & term of office provisions; amends compensation for board members to comply with general law; deletes obsolete powers; provides additional district powers, including mosquito control, fire & emergency services, & construction & maintenance of school facilities; provides for applicability of general laws; provides ballot statement;

688.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Care Regulation Policy (HFPC)

688.description: Deletes requirement that person who applies to be certified or is certified as emergency medical technician, paramedic, 911 emergency dispatcher, emergency medical technician, or paramedic must complete educational course approved by DOH regarding HIV/AIDS, etc.

689.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
689.title: State Financial Matters
689.description: Prohibits agency or branch of state government from contracting, without legislative authority, to pay liquidated damages or early termination fees resulting from breach or early termination of contract or agreement, to pay interest because of insufficient budget authority to pay obligation in current year, from obligating state to make future payments to cover unpaid balances, etc.

690.title: Career Offenders [SPSC]
690.description: Prohibits performing specified acts with intent to assist career offender in eluding law enforcement agency that is seeking to find career offender to question career offender about, or to arrest career offender for, his or her noncompliance.

692.last_action: Died in Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council
692.title: Civil Citations
692.description: Requires expungement of nonjudicial arrest record of minor who successfully completes civil citation program; requires FDLE to expunge nonjudicial record of arrest of minor who successfully completes civil citation program; sets forth conditions that apply for FDLE to expunge record; authorizes processing fee; provides for retroactive effect.

694.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)

694.description: Authorizes counties, municipalities, political subdivisions, & agencies of state which have been excluded from participation in Insurance Risk Management Trust Fund to require their officers, employees, & agents to make payment of certain judgments under certain circumstances, etc.

696.description: Revises provisions relating to John M. McKay Scholarships for Students with Disabilities Program; authorizes Commissioner of Education to deny, suspend, or revoke private school's participation in scholarship program if owner or operator of such school has operated educational institution in this state or another in manner contrary to health, safety, or welfare of public, etc.

697.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 1752; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7109 (Ch. 2010-136), CS/SB 1118 (Ch. 2010-208), CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147) -HJ 01135

697.description: Requires agencies receiving county or municipal economic development funds to submit reports; requires counties & municipalities to submit reports to LCIR & include in annual financial audits; authorizes extension of economic development ad valorem tax exemptions; provides for distribution of proceeds of sales & use tax & certain other taxes to National Swimming Center at Cape Coral, etc.

698.last_action: Died in Committee on Military & Local Affairs Policy (EDCA)
698.title: Effective Public Notices by Governmental Entities
698.description: Authorizes local government to use its publicly accessible website for legally required notices & advertisements; defines "publicly accessible website"; provides conditions for utilization of publicly accessible website for such purposes; provides for optional receipt of legally required public notices & advertisements via first class mail or e-mail, etc.

699.description: Provides additional powers & duties of Legislative Budget Commission; subjects Florida Clerks of Court Operations Corporation to specified procurement requirements; removes statement exempting corporation from APA; revises & expands duties & responsibilities of corporation relating to budget requests; requires corporation to submit specified budgets & information to Legislative Budget Commission, etc. APPROPRIATION: Indeterminate.

701.description: Designates act "Raymond L. Marky Speedy Trial Reform Act"; provides legislative findings & intent concerning speedy trial requirements; specifies periods for commencement of trial absent request for application of speedy trial time periods; specifies periods for commencement of trial when request for application of speedy trial periods is made; provides grounds for denial of such motion, etc.

702.description: Provides for appointment of additional members to Sarasota County Tourist Development Council; specifies requirements for council members; provides for duties, responsibilities, & procedures of council; provides for superseding specified provisions of general law.

704.last_action: Died in Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council
704.title: Homeowner Relief
704.description: Creates "Homeowner Relief & Housing Recovery Act"; provides general provisions for nonjudicial foreclosures; provides criteria for notice & knowledge; provides for transactions creating security interest; provides for time of foreclosure; provides procedures, requirements, & limitations before foreclosure; specifies right to foreclose; requires notice of default; provides right to cure, etc.

705.description: Proposes nonbinding statewide advisory referendum; requires that question regarding balanced federal budget be printed on ballot & submitted to voters in 2010 general election.

706.description: Creates "Florida Nurse Home Visitation Act"; establishes nurse home visitation pilot program in specified areas; provides purpose; requires local Healthy Start coalitions to administer program; provides duties of DOH; provides for administration & evaluation of program; provides eligibility requirements; requires DOH to adopt standards & guidelines & submit annual report to Governor & Legislature.

707.description: Provides that arbitration agreement that violates specified requirements is voidable at consumer's option until initiation of arbitration; prohibits agreement from restricting or abolishing any substantive or due process right or restricting damages or remedies; requires allowing selection of arbitrators by mutual agreement; requires court to appoint acceptable arbitrators if parties are unable to agree, etc.

710.description: Revises rulemaking authority of Department of Lottery; authorizes department to adopt rules governing operation of games offered by department; authorizes department to adopt emergency rules for purpose of implementing instant ticket games & online games; removes authority of department to perform any functions of DMS under any of chs. 255, 273, 281, 283, & 287, F.S., etc.

712.last_action: Died in Committee on Civil Justice & Courts Policy (CCJP)

721.description: Exempts specified categories or types of insurance & types of commercial lines risks from specified rate requirements; excludes specified commercial motor vehicle insurance from specified motor vehicle insurance rate requirements; prohibits specified commercial motor vehicle insurance from being excessive, inadequate, or unfairly discriminatory, etc.

722.description: Requires each agency, before adopting, amending, or repealing certain rules, to prepare statement of estimated regulatory costs of proposed rule if proposed rule has adverse impacts on small business or increases regulatory costs; provides exception to circumstances under which emergency rule shall not be effective, etc.

730.description: Authorizes doctor of medicine degree program at FAU.

733.description: Revises provisions relating to employment policy of state; revises rulemaking authority of DMS; revises & provides provisions relating to state agencies, ad hoc advisory committees, State Personnel System, state employees, telecommuting, collective bargaining, Select Exempt Service positions, civil service positions, Senior Management Services positions, other-personal-service employment, etc.

738.description: (THIS BILL COMBINED IN CS/H1407, H1367, & H1605) Directs counties & municipalities, in cooperation with water management districts, to evaluate primary water resources; authorizes counties & municipalities to use funds collected for water & sewage utility services for water resource protection & restoration; authorizes counties & municipalities to transfer funds to water management districts for such purposes.

744.description: Extends & enlarges boundaries of North Springs Improvement District.

747.description: Revises provisions relating to authority's purpose & grant application criteria; corrects cross-references.

749.description: Corrects legal description of Lake Padgett Estates Independent Special District boundaries.

752.description: Provides moneys for annual period beginning July 1, 2010, & ending June 30, 2011, to pay salaries, & other expenses, capital outlay - buildings, & other improvements, & for other specified purposes of various agencies of state government. APPROPRIATION: $70,377,423,887.

759.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-159; companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152)
759.title: Mental Health and Substance Abuse [WPSC]

760.description: Provides for counter-marketing & advertising campaign to include innovative communication strategies; revises terminology; provides requirements for administration & management of program by DOH; specifies purpose of certain funds distributed under program; revises area health education center network program component functions & requirements; deletes obsolete language.
