764.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-163; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 325 (Ch. 2010-80), HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152)
764.title: Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles [WPSC]
764.description: Revises provisions for motor vehicle crash reports; provides for short-form crash reports; requires department to authorize any or all of tax collectors in several counties of state to serve as its agent for provision of specified driver's license services; directs department, in conjunction with Florida Tax Collectors Association, to develop plan to transition all driver's license issuance services to county tax collectors, etc.

765.last_action: Died in Conference Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152), HB 5003 (Ch. 2010-153)
765.title: Transportation Revenue [WPSC]
765.description: Provides for imposition of specified service charge on specified income of revenue nature; revises disposition of proceeds collected on initial application for registration of specified motor vehicles; providing for effect of revised funding levels on certain projects.

766.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-164; companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152)
766.title: Supplemental Corporate Fees [WPSC]
766.description: Revises exception from imposition of late charge upon certain business entities remitting supplemental corporate fee after specified deadline.

767.last_action: Died in Conference Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152)
767.title: Department of Revenue Maps and Photographs [WPSC]
767.description: Revises requirements for DOR to prescribe & furnish aerial photographs & nonproperty ownership maps to property appraisers; requires that such aerial photographs & maps furnished by DOR to property appraisers be at property appraiser's expense.

768.last_action: Veto Message received -HJ 00011; Veto Message referred to Rules and Calendar Council -HJ 00016
768.title: Department of Financial Services [WPSC]
768.description: Revises duties of Division of Consumer Services; revises criteria for premiums charged to agencies & departments for purposes of State Risk Management Trust Fund; revises reporting requirements on state insurance program; requires Division of Risk Management to analyze & report on certain agency return-to-work programs & activities; requires certain agencies to establish & maintain return-to-work programs for certain employees, etc.

769.last_action: Died in Conference Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152)
769.title: Public Employees Relations Commission [WPSC]
769.description: Requires commission to be comprised of chair & two part-time members; requires chair of commission to devote full time to commission duties & not engage in any other business, vocation, or employment while in such office; prohibits part-time members from engaging in any business, vocation, or employment that conflicts with their duties while in such office.

771.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 1628; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1628 (Ch. 2010-12) -HJ 00388
771.title: Trust Funds/Federal Grants Trust Fund/DMS
771.description: Creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within DMS; provides for purpose of trust fund & sources of funds; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

772.last_action: Veto Message received -HJ 00011; Veto Message referred to Rules and Calendar Council -HJ 00016
772.title: Review of the Department of Management Services [WPSC]
772.description: Revises governance of DMS; provides for electronic filing & transmission procedures for certain actions, proceedings, & petitions; requires petitioner requesting administrative hearing to include petitioner's e-mail address; requires attorney to use electronic means when filing document with Division of Administrative Hearings; provides requirements for use of wireless communication devices by agency employees, etc. APPROPRIATION: $2,185,746.

773.last_action: Died in Conference Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152)
773.title: Health Insurance Subsidies [WPSC]
773.description: Revises provisions relating to health insurance subsidies; provides for elimination of retiree health insurance subsidies to certain new retirees or beneficiaries; provides for future repeal of certain retiree health insurance subsidies; revises employer contribution requirements; provides for future repeal of required employer contributions on behalf of specified members, etc.

775.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-165; companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152)
775.title: State Employees [WPSC]
775.description: Provides for resolution of certain collective bargaining issues at impasse between State of Florida & certified bargaining units of state employees; provides for all other mandatory collective bargaining issues at impasse & that are not addressed by act or General Appropriations Act to be resolved consistent with personnel rules or by otherwise maintaining status quo.

776.last_action: Died in Conference Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152)
776.title: Florida Savings Fund [WPSC]
776.description: Establishes Florida Savings Fund; specifies that fund balance is part of working capital balance of state; provides for calculation of required fund balance; provides for transfer of funds from General Revenue Fund to Florida Savings Fund; requires that interest earned by Florida Savings Fund be deposited in General Revenue Fund; provides for use of funds in Florida Savings Fund, etc.

777.last_action: Died in Conference Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152), CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
777.title: Joint Legislative Organizations [WPSC]
777.description: Consolidates joint legislative functions; provides for Legislative Accountability Office, to assume certain duties & obligations of Auditor General & OPPAGA; revises duties of JAPC, Legislative Auditing Committee, & EDR; repeals provisions relating to Auditor General, OPPAGA, JAPC, LCIR, Joint Legislative Committee on Everglades Oversight, Florida Government Accountability Act, interstate cooperation, etc.

778.last_action: Died in Conference Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152)
778.title: Agency Travel [WPSC]
778.description: Provides job-related travel & reimbursement reporting requirements for state agency heads & other specified state officials.

779.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-166; companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152), HB 5003 (Ch. 2010-153), CS/HB 7157 (Ch. 2010-138)
779.title: Taxation [WPSC]
779.description: Directs DOR to develop & implement amnesty program for taxpayers subject to state & local taxes; provides time periods, program guidelines, eligible participants, & for waiver of penalties & interest under specified circumstances; revises rate & distribution of taxes on severance of phosphate rock; provides that DOR may release confidential taxpayer information relating to corporation having outstanding tax warrant to DBPR, etc. APPROPRIATION: $2,776,025.

780.last_action: Died, reference deferred, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 622 (Ch. 2010-29)
780.title: Pari-mutuel Permitholders
780.description: Revises effective date provisions of ch. 2009-170, LOF, to remove contingency requirements applicable to provisions of that act relating to pari-mutuel industry & specify date for those provisions to take effect.

781.title: Regulation of Electronic Communications
781.description: Repeals provisions relating to regulation of telegraph companies; removes provisions requiring transmission & delivery of messages; removes provisions relating to liability & recovery of damages; repeals provisions relating to telecommunications services, etc.

782.title: Renewable Energy Property Tax Exemption
782.description: Deletes definition of term "renewable energy source device"; repeals renewable energy source device property tax exemption.

783.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
783.title: Pollutant Discharge Prevention and Removal
783.description: Eliminates requirement that DEP make recommendations to Legislature each regular session relating to operation of Pollutant Discharge Prevention & Control Act; removes obsolete language requiring DEP to submit report relating to preapproved advanced cleanup of petroleum contamination sites to Governor & Legislature.

784.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
784.title: Aquaculture
784.description: Eliminates requirement that FWCC provide assistance to DACS in development of aquaculture plan for state.

785.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
785.title: South Florida Tropical Fruit Plan
785.description: Revises provisions relating to South Florida Tropical Fruit Plan; eliminates requirement for Commissioner of Agriculture, in consultation with Tropical Fruit Advisory Council, to submit plans, reports, & requests relating to tropical fruit industry to Legislature.

786.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
786.title: Interagency Agreements/State Water Resources
786.description: Removes obsolete language requiring Secretary of Environmental Protection to submit report relating to certain interagency agreements & environmental protection measures to Legislature by specified date.

788.title: Pub. Rec./Credit History/Credit Scores/OFR [CPSC]
788.description: Creates exemption from public records requirements for credit history information & credit scores held by OFR within DFS & related to licensing of loan originators, mortgage brokers, & mortgage lenders; provides exception to exemption for specified governmental entities; transfers specified provisions; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

789.title: Mortgage Guaranty Trust Fund/OFR [CPSC]
789.description: Creates Mortgage Guaranty Trust Fund within OFR of DFS; provides for sources of funds & purposes; provides for annual carryforward of funds; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

790.title: Government-Sponsored Health Insurance
790.description: Repeals Florida Employee Long-Term-Care Plan Act & provisions relating to health insurance for retirees under FRS, authority of DMS to initiate & supervise group insurance program for active members of FHP Auxiliary, & participation by correctional work programs nonprofit corporation in state group health insurance & prescription drug programs.

791.title: Repeal of Obsolete Insurance Provisions
791.description: Deletes specified obsolete provisions of insurance law relating to transfer of funds from SBA to Citizens Property Insurance Corporation, Florida Automobile Joint Underwriting Association presuit notice, Citizens Property Insurance Corporation reporting, reporting of activities relating to sinkhole database, feasibility & cost-benefit study of Florida Sinkhole Insurance Facility, etc.

792.title: Residential Property Structural Soundness
792.description: Deletes obsolete unfunded Citizens Property Insurance Corporation residential property structural soundness evaluation grant program.

794.title: Certification of Minority Business Enterprises
794.description: Deletes provisions establishing Minority Business Certification Task Force, requiring that criteria for certification of minority business enterprises be approved by task force, & authorizing task force to amend statewide & interlocal agreement for certification of minority business enterprises.

795.title: Judiciary [SPSC]
795.description: Repeals specified provisions of law relating to terms of Supreme Court, circuit courts, & district courts of appeal, census commissions for judicial circuits, attendance or nonattendance of circuit court judges, calling cases on docket at end of circuit court term, executive officers of circuit courts, residence of circuit court clerks, compensation of marshal, & guardians of incapacitated world war veterans.

796.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-1; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1736 (Ch. 2010-90)
796.title: Unemployment Compensation [CPSC]
796.description: Establishes temporary state extended benefits for weeks of unemployment; provides for state extended benefits for certain weeks & for periods of high unemployment; reduces amount of exempt wages beginning January 1, 2010; increases amount of exempt wages beginning January 1, 2012; suspends exempt wages adjustment when repayment of federal advance is owed, etc. APPROPRIATION: $1,547,504.

797.title: Criminal Justice [SPSC]
797.description: Repeals provision relating to prohibition on Attorney General collecting fee for defending supposed offender; repeals provisions relating to sheriff's or deputy's required place of residence; removes penalty provisions relating to criminal transmission of HIV; revises provisions relating to obsolete community residential drug punishment centers; repeals provisions relating to initiation of restoration of civil rights, etc.

798.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-70; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 4 (Ch. 2010-22), CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
798.title: Education [SPSC]
798.description: Revises & repeals provisions relating to vocational rehabilitation programs & services; revises provisions relating to eligibility for services; provides duties of Division of Vocational Rehabilitation in DOE; allows records to be released for audit, program evaluation, & research purposes; repeals provisions relating to SMART Schools Clearinghouse; specifies criteria for prioritization of SIT Program awards, etc.

799.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
799.title: Driver's Licenses
799.description: Repeals provisions relating to study of effects of aging on driving ability, plan of DHSMV & FDLE to ensure identification of certain driver license records, & effect of classified licensure on persons holding chauffeur's license.

800.title: Outdoor Theaters
800.description: Repeals provisions relating to access to public roads from outdoor theaters; removes provisions for entrances, exits, enclosures, vehicle storage, screen orientation, tower location, & driveway lighting; removes requirements for qualifying certificate to prove compliance with agency regulations prior to issuance of occupational license by tax collector.

801.title: Transportation Corridors
801.description: Repeals provisions relating to statewide transportation corridors; removes provisions that specify certain transportation facilities as statewide transportation corridors.

802.title: Local Government Services
802.description: Repeals provision relating to efficiency & accountability in local government services.

803.title: Recreation and Parks
803.description: Repeals provisions relating to recreation centers; use & acquisition of land, & equipment & maintenance; supervision; playground & recreation board; cooperation with other units & boards; gifts, grants, devises, & bequests; issuance of bonds; petition for referendum; resolution or ordinance providing for recreation system; tax levy, etc.

804.title: Governor
804.description: Repeals Governor's authority to appoint & commission private secretary.

805.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 4; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 4 (Ch. 2010-22), HB 7037 (Ch. 2010-70) -HJ 00615
805.title: Education Accountability
805.description: Revises statewide student achievement testing program; discontinues administration of certain FCAT assessments in specified school years; requires end-of-course assessments in certain subjects beginning with students entering grade 9 in specified school years; requires use of scaled scores & achievement levels for measuring student's knowledge & skills; provides for waiver of assessment requirements for certain students, etc.

806.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
806.title: Growth Policy
806.description: Repeals Urban Infill & Redevelopment Assistance Grant Program & provision relating to review & evaluation of Growth Policy Act.

807.title: Florida Industrial Development Corporation
807.description: Repeals provisions relating to Florida Industrial Development Corporation.

808.title: Formation of Local Governments
808.description: Deletes reference to Department of Community Affairs; deletes provision specifying authority of DCA & authority & responsibility of state & local agencies to cooperate in administration of specified provisions.

809.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7157 (Ch. 2010-138), CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102), CS/CS/SB 1736 (Ch. 2010-90)
809.title: Deletion of Obsolete Florida Statutes Provisions
809.description: Repeals or deletes provisions relating to DOR-approved bidder lists & standard contracts relating to sales of electronic data processing programs or equipment, DOR monitoring of use of tax deductions & annual report on persons claiming such deductions, obsolete DOR disclosure provision, & obsolete waiver of electronic telefile reporting requirement.

810.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted SB 1784; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1784 (Ch. 2010-5) -HJ 00229
810.title: Florida Statutes
810.description: Deletes provisions that have expired, have become obsolete, have had their effect, have served their purpose, or have been impliedly repealed or superseded; replaces incorrect cross-references & citations; corrects grammatical, typographical, & like errors; removes inconsistencies, redundancies, & unnecessary repetition in statutes; improves clarity of statutes & facilitates their correct interpretation, etc.

812.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted SB 1780; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1780 (Ch. 2010-3) -HJ 00229
812.title: Official Florida Statutes
812.description: Adopts Florida Statutes 2010 & designates portions thereof that are to constitute official law of state; provides that Florida Statutes 2010 shall be effective immediately upon publication; provides that general laws enacted during 2009 regular session & prior thereto & not included in Florida Statutes 2010 are repealed, etc.

813.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-114; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 5401 (Ch. 2010-162)
813.title: Screening [SPSC]
813.description: Revises exemption from screening requirements for volunteers who assist providers under contract with DCFS; revises background screening requirements for Guardian Ad Litem Program, mental health personnel, nursing home personnel, home health agency personnel, nurse registry personnel, companions & homemakers, hospice personnel, personnel at homes for special services, & transitional living facility personnel, etc.

814.title: Repealing Budgeting Provisions
814.description: Deletes requirement for state agencies & judicial branch to submit certain budget summary information in accordance with legislative budget instruction; repeals provision relating to Mobility 2000 funding.

815.title: Obsolete Health Care Provisions
815.description: Repeals provisions relating to separate restrooms & dressing rooms for males & females, Florida Healthy People 2010 Program, & MedAccess program.

816.title: Health and Human Services
816.description: Repeals obsolete provisions relating to child abuse prevention training in district school system, DCFS model plan for community intervention & treatment in intrafamily sexual abuse cases, authorization for pilot & demonstration projects, Commission on Marriage & Family Support Initiatives, Family Policy Act, financial commitment to community services programs, respite & family care subsidy expenditures & funding recommendations, etc.

817.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
817.title: Legislative Advisory Bodies
817.description: Repeals provisions relating to Commission on Interstate Cooperation, Senate Committee on Interstate Cooperation, House of Representatives Committee on Interstate Cooperation, Joint Legislative Committee on Interstate Cooperation, Governor's Committee on Interstate Cooperation, etc.

818.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-115; companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7123 (Ch. 2010-42)
818.title: OGSR/Voter Information [SPSC]
818.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemption from public records requirements for certain information regarding voters & voter registration & which provides exemption from copying requirements for signatures of voters & voter registrants; makes clarifying changes; creates public-records exemption for specified personal identifying information of stalking victims held by the Attorney General, etc.

819.last_action: Died, reference deferred, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
819.title: Review/DCFS/Florida Government Accountability Act
819.description: Reenacts provisions establishing DCFS; renames Department of Children & Family Services as Department of Children & Families; authorizes DCF to establish circuits & regions based on judicial circuits & headed by circuit administrators & region directors; revises provisions relating to establishment & structure of, & services provided by, department; provides directive to Division of Statutory Revision.

820.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/CS/SB 694; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 694 (Ch. 2010-187) -HJ 01173
820.title: Child Support Enforcement
820.description: Revises provisions relating to child support payments; clarifies that income deduction payments are required to be paid to State Disbursement Unit; authorizes DOR to provide documentation of income of parent receiving public assistance to court, to collect noncovered medical expenses in installments by issuing income deduction notice to modify support orders, & to seek waiver, etc.

821.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-116; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 551 (Ch. 2010-130)
821.title: OGSR/Commission on Ethics [GPSC]
821.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemption from public records requirements for complaints & related records held by Commission on Ethics or Commission on Ethics and Public Trust established by county or municipality & exemption from public meetings requirements for proceedings conducted by such commissions pursuant to complaint or preliminary investigation; reorganizes exemption.

822.title: OGSR/Guardians Ad Litem [SPSC]
822.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemption from public records requirements for identification & location information of current or former guardians ad litem & spouses & children thereof; expands exemption to include names & locations of schools or day care facilities attended by children of current or former guardians ad litem; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption, etc.

823.title: OGSR/Florida Self-Insurers Guaranty Association [CPSC]
823.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemptions from public records & public meetings requirements for Florida Self-Insurers Guaranty Association, Inc.

824.title: OGSR/Insurance Claim Data Exchange Information/DOR [SPSC]
824.description: Saves from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act exemption from public records requirements for certain records obtained by DOR under insurance claim data exchange system; extends repeal date of exemption.

825.title: OGSR/Domestic Security Oversight Council [GPSC]
825.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemptions from public records & public meetings requirements for Domestic Security Oversight Council.

826.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/CS/SB 846; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176), CS/CS/CS/SB 846 (Ch. 2010-99) -HJ 01128
826.title: Residential Fire Sprinkler Requirements
826.description: Prohibits incorporation into Florida Building Code of mandatory residential fire sprinkler provisions of International Residential Code; prohibits requirement for installation of fire sprinklers in single-family dwelling units.

828.last_action: Died in returning Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
828.title: Legislative Reauthorizations [EPSC]
828.description: Reauthorizes specified exemptions, 2-year extensions, & local comprehensive plan amendments granted, authorized, or adopted under general law & in effect as of specified date.

829.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 131 (Ch. 2010-167)
829.title: Voter Interface Device Requirements
829.description: Extends deadline by which persons with disabilities will be required to vote on voter interface devices meeting specified requirements.

831.last_action: Died in Economic Development & Community Affairs Policy Council
831.title: Review of DCA/Fla. Government Accountability Act
831.description: With respect to review of DCA under Florida Government Accountability Act, reenacts pt. V of ch. 420, F.S., "Florida Housing Finance Corporation Act"; provides for appointment of inspector general of FHFC; provides appointing authority thereof; provides duties & responsibilities of inspector general; revises definitions of "state agency" & "agency head" to include FHFC within state agencies within which Office of Inspector General is established, etc.

832.last_action: Died in Economic Development & Community Affairs Policy Council, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5003 (Ch. 2010-153), CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
832.title: Review/DCA/Florida Government Accountability Act
832.description: With respect to review of DCA under Florida Government Accountability Act, reenacts provisions relating to establishment of DCA & divisions & offices thereof, & powers, duties, & functions of DCA & its divisions & offices; revises various provisions relating to Florida Communities Trust Act; repeals Community-Based Development Organization Assistance Act, etc.

833.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-136; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
833.title: Qualified Target Industry Tax Refund Program [WPSC]
833.description: Establishes schedule for OTTED to review & revise list of target industries & submit report to Governor & Legislature; revises criteria for evaluating applications for program; requires consideration of state's return on investment in evaluating applications for participation in program; requires EDR to submit reports to Legislature evaluating calculation of state's return on investment for program, etc.

834.title: OGSR/Information Held by Guardians Ad Litem [SPSC]
834.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemption from public records requirements for certain information regarding child held by guardian ad litem; clarifies & reorganizes exemption.

835.title: OGSR/State Child Abuse Death Review Committee [SPSC]
835.description: Saves from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act exemption from public records requirements for information held or obtained by State Child Abuse Death Review Committee or any local committee & exemption from public meetings requirements for specified meetings of committee or local committee; defines term "local committee"; reorganizes provisions, etc.

836.title: OGSR/I.D. of Minor/Waiver/Termination of Pregnancy [SPSC]
836.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemption from public records requirements for information that could identify minor which is contained in record relating to minor's petition to waive notice requirements when terminating pregnancy; makes editorial changes; expands exemption to include such information held by office of criminal conflict & civil regional counsel or Justice Administrative Commission, etc.

837.title: OGSR/Funeral, Cemetery & Consumer Services Board [CPSC]
837.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemptions from public meetings & public records requirements for Board of Funeral, Cemetery, & Consumer Services within DFS & for certain information held by DFS; requires recording of closed meetings wherein licensure examination questions or answers are discussed; creates public record exemption for recordings of closed meetings, etc.

838.title: OGSR/Hurricane Loss Projection Methodology [CPSC]
838.description: Requires recording of closed meeting of Florida Commission on Hurricane Loss Projection Methodology or of rate proceeding on insurer's rate filing at which confidential & exempt trade secrets are discussed; creates public records exemption for recording of closed meeting; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity, etc.

839.title: OGSR/Hurricane Loss and Exposure Data [CPSC]
839.description: Saves from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act exemption from public records requirements for specified reports of hurricane loss data & associated exposure data that are specific to particular insurance company; requires specified FIU center to publish annual report summarizing loss data & associated exposure data collected from residential property insurers & licensed rating & advisory organizations, etc.

840.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-42; companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7079 (Ch. 2010-115)
840.title: OGSR/Address Confidentiality/Domestic Violence [SPSC]
840.description: Saves from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act exemptions from public records requirements for identifying information of participants in Address Confidentiality Program for Victims of Domestic Violence held by Office of Attorney General & contained in voter registration & voting records held by supervisor of elections & Department of State.

841.title: Criminal Penalties for Violations of Tax Statutes
841.description: Imposes additional monetary penalty on dealer for willfully failing to collect specified taxes or fees after notice of duty to collect taxes or fees by DOR; specifies schedule of criminal penalties relating to amounts not collected; requires DOR to send written notice of duty to register by specified means; revises provisions imposing additional monetary penalty on persons making false or fraudulent returns, etc.

843.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-182; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 713 (Ch. 2010-106), CS/SB 464 (Ch. 2010-79)
843.title: Military Support [EPSC]
843.description: Provides applicability of provisions governing compatibility of land development with military installations under Local Government Comprehensive Planning & Land Development Regulation Act to specified local governments & associated military installations, etc.

845.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted SB 1626; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1626 (Ch. 2010-11) -HJ 00389
845.title: Trust Funds/Ringling Investment Trust Fund/DMS
845.description: Terminates Ringling Investment Trust Fund within DMS; provides for disposition of balances in & revenues of trust fund; prescribes procedures for terminating trust fund.

846.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 1630; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1630 (Ch. 2010-13) -HJ 00389
846.title: Audit and Warrant Clearing Trust Fund/DOR
846.description: Re-creates Audit & Warrant Clearing Trust Fund within DOR without modification.

847.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted SB 1632; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1632 (Ch. 2010-14) -HJ 00389
847.title: Transportation Revenue Bond Trust Fund/DOT
847.description: Reenacts Transportation Revenue Bond Trust Fund within DOT & provides for future review & termination of trust fund.

848.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 1634; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1634 (Ch. 2010-15) -HJ 00390
848.title: Transportation Governmental Bond Trust Fund/DOT
848.description: Creates Transportation Governmental Bond Trust Fund within DOT; provides purpose of trust fund & sources of funds; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

849.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 1636; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1636 (Ch. 2010-16) -HJ 00390
849.title: Trust Funds/Clearing Trust Fund/DOS
849.description: Creates Clearing Funds Trust Fund within DOS; provides for sources of funds & purposes; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund; clarifies provisions requiring that election assessments be transferred to Elections Commission Trust Fund within DLA; requires that filing fees for certain offices be transferred to DLA rather than DOR for deposit into Elections Commission Trust Fund, etc.

850.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 1638; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1638 (Ch. 2010-17) -HJ 00391
850.title: Trust Funds/Federal Grants Trust Fund/DOS
850.description: Creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within Department of State; provides for purpose of trust fund & sources of funds; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

851.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 1640; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1640 (Ch. 2010-18) -HJ 00391
851.title: Trust Funds/Florida Forever Program Trust Fund/DCA
851.description: Re-creates Florida Forever Program Trust Fund within DCA; reenacts & amends provisions relating to trust fund; provides for sources of funds & purposes thereof & annual carryforward of funds; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

852.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 1642; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1642 (Ch. 2010-19) -HJ 00391
852.title: Trust Funds/Emergency Response Trust Fund/DMA
852.description: Re-creates Emergency Response Trust Fund within DMA without modification; abrogates provisions relating to termination of trust fund.

853.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted SB 2462; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 2462 (Ch. 2010-21) -HJ 00392
853.title: Trust Funds/Federal Grants Trust Fund/DCA
853.description: Creates Federal Grants Trust Fund within DCA; provides for sources of funds & purposes; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

854.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 2386 (Ch. 2010-151)
854.title: Procurement
854.description: Revises & organizes provisions relating to procurement of commodities & contractual services by state; specifies authorized uses for competitive solicitation processes; provides procedures & requirements with respect to competitive solicitation; specifies types of procurements for which invitations to bid, requests for proposals, & invitations to negotiate are to be utilized & provides procedures & requirements with respect thereto, etc.

855.title: Open Government Sunset Review Act
855.description: Amends various sections of law for purpose of correcting cross-references to repealed section of Florida Statutes.

856.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 2386 (Ch. 2010-151)
856.title: Claims for Collections Due the State
856.description: Provides that each agency is responsible for exercising due diligence in securing payment for all accounts receivable & other claims due to state; creates requirements for agencies for purposes of reporting delinquent accounts receivable; requires agencies to report annually to Legislature & CFO on accounts receivable & other claims due to state, etc.

858.last_action: Died in Committee on Government Operations Appropriations (CGHC), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 2386 (Ch. 2010-151)
858.title: DMS Review/Florida Government Accountability Act
858.description: Reenacts provision relating to creation & organization of DMS; provides requirements for petitioners & respondents requesting administrative hearing; requires filing of documents with DOAH by electronic means; provides for electronic filing & transmission procedures for certain actions, proceedings, & petitions; repeals provisions relating to Council on Efficient Government, etc.

859.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 5401 (Ch. 2010-162)
859.title: Court-Appointed Counsel
859.description: Specifies that lien for cost of court-appointed counsel against parent for services provided to child does not expire upon emancipation of child or upon child reaching age of majority; clarifies proceedings in which party may qualify for court-appointed counsel; revises provisions relating to payment of application fee by person eligible for court-appointed counsel, etc.

861.title: OGSR/Domestic Violence Fatality Review Teams [SPSC]
861.description: Removes scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act of exemption from public records requirements for specified identifying information in records created by domestic violence fatality review team & exemption from public meetings requirements for specified meetings of domestic violence fatality review team.

862.title: OGSR/Commission for Independent Education [SPSC]
862.description: Saves from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act exemption from public records requirements for investigatory records held by Commission for Independent Education & exemption from public meetings requirements for probable cause panel wherein exempt information is discussed; reorganizes exemption; requires recording for any portion of closed meeting of probable cause panel, etc.

863.title: State-owned Real Property
863.description: Requires assessments of state-owned real property upon request; requires annual written notification from local governments to property appraisers; authorizes DOR to provide specified information to DEP; revises requirements for DMS to develop inventories of state-owned or state-occupied facilities; requires DEP to maintain comprehensive database of state-owned lands; specifies duties of DMS, etc.

864.last_action: Died in General Government Policy Council
864.title: Stormwater Management Systems
864.description: Requires DEP, in coordination with water management districts, to develop uniform statewide stormwater quality treatment rule; provides exemptions for specified stormwater management systems & permitted activities; provides exemption from ch. 120; provides applicability, effect, & repeal of specified rules.

865.last_action: Died in Full Appropriations Council on Education & Economic Development
865.title: Handbill Distribution
865.description: Requires that permission to distribute handbills be written; provides additional penalties; specifies that certain items are subject to seizure & forfeiture; Revises definition of term "contraband" to include items subject to seizure & forfeiture for certain violations of handbill distribution statute, etc.

866.title: Consumptive Use Permits
866.description: Reduces frequency of compliance reports during term of consumptive use permit; prohibits decreases in maximum permitted allocation for consumptive use of water under specified conditions; provides exception to certain revocation of consumptive use permits for implementation of conservation measures.

868.title: Qualifying Improvements to Real Property [WPSC]
868.description: Authorizes local government to levy non-ad valorem assessments to fund certain improvements; authorizes property owner to apply for funding & enter into financing agreement with local government to finance certain improvements; authorizes local government to collect moneys for such purposes through non-ad valorem assessments; provides collection requirements, etc.

870.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5311 (Ch. 2010-161)
870.title: Reorganization of the Department of Health
870.description: Revises mission & responsibilities of department; provides duties of State Surgeon General with respect to management of department; abolishes responsibility to regulate health practitioners effective July 1, 2011; abolishes specified divisions of department effective July 1, 2011, unless reviewed & reenacted by Legislature; authorizes the department to establish multicounty service areas for county health departments, etc.

871.last_action: Died in Economic Development & Community Affairs Policy Council
871.title: Review/Department of State
871.description: Reenacts provisions establishing DOS; assigns various duties of Secretary of State to DOS; revises application requirements for notaries; requires notary applicants to complete certain instruction; authorizes certain persons or entities to offer courses for required instruction; revises provisions for deposit & use of notary surcharge; provides penalties for applicants who submit applications containing certain statements, etc.

873.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/CS/SB 6 (Vetoed by Governor); Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7037 (Ch. 2010-70) -HJ 00618
873.title: Education Personnel
873.description: Revises provisions relating to teacher preparation programs, school district compensation & salary schedules, appraisal of education personnel, & educator certification requirements; requires school districts to develop & implement end-of-course assessments; creates Performance Fund for Instructional Personnel & School-Based Administrators; provides employment criteria for newly hired classroom teachers, etc.

874.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
874.title: Florida Keys Area
874.description: Authorizes issuance of bonds to be used to finance cost of constructing sewage facilities in Florida Keys Area; revises legislative intent relating to designation of Florida Keys as area of critical state concern; revises compliance requirements for reviewing comprehensive plan amendments; provides additional requirements for onsite sewage treatment & disposal systems in Monroe County.

875.title: OGSR/Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program [SPSC]
875.description: Saves from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act exemption from public records requirements for records of children in Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program.

876.last_action: Died, reference deferred, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 5101 (Ch. 2010-154)
876.title: Local Government Accountability
876.description: Clarifies when DCA may institute procedures for declaring special districts inactive; revises provisions relating to budgets, audits, actuarial, financial, & other reports, & statements of retirement plans for governmental entities; requires specified level of detail for each fund in proposed budgets of governmental entities; requires budgets of governmental entities to be posted online, etc.

877.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted SB 1678; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1678 (Ch. 2010-194) -HJ 01133
877.title: OGSR/H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center & Research Inst.
877.description: Saves from scheduled repeal under Open Government Sunset Review Act exemption from public records & public meetings requirements for not-for-profit corporation of H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute & its subsidiaries; clarifies & reorganizes exemption; expands public records exemption to include identity of donor or prospective donor to not-for-profit corporation or subsidiary who wishes to remain anonymous, etc.

879.last_action: Veto Message received -HJ 00012; Veto Message referred to Rules and Calendar Council -HJ 00016
879.title: Community Development Districts [WPSC]
879.description: Authorizes specified community development districts to levy tax on rental or license fee for use of real property; requires approval by district board of supervisors & district landowners; provides procedure to enact tax; provides for effective date of tax; provides for expiration of tax under specified circumstances; specifies uses of tax proceeds; requires prior approval by district board for expenditures of tax proceeds, etc.

880.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-140; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
880.title: Professional Sports Franchises [WPSC]
880.description: Amends specified provisions relating to OTTED, distribution of certain tax proceeds, & allocation of portion of local government half-cent sales tax; authorizes certain units of local government to apply for certification to receive state funding for facilities for spring training franchises; provides that OTTED may authorize direct-support organization to assist in retention of professional sports franchises, etc.

881.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
881.title: Drinking Water
881.description: Renames Florida Water Pollution Control Financing Corporation as Florida Water Pollution Control & Drinking Water Financing Corporation; revises provisions regarding purpose, powers, & duties of corporation; provides that specified drinking water projects & activities are eligible for financing; authorizes DEP to request loans for planning, designing, & constructing specified public water systems, etc.

882.title: Reorganization of the Public Service Commission
882.description: Revises requirements for nomination by Public Service Commission Nominating Council for appointment to commission; prohibits attempts by certain persons to sway judgment of commissioners; provides for Commission on Ethics to receive & investigate complaints of violations pursuant to specified procedures; provides requirements for nomination by said nominating council for appointment to commission, etc.

883.title: Pub. Rec./Office of Regulatory Staff
883.description: Provides Office of Regulatory Staff within Financial Services Commission access to specified records of telecommunications companies, public utilities, natural gas transmission companies, affiliated entities of such companies & utilities, & other persons; limits authority of PSC to access records, etc.

884.title: Capital Formation for Infrastructure Projects
884.description: Provides for creation of Florida Infrastructure Fund Partnership; provides partnership's purpose & duties; provides for management of partnership by Florida Opportunity Fund; authorizes fund to lend moneys to partnership; requires partnership to raise funds from investment partners; provides for commitment agreements with & issuance of certificates to investment partners; authorizes partnership to invest in certain infrastructure projects, etc.

886.title: Hurricane Catastrophe Fund Emergency Assessments [WPSC]
886.description: Delays repeal of exemption from specified emergency assessments provided for medical malpractice insurance premiums & subjection of such premiums to emergency assessments.

887.title: Corporate Income Tax [WPSC]
887.description: Provides for adoption of 2010 version of Internal Revenue Code; provides for retroactive operation.

888.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 622; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 622 (Ch. 2010-29) -HJ 00746
888.title: Gaming
888.description: Revises provisions relating to compact authorization; provides that specified agreements executed by Seminole Tribe of Florida & Governor are void & not in effect; approves specified compact; revises powers & duties of Governor; provides for distribution of certain moneys & of local government share; revises provisions that authorize certain gaming activity, etc.

889.title: Medicaid Managed Care
889.description: Creates pt. IV, ch. 409, F.S., entitled Medicaid Managed Care; designates AHCA as single state agency to administer Medicaid program; establishes Medicaid program as statewide, integrated managed care program for all covered services; authorizes agency to apply for & implement waivers; provides related & conforming provisions to reorganization of Medicaid managed care.

892.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7179 (Ch. 2010-139), HB 7243 (Ch. 2010-143), CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
892.title: Economic Incentives for Energy Initiatives
892.description: Revises legislative intent relating to state's energy policy; deletes provisions for renewable portfolio standard & renewable energy credits; provides mechanism for providers to recover costs to produce or purchase specified amounts of renewable energy through environmental cost-recovery clause under certain conditions; establishes Agriculture & Clean Energy Economic Development Pilot Project, etc.

893.last_action: Substituted CS/CS/CS/SB 2086; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 2086 (Ch. 2010-127) -HJ 01185
893.title: Consumer Debt Collection
893.description: Requires consumer debt collection agency to maintain certain records; increases administrative fine imposed against out-of-state consumer debt collector that fails to register as required; revises provisions relating to authorized activities of Attorney General; revises requirements for providing written notice of assignment of debt, etc.

894.title: Compulsory Health Insurance Coverage
894.description: Provides declaration of state public policy protecting persons from government compulsion to purchase health insurance coverage; authorizes AG to initiate & advocate such public policy in federal or state court or administrative forum on behalf of specified persons.

896.title: Pub. Rec./Statement of Reference/Board of Pharmacy
896.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for statements of reference held by Board of Pharmacy within DOH concerning practitioner seeking controlled substance dispensing registration; provides exception to exemption; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

897.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Substituted CS/SB 2046; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 2046 (Ch. 2010-126) -HJ 01129
897.title: Employee Leasing Companies
897.description: Deletes requirement that employee leasing company obtain approval of Board of Employee Leasing Companies before changing name or location of company; provides that board approval is not required before purchase or acquisition of company if controlling person in company is licensed; deletes provisions requiring board approval prior to existing stockholders or partners of company acquiring control of company, etc.

898.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-143; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
898.title: Environmental Control [EPSC]
898.description: Requires Enterprise Florida, Inc., to provide technical assistance to DEP in creation of Recycling Business Assistance Center; eliminates greenhouse gas registration & reporting requirement for major emitters; requires all public entities & entities occupying buildings managed by DMS to report recycling data; requires counties to meet specific recycling benchmarks; revises requirements for review of new waste-to-energy facility capacity by DEP, etc.

899.last_action: Died in Rules and Calendar Council
899.title: Federal Health Care Legislation
899.description: Urges Florida Attorney General to file suit challenging constitutionality of any individual health care mandate passed into law by Federal Government.

900.title: Taiwan

974.last_action: Signed by Officers and filed with Secretary of State

974.description: Proposes creation of s. 28, Art. I of State Constitution to prohibit laws or rules from compelling any person, employer, or health care provider to participate in any health care system, permit person or employer to purchase lawful health care services directly from health care provider, permit health care provider to accept direct payment from person or employer for lawful health care services, etc.

976.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
976.title: Expanding Public's Access/Legislative Process
976.description: Proposes amendment of s. 24, Art. I & ss. 4, 7, & 19, Art. III of State Constitution to provide that 2/3 vote of membership of each house is required to enact public records or public meeting exemptions, authorize challenges in circuit court to reasonableness or interpretation of legislative rules governing public access to legislative documents & meetings, etc.

978.last_action: Died in Rules and Calendar Council
978.title: Disabled Veterans' Property Tax Discount
978.description: Proposes amendment to s. 6, Art. VII & creation of s. 31, Art. XII of State Constitution to expand availability of property tax discount on homesteads of veterans who became disabled as result of combat injury to include those who were not Florida residents when they entered military & schedule amendment to take effect January 1, 2011.

979.last_action: Died in Full Appropriations Council on Education & Economic Development
979.title: State Trust Funds
979.description: Proposes amendment to s. 19, Art. III of State Constitution, relating to state trust funds, to require two-thirds vote of membership of each house of Legislature in separate bill for that purpose only to expend balance of state trust fund, or any portion of state trust fund, for any purpose other than purpose authorized by act that created trust fund.

980.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
980.title: Governing Boards/Election of Members
980.description: Proposes creation of s. 28, Art. X of State Constitution to require election of members of governing boards that have authority to adopt millage rates; provides for implementing legislation that may include phase-in schedule; provides that transition to elected governing boards must be completed by January 1, 2013.

981.title: Term Limits
981.description: Proposes amendment of s. 15, Art. III & s. 4, Art VI & creation of provision in Art. XII of State Constitution to increase length of terms of state senators to 6 years & state representatives to 4 years & limit state senators, state representatives, & elected county & municipal officers to 12 consecutive years in office.

982.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Affairs Policy (EDCA)
982.title: Legislative Apportionment & Cong. Redistricting
982.description: Proposes repeal of s. 16, Art. III & creation of s. 10, Art. II of State Constitution to replace existing provisions for legislative apportionment with new standards for legislative reapportionment & congressional redistricting; provides for creation of nine-member commission to prepare apportionment plan for state legislature & redistricting plan for congressional districts.

983.last_action: Died in Rules and Calendar Council
983.title: Nonhomestead Property/Homestead Exemption
983.description: Proposes amendment to ss. 4 & 6, Art. VII & creation of ss. 31 & 32, Art. XII of State Constitution to reduce from 10 percent to 5 percent limitation on annual increases in assessments of nonhomestead real property; provide new owners of homestead property who have not owned homestead property during immediately preceding 3 years with additional homestead exemption equal to 50 percent of property's just value in first year, etc.

984.last_action: Died in Criminal & Civil Justice Policy Council
984.title: Sovereignty of the State
984.description: Proposes creation of s. 28, Art. I of State Constitution to assert sovereignty of state & declare right of people of state to refuse to comply with federal mandates that violate U.S. Constitution.

985.title: Election of Superintendent of Schools
985.description: Proposes amendment to s. 5, Art. IX of State Constitution to require that district school superintendent be elected by voters in school districts having student population of 300,000 or more, thereby precluding in such districts option of school board or law approved by electors to provide for appointment of superintendent.

986.last_action: Died in Economic Development & Community Affairs Policy Council
986.title: Inheriting Homestead Property
986.description: Proposes amendment to s. 4, Art. VII of State Constitution to allow cap on homestead property assessments & transfer of that cap to new homestead to inure to spouse, child, or grandchild of property owner who inherits property if property becomes homestead of inheritor.

987.title: Religious Freedom
987.description: Proposes amendment to s. 3, Art. I of State Constitution to provide that individual may not be barred from participating in any public program because he or she has chosen to use his or her program benefits at religious provider; deletes prohibition against using revenues from public treasury directly or indirectly in aid of any church, sect, or religious denomination or in aid of any sectarian institution.

988.last_action: Died in Rules and Calendar Council
988.title: Basic Rights
988.description: Proposes amendment to s. 2, Art. I of State Constitution to eliminate authority granted to Legislature by constitutional amendment that at time of adoption in 1926 allowed Legislature to regulate or eliminate real property rights of individuals based on race or national origin, so that, as amended, Florida Constitution will state that all natural persons are equal before law, etc.

Under amendment, current limits on maximum number of students assigned to each teacher in public school classrooms would become limits on average number of students assigned per class to each teacher, by specified grade grouping, in each public school, etc.
