1044.description: Requires that the Florida Energy and Climate Commission prepare a report identifying ways to increase the energy-efficiency practices of low-income households. Requires that the report include certain determinations and recommendations. Requires that the commission submit the report to the Legislature by a specified date.

1045.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00687; Substituted HB 1 -SJ 00687; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 1 (Ch. 2010-45) -SJ 00687
1045.title: Statutes of Limitations/Wrongful Death Actions [SPSC]
1045.description: Eliminates the statute of limitations for wrongful death actions for intentional torts resulting in death from acts described in specified provisions relating to murder or manslaughter. Provides for application.

1046.title: Regulation of Firearms [SPSC]
1046.description: Creates the Florida Firearms Freedom Act. Provides that specified firearms, firearm accessories, and ammunition for personal use manufactured in the state are not subject to federal law or regulation. Provides that certain basic materials are not subject to federal regulation of firearms, firearm accessories, or ammunition under interstate commerce, etc.

1047.title: Vessel Safety [EPSC]
1047.description: Revises certain requirements for operating personal watercraft. Revises the requirements relating to the boating safety course required for leasing or renting a personal watercraft from a livery.

1049.title: Sexual Activities Involving Animals [SPSC]
1049.description: Prohibits knowing sexual conduct or sexual contact with an animal. Prohibits specified related activities. Provides that the act does not apply to certain husbandry, conformation judging, and veterinary practices, etc.

1050.title: Transportation Facilities [CPSC]
1050.description: Deletes a provision authorizing the DOT to lease existing toll facilities through public-private partnerships.

1051.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1051.title: Nursing Services/Hospital Nurse Staffing Plans [SPSC]
1051.description: Requires that hospitals establish nurse staffing collaborative councils. Requires the council to produce annual hospital nurse staffing plans. Requires the chief nurse executive to communicate with the council to ensure appropriate implementation of the nurse staffing plan. Requires that the council conduct a semiannual review of said plan. Requires such plan to be reviewed with the nurse personnel and made available to the public, etc.

1052.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1052.title: Debtors and Collectors [CPSC]
1052.description: Requires lenders or creditors to verify the identity of persons applying for a loan, credit card, or extension of credit. Provides that the knowing and willful use of personal identifying information of another individual creates a rebuttable presumption. Provides for the forfeiture of indebtedness for failure of the lender or creditor to verify an applicant's identity.

1053.title: Legislative Travel Reimbursement [GPSC]
1053.description: Authorizes legislators and their staff members to be reimbursed by the state under certain circumstances for travel to visit an immediate family member in the case of death or serious illness, etc.

1054.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 4 (Ch. 2010-22)
1054.title: Florida Comprehensive Assessment Test [SPSC]
1054.description: Removes the requirement that a district school board adopt policies for meeting class size maximums which allow a student to graduate from high school if the student passes the grade 10 FCAT. Removes the requirements that a student earn a passing score on the FCAT or alternative assessment to graduate from high school, etc.

1055.title: Sale of Dogs and Cats [EPSC]
1055.description: Requires that additional information relating to the genetic disorders to which dogs and cats are susceptible be included in the written notice that pet dealers provide to a consumer at the time of sale, etc. APPROPRIATION: $82,669.

1056.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1056.title: School Entry Requirements/Swimming Life Skills [SPSC]
1056.description: Requires that children who enter public or private schools in the state present evidence of having completed a class in swimming life skills conducted by a certified instructor. Provides for certain exemptions from the requirement. Amends specified provisions relating to student and parent rights and requirements for private schools, etc.

1057.title: Community Redevelopment [EPSC]
1057.description: Expands the definition of the term "blighted area" to include land previously used as a military facility.

1058.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1058.title: Beach Safety [EPSC]
1058.description: Expands the beach safety program administered by the Department of Environmental Protection to apply to all beaches. Specifies how department funds for promoting the use of beach warning flags are to be dispersed. Provides enhanced penalties for an assault or battery on an ocean lifeguard while he or she is engaged in the lawful performance of his or her duties, etc.

1059.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations
1059.title: Judicial Proceedings in Civil Cases [SPSC]
1059.description: Provides for the chief judge of a judicial circuit, subject to approval by the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court, to establish a program for retired justices or judges to preside over civil cases and trials upon written request of one or more parties. Provides for the procedures governing voluntary trial resolution to include a jury trial if there is a right to a jury trial and if at least one party has requested a jury trial, etc.

1060.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1060.title: Statewide Legacy Communities Initiative [EPSC]
1060.description: Establishes the Statewide Legacy Communities Initiative. Creates the Urban Empowerment Corporation within the Department of Community Affairs, etc. APPROPRIATION: Indeterminate.

1061.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1061.title: Culpable Negligence/Assault Weapons [SPSC]
1061.description: Provides that a person commits a felony of the third degree if he or she stores or leaves an assault weapon within the reach or easy access of another person if that person obtains the weapon and uses it to inflict injury or death. Provides criminal penalties. Provides exceptions. Defines the term "assault weapon."

1062.title: Concealed Weapon or Firearm/License to Carry [CPSC]
1062.description: Revises conditions precedent to the issuance of a license to carry a concealed weapon or firearm. Revises conditions under which a license to carry a concealed weapon or firearm is suspended or revoked and the conditions under which an application for such license is denied or the processing thereof suspended.

1063.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1063.title: Public Meetings [EPSC]
1063.description: Adds the risk manager and certain division heads of a governmental entity to the persons who may attend a private meeting discussing pending litigation. Authorizes the required public announcement of an attorney-client session to be made immediately before the session. Prohibits an adverse party from attending the attorney-client session, etc.

1064.title: School Food Service Programs [SPSC]
1064.description: Creates the Florida Farm Fresh Schools Program within the DOE. Requires the department to work with the DOACS to develop policies that encourage school districts to buy fresh and local food and select foods with maximum nutritional content. Requires the DOE, in collaboration with the DOACS, to provide outreach services regarding the benefits of fresh food products from this state, etc.

1065.last_action: Died in Committee on General Government Appropriations, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
1065.title: Water Management Districts [EPSC]
1065.description: Revises provisions relating to the obstruction of public canals and drainage works. Revises the requirement that the district governing board delegate its authority to take final actions to the executive director. Revises the board's authority to delegate final actions to the executive director. Requires the board to provide a process for referring certain delegated actions to the governing board for final action, etc.

1066.title: Student Financial Assistance
1066.description: Creates the Sure Futures Scholarship Program. Requires that the Board of Governors of the State University System administer the program. Provides eligibility criteria for participation in the program by students and sponsors. Authorizes sponsors to establish terms of sponsorship and specify state universities or private colleges or universities at which a student may enroll to receive sponsorship, etc.

1067.last_action: Died in Committee on Health and Human Services Appropriations
1067.title: Senior Services/Independent Special Districts [WPSC]
1067.description: Authorizes a county to create an independent special district by ordinance to provide funding for services for seniors. Requires approval by a majority vote of electors to annually levy ad valorem taxes. Creates a governing council for the district. Requires the council to prepare a tentative annual budget and compute a millage rate to fund the district. Provides legislative intent with respect to the use of funds collected by the council, etc.

1068.title: Employment for the Homeless [WPSC]
1068.description: Specifies the order for applying the tax credit for employment of the homeless, etc.

1069.title: Athletic Coaches [SPSC]
1069.description: Requires the independent sanctioning authority of a youth athletic team to screen the background of current and prospective athletic coaches through designated state and federal sex offender registries. Requires the independent sanctioning authority to disqualify any athletic coach appearing on a registry. Requires said sanctioning authority to maintain documentation of screening results and disqualification notices, etc.

1070.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1070.title: Environmental Surcharge/Bottled Water [WPSC]
1070.description: Establishes a surcharge on bottled water sold at retail in this state. Requires that moneys collected from the surcharge be deposited into the Ecosystem Management and Restoration Trust Fund.

1071.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1071.title: Workplace Safety [CPSC]
1071.description: Requires public employers to submit by a certain date injury and illness data to the Division of Workers' Compensation in the DFS using a specified form. Requires the division to establish a toll-free telephone number for public employees relating to workplace safety by a certain date. Revises the annual report submitted by the DFS to include an analysis and summary on public employers' work-related injuries and workers' compensation claims, etc.

1072.title: Tax on Transient Rentals [WPSC]
1072.description: Requires that persons who engage in certain business activities related to transient rentals collect the tax. Authorizes the DOR to adopt rules to exclude certain charges from the definition of the terms "total rent" or "total consideration." Requires certain persons to report and remit the tax on certain transient rentals. Requires the DOR to provide for an amnesty for certain unpaid taxes, penalties, and interest, etc.

1073.last_action: Died in Committee on Military Affairs and Domestic Security
1073.title: Hurricane Preparedness [WPSC]
1073.description: Provides an exemption from the sales and use tax for sales of certain tangible personal property for a certain period. Provides an exception for sales within a public lodging establishment, theme park, entertainment complex, or airport. Authorizes the DOR to adopt rules. APPROPRIATION: $315,905.

1074.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 483 (Ch. 2010-93)
1074.title: Sales Tax Exemption/Books/Clothing/School Supplies [WPSC]
1074.description: Specifies a period during which the sale of books, clothing, and school supplies is exempt from the tax on sales, use, and other transactions. Provides definitions and exceptions. Authorizes the DOR to adopt rules. APPROPRIATION: $251,317.

1075.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1075.title: Disability Retirement Benefits [WPSC]
1075.description: Provides that certain members of the Special Risk Class who retired under the disability retirement provisions of the FRS may be reemployed and continue to receive their disability retirement benefits. Provides a declaration of important state interest.

1076.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1076.title: Foreclosure of Condominium Units [CPSC]
1076.description: Requires a first mortgagee to pay a certain portion of unpaid assessments to the condominium association prior to the transfer of title under certain circumstances.

1077.title: Prescribed Pancreatic Enzyme Supplements/Use [SPSC]
1077.description: Authorizes certain K-12 students to use prescribed pancreatic enzyme supplements under certain circumstances. Requires the State Board of Education to adopt rules. Provides for indemnification.

1078.title: State Uniform Traffic Control/Electronic Devices [CPSC]
1078.description: Prohibits the use of electronic communication devices to send or receive text-based communications while operating a motor vehicle. Provides exceptions. Provides for enforcement.

1079.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 01004; Substituted CS/HB 83 -SJ 01004; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 83 (Ch. 2010-215) -SJ 01004
1079.title: Endless Summer License Plate [CPSC]
1079.description: Creates an Endless Summer license plate. Establishes an annual use fee for the plate. Provides for the distribution of use fees received from the sale of such plates.

1080.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1080.title: Standards of Conduct [GPSC]
1080.description: Repeals specified provision relating to the prohibition against citizen members of the Board of Governors of the State University System or the board of trustees of a local university from having employment or a contractual relationship as a legislative lobbyist.

1081.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1081.title: Domestic, Repeat, Sexual and Dating Violence [SPSC]
1081.description: Provides that a court may order a respondent to wear a global positioning monitoring device if it appears to the court that the petitioner is the victim of domestic violence, repeat violence, sexual violence, or dating violence or has reasonable cause to believe that he or she is in imminent danger of becoming a victim of such violence. Provides that the petitioner be provided a telephone contact of a law enforcement agency, etc.

1082.title: Road Designations/Duval County [CPSC]
1082.description: Designates the James E. "Jim" King, Jr., Parkway, the Hans G. Tanzler, Jr., Interstate, and the Don Davis Memorial Interchange in Duval County. Directs the Department of Transportation to erect suitable markers.

1083.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 29 (Ch. 2010-231)
1083.title: Ray Charles Memorial Parkway/Madison County [CPSC]
1083.description: Designates the Ray Charles Memorial Parkway in Madison County. Directs the Department of Transportation to erect suitable markers.

1084.last_action: Died in Committee on General Government Appropriations
1084.title: Coverage for Mental and Nervous Disorders [CPSC]
1084.description: Revises requirements and limitations for optional coverage for mental and nervous disorders. Specifies nonapplication under certain circumstances. Conforms a cross-reference. Repeals specified provision relating to optional coverage required for substance abuse impaired persons. Provides for application.

1085.title: Adolescent Offenders/Parole [SPSC]
1085.description: Provides that an adolescent offender who was 15 years of age or younger at the time of commission of an offense and who is sentenced to life or a single or cumulative term of 10 years or more in prison is eligible for parole if the offender has been incarcerated for a minimum period and has not previously been convicted of or adjudicated delinquent for certain offenses. Provides for retroactive application, etc.

1086.title: Judicial Nominating Commissions [SPSC]
1086.description: Authorizes the Board of Governors of The Florida Bar to appoint some of the members of Judicial Nominating Commissions. Requires that each judicial nominating commission satisfy certain prerequisites for racial and gender diversity. Provides for the prerequisites to be satisfied over a period of time.

1087.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1087.title: Advanced Registered Nurse Practitioners [SPSC]
1087.description: Redefines the term "practitioner" for purposes of the Florida Comprehensive Drug Abuse Prevention and Control Act to include advanced registered nurse practitioners.

1088.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1088.title: Breast Cancer Treatment [WPSC]
1088.description: Includes lymph node dissections under provisions prescribing the length of hospital stay relating to a mastectomy and the outpatient postsurgical followup care that specified health insurers and health maintenance organizations must cover. Limits application.

1089.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Governmental Operations
1089.title: Voter Information Cards [GPSC]
1089.description: Requires that voter information cards contain the address of the polling place of the registered voter. Requires a supervisor of elections to issue a new voter information card to a voter upon a change in a voter's address of legal residence or a change in a voter's polling place address, etc.

1090.title: Injunctions for Protection/Violations [SPSC]
1090.description: Adds circumstances that violate an injunction for protection against repeat violence, sexual violence, or dating violence.

1091.title: Retirement/Special Risk Class [WPSC]
1091.description: Authorizes certain employees to purchase the retirement credit for past service at a 3 percent Special Risk Class accrual value. Provides requirements for calculating the first 2 percent of a member's average monthly compensation for purposes of purchasing past service credit. Provides that past service credit may be purchased by the member or by the employer on behalf of the member, etc.

1092.title: Parole Interview Dates for Certain Inmates [WPSC]
1092.description: Extends from 5 to 7 years the period between parole interview dates for inmates convicted of violating specified provisions or serving a mandatory minimum sentence under a specified provision.

1093.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 1193 (Ch. 2010-179)
1093.title: Firefighter Death Benefits [WPSC]
1093.description: Revises provisions providing death benefits for firefighters. Expands activities entitling firefighters to death benefits to include participation in training exercises and injury by an unlawful and intentional act which results in death. Provides legislative findings that the act fulfils an important state interest. Provides for application.

1094.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1094.title: Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement [WPSC]
1094.description: Specifies certain facilities that are exempt from the transient rentals tax. Deletes criteria establishing circumstances under which taxes on the lease or rental of a motor vehicle are due. Limits the $5,000 cap on discretionary sales surtax to the sale of motor vehicles, aircraft, boats, motor homes, manufactured homes, modular homes, and mobile homes. Revises exemptions from sales and use tax for food and medical products, etc.

1095.title: District School Board Policies and Procedures [SPSC]
1095.description: Provides legislative intent to recognize student academic achievement. Encourages each district school board to adopt policies and procedures that provide for an annual "Academic Scholarship Signing Day."

1096.title: Community College Student Fees/Transportation [SPSC]
1096.description: Authorizes community college boards of trustees to establish a transportation access fee. Limits the amount of the fee. Provides a timeframe for a fee increase and implementation of an increase. Prohibits the inclusion of the fee in calculating the amount a student receives under Florida Bright Futures Scholarship Program awards.

1097.title: Leaving the Scene/Crash/Death or Personal Injuries [CPSC]
1097.description: Requires a driver of any vehicle involved in a crash that results in serious bodily injury to any person to immediately stop the vehicle at the scene of the crash, etc.

1098.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 2176 (Ch. 2010-175)
1098.title: Claims/Law Enforcement and Correctional Officers [WPSC]
1098.description: Provides for interpretation of provisions relating to workers' compensation benefits for certain services performed by off-duty deputy sheriffs. Provides conditions under which a law enforcement officer, correctional officer, or correctional probation officer who suffers from a specified medical condition and has materially departed from the prescribed treatment for that condition shall lose a specified presumption for workers' compensation claims, etc.

1099.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1099.title: Autism and Other Developmental Disabilities [SPSC]
1099.description: Requires that a physician refer a minor to an appropriate specialist for screening for autism spectrum disorder under certain circumstances. Provides health insurance coverage for individuals with certain developmental disabilities. Requires the insurer's policy or the HMO's contract to provide a minimum number of visits per year for screening, evaluation, or diagnosis of autism spectrum disorder or other developmental disabilities, etc.

1100.last_action: Withdrawn from Finance and Tax; General Government Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means; Rules -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
1100.title: Sales Tax/Review of Exemptions and Exclusions [WPSC]
1100.description: Provides additional responsibilities of the Joint Legislative Sunset Committee for the purpose of reviewing exemptions from the general state sales and use tax and exclusions of sales of services from such taxation. Provides for future elimination of all sales, rental, use, consumption, distribution, and storage tax exemptions except those for general groceries, medical, guide dogs for the blind, and household fuels, etc.

1101.title: Medical Expenses/Inmates/County or Municipality [EPSC]
1101.description: Requires that payments made by a county or municipality to a provider for certain services for an arrested person be made at a certain percentage of the Medicare allowable rate. Provides that this maximum allowable cap does not apply to physician payments for emergency services provided within a hospital emergency department.

1102.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Was taken up -SJ 01141; Substituted CS/HB 173 -SJ 01141; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 173 (Ch. 2010-128), CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147) -SJ 01141
1102.title: Tax On Sales, Use, and Other Transactions [WPSC]
1102.description: Deletes a requirement that a specified penalty is mandatory and may not be waived by the DOR. Deletes authorization to return certain aircraft to the state for repairs without liability for taxes and penalties under certain circumstances. Exempts from the use tax aircraft that are owned by nonresidents and that enter and remain in the state for certain purposes under certain circumstances.

1103.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1103.title: Childhood Vaccinations [SPSC]
1103.description: Requires a pediatrician or attending physician to discuss the risks, benefits, and alternatives of each vaccination before a child is vaccinated. Provides requirements for the administration of certain vaccines required for school entry. Requires licensed health care providers to provide certain vaccine information statements to parents, legal guardians, and legal representatives before administering certain vaccines to children, etc.

1104.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1104.title: Student Statewide Assessments/Religious Holidays [SPSC]
1104.description: Revises provisions relating to the schedule for administering comprehensive statewide assessments. Provides that a comprehensive statewide assessment may be administered the week before the week of April 15 if a religious holiday occurs during that week.

1105.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1105.title: Presidential Preference Primary [GPSC]
1105.description: Revises dates relating to the presidential preference primary.

1106.last_action: Withdrawn from Education Pre-K - 12; Education Pre-K - 12 Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means -SJ 00796; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00796
1106.title: Charter Technical Career Centers [SPSC]
1106.description: Creates the Charter Technical Career Center Associate in Applied Science and Associate in Science Degrees Program. Authorizes charter technical career centers to offer such degree programs through partnerships with community colleges or direct authority. Prohibits a center from requesting funding for the initial costs associated with implementing the degree programs for a specified amount of time after receiving authorization, etc

1107.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see SB 1166 (Ch. 2010-193)
1107.title: Discrimination Based on Disability [WPSC]
1107.description: Substitutes the term "disability" for the term "handicap." Provides that an impairment that limits one major life activity is a disability. Provides that the Florida Commission on Human Relations may delegate its functions relating to the Florida Civil Rights Act. Authorizes the commission to recover expenditures made on behalf of persons seeking relief. Provides for a direct-support organization to support the commission, etc.

1108.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1108.title: Domestic Partnerships [SPSC]
1108.description: Sets forth fees and costs to be applied when petitioning for a dissolution of a domestic partnership or registering a domestic partnership, respectively. Provides applicability of domestic partnerships to state tax laws. Requires two individuals who wish to become partners in a domestic partnership to complete and file a Declaration of Domestic Partnership form with the clerk of the circuit court, etc.

1109.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00789; Substituted CS/HB 109 -SJ 00789; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 109 (Ch. 2010-32), CS/HB 7157 (Ch. 2010-138) -SJ 00789
1109.title: Excise Tax on Documents/Short Sale [WPSC]
1109.description: Imposes the tax on the consideration for short sale transfers of real property. Excludes certain unpaid indebtedness from such consideration. Defines the term "short sale."

1110.title: Vanpools [WPSC]
1110.description: Creates an exemption from the tax on sales, use, and other transactions for certain leases of passenger vehicles for commuting purposes. Defines the term "vanpool lease."

1111.last_action: Withdrawn from Criminal Justice; Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
1111.title: Procuring a Person for Prostitution [SPSC]
1111.description: Provides that a person who is 18 years of age or older commits a felony of the first degree if the victim of such offense is 16 years of age or younger and is 5 or more years younger than the person committing the violation. Provides criminal penalties, etc.

1112.last_action: Withdrawn from Environmental Preservation and Conservation -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
1112.title: James E. "Jim" King, Jr., Dam/Putnam County [EPSC]
1112.description: Designates the James E. "Jim" King, Jr., Dam in Putnam County. Directs the DEP to erect markers.

1113.last_action: Withdrawn from Criminal Justice; Judiciary; Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
1113.title: Restraints/Use During Juvenile Proceedings [SPSC]
1113.description: Prohibits the use of instruments of restraint on a child during court proceedings or elsewhere in a courthouse. Provides specified exceptions. Requires the Department of Juvenile Justice to comply with the Protective Action Response policy whenever mechanical restraints are used, etc.

1114.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1114.title: Heather's Law/Cellular Telephone Use in Vehicles [CPSC]
1114.description: Prohibits the use of a cellular telephone while operating a motor vehicle except when using a headset or hands-free device. Provides for enforcement only as a secondary offense, etc.

1115.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1115.title: Extended School Day Programs/Miami-Dade County [SPSC]
1115.description: Creates a pilot program in Miami-Dade County that authorizes school districts to enter into agreements with the county recreation department for the purpose of using facilities for extended school day programs in approved middle schools and high schools.

1116.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
1116.title: Tuition/Resident Status Determination [SPSC]
1116.description: Provides conditions for reclassification as a resident for tuition purposes. Requires that evidence be provided relating to dependent status. Provides additional categories within which students may be classified as residents for tuition purposes. Limits eligibility for state financial aid, etc.

1117.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1117.title: Juveniles/Sentencing [SPSC]
1117.description: Authorizes the court to sentence a juvenile using juvenile sanctions, adult sanctions, or a blend of juvenile and adult sanctions. Requires the Department of Juvenile Justice (DJJ) to file a written report with the court if the DJJ believes that the child's sanction is inappropriate. Authorizes the court to place the child on probation. Authorizes the court to order that the child attain appropriate educational goals, etc.

1118.title: Noose/Public Display [SPSC]
1118.description: Prohibits a person from placing a noose in a public place, on the property of another without first obtaining the written permission of the owner or occupier of the property, or in an exhibit of any kind with the intention of intimidating another person. Provides circumstances under which the provisions of the act apply. Provides that a person who violates the act commits a misdemeanor of the first degree. Provides criminal penalties.

1119.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1119.title: Early Voting [GPSC]
1119.description: Authorizes the supervisor of elections to designate any public university, college, or community college facility as an early voting site. Requires that the supervisor for each county establish early voting hours. Provides a minimum and a maximum daily duration for such early voting hours.

1120.title: Unemployment Compensation/Drug Testing [CPSC]
1120.description: Creates the Drug Deterrence Pilot Program within the Agency for Workforce Innovation. Provides for the screening of individuals to determine which individuals must be tested. Requires the agency to supply information concerning drug treatment programs. Provides for authentication and the admissibility of drug tests in unemployment compensation hearings. Provides for expiration of the program, etc.

1121.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1121.title: Title Insurance [CPSC]
1121.description: Authorizes a title insurance agent or agency to charge a reasonable fee for certain services. Requires that certain information regarding each charge be filed with the Office of Insurance Regulation. Prohibits a person from knowingly quoting, charging, accepting, collecting, or receiving a premium for title insurance other than the premium approved by the office, etc.

1123.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs

1123.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to affordable housing.

1124.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs

1124.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Department of Community Affairs.

1126.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs

1126.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Florida Building Code.

1128.title: Domestic Security [EPSC]
1128.description: Specifies the military installations, and the local governments associated with those bases, to which certain provisions of the act apply. Authorizes the Florida Council on Military Base and Mission Support to recommend changes to military installations and local governments. Revises provisions related to seaport security. Authorizes the Adjutant General to employ a second Assistant Adjutant General for Army, etc.

1129.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1129.title: SSB/Growth Management [EPSC]
1129.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to growth management.

1130.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1130.title: SSB/Property Taxes [WPSC]
1130.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to property taxes.
