1132.description: Reenacts provisions relating to the establishment of the Department of Community Affairs and relating to the establishment of the Florida Housing Finance Corporation. Repeals a specified provision relating to the repeal of the Florida Faith-based and Community-based Advisory Council.

1133.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1133.title: SSB/Review/DCA/Fla. Government Accountability Act [EPSC]
1133.description: Expresses the legislative intent to abolish, continue, or reorganize the Department of Community Affairs.

1134.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1134.title: SSB/Review/Florida Housing Finance Corporation [EPSC]
1134.description: Expresses the legislative intent to abolish, continue, or reorganize the Florida Housing Finance Corporation.

1136.title: Florida Unborn Victims of Violence Act [SPSC]
1136.description: Defines the term "unborn child" for purposes of vehicular homicide. Revises terminology to refer to "unborn child" rather than "viable fetus." Provides legislative intent. Revises and conforms terminology.

1137.title: Adverse Possession/Property [SPSC]
1137.description: Specifies that occupation and maintenance of property can satisfy possession for purposes of gaining title to property via adverse possession without color of title. Requires a person seeking property by adverse possession to use a uniform adverse possession return developed by the DOR. Requires the tax collector to determine whether a duplicate tax payment is made by an adverse possessor, etc.

1138.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 325 (Ch. 2010-80)
1138.title: Mark Wandall Traffic Safety Act [WPSC]
1138.description: Creates the Mark Wandall Traffic Safety Program to be administered by the DOT. Requires a county or municipality to enact an ordinance in order to use a traffic infraction detector to identify a motor vehicle that fails to stop at a traffic control signal steady red light. Provides that the registered owner of the motor vehicle involved in the violation is responsible and liable for payment of the fine assessed, etc.

1139.title: State Attorneys [SPSC]
1139.description: Deletes provisions that require each state attorney to submit on a quarterly basis deviation memoranda relating to offenders who are not sentenced to the mandatory minimum prisons sentence in cases involving the possession or use of a weapon and in cases involving certain specified offenses. Deletes provisions regarding the burden of establishing financial resources of the defendant, etc.

1140.title: Motor Vehicles/Soundmaking Devices [CPSC]
1140.description: Revises penalties for unlawful operation of a soundmaking device in a motor vehicle. Provides that such operation is a moving violation, which includes the assessment of points against the driver's license. Provides increased penalties for repeat violations within a certain time period.

1141.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations
1141.title: Officer Andrew Widman Act/Pretrial Proceedings [SPSC]
1141.description: Provides that at the first appearance of a probationer or an offender on community control arrested for a new offense for which the court finds the existence of probable cause, the court may determine the likelihood of a prison sanction for the violation based on the new arrest. Provides that the court may order detention if it appears more likely than not that a prison sanction may be forthcoming on the violation, etc.

1142.title: Dentists/Contracts [CPSC]
1142.description: Prohibits contracts between health insurers and dentists from containing certain fee requirements set by the insurer under certain circumstances. Prohibits contracts between prepaid limited health service organizations and dentists from containing certain fee requirements set by the organization under certain circumstances, etc.

1143.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00679; Substituted HB 53 -SJ 00679; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 53 (Ch. 2010-81) -SJ 00679
1143.title: St. Johns River License Plate [CPSC]
1143.description: Creates the St. Johns River license plate. Establishes an annual use fee for the plate. Provides for the distribution of use fees received from the sale of such plates.

1144.title: Consumer Protection/Unsolicited Checks [CPSC]
1144.description: Provides a definition. Prohibits the mailing or delivery of unsolicited checks. Provides an exception and a penalty. Exempts credit card bearers from liability for the unauthorized use of such checks.

1145.title: Disorders/Ability to Operate a Motor Vehicle [SPSC]
1145.description: Requires a physician or person having knowledge of a licensed driver's or applicant's mental or physical disability to drive or need to wear a medical identification bracelet to report such knowledge to the HSMV, etc.

1146.title: Pub. Rec./Proprietary Confidential Business Info. [CPSC]
1146.description: Provides that proprietary confidential business information held by an agency is confidential and exempt from public records requirements. Authorizes any person to petition a court for the public release of those portions of a record made confidential and exempt by the act. Provides that the act does not supersede any other applicable public records exemptions that existed before a certain date, etc.

1147.title: Pub. Rec./Public Defenders/Regional Counsel [SPSC]
1147.description: Creates a public records exemption for specified personal information of current and former public defenders and criminal conflict and civil regional counsel, as well as their spouses and children. Provides for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption under the Open Government Sunset Review Act. Provides a statement of public necessity.

1148.title: Child-restraint Requirements/Motor Vehicles [CPSC]
1148.description: Provides child-restraint requirements for certain children ages 4 through 7. Provides certain exceptions. Redefines the term "motor vehicle" to exclude certain vehicles from such requirements. Provides a grace period.

1149.title: Wildlife Regulation [EPSC]
1149.description: (THIS BILL COMBINES S318 & CS/S572) Prohibits the import or release of nonnative animals in this state unless authorized by the FWC. Requires that any person or entity wishing to keep wildlife in captivity or sell specified species of wildlife obtain a permit from the FWC. Requires that the FWC annually evaluate the placement of additional species on the list of reptiles of concern beginning by a specified date, etc.

1150.title: Household Moving Services [CPSC]
1150.description: Redefines the term "storage." Provides for the biennial renewal of mover and moving broker registrations. Authorizes the DOACS to extend registration expiration dates in order to establish staggered dates. Authorizes a mover to exclude liability for household goods packed by the shipper under certain circumstances. Prohibits a mover or moving broker from conducting business without being registered with the department, etc.

1151.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5 (Ch. 2010-230), CS/HB 321 (Ch. 2010-232), CS/CS/HB 1033 (Ch. 2010-233)
1151.title: Street Designations/Orange Bowl Way [CPSC]
1151.description: Designates Orange Bowl Way in Miami Lakes. Directs the Department of Transportation to erect markers.

1152.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1152.title: Motor Vehicle Operators/Text Messaging [CPSC]
1152.description: Prohibits a person younger than 18 years of age from writing or sending a text message on an electronic communications device while operating a motor vehicle. Provides for enforcement. Provides exceptions. Provides penalties.

1153.title: Public Transportation Operators/Text Messaging [CPSC]
1153.description: Prohibits railroad engineers or operators of school buses or other public transportation vehicles from writing or sending text messages on electronic communications devices while operating a public transportation vehicle. Provides a penalty.

1154.title: State Uniform Traffic Control/Texting Prohibited [CPSC]
1154.description: Prohibits the use of an electronic communication device to send or receive text-based communications while operating a motor vehicle. Defines the term "text-based communication." Provides exceptions and for enforcement.

1155.last_action: Died in Committee on Health and Human Services Appropriations
1155.title: Optometry/Oral and Topical Pharmaceutical Agents [SPSC]
1155.description: Authorizes the Board of Optometry to adopt rules for the administration and prescription of oral ocular pharmaceutical agents. Prohibits the board from adding to, deleting from, or modifying the formulary with respect to oral ocular pharmaceutical agents. Prohibits certified optometrists from administering and prescribing certain controlled substances, etc.

1156.last_action: Withdrawn from Banking and Insurance; Commerce; General Government Appropriations; Withdrawn prior to introduction
1156.title: Debt Negotiation Services [CPSC]
1156.description: Provides that an attorney providing legal representation is exempt from debt negotiation organization requirements. Requires a debt negotiation organization to annually register with the OFR. Requires an annual fee. Specifies acts prohibited by a debt negotiation organization. Provides insurance requirements for such an organization. Provides requirements for debt negotiation service contracts, etc.

1157.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00688; Amendment(s) adopted (278878) -SJ 00688; Substituted CS/CS/HB 25 -SJ 00688; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 25 (Ch. 2010-30) -SJ 00688
1157.title: Child Custody/Temporary and Concurrent Custody [SPSC]
1157.description: Revises provisions relating to petitions and court orders awarding the temporary custody of a child to an extended family member, to also provide for concurrent custody with the parents of the child. Provides that if a parent objects to a petition for concurrent custody, the court may not grant the petition and must give the petitioner the option of converting the petition to one for temporary custody, etc.

1159.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1159.title: Taxpayer Rights/Property Appraiser's Assessment [EPSC]
1159.description: Provides a taxpayer the right to be provided all supporting documentation used in a property appraiser's assessment, without requesting such documentation, 14 days before the value adjustment board's hearing date.

1160.title: Sealing Criminal History Records [GPSC]
1160.description: Cites this act as the "Jim King Keep Florida Working Act." Authorizes a court to seal a criminal history record of a person who had a prior criminal history record sealed or expunged in certain circumstances.

1161.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1161.title: Video Visitation for Inmates/DOC [SPSC]
1161.description: Authorizes the Department of Corrections to adopt rules to install and operate an inmate video visitation system in the correctional facilities in this state. Encourages the department to use communication technology equipment to operate an inmate video visitation system to increase the frequency and quality of the visits between an inmate and the inmate's family.

1162.last_action: Read 3rd time -SJ 00862; Substituted HB 281 -SJ 00862; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 281 (Ch. 2010-83) -SJ 00862
1162.title: Communications Services Taxes/Credit for Bad Debt [WPSC]
1162.description: Authorizes dealers to report a credit for bad debt by netting the credit against the tax due. Authorizes dealers to use a proportionate allocation method or other reasonable method in determining the amount of bad debt attributable to the state or local jurisdiction. Provides for retroactive operation. Specifies that the act is remedial in nature and not a basis for certain refunds of tax.

1163.title: Working Waterfront Property [WPSC]
1163.description: Specifies properties that are eligible for classification as working waterfront property. Requires property appraisers to consider specified factors in assessing certain property. Provides for assessment of a portion of property within a working waterfront property which is not used as such property. Requires an application for classification of property as working waterfront property, etc.

1164.last_action: Died in Committee on Military Affairs and Domestic Security, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 1003 (Ch. 2010-177)
1164.title: Solicitation of Funds/Veterans' Organizations [GPSC]
1164.description: Exempts certain veterans' organizations from requirements to file registration statements with the Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services.

1165.title: Tomato Food Safety [EPSC]
1165.description: Requires minimum food safety standards for producing, harvesting, packing, and repacking tomatoes. Authorizes the DOACS to inspect tomato farms, greenhouses, and packinghouses or repackers. Provides a presumption that tomatoes introduced into commerce are safe for human consumption under certain circumstances. Revises duties of the Division of Fruit and Vegetables for tomato food safety inspections, etc.

1166.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1166.title: Homeowner's Insurance/Termination/Notification [CPSC]
1166.description: Requires that the OIR provide policyholders with written notice of certain information regarding the termination of a policy and the selection of a new policy. Requires that the OIR provide policyholders with written instructions for contacting a broker, agent, or counselor for the purpose of selecting a new coverage plan or making changes to an existing policy, etc.

1167.title: Mobile Home and Recreational Vehicle Parks [SPSC]
1167.description: Specifies laws and rules to be enforced by the Department of Health. Provides for the adoption of rules. Revises applicability of recreational vehicle park requirements to mobile home parks. Revises permit requirements. Provides requirements for construction review and approval for private parks and camps. Revises requirements for permit applications. Revises fees charged to operators of certain parks or camps, etc.

1168.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1168.title: Congressional Vacancies/United States Senate [GPSC]
1168.description: Provides that a special election or special primary election shall be held to fill a vacancy in the office of a member from Florida of the United States Senate. Provides that the Governor is not required to call a special election to fill such a vacancy if a session of Congress is not scheduled during the unexpired portion of the term, etc.

1169.title: Contamination Notification/Site Rehabilitation
1169.description: Revises contamination notification provisions. Requires individuals responsible for site rehabilitation to provide notice of site rehabilitation to specified entities. Authorizes the DEP to pursue enforcement measures for noncompliance with notice requirements. Requires the DEP to provide specified notice to private K-12 schools and child care facilities. Requires the DEP to provide specified notice to public schools within a specified area, etc.

1170.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1170.title: Contributions/Electioneering Communications Org. [GPSC]
1170.description: Limits the amount of contributions to an electioneering communications organization to a specified amount per person or committee.

1171.title: Mobile Home Park Lot Tenancies [CPSC]
1171.description: Authorizes the court to refer actions to binding arbitration. Provides that the arbitration decision may be made known to a judge in a trial de novo prior to the judge entering his or her order on the merits. Amends provisions relating to grounds and proceedings for eviction. Requires mobile home park owners receiving a bona fide offer for purchase to notify the officers of the homeowners' association, etc.

1172.title: Instant Bingo Tickets [CPSC]
1172.description: Authorizes the dispensing of instant bingo tickets by electronic or mechanical devices. Requires that such devices be capable of recording certain transaction information.

1173.title: Retail Sales of Smoking Pipes and Devices [CPSC]
1173.description: Prohibits retail sales of certain smoking pipes and smoking devices under certain circumstances. Specifies criteria for the lawful sales of such items. Provides a criminal penalty for unlawful sales of such items.

1174.title: Motor Vehicle Racing Events [SPSC]
1174.description: Provides that a motorsport liability release signed by a minor is valid if the release is also signed by the parent or guardian of the minor.

1175.title: Community Corrections Assistance [SPSC]
1175.description: Adds rehabilitative community reentry programs to the list of programs, services, and facilities that may be funded using community corrections funds.

1176.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1176.title: Municipal Water & Sewer Utilities [EPSC]
1176.description: Exempts municipalities in certain counties from the applicability of provisions limiting the rates that a municipality may charge consumers located outside their boundaries for water or sewer utility services.

1177.title: State Uniform Traffic Control/Prohibits Texting [CPSC]
1177.description: Prohibits the use of electronic communication devices to send or receive text-based communications while operating a motor vehicle. Provides exceptions. Provides a penalty.

1178.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1178.title: Required Advertisements and Public Notices [EPSC]
1178.description: Authorizes a governmental entity to use its publicly accessible website for legally required advertisements and public notices. Provides that a notice, advertisement, or publication on a publicly accessible website in accordance with specified provision constitutes legal notice. Provides for notice of special election or referendum on a publicly accessible website, etc.

1179.title: SSB/Agriculture [EPSC]
1179.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to agriculture.

1183.title: SSB/Dairy Industry of Florida [EPSC]
1183.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the dairy industry of Florida.

1184.title: SSB/Dairy Industry [EPSC]
1184.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the dairy industry.

1185.title: SSB/Pest Control Activities [EPSC]
1185.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to pest control activities.

1186.title: SSB/Pest Control Activities in Florida [EPSC]
1186.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to pest control activities in Florida.

1190.title: Programs to Prevent Violence [SPSC]
1190.description: Requires that an additional or increased court cost or surcharge be assessed against a defendant who pleads guilty or nolo contendere to, or is found guilty of, regardless of adjudication, certain specified criminal offenses. Provides for proceeds of the additional court cost or surcharge to be deposited into the Rape Crisis Program Trust Fund or the Domestic Violence Trust Fund, etc.

1191.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1191.title: Children of Incarcerated Parents [SPSC]
1191.description: Provides legislative findings and purpose. Provides guiding principles to be used by state agency personnel when dealing with children of incarcerated parents. Provides for applicability.

1192.title: Barriers/Highways/Canals or Bodies of Water [CPSC]
1192.description: Requires limited access facilities that are adjacent to a canal or other water body to have a system of guardrails, retention cables, or other barriers between the highway and the canal or water body. Requires the DOT to establish certain standards governing the installation and maintenance of the barriers. Requires that barriers be installed for existing highways by a specified date.

1193.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1193.title: Congenital Craniofacial Anomalies [CPSC]
1193.description: Requires that the AHCA, in consultation with the OIR, conduct a study concerning the medical necessity, costs, and efficacy of mandating coverage for certain treatments and therapies. Requires that the AHCA report its findings and recommendations to the Legislature. APPROPRIATION: $25,000.

1194.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1194.title: Gifts/Governmental Entity/Charitable Organization [GPSC]
1194.description: Deletes a limitation on the amount of time that a gift accepted on behalf of a governmental entity or charitable organization may be retained.

1195.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1195.title: Emergency Management [SPSC]
1195.description: Requires the DCFS, to the extent permitted by federal law, to expedite application procedures for persons who reside in an area damaged by a major disaster and who apply for temporary cash assistance. Authorizes the Governor to employ such measures and give such directions to certain specified agencies as are necessary for the purpose of addressing the needs for immediate cash, shelter, or food assistance, etc.

1196.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1196.title: Super Enterprise Zones [CPSC]
1196.description: Provides a tax exemption for certain property purchased for use or consumption by businesses in a super enterprise zone and for retail sales made by certified businesses in such a zone. Provides additional responsibilities of an enterprise zone development agency relating to such zones. Requires the OTTED to designate specified areas in Miami-Dade, Lee, and Collier Counties as pilot project super enterprise zones, etc.

1197.title: Bicycle Safety/Helmets and Lighting Equipment [CPSC]
1197.description: Revises safety standard requirements for bicycle helmets that must be worn by certain riders and passengers. Provides for enforcement of requirements for bicycle lighting equipment. Provides penalties for violations. Provides for dismissal of the charge following a first offense.

1198.title: Cell Phones/Motor Vehicle Operators/School Zones [CPSC]
1198.description: Prohibits the use of a cellular telephone while operating a motor vehicle in a school zone. Provides an enhanced penalty.

1199.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 4 (Ch. 2010-22)
1199.title: Student Assessment/Public Schools/FCAT [SPSC]
1199.description: Terminates the administration of the Florida Comprehensive Assessment Test (FCAT) to students in grades 9 through 12. Requires the Preliminary SAT/National Merit Scholarship Qualifying Test (PSAT/NMSQT) to replace the grade 10 FCAT for purposes of measuring a student's knowledge and skills. Requires students to earn passing scores on the PSAT/NMSQT to qualify for a standard high school diploma, etc.

1200.last_action: Withdrawn from Environmental Preservation and Conservation; Health Regulation; General Government Appropriations; Withdrawn prior to introduction
1200.title: Injection Wells [EPSC]
1200.description: Provides exceptions to requirements of the DEP regarding minimum casing for injection wells used by facilities that have a specified design capacity. Provides requirements for an injection well used as a backup to a primary injection well.

1201.title: Department of Transportation [CPSC]
1201.description: Directs the department to maintain specified training programs for employees and prospective employees. Eliminates the requirement for annual updating of the Florida Transportation Plan. Amends specified provisions relating to proposed turnpike projects, the Transportation Regional Incentive Program, and the Enhanced Bridge Program for Sustainable Transportation, etc.

1202.title: Consumer Protection/Consumer Reports/Inmates [CPSC]
1202.description: Requires the DOC to provide each inmate in a correctional facility the opportunity to place a security freeze on his or her consumer report. Requires the department, at the request of the inmate, to provide the appropriate forms to the inmate to initiate the security freeze process. Requires that the inmate pay all fees and expenses incurred in the application for a security freeze.

1203.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1203.title: Human Services Personnel [SPSC]
1203.description: Requires the owner or operator of a child care facility to report background screening results to the DCFS before employing a person at the child care facility. Prohibits the hiring of a person with a disqualifying offense without being granted an exemption. Prohibits the Agency for Health Care Administration from granting an exemption from disqualification from employment in an assisted living facility under certain circumstances, etc.

1204.last_action: Died in Committee on Health and Human Services Appropriations
1204.title: Tanning Facilities/Use by Minors [SPSC]
1204.description: Requires that the operator or proprietor of a tanning facility witness the signing of a written statement by the parent or legal guardian of a minor before the minor is allowed to use a tanning device. Deletes provisions authorizing the use of a tanning device by certain minors if accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Allows use of a tanning device by certain minors as treatment prescribed by a health care provider, etc.

1205.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 971 (Ch. 2010-223)
1205.title: Motor Vehicle Window Sunscreening Requirements [CPSC]
1205.description: Provides a medical exemption from sunscreening requirements for persons who are afflicted with any autoimmune disease or other medical conditions. Requires the HSMV to consult with its medical advisory board to provide guidance with respect to such autoimmune diseases and other medical conditions.

1206.title: Suicide Prevention Education [SPSC]
1206.description: Deletes references to inactive organizations represented by members of the Suicide Prevention Coordinating Council and replaces with active organizations. Requires that district school boards provide access to suicide prevention educational resources to all instructional and administrative personnel as part of the school district professional development system.

1207.title: Community Colleges [SPSC]
1207.description: Amends a specified provision relating to educational institutes. Conforms provisions. Renames Central Florida Community College as "College of Central Florida." Renames Lake City Community College as "Florida Gateway College." Renames Palm Beach Community College as "Palm Beach State College." Renames Seminole Community College as "Seminole State College of Florida."

1208.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1208.title: Voting Conflicts [GPSC]
1208.description: Prohibits a member of the Legislature from voting upon or participating in any legislation inuring to the personal gain or loss of the member or his or her relative. Prohibits a member of the legislature from participating in any legislation inuring to the personal gain or loss of a business associate, employer, board on which the member sits, principal by whom the member is retained, or parent corporation or subsidiary of such principal, etc.

1209.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1209.title: Personal Needs Allowance [WPSC]
1209.description: Revises the monthly personal needs allowance for certain eligible persons.

1210.last_action: Withdrawn from Criminal Justice; Ethics and Elections; Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations; Rules -SJ 00182; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00182
1210.title: Public Officials and Others/Offenses [SPSC]
1210.description: Prohibits a person or public servant from engaging in certain activities to deprive another of his or her right of honest services. Provides for such prohibition to be construed in accordance with certain federal laws. Provides penalties.

1211.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1211.title: Sale of Alcoholic Beverages [CPSC]
1211.description: Creates the "Point-of-Purchase Messaging About Alcohol and Pregnancy Act." Requires certain warning signs to be displayed in specific ways on the premises of alcoholic beverage vendors and manufacturers. Requires the Division of Alcoholic Beverages and Tobacco of the DBPR to produce and distribute the signs, etc.

1212.title: Wireless Communications Device/Driving [CPSC]
1212.description: Creates the "Florida Ban on Texting While Driving Law." Prohibits the operation of a motor vehicle while using a wireless communications device for certain purposes. Provides for points to be assessed against a driver's license for the unlawful use of a wireless communications device resulting in a crash, etc.

1213.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1213.title: SSB/Community Supervision [SPSC]
1213.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to community supervision.

1214.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1214.title: SSB/Sentencing [SPSC]
1214.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to sentencing.

1215.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1215.title: SSB/Death Penalty [SPSC]
1215.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the death penalty.

1216.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1216.title: SSB/Parole [SPSC]
1216.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to parole.

1217.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1217.title: SSB/Juvenile Justice [SPSC]
1217.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to juvenile justice.

1218.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1218.title: SSB/Corrections [SPSC]
1218.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to corrections.

1219.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1219.title: SSB/Law Enforcement [SPSC]
1219.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to law enforcement.

1220.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-79; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7129 (Ch. 2010-182)
1220.title: Military Affairs/Leave of Absence [GPSC]
1220.description: Amends specified provision relating to provisions authorizing leave of absence for officers and employees of the state or counties, municipalities, or political subdivisions who are commissioned reserve officers or reserve enlisted personnel in the United States military or naval service or who are members of the National Guard. Provides for the appointment of a second Assistant Adjutant General for the Florida National Guard Army, etc.

1221.last_action: Withdrawn from Environmental Preservation and Conservation; General Government Appropriations -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
1221.title: James E. "Jim" King, Jr., State Reserve [EPSC]
1221.description: Designates certain lands located in Marion and Putnam Counties as the James E. "Jim" King, Jr., State Reserve. Requires that the Office of Greenways and Trails within the DEP develop multipurpose recreational opportunities and provide for the care, maintenance, and beautification of the state reserve. Authorizes the Division of State Lands within the DEP to acquire adjacent or contiguous property to the state reserve, etc.

1222.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1222.title: Child Abuse/False Reports [SPSC]
1222.description: Requires a child to be returned to a parent or guardian within 3 days following a determination that an order for shelter care was based on a false report of child abuse, abandonment, or neglect.

1223.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1223.title: Political Contributions and Expenditures [GPSC]
1223.description: Deletes a requirement that committees of continuous existence report information relating to contributions by corporations. Deletes a requirement that the campaign treasurer for a candidate or a political committee report information relating to contributions by corporations. Authorizes criminal penalties and fines for making or accepting or aiding or abetting prohibited contributions or expenditures, etc.

1224.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1224.title: Nondenominational Television Stations/PBPS [SPSC]
1224.description: Includes certain television stations licensed by the Federal Communications Commission for which support and funding may be given.

1225.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1225.title: Allocation/Expenditure of State Lottery Revenues [WPSC]
1225.description: Requires a portion of Powerball net revenues to be allocated to voluntary prekindergarten education programs. Provides for the use of funds.

1226.last_action: Died in Committee on Health and Human Services Appropriations
1226.title: Medicaid/Behavioral Health Services [WPSC]
1226.description: Requires that funds repaid to the Agency for Health Care Administration by managed care plans that spend less than a certain percentage of the capitation rate for behavioral health services be deposited into the Medical Care Trust Fund. Provides that such repayments be allocated to community behavioral health providers and used for Medicaid behavioral and case management services. Provides for payment to unpaid providers.

1227.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1227.title: High School Graduation Requirements/Health Ed. [SPSC]
1227.description: Provides for a mandatory one-half credit in health education, independent of physical education credit requirements, for high school students. Provides a waiver for students who request to take and successfully complete a health education assessment developed by the Department of Education. Reduces the number of credits in elective courses.

1228.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 631 (Ch. 2010-198), CS/CS/HB 971 (Ch. 2010-223)
1228.title: Highway Safety Act [CPSC]
1228.description: Provides legislative intent relating to road rage and aggressive careless driving. Defines the term "road rage." Requires an operator of a motor vehicle to yield the left lane when being overtaken on a multilane highway. Revises the types of documentation that a secondary metals recycler must obtain, etc.

1229.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1229.title: Elderly Rehabilitated Inmate Program [SPSC]
1229.description: Creates the Elderly Rehabilitated Inmate Program to authorize the Parole Commission to approve the early release of certain elderly inmates. Requires that the petition to participate in the program include certain documents. Requires the DOC to notify the victim or the victim's family within a specified period that a petition has been filed, etc.

1230.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 29 (Ch. 2010-231)
1230.title: Trooper Ronald Gordon Smith Memorial Bridge [CPSC]
1230.description: Designates the Trooper Ronald Gordon Smith Memorial Bridge in Citrus County. Directs the DOT to erect suitable markers.

1231.title: Vehicle Registration Forms/Voluntary Contribution [CPSC]
1231.description: Requires motor vehicle registration application forms to provide for a voluntary contribution to Florida Network of Children's Advocacy Centers, Inc. Provides for the use of such funds.

1232.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1232.title: Dentistry [SPSC]
1232.description: Defines the term "public health supervision" and redefines the term "health access settings" to include school-based prevention programs. Authorizes dental hygienists to perform certain additional dental hygiene services under public health supervision. Provides that certain tasks are remediable and delegable to dental hygienists in certain settings. Provides a list of remediable and delegable tasks, etc.

1233.title: Garnishment/Exemption of Wages [CPSC]
1233.description: Increases the amount of wages of a head of family which is exempt from garnishment. Provides a form that must be used for an agreement to waive the exemption from garnishment. Increases the amount of wages of a head of family which is exempt from garnishment.

1235.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1235.title: Campaign Contributions [GPSC]
1235.description: Prohibits a person or political committee from contributing in excess of a specified monetary amount to a committee of continuous existence or an electioneering communication organization.

1236.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1236.title: Standards for Drywall [CPSC]
1236.description: Directs the Florida Building Commission, in consultation with the Department of Health, to prohibit by rule in the Florida Building Code the use of drywall that exceeds certain limits established for emissions or the content of sulfur or strontium compounds.

1237.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1237.title: Reactive Drywall Mitigation [CPSC]
1237.description: Creates the Reactive Drywall Mitigation Act. Prohibits a person from performing an inspection or preparing a plan for the removal of reactive drywall or removing reactive drywall and damaged items unless the person is employed by a licensed reactive drywall mitigation business. Specifies prerequisites for licensure by the DBPR as a reactive drywall mitigation business, etc.

1238.title: Special Investigators [SPSC]
1238.description: Deletes a requirement that investigators be employed on a full-time basis. Specifies matters that may be investigated by special investigators.

1239.title: Health Insurance/Medigap/Disabled Persons
1239.description: Requires that insurers writing health policies in this state offer Medigap policies to disabled persons under 65 years of age.

1241.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1241.title: Electrical and Alarm System Contracting [CPSC]
1241.description: Requires that an electrical journeyman be present on any industrial or commercial new construction site when certain electrical work is being performed.

1242.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1242.title: Construction Contracts [CPSC]
1242.description: Requires a contractor to provide an owner with a statement of an Owner's Rights and Responsibilities Under Florida's Construction Lien Law. Requires that a signed copy of the statement be filed with the building permit application. Specifies the form and content of the notice. Deletes the requirement that the permit authority provide the applicant with a printed statement relating to construction lien law, etc.

1243.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1243.title: Local Govt./Health Insurance/Drug Coverage [WPSC]
1243.description: Expands eligibility for participation in the state group health insurance program and the prescription drug coverage program to include all counties, municipalities, special taxing districts, and district school boards rather than only small counties and municipalities and certain school boards. Specifies prerequisites and conditions for participation. Provides a minimum period of enrollment, etc.

1244.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00903; Amendment(s) adopted (690214) -SJ 00903; Substituted CS/HB 483 -SJ 00903; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 483 (Ch. 2010-93) -SJ 00903
1244.title: Sales Tax Exemption/Clothing/School Supplies [WPSC]
1244.description: Specifies a period during which the sale of clothing and school supplies are exempt from the tax on sales, use, and other transactions. Provides definitions and exceptions. Authorizes the Department of Revenue to adopt emergency rules. APPROPRIATION: $250,304.

1245.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1245.title: Prescription Drugs Insurance Coverage [CPSC]
1245.description: Prohibits health insurance policies or contracts for a health care service plan from limiting, reducing, or denying coverage for a prescription drug under certain circumstances. Provides that a change to any health insurance policy or contract for a health care service plan is effective upon the renewal of the policy or contract. Requires the insurer to communicate the change and its effective date to the insured, etc.

1248.title: Electronic Wireless Communications Device/Driving [CPSC]
1248.description: Cites this act as the "You Talk, You Walk Act." Prohibits a person younger than 18 years of age from operating a motor vehicle while using a wireless communications device or telephone. Provides exceptions. Provides for enforcement as a secondary action. Provides penalties. Provides for the suspension of a person's driver's license for a violation of a specified provision.

1249.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1249.title: Student Voter Education [SPSC]
1249.description: Provides for a voter education program. Requires that each district school board and county supervisor of elections jointly provide the program for high school students who are eligible to register or preregister to vote. Requires that such education consist of a mandatory presentation made by the supervisor of elections to public high school students who are eligible to register or preregister to vote, etc.

1250.last_action: Withdrawn from Regulated Industries; Commerce; Judiciary; General Government Appropriations -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
1250.title: Travel Buying Clubs and Travel Buying Services [CPSC]
1250.description: Authorizes a person who has elected to become a member of a travel buying club or travel buying service to cancel the membership within a specified period. Requires the travel buying club or travel buying service to hold in escrow the membership fee paid by the person until the end of the cancellation period, etc.

1251.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1251.title: Voter Eligibility Challenge [GPSC]
1251.description: Prohibits a voter from being challenged on the basis of certain documents. Prohibits certain persons from submitting a formal challenge to an individual's eligibility to register to vote or to vote in any election under certain circumstances.

1253.last_action: Read 3rd time -SJ 00519; Substituted CS/HB 295 -SJ 00519; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 295 (Ch. 2010-28) -SJ 00519
1253.title: Food Service Inspections [SPSC]
1253.description: Includes the investigation of food service programs for domestic violence centers and group care homes within the Department of Health's environmental health program. Revises the definition of the term "food service establishment" to exclude domestic violence centers under certain conditions.

1254.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1254.title: Virtual Schools [WPSC]
1254.description: Provides that a virtual school operated by an approved provider under s. 1002.45, F.S., may be a charter school for purposes of s. 1002.33, F.S. Provides that the virtual school is not subject to certain provisions pertaining to facilities or student transportation.

1255.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1255.title: Money Transmitters' Code [CPSC]
1255.description: Provides that any deferred presentment transaction entered into by a drawer with a nonexempt person who is not registered under specified provisions are void. Provides penalties and civil remedies. Provides that it is a felony of the third degree to collect on any deferred presentment transaction known to be void. Provides criminal penalties.

1256.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1256.title: Everglades Restoration [EPSC]
1256.description: Deletes an obsolete provision relating to a report by the South Florida Water Management District and the Department of Environmental Protection on the research and monitoring program within the Everglades Protection Area.

1257.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1257.title: Water Resources [EPSC]
1257.description: Deletes an obsolete date relating to a water supply assessment conducted by the water management districts.

1258.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
1258.title: Contaminated Site Cleanup [EPSC]
1258.description: Repeals specified provision relating to an obsolete report by the Department of Environmental Protection to the Governor and Legislature on preapproved advanced cleanup contract applications.

1259.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
1259.title: Brownfield Development [EPSC]
1259.description: Provides requirements for claiming certain site rehabilitation costs in an application for a contaminated site rehabilitation tax credit. Specifies additional requirements for the DEP in its annual report to the Legislature regarding site rehabilitation. Specifies criteria for prioritizing certain brownfield site projects that eliminate public health hazards.

1260.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1260.title: Land Acquisition [EPSC]
1260.description: Deletes an obsolete date with respect to implementation of initiatives requiring that the Department of Environmental Protection and water management districts use alternatives to fee simple acquisition.

1261.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1261.title: Greenways and Trails [EPSC]
1261.description: Deletes an obsolete provision requiring that the Department of Environmental Protection submit a report to the Governor and Legislature.

1262.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-205; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 1271 (Ch. 2010-225)
1262.title: Environmental Protection [EPSC]
1262.description: Creates specified provisions relating to water supply policy, planning, production, and funding. Provides for the general powers and duties of water management district governing boards. Provides for the inclusion of wastewater utilities, reuse utilities, and the DEP in the regional water supply planning process. Reduces the frequency of compliance reports during the term of a consumptive use permit, etc.

1263.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1263.title: Land Management [EPSC]
1263.description: Deletes a provision requiring the Legislature to review certain funding formulas.

1264.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1264.title: State Parks and Preserves [EPSC]
1264.description: Deletes obsolete provisions regarding the establishment of rules by the Department of Environmental Protection.

1265.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1265.title: Coastal Zone Protection [EPSC]
1265.description: Eliminates obsolete provisions with respect to a continuing education program provided by the state land planning agency.

1266.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1266.title: Beach Erosion Control Projects [EPSC]

1267.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1267.title: Restoration of Lake Jesup [EPSC]
1267.description: Requires the Department of Environmental Protection, the St. Johns River Water Management District, the Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission, and the City of Sanford to develop a plan concerning the progress of the commission's project to restore aquatic habitats in Lake Jesup. Requires the commission to report to the Legislature concerning the development of the plan, etc.

1268.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1268.title: SSB/Drainage Control [EPSC]
1268.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to drainage control.

1269.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1269.title: SSB/Fertilizer [EPSC]
1269.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to fertilizer.

1270.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1270.title: State Lands [EPSC]

1271.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1271.title: Florida Springs Protection Act [EPSC]
1271.description: Provides a short title. Provides legislative findings and intent with respect to the need to protect and restore springs and ground water.

1273.last_action: CS combines this bill with SB 318 -SJ 00600; CS by General Government Appropriations; YEAS 5 NAYS 0 -SJ 00600; Original bill laid on Table, refer to combined CS/SB 318 (Ch. 2010-185) -SJ 00600
1273.title: Wildlife [EPSC]
1273.description: (THIS BILL COMBINED IN CS/S318 & CS/S572) Revises provisions relating to the sale or release of wild animals. Revises violations for the sale and exhibition of wildlife in the state unless authorized by the FWC. Revises nonnative and captive wildlife penalties. Provides provisions for bonding requirements for the possession of wildlife, etc.

1274.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1274.title: Air Emissions [EPSC]
1274.description: Deletes an obsolete deadline for the Department of Environmental Protection to adopt rules relating to generic air emissions.

1276.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1276.title: Land Reclamation [EPSC]
1276.description: Deletes an obsolete provision relating to requests to the Department of Environmental Protection for approval of a reclamation program.

1277.title: Alzheimer's Disease [SPSC]
1277.description: Directs the Department of Elderly Affairs to develop and implement a public education program relating to screening for Alzheimer's disease. Provides criteria for awarding grants. Provides a definition. Requires grant recipients to submit an evaluation of certain activities to the department. Authorizes the department to provide technical support, etc.

1278.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1278.title: Grandparent Visitation [SPSC]
1278.description: Provides additional grounds for awarding a grandparent visitation with a grandchild.

1279.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1279.title: Lease of Submerged Lands [EPSC]
1279.description: Deletes the per-acre surcharge imposed on each lease. Prohibits the imposition of rental fees or other charges for the lease of submerged lands used for residential docks, piers, and wetslips.

1280.title: Data Destruction [CPSC]
1280.description: Provides definitions. Requires all public agencies and private entities that collect personal information to adhere to the procedures provided in the National Institute of Standards and Technology "Guidelines for Media Sanitization" when destroying such information, etc.

1281.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1281.title: Efficiency in Procurement and Contracting [GPSC]
1281.description: Establishes the Advisory Committee on State Procurement for the purpose of evaluating the state procurement process and carrying out the legislative policy created under the act. Provides policy of the Legislature with respect to the procurement of goods, services, and facilities by the state. Provides for membership, organization, and staffing of the committee. Provides duties and powers of the committee, etc. APPROPRIATION: $3,500,000.

1282.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1282.title: Non-court-related Financial Obligations/Collection [EPSC]
1282.description: Authorizes a board of county commissioners or the governing body of a municipality to pursue or refer the collection of any fees, service charges, fines, or costs to which it is owed to a private attorney or collection agent, if such referral is determined to be cost-effective. Provides that the collection fee paid to any attorney or collection agent may be added to the balance owed, which may not exceed a specified percentage, etc.

1283.title: Motor Vehicle Operators/Electronic Handheld Device [CPSC]
1283.description: Prohibits persons younger than 18 from using any electronic handheld device while operating a motor vehicle. Provides a surcharge for the violation. Provides for enforcement only as a secondary offense. Authorizes the issuance of a warning and safety literature in lieu of the surcharge.

1284.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1284.title: Energy [EPSC]
1284.description: Requires that electric utilities meet or exceed specified standards for the production or purchase of clean energy. Authorizes the Public Service Commission to allow a utility to recover the costs of converting an existing fossil fuel plant to a biomass plant under certain conditions. Provides legislative findings with respect to the need to reduce greenhouse gas emissions through the direct end-use of natural gas, etc.

1285.title: Inmates/Illegal or Undocumented Aliens/Deportation [SPSC]
1285.description: Requires the DOC and the Parole Commission to establish agreements to implement a federal deportation program for state inmates. Requires the Control Release Authority to implement a program to execute an immediate deportation order. Creates provisions relating to control release for removal and deportation to require the DOC to identify eligible inmates at the reception process, etc.

1286.title: Contamination Notification/Site Rehabilitation [EPSC]
1286.description: Revises contamination notification provisions. Requires individuals responsible for site rehabilitation to provide notice of site rehabilitation to specified entities. Requires the DEP to provide specified notice to private K-12 schools and child care facilities. Authorizes the local government and the DEP to recover notification costs from responsible parties, etc.

1287.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1287.title: Water Protection and Sustainability Trust Fund [EPSC]
1287.description: Authorizes water management districts to use certain moneys in the fund for water resource development projects.

1288.title: Termination of Rental Agreement [SPSC]
1288.description: Requires the landlord or mortgagor or its agent to tender to the registry of the court or to the foreclosing entity all funds held for advance rent or security deposits at the time of foreclosure. Directs that such funds continue to be held for the use and benefit of the tenants of the foreclosed property, etc.

1289.title: Cellular Telephones/Use While Driving [CPSC]
1289.description: Prohibits the use of a cellular telephone while operating a motor vehicle except when using a headset or hands-free device. Provides exemptions. Provides a penalty. Provides for enforcement only as a secondary offense.

1290.title: Collective Bargaining for Certain Public Employees [EPSC]
1290.description: Specifies that for purposes of resolving an impasse the sheriff, the tax collector, the property appraiser, the supervisor of elections, and the clerk of the circuit court are each deemed the "legislative body" for their respective employees, etc.

1291.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1291.title: Special Risk Class/DROP [WPSC]
1291.description: Prohibits certain members of the Special Risk Class from being reemployed or contracting with the same employer from which the member retired. Extends the period of time during which certain Special Risk Class members may participate in the Florida Retirement System Deferred Retirement Option Program, etc.

1292.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1292.title: Water and Wastewater Utilities [EPSC]
1292.description: Provides for recovery through a surcharge of certain costs relating to water and wastewater system improvement projects. Requires utilities to submit tariffs reflecting the surcharge for recovery of such costs to the Florida Public Service Commission for approval and to provide specified notice of such tariff filings. Specifies a limitation for the surcharge amount, etc.

1293.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1293.title: Prescription Drug Monitoring Program [SPSC]
1293.description: Requires that the confidential and exempt information in the program database which is disclosed to the Attorney General or a law enforcement agency by the Department of Health be disclosed pursuant to a search warrant based upon probable cause.

1295.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 889 (Ch. 2010-34), HB 5311 (Ch. 2010-161)
1295.title: Biomedical Research Programs [SPSC]
1295.description: Deletes provisions requiring that the James and Esther King Biomedical Research Program be funded by proceeds from the Lawton Chiles Endowment Fund. Increases the funding available to the Florida Center for Universal Research to Eradicate Disease. Revises the purpose of the William G. "Bill" Bankhead, Jr., and David Coley Cancer Research Program. Creates the Cancer Control Collaborative Program within the Department of Health, etc.

1296.title: Gaming [CPSC]
1296.description: Amends specified provision relating to compact authorization. Provides that specified agreements executed by the Seminole Tribe of Florida and the Governor are void and not in effect. Ratifies and approves a specified compact executed by the Tribe and the Governor. Directs the Governor to cooperate with the Tribe in seeking approval of the compact from the United States Secretary of the Interior, etc.

1297.title: SSB/Construction Contracting [CPSC]
1297.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to construction contracting.

1298.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to elevators.

1299.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to arcades.

1300.title: SSB/Community Associations [CPSC]
1300.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to community associations.

1301.title: SSB/Alcoholic Beverages [CPSC]
1301.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to alcoholic beverages.

1302.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1302.title: SSB/Construction Lien Law [CPSC]
1302.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the construction lien law.

1303.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1303.title: SSB/Video Lotteries [CPSC]
1303.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to video lotteries.

1304.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1304.title: SSB/Cardrooms [CPSC]
1304.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to cardrooms.

1305.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1305.title: Pari-mutuel Wagering [CPSC]
1305.description: Exempts pari-mutuel wagers at pari-mutuel facilities that do not operate slot machines from the tax on handle. Imposes a surcharge on pari-mutuel licensees that do not operate slot machines if the taxes on slot machine revenue are less than a certain amount. Revises the amounts that greyhound and jai alia permitholders that operate cardrooms must use to supplement greyhound purses or jai alai prize money, etc.

1306.last_action: Withdrawn from Education Pre-K - 12 Appropriations -SJ 01241; Placed on Calendar, on 2nd reading; Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 01245; Substituted CS/HB 467 -SJ 01245; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 467 (Ch. 2010-217) -SJ 01245
1306.title: Public K-12 Education/Teen Dating Violence & Abuse [SPSC]
1306.description: Provides that comprehensive health education taught in the public schools shall include a component on teen dating violence and abuse for students in grades 7 through 12. Requires district school boards to adopt and implement a dating violence and abuse policy. Provides policy requirements. Requires the Department of Education to develop a model policy. Requires school personnel training.

1307.title: Direct-support Org./Department of Military Affairs [WPSC]
1307.description: Authorizes the direct-support organization to support the processing of requests from the Soldiers and Airmen Assistance Program or similar programs. Requires the direct-support organization to submit its annual budget and financial reports to the DMA. Requires the financial committee of the board of directors of the direct-support organization for the DMA to review the financial transactions of the program quarterly, etc.

1308.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 2272 (Ch. 2010-211)
1308.title: Pain-management Clinics [SPSC]
1308.description: Prohibits a person from owning or operating a pain-management clinic unless he or she is a physician licensed in this state. Requires a physician's license to be clear and active to own or operate a pain-management clinic. Provides that a pain-management clinic may not be owned by or employ a physician who has been disciplined by the Board of Medicine or the Board of Osteopathic Medicine for dependency on drugs or alcohol, etc.

1310.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1310.title: Reproductive Health Services/Rape Survivors [SPSC]
1310.description: Creates the "Prevention First Act." Provides duties of licensed health care practitioners and facilities relating to the treatment of rape survivors. Requires the Agency for Health Care Administration to provide for enforcement and impose penalties. Requires licensed pharmacies to dispense certain forms of contraception without delay. Specifies conditions under which a pharmacy may refuse to provide a contraceptive, etc.

1311.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations
1311.title: Compensation for Wrongful Incarceration [SPSC]
1311.description: Requires that a petition for compensation include clear and convincing evidence of actual innocence. Requires the petitioner to submit fingerprints for criminal history records checks. Requires that the results of the criminal history records checks be submitted to the clerk of the court. Provides for compensation of reasonable attorney's fees and expenses, up to $50,000, incurred for pursuing compensation for wrongful incarceration, etc.

1312.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1312.title: Public Records/State Long Term Care Ombudsman [SPSC]
1312.description: Provides an exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying and location information of any certified ombudsman or employee of the Office of State Long-Term Care Ombudsman within the Department of Elderly Affairs and the spouses and children of such ombudsmen or employees. Provides for future review and repeal of the exemption. Provides a finding of public necessity, etc.

1313.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1313.title: Locksmith Services [CPSC]
1313.description: Requires the licensure of locksmith services businesses and locksmith referral services by the DOACS. Requires fingerprinting and background screening for criminal records checks of the owner and certain other persons affiliated with a locksmith services business. Requires the FDLE to provide certain records to the DOACS upon request. Provides that a violation of the act is a deceptive and unfair trade practice, etc.

1314.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1307 (Ch. 2010-180)
1314.title: Defined Contribution Retirement Program [WPSC]
1314.description: Changes the name of the Public Employee Optional Retirement Program to the Public Employee Retirement Investment Program. Limits the option of enrolling in the State Retirement System's defined benefit program or defined contribution program to public employees employed before January 1, 2011. Deletes requirements for an educational program that compares retirement programs, etc.

1315.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1315.title: Insurance [CPSC]
1315.description: Prohibits an insurer that issues motor vehicle insurance from using a rate, rating schedule, rating manual, or an underwriting rule that is not contained in a rating manual and is determined in whole or in part on the basis of certain characteristics of an insured. Prohibits the use by insurers of credit reports and credit scores in making rating determinations. Deletes provisions authorizing the Financial Services Commission to adopt rules, etc.

1316.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
1316.title: Property Taxation [WPSC]
1316.description: Tolls the statute of limitations relating to proceedings involving tax lien certificates or tax deeds by the period of an intervening bankruptcy. Revises provisions relating to applications for tax deeds. Provides that the authority of the governing body of a county or municipality to grant certain ad valorem tax exemptions may be renewed for multiple 10-year periods upon approval by referendum, etc.

1317.title: SSB/Professions [CPSC]
1317.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to professions.

Provides that the DOL may lease all instant ticket vending machines. Prohibits the department from entering into a contract for a major procurement if a managing member of the vendor has been convicted of a felony, etc.

1327.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to public records and meetings.

1329.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 5101 (Ch. 2010-154)
1329.title: Local Government Accountability [EPSC]
1329.description: Clarifies when the DCA may institute procedures for declaring that a special district is inactive. Specifies the level of detail required for each fund in the sheriff's proposed budget. Amends specified provision relating to the review of the actuarial reports and statements of retirement plans of governmental entities by the DMS. Deletes a time restriction on preparing and presenting a tentative county budget, etc.

1330.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1330.title: SSB/Public Records [SPSC]
1330.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to public records.

1331.title: Child Support [SPSC]
1331.description: Provides that an obligor may make child support payments directly to the obligee under certain circumstances. Clarifies when income deduction payments are required to be paid to the State Disbursement Unit. 1334.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to elder affairs.

1335.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the elderly.

1336.description: Provides that it is an aggravating circumstance for the purpose of determining sentence if a capital felony was committed by a person subject to an injunction or protection order against the petitioner who obtained that injunction or order or any of certain related persons.

1345.description: Reenacts and amends a specified provision relating to the establishment of the Department of Children and Family Services. Revises licensure requirements for family day care homes. Revises provisions relating to lead agencies. Requires that a guardian ad litem be appointed by the court to represent a child in the custody of the DCFS who is prescribed a psychotropic medication, etc.

1348.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1348.title: SSB/Review/DCFS/Fla. Government Accountability Act [SPSC]
1348.description: Expresses the legislative intent to abolish, continue, or reorganize the Department of Children and Family Services.

1349.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1349.title: Stillbirth and SUID Education and Awareness [SPSC]
1349.description: Requires the State Surgeon General to prepare and implement a public health awareness and education campaign in order to provide information that is focused on decreasing the risk factors for sudden unexpected infant death and sudden unexplained death in childhood. Requires the State Surgeon General to establish a task force to develop a research plan to determine the causes of, and how to prevent, stillbirth in children, etc.

1350.title: Public Corruption [GPSC]
1350.description: Provides for the reclassification of criminal offenses committed "under color of law." Provides an exception.

1352.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability

1352.description: Revises the requirements for appointing or removing the directors of insurance regulation and financial regulation. Requires the Financial Services Commission to reconfirm the appointment of the directors every two years.

1353.title: Public Safety Telecommunicators/E911 [SPSC]
1353.description: Includes dispatching as a function of E911 services. Includes fees for certification and recertification collected by the Department of Health in authorized expenditures for E911 services. Requires certain 911 public safety telecommunicators, sworn state-certified law enforcement officers, or state-certified firefighters to pass an examination administered by the department, etc.

1354.title: Negligence/Products Liability Action [SPSC]
1354.description: Defines the terms "negligence action" and "products liability action." Requires the trier of fact to consider the fault of all parties to an accident when apportioning damages in a products liability action alleging an additional or enhanced injury.

1355.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation

1355.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to public records and meetings.

1356.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Agency for Health Care Administration.

1357.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Department of Health.

1359.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to Medicaid.

1360.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the regulation of health care facilities and services.

1361.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to health care practitioners.

1363.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to health insurance.

1364.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1364.title: SSB/Public Health [SPSC]
1364.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to public health.

1365.title: Luis Rivera Ortega Street Racing Act [CPSC]
1365.description: Creates the "Luis Rivera Ortega Street Racing Act." Revises penalties for violating provisions prohibiting certain speed competitions and exhibitions.

1366.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1366.title: Permits/Consumptive Use of Water/Commercial Profit [EPSC]
1366.description: Prohibits until July 1, 2020, the governing board of a water management district or the Department of Environmental Protection from approving an application for a required permit if the applicant intends to resell the water for a commercial profit.

1367.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1367.title: Physical Education [SPSC]
1367.description: Clarifies provisions requiring that a school district notify a student's parent regarding certain options available to the student as an alternative to participation in physical education.

1368.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1368.title: Renewable Energy Policy [EPSC]
1368.description: Ratifies the rules on renewable portfolio standards adopted by the Public Service Commission.

1369.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 1271 (Ch. 2010-225), CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
1369.title: Wekiva River Protection Act [EPSC]
1369.description: Clarifies mitigation offsets in the Wekiva Study Area.

1370.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education Appropriations
1370.title: State Universities [WPSC]
1370.description: Authorizes university boards of trustees to establish a renewable energy fee under certain circumstances. Provides that the fee not exceed a specified amount. Limits the use of such fee. Establishes a renewable energy fee committee. Provides for membership. Provides terms. Provides for a referendum on continuing or discontinuing the fee. Authorizes the university to reestablish the fee. Conforms cross-references.

1371.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1371.title: Foreclosure Proceedings/Payment of Fees [CPSC]
1371.description: Requires a financial institution that institutes a foreclosure proceeding against residential property to pay all fees associated with or owed by the property which accrue from the date the foreclosure action is initiated until the foreclosure is finalized. Provides for retroactive application.

1372.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1372.title: Pretrial Detention and Release [SPSC]
1372.description: Requires all pretrial release programs established by an ordinance of a county commission, by an administrative order of a court, or by any other means to facilitate the release of defendants from pretrial custody to conform to the policies and restrictions established in the act. Requires that the defendant meet certain specified criteria in order to be eligible for pretrial release, etc.

1373.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1373.title: Alcoholic Beverage Regulation [CPSC]
1373.description: Corrects and conforms cross-references. Provides an exemption from specified taxes on alcoholic beverages provided by certain distillers for spirituous beverage tastings. Repeals a provision relating to the sale, processing, and consumption of certain distilled spirits. Provides the Division of Alcoholic Beverages and Tobacco with certain requirements regarding the registration of brands and labels, fee payments, and notices, etc.

1374.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1374.title: Residential Tenancies [SPSC]
1374.description: Prohibits a landlord from refusing to enter into a rental agreement with a person for a dwelling unit because the person is a victim of domestic violence, dating violence, repeat violence, or sexual violence. Prohibits a landlord from refusing to enter into a rental agreement with a victim of said violence because the person previously terminated a rental agreement or had a rental agreement terminated as a result of such violence, etc.

1376.title: Retired Justices and Judges [SPSC]
1376.description: Provides that a former justice or judge may be qualified to serve as a retired justice or judge under certain conditions. Provides circumstances under which such justice or judge may not serve as a retired justice or judge.

1377.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 631 (Ch. 2010-198)
1377.title: Derelict Motor Vehicles and Mobile Homes [CPSC]
1377.description: Revises provisions relating to an application for the removal of a lien from the files of the HSMV or from the certificate of title. Provides for the dealer or recycler to apply to the HSMV for a derelict motor vehicle certificate if the certificate of title, salvage certificate of title, or certificate of destruction is not available, etc.

1378.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1378.title: School Food Services/Nutritional Awareness [WPSC]
1378.description: Cites this act as the "Cafeteria Nutritional Awareness Act." Provides that district school board policies for the operation of school food service programs include the requirement that schools provide and post nutritional information for daily meals. Requires each school district with a summer nutrition program to provide and post nutritional information for daily meals.

1379.title: Injunctions for Protection [SPSC]
1379.description: Subject to available funding, directs the Florida Association of Court Clerks to develop an automated process by which a petitioner may request notification of service of the injunction for protection. Requires that notice to the petitioner be given to the petitioner within a specified time. Provides for the content of the notice.

1380.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1380.title: Prohibited Discrimination [EPSC]
1380.description: Revises provisions to include sexual orientation and gender identity or expression as impermissible grounds for discrimination. Revises provisions to include sexual orientation and gender identity or expression as impermissible grounds for discrimination in public lodging establishments and public food service establishments. Specifies when an individual has an impairment for certain purposes, etc.

1381.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1381.title: SSB/Domestic Violence [SPSC]
1381.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to domestic violence.

1383.title: Murder/Unlawful Distribution of Methadone [SPSC]
1383.description: Provides that murder in the first degree includes the unlawful killing of a human being which resulted from the unlawful distribution of methadone by a person aged 18 or older when such drug is proven to be the proximate cause of the death of the user, etc.

1384.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1384.title: Florida Retirement System [WPSC]
1384.description: Conforms cross-references. Authorizes additional persons to purchase credit for prior military wartime service. Conforms a cross-reference. Revises the payroll contribution rates for the membership classes of the system. Provides a declaration of important state interest.

1385.title: Lifeline Telecommunications Service [EPSC]
1385.description: Authorizes any commercial mobile radio service provider designated as an eligible telecommunications carrier to offer Lifeline services. Authorizes the DCFS, DOE, PSC, and Office of Public Counsel to exchange certain information with eligible telecommunications carriers and certain commercial mobile radio service providers so the carriers and providers can identify and enroll an eligible person in the Lifeline and Link-Up programs, etc.

1387.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12 Appropriations
1387.title: Student Achievement in Fine Arts Courses [SPSC]
1387.description: Revises the basis for the designation of school grades to include the performance of students who are enrolled in fine arts courses. Requires that the Department of Education, in coordination with Florida professional arts education associations, develop the assessments, subject to available funding. Requires that field testing of the assessments be completed, etc.

1388.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1388.title: Forensic Services/Misdemeanants [SPSC]
