1388.description: Provides legislative intent that forensic services be provided to a person charged with a misdemeanor as well as a felony offense. Amends specified provisions relating to definitions, the rights of forensic clients, the involuntary commitment of a defendant with mental illness, and the involuntary commitment of a defendant determined to be incompetent, etc.

1389.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1389.title: Presidential Elections [GPSC]
1389.description: Establishes the Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote. Provides a method by which any state may become a member state. Requires a statewide popular election for President and Vice President of the United States. Establishes a procedure for appointing presidential electors in member states. Provides that the agreement becomes effective upon the occurrence of specified actions, etc.

1390.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1390.title: Pardons/Restoration of Rights/Rosa Parks Act [SPSC]
1390.description: Creates the "Rosa Parks Act." Encourages the Board of Executive Clemency to grant a full pardon to a person convicted of protesting or challenging a state law or local government ordinance the purpose of which was to maintain racial segregation of or racial discrimination against individuals. Requires the Parole Commission to notify the state attorney of the circuit where the violation occurred, etc.

1392.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1392.title: Health Care Provider/Immunity From Civil Liability [SPSC]
1392.description: Provides immunity from civil damages to health care providers providing emergency care or medical consultation services. Provides an exception. Provides for severability. Provides for retroactive application.

1393.last_action: Withdrawn from Banking and Insurance; Community Affairs; General Government Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means -SJ 00522; Withdrawn from further consideration, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176), SB 1136 (Ch. 2010-173) -SJ 00522
1393.title: State Fire Marshal [CPSC]
1393.description: Requires application of uniform firesafety standards to state universities. Provides authority and requirements for completion of plans for and inspection of manufactured buildings at the point of manufacture under certain circumstances. Requires the State Fire Marshal to establish a Fire Code Interpretation Committee for certain purposes. Revises requirements and procedures for inspections of buildings and equipment, etc.

1394.title: Child Care Facilities [SPSC]
1394.description: Provides for certain household children to be included in calculations regarding the capacity of licensed family day care homes and large family child care homes. Revises advertising requirements applicable to child care facilities. Provides penalties, etc.

1395.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1395.title: Ad Valorem Tax Assessments [WPSC]
1395.description: Requires that a petition before the value adjustment board challenging an ad valorem assessment contain certain information relating to the property and the petitioner.

1396.last_action: In Messages; Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5201 (Ch. 2010-155)
1396.title: University of South Florida/Doctor of Pharmacy [SPSC]
1396.description: Authorizes a doctor of pharmacy degree program at the university. Provides for the program to be physically located on the new campus of the University of South Florida Polytechnic. Authorizes the university to develop and implement the program within existing facilities until a pharmacy facility is constructed on the new campus of the University of South Florida Polytechnic.

1397.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 1196 (Ch. 2010-174)
1397.title: Community Associations [CPSC]
1397.description: Redefines the term "developer." Specifies that the Division of Florida Condominiums, Timeshares, and Mobile Homes of the DBPR has jurisdiction with respect to bulk assignees and bulk buyers. Creates the "Distressed Condominium Relief Act." Specifies liabilities of bulk assignees and bulk buyers. Provides for the resolution of a conflict between specified provisions of state law, etc.

1400.last_action: Chapter No. 2010-99; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176)
1400.title: Residential Fire Sprinkler Requirements [CPSC]
1400.description: Prohibits incorporation into the Florida Building Code certain mandatory residential fire sprinkler provisions of the International Residential Code. Provides an exception. Prohibits the requirement of property owners to install fire sprinklers in residential properties based on the use of that property as a rental property or any change in or reclassification of the property's primary use to a rental property.

1401.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1401.title: Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program [SPSC]
1401.description: Provides that prekindergarten instructors in school-year prekindergarten programs delivered by private providers and public schools must meet new professional credentialing requirements beginning July 1, 2013. Deletes provisions relating to alternate educational credentials, to conform. Repeals a specified provision relating to aspirational goals for the professional credentials of prekindergarten instructors, etc.

1402.title: Fla. Industrial and Phosphate Research Institute [SPSC]
1402.description: Renames the Florida Institute of Phosphate Research as the "Florida Industrial and Phosphate Research Institute" and establishes it within the University of South Florida Polytechnic. Provides for a type two transfer of the Florida Institute of Phosphate Research to the Florida Industrial and Phosphate Research Institute within said university. Repeals a specified provision relating to the Florida Institute of Phosphate Research, etc.

1403.title: Rental Property Foreclosure or Short-sale Actions [SPSC]
1403.description: Requires lenders to notify tenants or lessees of potential foreclosure or short-sale actions against the rental property. Requires the lenders to provide tenants or lessees a first right of refusal to purchase the property at fair market value. Specifies lender liability for certain costs for failure to comply with certain notice requirements. Specifies time restrictions on tenants or lessees bringing actions for damages, etc.

1404.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1404.title: Immigration [CPSC]
1404.description: Requires the DOL to verify the citizenship or legal presence in the United States of certain prize winners. Prohibits counties and municipalities from adopting ordinances relating to persons illegally present in the United States. Requires the FDLE to establish a memorandum of understanding with the federal Department of Homeland Security regarding illegal aliens who are confined in county detention facilities, etc.

1405.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
1405.title: Sales Tax/Fractional Aircraft Ownership Program [WPSC]
1405.description: Defines the term "fractional aircraft ownership program." Provides tax exemptions on the sale or use of aircraft primarily used in a fractional aircraft ownership program and for the parts and labor used in the maintenance, repair, and overhaul of such aircraft. Provides a maximum tax on the sale or use of fractional aircraft ownership interests.

1407.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1407.title: Funeral and Burial Arrangements [SPSC]
1407.description: Authorizes a medical examiner to record the identity of certain persons who may have unlawfully participated in the death of a decedent. Directs a medical examiner to provide to the funeral director findings of the identity of certain persons who may have unlawfully participated in a decedent's death. Narrows a public records exemption to authorize the parent or adult child of a decedent to obtain autopsy records, etc.

1409.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1409.title: SSB/Elections [GPSC]
1409.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to elections.

1410.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5 (Ch. 2010-230)
1410.title: Road Designations/Julia Tuttle Way/Miami-Dade Co. [CPSC]
1410.description: Designates Julia Tuttle Way in Miami-Dade County. Directs the DOT to erect markers.

1412.last_action: Withdrawn from Finance and Tax; Transportation and Economic Development Appropriations -SJ 00635; Withdrawn from further consideration, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 1271 (Ch. 2010-225) -SJ 00635
1412.title: Wreckers [CPSC]
1412.description: Revises provisions of an exception to penalties for exceeding weight limits. Provides that the exception does not apply to load limits for bridges and culverts when those limits are posted. Provides that wreckers are subject to certain safety and operational requirements. Provides wreckers with an exception to gross weight limits. Provides that specified license tax provisions apply to wreckers used for certain purposes, etc.

1414.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1414.title: Residential Property Insurance [CPSC]
1414.description: Authorizes certain insurers to use a rate different from otherwise applicable filed rates. Limits the maximum average statewide increase for certain rate filings. Preserves the authority of the OIR to disapprove rates as inadequate or disapprove a rate filing for using certain rating factors. Provides requirements for the levy of the Citizens policyholder surcharge, etc.

1415.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1415.title: Construction Contracting/Nonpayment Notices [CPSC]
1415.description: Requires a claimant to verify a notice of nonpayment submitted to a contractor or surety. Specifies the information that must be included in a notice of nonpayment. Prohibits a person who furnishes a false or fraudulent notice of nonpayment from recovering under the surety bond. Specifies the manner in which certain notices relating to construction contracting must be served, etc.

1418.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00746; Substituted CS/HB 7165 -SJ 00746; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7165 (Ch. 2010-43) -SJ 00746
1418.title: OGSR/Domestic Violence Fatality Review Team [SPSC]
1418.description: Repeals a specified provision relating to an exemption from public records and public meetings requirements for information held by a domestic violence fatality review team and for portions of meetings of a review team at which confidential or exempt information is discussed. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act. Deletes provisions providing for repeal of the exemption.

1419.last_action: Read 3rd time -SJ 00664; Substituted HB 7091 -SJ 00664; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7091 (Ch. 2010-73) -SJ 00664
1419.title: OGSR/Insurance Claim Data Exchange Information [SPSC]
1419.description: Amends a specified provision which provides an exemption from public records requirements for certain records obtained by the Department of Revenue under an insurance claim data exchange system. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act. Extends the repeal date.

1422.title: SSB/Department of Highway Safety & Motor Vehicles [CPSC]
1422.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles.

1423.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education Appropriations
1423.title: University of South Florida St. Petersburg [SPSC]
1423.description: Authorizes the Board of Trustees of the Univ. of South Florida to increase the aggregate sum of activity and service, health, and athletic fees to exceed the 5 percent cap on annual increases for the purpose of increasing the activity and service fee at the Univ. of South Florida St. Petersburg. Requires the revenue from the increase in the activity and service fee be used to construct and operate a multipurpose campus center, etc.

1425.title: SSB/Specialty License Plates [CPSC]
1425.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to specialty license plates.

1426.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00819; Amendment(s) adopted (952218) -SJ 00820; Amendment(s) failed -SJ 00820; Substituted CS/CS/HB 131 -SJ 00820; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 131 (Ch. 2010-167) -SJ 00820
1426.title: Voting [GPSC]
1426.description: Extends the deadline by which persons with disabilities will be required to vote on voter interface devices that meet certain requirements. Requires the supervisor of elections to notify the absent uniformed services voter and overseas voter of the free access system for determining absentee ballot status. Provides a timeframe for an absentee ballot to be sent to each absent uniformed services voter and overseas voter, etc.

1427.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 131 (Ch. 2010-167), HB 1301 (Ch. 2010-112)
1427.title: Public Trust [GPSC]
1427.description: Authorizes the Florida Elections Commission to determine whether a person's conduct was willful in an informal hearing following a finding of probable cause. Authorizes a county to specify by ordinance penalties for a violation of certain county ordinances. Requires the executive and judicial branch to notify the Governor and Legislature before entering into contracts containing certain provisions relating to expenditures, etc.

1428.title: SSB/Department of Transportation [CPSC]
1428.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Department of Transportation.

1429.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1429.title: SSB/Ethics [GPSC]
1429.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to ethics.

1431.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1431.title: Clinical Perfusionists [SPSC]
1431.description: Specifies financial responsibility requirements for clinical perfusionists. Requires a supervising physician to be qualified in the medical area in which the clinical perfusionist performs. Prescribes duties of a clinical perfusionist. Prohibits a clinical perfusionist from prescribing, ordering, compounding, or dispensing certain drugs or medical devices. Provides certification requirements, etc.

1433.title: SSB/Transportation [CPSC]
1433.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to transportation.

1434.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1434.title: Newborns/Screening [SPSC]
1434.description: Authorizes the DOH to charge a fee for each live birth to cover the administrative costs incurred in providing for followup evaluation of abnormal screening results. Deletes a requirement that the DOH certify the annual costs of the newborn screening program in its legislative budget requests. Requires that the DOH be reimbursed by Medicaid for newborn screening tests and followup reevaluations, etc.

1436.title: SSB/Highway Safety [CPSC]
1436.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to highway safety.

1437.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 971 (Ch. 2010-223)
1437.title: Driver's Licenses [CPSC]
1437.description: Provides procedures for the restoration of the driving privileges of certain persons whose driving privileges have been revoked. Provides for a hearing. Provides for the adoption of rules. Provides a phase-in period. Requires the installation of an ignition interlock device under certain circumstances.

1438.title: Trusts [CPSC]
1438.description: Limits the duties and liability of certain trustees with respect to contracts for life insurance. Provides for the application and nonapplication of certain provisions of state law. Prohibits the compensation of a trustee for the performance of certain activities. Expands the list of delegable investment functions for certain fiduciaries, etc.

1439.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1439.title: Low-income and Moderate-income Homeowners [EPSC]
1439.description: Provides for counties to establish a fund for providing no-interest loans to assist low-income and moderate-income homeowners in paying homeowners' insurance premiums. Provides for the program to be adopted initially by the governing authority of certain constitutional charter counties and for later adoption in the remaining counties of the state, etc.

1440.last_action: Withdrawn from Criminal Justice; Judiciary; Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations; Withdrawn prior to introduction
1440.title: Driving or Boating Under the Influence [SPSC]
1440.description: Authorizes a law enforcement officer to arrest a person without a warrant when there is probable cause to believe the person has committed any of specified driving or boating under the influence violations.

1441.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1441.title: Sexual Offenses Involving the Internet [SPSC]
1441.description: Prohibits persons convicted of certain sexual offenses involving the Internet from accessing the Internet or maintaining or contracting for access to the Internet. Provides an employment exception. Provides criminal penalties.

1442.title: Wireless Communications Devices in Motor Vehicles
1442.description: Prohibits reading, writing, or using a wireless communications device for text messaging while driving a motor vehicle. Prohibits the use of a wireless telephone while driving a motor vehicle unless the telephone is designed and used for hands-free talking and listening. Prohibits operators of school buses or other public transportation vehicles from operating such vehicle while using a wireless telephone, etc.

1443.last_action: Died in Committee on Health and Human Services Appropriations
1443.title: Breast Cancer Early Detection and Treatment [SPSC]
1443.description: Revises certain criteria of the breast cancer early detection and treatment referral program by requiring that the public education and outreach initiative and professional education programs use guidelines currently employed by the United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention rather than the United States Preventive Services Task Force.

1444.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1444.title: Debt Settlement Services [CPSC]
1444.description: Requires that a person be licensed if he or she provides or offers to provide debt settlement services to a client who resides in this state. Requires the fingerprinting and background screening of licensees and certain personnel of the licensees' businesses. Requires an applicant or licensee to notify the Office of Financial Regulation of any change of the application information within a specified time, etc.

1445.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1445.title: School Attendance/Withdrawal from School [SPSC]
1445.description: Requires that a student who is withdrawing from school be assigned a counselor or other school personnel to provide educational information until the student is 18 years of age. Requires that 9th grade students in their second semester and students who are withdrawing from school receive detailed instruction regarding the effects of withdrawing from high school without graduating and certain available options.

1447.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1447.title: Injunctions/Domestic/Repeat/Sexual/Dating Violence [SPSC]
1447.description: Requires the court, under certain circumstances, to order the sheriff to take into custody and to keep in custody for a specified period the respondent of a petition for an injunction for protection against domestic violence or for an injunction for protection against repeat violence, sexual violence, or dating violence, etc.

1448.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1448.title: Domestic Violence/Surrender Weapon [SPSC]
1448.description: Provides that a respondent may be ordered, as part of a domestic violence injunction, to surrender any weapon identified in the injunction order. Provides requirements for such an order. Provides for consequences of failure to comply with such an order, etc.

1449.title: Department of Corrections
1449.description: Provides for the Secretary of Corrections to appoint no more than three deputy secretaries. Sets forth the administrative actions that an agency must take if a prisoner files a petition that is directed to an unadopted agency rule.

1450.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1450.title: Florida School for the Deaf and the Blind [WPSC]
1450.description: Requires that salaries for full-time instructional personnel at the school be increased annually according to the average of certain comparable salaries. Requires annual negotiation of salary schedules. Provides for implementation based on funding.

1451.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1451.title: Encroachment Onto Real Property of Others [EPSC]
1451.description: Provides that, in the absence of an easement or agreement, a person may not erect a building or other structure on his or her own land if any part of the building or structure encroaches upon the adjoining premises. Provides that the owner of the land encroached upon has a cause of action against the landowner who encroaches on the adjoining premises, etc.

1454.title: Driver License Records [CPSC]
1454.description: Revises the authorized uses of license identification information maintained by the HSMV and released to the DCFS. Authorizes use for certain adult protective services investigations. Provides conditions for such information to be used for verification of identity in determination of eligibility for public assistance and for certain fraud investigations.

1455.last_action: Died pending reference review under Rule 4.7(2)
1455.title: Massage Services [SPSC]
1455.description: Requires a person who provides or offers to provide massage services to possess a license and certain identifying documents and requires such person to present a license and an identifying document to a law enforcement officer upon request. Requires any person who operates a massage establishment to maintain certain valid work authorization documents on the premises for certain employees, etc.

1456.title: Condominiums/Notice of Delinquency [CPSC]
1456.description: Provides requirements for the collection of unit owner debts. Provides requirements for a notice of delinquency. Prohibits a condominium association from imposing certain penalties for delinquency during a notice period or while an objection made within such notice period is unresolved.

1457.title: Dentists/Dental Hygienists [SPSC]
1457.description: Requires persons who apply for licensure renewal as a dentist or dental hygienist to furnish certain information to the DOH in a dental workforce survey. Requires the Board of Dentistry to issue a nondisciplinary citation and a notice for failure to complete the survey within a specified time. Authorizes certain business entities to pay for prescription drugs obtained by practitioners licensed under specified provisions, etc.

1458.title: Pub. Rec./Dental Workforce Surveys [SPSC]
1458.description: Provides an exemption from public records requirements for information contained in dental workforce surveys submitted by dentists or dental hygienists to the Department of Health as a condition for license renewal. Provides exceptions to the exemption. Provides for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption under the Open Government Sunset Review Act. Provides a statement of public necessity.

1459.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1459.title: Municipal Elections [GPSC]
1459.description: Provides circumstances under which a candidate without opposition due to a specified vacancy in candidacy shall be declared elected to office without having to reopen the qualifying period and hold a municipal special election.

1460.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1460.title: Public School Students/Grades 1-3/Reading [SPSC]
1460.description: Requires that certain students who are enrolled in a public elementary school and reading below grade level be placed into an intensive reading lab. Provides for oversight of the progress of students assigned to a reading lab. Encourages the principal of a school where reading labs are required to solicit donations to secure instructional materials. Specifies requirements for training teachers to teach reading, etc.

1461.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 01141; Amendment(s) adopted (753998) -SJ 01141; Substituted CS/HB 289 -SJ 01141; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 289 (Ch. 2010-216) -SJ 01141
1461.title: License Plates/Fraternal Order of Police [CPSC]
1461.description: Creates a Fraternal Order of Police license plate. Establishes an annual use fee for the plate. Provides for the distribution of use fees received from the sale of the plate.

1462.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1462.title: Interpreters and Transliterators [SPSC]
1462.description: Requires the Florida School for the Deaf and the Blind to designate an entity to issue credentials to interpreters and transliterators who provide services for persons who are deaf or hard of hearing. Requires that a person who provides interpreting or transliterating services possess a credential issued under the act. Requires that the credentialing entity establish the Interpreters for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing Advisory Board, etc.

1463.title: Underground Facility Damage Prevention & Safety [EPSC]
1463.description: Prohibits municipalities, counties, districts, and other local governments from enacting ordinances or rules that conflict with ch. 556, F.S. Provides that if an excavation is proposed within 15 feet of a high-priority subsurface installation and is identified as such by the facility operator, the facility operator must notify the excavator of such installation and mark its location before excavation may begin, etc.

1464.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1464.title: SSB/Renewable Energy [EPSC]
1464.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to renewable energy.

1465.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1465.title: SSB/Communications [EPSC]
1465.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to communications.

1466.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1466.title: SSB/Electric Regulation [EPSC]
1466.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to electric regulation.

1468.last_action: Died pending review, Rule 4.7(2), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7179 (Ch. 2010-139), CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
1468.title: Renewable Energy [EPSC]
1468.description: Deletes obsolete provisions relating to the creation of the Florida Development Finance Corporation. Authorizes the corporation to issue notes or other evidence of indebtedness for the purpose of financing any capital projects that promote economic development within the state. Deletes provisions requiring that the PSC adopt rules for a renewable portfolio standard. Requires the PSC to approve certain renewable energy projects, etc.

1469.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1469.title: SSB/Energy [EPSC]
1469.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to energy.

1470.title: Transient Rentals Tax/Room Remarketers [WPSC]
1470.description: Defines terms. Requires a room remarketer to collect and remit taxes on the total rent charged to customers for the occupancy of a transient rental accommodation. Requires certain persons to report and remit the tax on certain transient rentals. Provides requirements, procedures, and limitations.

1471.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-122; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1237 (Ch. 2010-132)
1471.title: Trust Administration [SPSC]
1471.description: Limits a personal representative's entitlement to payment from a trust of certain estate expenses and obligations. Deletes certain notice requirements relating to court review of a trustee's employment of certain persons. Prohibits state agencies and local governments from requiring the disclosure of certain characteristics of persons associated with certain charitable organizations, trusts, and foundations, etc.

1472.title: Enterprise Zones [CPSC]
1472.description: Authorizes certain governing bodies to apply to the OTTED to amend the boundary of an enterprise zone that includes a rural area of critical economic concern. Provides a limitation. Authorizes the office to approve the amendment application subject to certain requirements. Authorizes Martin County to apply to the OTTED for designation of an enterprise zone. Authorizes the office to designate an enterprise zone in Martin County, etc.

1473.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1473.title: Medicaid [WPSC]
1473.description: Requires each managed care organization to certify to the Agency for Health Care Administration its medical loss ratio and the medical loss ratio for its subcontractors. Provides requirements for the reporting of the medical loss ratios. Requires the managed care organization to pay a certain amount to the agency if the certified medical loss ratio is less than a specified ratio. Requires that fines collected supplement the agency's Medicaid budget, etc.

1474.last_action: Veto Message received (2010-C) -SJ 00003; Veto Message referred to Rules -SJ 00005
1474.title: Local Government [EPSC]
1474.description: Authorizes a board of county commissioners to negotiate the lease of certain real property for a limited period. Authorizes transfers of right-of-way between local governments by deed.

1475.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
1475.title: Department of Juvenile Justice/Reports/Functions [SPSC]
1475.description: Deletes a provision that requires the DJJ to develop an annual report on the performance of assessment and treatment services for serious or habitual juvenile offenders for delivery to the Governor and other designated persons by a specified date. Repeals a specified provision relating to the requirement that the DJJ and the DOE develop and implement an evaluation of the literacy programs for juvenile offenders, etc.

1476.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1476.title: SSB/Water and Wastewater [EPSC]
1476.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to water and wastewater.

1477.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1477.title: SSB/Florida Public Service Commission [EPSC]
1477.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Florida Public Service Commission.

1478.title: Juvenile Justice Facilities and Programs [SPSC]
1478.description: Defines the term "ordinary medical care." Requires that the DJJ adopt rules to ensure the effective delivery of services to children in the care and custody of the DJJ. Clarifies that the rules of the DJJ do not supersede provisions governing consent to treatment and services, etc.

1479.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1479.title: SSB/Solar Energy [EPSC]
1479.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to solar energy.

1480.title: Mobile Home Park Tenancies [CPSC]
1480.description: Directs the Florida Housing Finance Corporation to provide technical assistance to mobile home owners in purchasing their mobile home park. Provides legislative findings. Revises procedures for mobile home owners being provided an eviction notice due to a change in use of the land comprising the mobile home park. Requires certain notice to the homeowners' association.

1481.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1481.title: SSB/Energy Efficiency and Conservation [EPSC]
1481.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to energy efficiency and conservation.

1482.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1482.title: Agency Inspectors General [WPSC]
1482.description: Provides that an agency inspector general may be appointed by the agency head after 14 days notice, in writing, to the Governor. Requires each state agency to include in its legislative budget request for the 2011-2012 fiscal year the transfer of positions and funding for the inspector general's office to a new and separate budget entity within the respective agency, etc.

1484.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1484.title: SSB/Florida Energy and Climate Commission [EPSC]
1484.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Florida Energy and Climate Commission.

1487.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1487.title: SSB/Water Facilities [EPSC]
1487.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to water facilities.

1488.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1488.title: SSB/Telecommunications [EPSC]
1488.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to telecommunications.

1489.last_action: In returning messages; Died in returning Messages
1489.title: Public Service Commission [EPSC]
1489.description: Revises the standards of conduct for commissioners of the PSC. Requires that commissioners observe and abide by the Code of Judicial Conduct while conducting docketed proceedings. Prohibits a commissioner or the commissioner's direct reporting staff from initiating, engaging in, or considering prohibited communications in any proceeding other than an undocketed workshop or an internal affairs meeting, etc.

1490.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1490.title: Discretionary Sales Surtaxes [WPSC]
1490.description: Deletes a limitation upon the imposition of indigent care and trauma center discretionary sales surtaxes by certain counties. Authorizes the governing boards of certain counties to levy the surtaxes only pursuant to a referendum.

1491.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1491.title: Information Technology/Interagency Workgroup [SPSC]
1491.description: Creates a children and families interagency workgroup to evaluate and make recommendations relating to an integrated information infrastructure. Requires the workgroup to submit its recommendations to the Governor and Legislature.

1492.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1492.title: Domestic Violence Trust Fund [SPSC]
1492.description: Requires the court to impose a surcharge of $301, rather than the formerly imposed surcharge of $201, for violations of certain specified provisions of law and for other offenses of domestic violence. Requires the clerk of court to deposit the sum of $185, rather than the formerly required deposit of $85, into the Domestic Violence Trust Fund.

1493.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1493.title: Reactive Drywall [CPSC]
1493.description: Requires a person who inspects homes for corrosion of metals associated with reactive drywall to inspect certain items for corrosion. Requires a person who removes reactive drywall or corroded appliances to provide the homeowner with a remediation plan. Requires the DBPR to adopt rules to establish minimum standards for home inspections of and remediation planning for reactive drywall, etc.

1495.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
1495.title: First Generation Matching Grant Program [SPSC]
1495.description: Authorizes certain independent colleges and universities to participate in the program. Requires the institutions to raise specified funds before the Office of Student Financial Assistance may reserve a proportionate allocation for the institutions. Provides for implementation.

1496.title: Construction Bonds [CPSC]
1496.description: Requires that a contractor record in the official records a payment bond for a public works construction project. Prohibits the issuing authority for a building permit or a private provider performing inspection services from inspecting the property being improved until certain documents are filed. Revises requirements for demands for a copy of a construction contract and a statement of account, etc.

1497.title: Ephedrine or Related Compounds/Sale [SPSC]
1497.description: Prohibits obtaining or delivering to an individual in a retail sale any nonprescription compound, mixture, or preparation containing ephedrine or related compounds in excess of specified amounts. Requires a purchaser of a nonprescription compound, mixture, or preparation containing any detectable quantity of ephedrine or related compounds to meet specified requirements, etc.

1499.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00919; Amendment(s) adopted (638382) -SJ 00919; Substituted CS/HB 551 -SJ 00919; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 551 (Ch. 2010-130), HB 7085 (Ch. 2010-116) -SJ 00919
1499.title: Public Records/Meetings/Ethics/Local Governments [EPSC]
1499.description: Revises an exemption from public record and public meeting requirements which is provided for complaints and related records in the custody of and proceedings conducted by a county or municipality that has established a local investigatory process to enforce more stringent standards of conduct and disclosure requirements. Provides for future repeal and legislative review under the OGSR Act of revisions to the exemption, etc.

1501.title: Cooperation Between Schools & Juvenile Authorities [SPSC]
1501.description: Requires that specified school personnel be notified when a child of any age is formally charged by a state attorney with a felony or a delinquent act that would be a felony if committed by an adult and the disposition of the charges. Authorizes certain entities to release a student's education records without consent of the student or parent to parties to an interagency agreement for specified purposes, etc.

1503.title: Performing Arts Center Funding [WPSC]
1503.description: Provides an alternative requirement for the DOR to distribute certain sales tax proceeds to certain performing arts centers under certain circumstances. Designates the OTTED as the state agency for screening and certifying applicants for performing arts center funding. Requires the office to adopt funding application rules. Authorizes the department to conduct audits to verify certain expenditures, etc.

1504.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations
1504.title: Open House Parties [CPSC]
1504.description: Provides that a person who violates the open house party statute a second or subsequent time commits a misdemeanor of the first degree. Provides that a person commits a misdemeanor of the first degree if the violation of the open house party statute causes serious bodily injury or death of a minor. Provides criminal penalties.

1506.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1506.title: Sporting Events [WPSC]
1506.description: Authorizes a county to use certain revenues from tourist development taxes to pay the debt service on bonds issued to finance the construction, reconstruction, or renovation of certain football stadiums and to pay planning and design costs incurred before the issuance of bonds. Creates an exemption from the tax on admissions for certain events sponsored by a governmental entity, sports authority, or sports commission.

1507.last_action: In returning messages; Died in returning Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7131 (Ch. 2010-117), CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
1507.title: Juvenile Justice [SPSC]
1507.description: Includes children 9 years of age or younger at the time of referral for a delinquent act within the definition of those children who are eligible to receive comprehensive mental health services. Encourages law enforcement agencies, school districts, counties, municipalities, and the DJJ to establish prearrest or postarrest diversion programs. Revises membership on the statewide risk assessment instrument committee, etc.

1508.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176)
1508.title: Firesafety [CPSC]
1508.description: Revises the rulemaking authority and responsibilities of the State Fire Marshal relating to educational and ancillary plants. Requires the State Fire Marshal and the Florida Building Code Administrators and Inspectors Board to enter into a reciprocity agreement to recognize certain continuing education recertification hours for certain purposes, etc.

1509.title: Public Servants [GPSC]
1509.description: Cites this act as the "Restoring Faith in Public Office Act." Provides that it is a third-degree felony for a public servant, with corrupt intent, to fail to disclose certain direct or indirect financial interests or benefits. Provides that it is a third-degree felony for a public servant, with corrupt intent, to fail to disclose a fact or information concerning an official act which is required to be disclosed by law, etc.

1510.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00787; Substituted CS/CS/HB 1307 -SJ 00787; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1307 (Ch. 2010-180) -SJ 00787
1510.title: State Financial Matters [WPSC]
1510.description: Provides for excess account balances in the Public Employee Optional Retirement Program when an employee transfers to the defined benefit program and for the use of such excess balance. Establishes a forfeiture account in the Public Employee Retirement Program Trust Fund and provides for the use of funds in the account. Specifies the bonds, notes, and obligations into which the trust funds of the state may be invested and in what amounts, etc.

1511.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1511.title: Capital Collateral Representation [SPSC]
1511.description: Provides a legislative finding that not all capital collateral cases are extraordinary or unusual. Requires that regional counsel report to and serve at the pleasure of the Commission on Capital Cases. Revises the criteria required for an attorney to be eligible to be placed on the registry of attorneys qualified to represent defendants in postconviction capital collateral proceedings, etc.

1512.title: Driver's License Restrictions [CPSC]
1512.description: Restricts the number of passengers under the age of 18 permitted in a vehicle operated by a person under the age of 18 unless accompanied by a driver at least 21 years of age. Provide exceptions. Provides for secondary enforcement. Provides penalties. Provides for applicability. Provides citation procedures for a violation of such restrictions.

1513.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
1513.title: Testimony before the Public Service Commission [EPSC]
1513.description: Requires each person offering testimony at a meeting, workshop, hearing, or other scheduled event of the PSC to disclose any financial or fiduciary relationship with any public utility. Requires such disclosure to be filed in writing with the office of the commission and with the office of the Public Counsel before testimony is provided to the commission. Provides procedures for a petition for a hearing to review the penalty, etc.

1515.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
1515.title: State Group Insurance Program [WPSC]
1515.description: Provides that graduate assistants at state universities may be covered by the program if the university they are attending elects to pay the cost of participation.

1517.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1517.title: Fireworks [CPSC]
1517.description: Repeals a specified provision relating to the moratorium on the opening of new, permanent retail sales facilities engaged in the sale of fireworks and the number of permits issued for temporary retail sales facilities engaged in the sale of fireworks, etc.

1518.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1518.title: Assault and Battery/Social Workers [SPSC]
1518.description: Provides for the upgrading of the degree of specified assault and battery offenses committed against specified persons based on their position or employment. Provides for sentencing. Provides for additional imprisonment in certain circumstances. Prohibits gain-time and discretionary early release for offenders. Provides an exception.

1519.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00631; Amendment(s) adopted (672830) -SJ 00631; Substituted CS/HB 105 -SJ 00631; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 105 (Ch. 2010-48) -SJ 00631
1519.title: Middle School Civics Education Assessment [SPSC]
1519.description: Cites this act as the "Justice Sandra Day O'Connor Civics Education Act." Amends a specified provision relating to the Sunshine State Standards. Provides requirements for a civics education course that a student must successfully complete for middle grades promotion beginning with students entering grade 6 in the 2012-2013 school year. Provides requirements for course grade and course credit for subsequent school years, etc.

1520.title: Public Works Projects [CPSC]
1520.description: Creates the "Florida Reemployment Investment Act." Requires each state agency and private sector contractor performing services for a state or local government public works project being funded by state or federal funds and administered by a state agency to verify that 100 percent of the onsite employees and independent contractors are state residents. Requires the Agency for Workforce Innovation to adopt rules, etc.

1521.title: Unauthorized Employment [EPSC]
1521.description: Requires denial of agricultural classification and assessment of land for specified time periods under circumstances involving knowingly hiring, recruiting, or referring unauthorized aliens for employment. Provides an additional civil penalty for employment of unauthorized aliens. Requires the DOACS to disseminate information concerning compliance with federal work authorization programs, etc.

1522.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
1522.title: Assisted Living Facilities/Residents [SPSC]
1522.description: Revises provisions relating to a resident's right to receive notice before being relocated or terminated from a facility. Provides that a document that waives such right is void. Requires a facility's grievance procedure to be in writing. Provides the grounds and notice requirements for relocating or terminating a resident from a facility. Authorizes the DOEA to adopt rules, etc.

1523.last_action: Died in Committee on General Government Appropriations
1523.title: Investor-owned Utilities/Service Reliability [EPSC]
1523.description: Requires the Florida Public Service Commission (PSC) to adopt rules establishing standards of reasonable and reliable electric service for retail residential customers which an investor-owned utility must follow. Requires the PSC to adopt rules establishing standards of reasonable and reliable water and waste water service for retail residential customers which an investor-owned utility must follow, etc.

1524.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Died on Calendar
1524.title: Credit Cards/Fraudulently Taking or Using [SPSC]
1524.description: Provides that a person who takes a credit card from the possession, custody, or control of another without the cardholder's consent, who possesses, receives or retains custody of the credit card with the knowledge that it has been taken, or who receives the credit card with the intent to use it, to sell it, or to transfer it to a person other than the issuer or the cardholder commits a felony of the third degree, etc.

1525.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00956; Substituted CS/HB 449 -SJ 00956; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 449 (Ch. 2010-129) -SJ 00956
1525.title: Court Pleadings/Sanctions [SPSC]
1525.description: Prohibits a monetary sanction against a represented party for a claim that is presented as a good faith argument but that is found to not be supported by the application of then-existing law to material facts. Prohibits sanctions against a party or its attorneys by a court on its own initiative if the case has already been settled or voluntarily dismissed by that party.

1526.title: School Speed Zones [CPSC]
1526.description: Creates the "Shaye Patrick Martin Safety Act." Provides for transitional speed areas before and after the slowest established speed limit within a school zone. Requires the installation of vehicle speed cameras in school zones to record an image of the driver and the license plate of a motor vehicle exceeding a speed limit within the school zone. Provides penalties for violation of a speed limit within a school zone, etc.

1528.title: Docks [EPSC]
1528.description: Authorizes the placement of roofs on certain residential single-family docks. Authorizes the DEP to adopt rules that include special criteria for approving certain docking facilities in shellfish harvesting waters. Authorizes the department to maintain a list of projects or activities for applicants to consider when developing proposals in order to meet mitigation or public interest requirements, etc.

1529.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1529.title: Health Insurance [CPSC]
1529.description: Establishes a minimum loss ratio for health insurance forms. Revises the loss ratio for certain health insurance coverage. Revises the loss ratio for Medicare supplement policies issued on or after a certain date. Establishes a minimum loss ratio for long-term care insurance policies.

1530.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1530.title: Instructional Materials for K-12 Public Education [SPSC]
1530.description: Includes computer hardware in the definition of the term "adequate instructional materials." Requires each district school board to provide technology as needed for its educational program. Authorizes the use of certain funds for the purchase of computer hardware by district school boards. Provides restrictions.

1531.last_action: Read 3rd time -SJ 01249; Amendment(s) adopted (640332) -SJ 01249; Substituted CS/HB 7129 -SJ 01249; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7129 (Ch. 2010-182), CS/HB 7179 (Ch. 2010-139), CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205) -SJ 01249
1531.title: Permitting [EPSC]
1531.description: Provides requirements for claiming certain site rehabilitation costs in applications for contaminated site rehabilitation tax credits. Clarifies duties of the OTTED to approve expedited permitting and comprehensive plan amendments. Revises criteria for businesses submitting permit applications or local comprehensive plan amendments, etc.

1532.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
1532.title: Admissions Tax [WPSC]
1532.description: Expands an exemption from the tax for certain sports championships or all-star games, certain other professional sporting events, and events surrounding certain professional sporting events.

1533.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1533.title: Local Government Revenue Intercept Act [WPSC]
1533.description: Provides that a local government may authorize by resolution or ordinance the DOR to intercept certain revenues in order to replenish the debt service reserve or other payment for local government bonds. Provides certain requirements for such resolution or ordinance. Specifies certain obligations and restrictions on the local government with respect to such interception. Authorizes the DOR to adopt rules, etc.

1534.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1534.title: Antiretroviral Drugs [WPSC]
1534.description: Prohibits limitations on the prescribing of antiretroviral drugs for treating human immunodeficiency virus infection. Conforms provisions to changes made by the act. Prohibits health insurance policies and HMOs from limiting the prescribing of antiretroviral drugs for treating human immunodeficiency virus infection.

1535.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1535.title: Chiropractic Medicine [SPSC]
1535.description: Revises the requirements for a chiropractic medicine faculty certificate. Requires a person to register as a chiropractic assistant if he or she renders therapeutic services or administers therapeutic agents related to a chiropractic physician's treatment of a patient. Requires a fee for approval of a supervising chiropractic physician or group of chiropractic physicians, etc.

1536.last_action: Approved by Governor; Chapter No. 2010-173; companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176)
1536.title: Firesafety Inspections [EPSC]
1536.description: Provides exceptions to certain local government firesafety inspection requirements. Specifies inspection requirements for fire hydrants owned by governmental entities. Authorizes local government utilities to comply using designated employees. Specifies responsibility for ensuring the qualification of designated employees to make inspections.

1538.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1538.title: Mental Health [WPSC]
1538.description: Creates the Community Mental Health and Substance Abuse Treatment and Crime Reduction Act. Requires the DCFS, in consultation with the AHCA, to develop and implement a community mental health and substance abuse forensic treatment system. Adds home and community based mental health services to the optional Medicaid services offered by the state Medicaid program. Provides for forensic evaluator training for mental health experts, etc.

1539.title: Pub. Rec./Competitive Procurement Solicitation [CPSC]
1539.description: Provides that bids, proposals, or replies in response to a competitive procurement solicitation are exempt from the public records law. Limits how long such records are exempt. Provides a temporary exemption from the public meetings law for meetings at which vendors make presentations or answer questions as part of a competitive procurement solicitation. Provides for future repeal and legislative review of the exemptions under OGSR Act, etc.

1540.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 971 (Ch. 2010-223)
1540.title: Driving Safety/Ronshay Dugans Act [CPSC]
1540.description: Creates the "Ronshay Dugans Act." Designates Drowsy Driving Prevention Week. Encourages the HSMV and the DOT to educate the law enforcement community and the public about the relationship between fatigue and driving performance.

1541.title: Foreclosures [SPSC]
1541.description: Provides requirements for landlords following commencement of a foreclosure action. Provides for security deposits and advance rents to be maintained in a specified manner. Provides for disclosure of the foreclosure action to prospective tenants. Provides an exception to liability for failure to provide notice, etc.

1543.title: Registration/Farm Labor Contractors and Employees [CPSC]
1543.description: Requires the renewal of farm labor contractor and employee certificates of registration under certain circumstances. Requires the DBPR to suspend, revoke, or refuse to issue or renew certificates of registration under certain circumstances.

1544.title: Funeral, Cemetery, and Consumer Services Act [CPSC]
1544.description: Revises qualifications for the membership of the Board of Funeral, Cemetery, and Consumer Services. Authorizes the waiver of certain provisions during a state of emergency. Authorizes fees for certain inspections of licensees. Prohibits the issuance or renewal of a license to an applicant that has specified criminal records under certain circumstances. Authorizes a licensing authority of the DFS to adopt rules, etc.

1545.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 4 (Ch. 2010-22)
1545.title: Public School Education [SPSC]
1545.description: Amends specified provisions relating to discontinuance of administration of the Florida Comprehensive Assessment Test (FCAT), to conform to changes made by the act. Deletes requirement that district school boards establish policies for intensive reading and mathematics intervention courses in high school. Provides for intervention services. Revises general requirements for high school graduation, etc.

1546.title: Consumer Protection/Retail Tire Dealers [CPSC]
1546.description: Requires retail tire dealers to disclose to purchasers the date of manufacture and certain warnings relating to the age of tires. Provides certain exceptions. Provides that a violation of the act is a deceptive and unfair trade practice. Provides penalties. Requires the Department of Legal Affairs to adopt rules.

1548.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1548.title: Female Inmates/Parents of Minor Children [SPSC]
1548.description: Provides legislative findings and intent with respect to the importance of a female inmate maintaining a relationship with her minor child. Requires the DOC to collect certain information concerning the children of female inmates in the state correctional system. Requires the department to analyze the institutional assignment of each female inmate who is a parent and determine the inmate's proximity to her minor child, etc.

1549.last_action: Died in Committee on Rules, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 511 (Ch. 2010-242)
1549.title: Children's Trust Act of Collier County
1549.description: Creates an independent special district to provide children's services in Collier County. Provides for a governing board. Provides for membership, terms, and powers and duties of the board. Requires certain reports and audits. Provides requirements for amendment or dissolution of the district, etc.

1550.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1550.title: Assessment of Residential Real Property [WPSC]
1550.description: Prohibits adding the value of certain improvements to the assessed value of certain real property. Provides a limitation on the assessed value of certain real property. Specifies additional exceptions to assessments of homestead and nonhomestead property at just value. Repeals specified provision relating to renewable energy source property tax exemption, etc.

1551.title: Community Residential Homes [EPSC]
1551.description: Prohibits certain rules adopted by the APD from restricting the number of facilities designated as community residential homes located within a planned residential community. Authorizes the agency to issue a license as a comprehensive transitional education program to serve children who have severe behavioral conditions. Defines the term "planned residential community," etc.

1552.title: Tangible Personal Property Taxes [WPSC]
1552.description: Authorizes a person who rents heavy equipment to collect a tangible personal property tax recovery fee. Defines the term "heavy equipment."

1554.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1554.title: Regulation of Hoisting Equipment [CPSC]
1554.description: Defines the terms "hoisting equipment," "mobile crane," and "tower crane." Requires an applicant for a building permit to submit certain information to a local building official. Requires radio communications between certain crane operators. Requires certain preparations for a hurricane or high-wind event. Requires that hoisting equipment be secured in a specified manner under certain circumstances. Provides exceptions, etc.

1555.last_action: Withdrawn from Environmental Preservation and Conservation; Commerce; General Government Appropriations -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
1555.title: Water-efficient Appliance Rebate Program [EPSC]
1555.description: Authorizes the DEP to develop and administer a consumer rebate program for water-efficient appliances. Authorizes the department to adopt rules. Authorizes the DEP to enter into contracts or memoranda of agreement with other state agencies or public-private partnerships or agree to other arrangements to administer the program. Provides requirements for the release of funds. APPROPRIATION: $100,000.

1556.title: Cost-benefit/Return-on-investment/Dynamic Scoring [WPSC]
1556.description: Authorizes the President of the Senate or the Speaker of the House of Representatives to request special impact sessions of consensus estimating conferences to evaluate proposed legislation based on specified techniques. Requires the Office of Economic and Demographic Research to develop protocols and procedures to be used by the consensus estimating conferences when evaluating proposed legislation, etc.

1558.title: Tax Credits for Research and Development [WPSC]
1558.description: Provides a tax credit for certain research and development expenses. Provides eligibility requirements for research and development tax credits. Provides a maximum amount of credit that may be taken during a single tax year. Revises legislative intent to include said tax credit in the ordered list according to which credits against corporate income tax or franchise tax are applied, etc.

1560.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation and Economic Development Appropriations
1560.title: Spaceflight [WPSC]
1560.description: Provides for the OTTED to administer corporate income tax credits for commercial spaceflight projects. Authorizes nontransferable corporate income tax credits, transferable net operating loss tax credits, and machinery and equipment tax credits for certified commercial spaceflight businesses engaged in commercial spaceflight projects. Requires the OTTED to approve or deny an application within 60 days after receipt, etc.

1561.last_action: Died in Committee on General Government Appropriations
1561.title: Sale of Event Tickets [CPSC]
1561.description: Provides legislative intent and purpose. Defines terms. Requires the original seller of tickets to an event held at a publically owned venue to keep all receipts from the ticket sales until the event occurs and return the charges to the purchaser under certain circumstances. Provides exceptions.

1562.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 907 (Ch. 2010-199)
1562.title: Alimony [SPSC]
1562.description: Allows for award of more than one type of alimony. Revises factors to be considered in whether to award alimony or maintenance. Provides for award of bridge-the-gap alimony. Provides that such an award is not modifiable. Provides for award of rehabilitative alimony in certain circumstances. Provides for award of durational alimony in certain circumstances. Provides for award of permanent alimony in certain circumstances, etc.

1564.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00750; Substituted HB 7115 -SJ 00750; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7115 (Ch. 2010-41) -SJ 00750
1564.title: OGSR/Identification of a Minor [SPSC]
1564.description: Amends specified provision relating to a public records exemption for information contained in court files which identifies a minor petitioning for a waiver of the notice requirements contained in the Parental Notice of Abortion Act. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act, etc.

1565.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00750; Substituted HB 7087 -SJ 00750; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7087 (Ch. 2010-71) -SJ 00750
1565.title: OGSR/Guardians Ad Litem/Identifying Information [SPSC]
1565.description: Amends specified provision relating to a public records exemption for identifying information of current or former guardians ad litem. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act. Expands the public records exemption to include the names and locations of schools and day care facilities attended by the children of current or former guardians ad litem, etc.

1566.last_action: Read 3rd time -SJ 00862; Amendment(s) adopted (703208, 348766, 254308, 143616) -SJ 00862; Substituted CS/CS/HB 163 -SJ 00862; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 163 (Ch. 2010-50) -SJ 00862
1566.title: Prepaid Wireless Telecommunications [EPSC]
1566.description: Deletes an obsolete provision relating to a study of the feasibility of collecting a fee for prepaid wireless service. Delays the collection of such fee. Revises the percentage of total funds that a county may carry forward to pay certain costs associated with the county's E911 or 911 system, to contract for E911 services, and to reimburse wireless telephone service providers for costs incurred to provide such services, etc.

1568.last_action: Died in Committee on Health and Human Services Appropriations, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 351 (Ch. 2010-168)
1568.title: Specialty License Plates/Florida Salutes Veterans [CPSC]
1568.description: Increases the length of time for distribution and reducing the percentage of annual use fees received from the sale of Florida Salutes Veterans license plates which is distributed to a specific direct-support organization.

1569.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1569.title: Juvenile Civil Citations [SPSC]
1569.description: Requires that a juvenile civil citation program be established at the local level with the concurrence of the chief judge of the circuit and other designated persons. Requires a law enforcement officer, upon making contact with a juvenile, to issue a civil citation if the juvenile admits to having committed a misdemeanor and he or she is not a danger to himself or herself or another, etc.

1570.last_action: Died in Committee on Rules, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 431 (Ch. 2010-241)
1570.title: Peace Creek Drainage District/Polk County
1570.description: Abolishes the district. Provides for transfer of assets and indebtedness. Repeals special acts relating to the district.

1571.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1571.title: Criminal History Records/Expunction [SPSC]
1571.description: Provides for the automatic expunction of criminal history records in specified circumstances. Provides procedures to expunge a criminal history record. Provides for the effect of expunction. Provides that expunction granted under this section does not prevent a person who receives such relief from petitioning for the expunction or sealing of a criminal history record under other provisions of law, etc.

1572.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 2014 (Ch. 2010-210)
1572.title: Children's Services [SPSC]
1572.description: Requires the governing body of the county to submit to the electorate the question of retention or dissolution of a special taxing district created to provide funding for children's services. Prescribes a schedule and conditions relating to submission of the question to the electorate. Prescribes reauthorization conditions governing newly created children's services districts, etc.

1573.last_action: Died in Committee on General Government Appropriations
1573.title: Office of the Chief Technology Officer [WPSC]
1573.description: Creates the Office of the Chief Technology Officer within the DFS. Requires that the Chief Technology Officer be appointed by the Governor and Cabinet. Requires that the office be composed of three divisions. Provides duties of such divisions. Requires that the Chief Technology Officer develop a multiyear plan of action for the purpose of meeting specified objectives.

1574.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1574.title: Infectious Disease Testing/Juvenile Centers [SPSC]
1574.description: Requires each juvenile assessment center or juvenile detention facility to have a written procedure regarding the testing of juveniles for infectious diseases. Requires the DOH to designate certain counties, if approved by the county's governing body, to participate in a program to test each juvenile for HIV who is referred to or who is under supervision of the DJJ. Provides that informed consent is not required for an HIV test, etc.

1575.last_action: CS combines this bill with SB 1196 -SJ 00189; CS by Regulated Industries; YEAS 8 NAYS 0 -SJ 00189; Original bill laid on Table, refer to combined CS/CS/CS/SB 1196 (Ch. 2010-174) -SJ 00189
1575.title: Condominiums [CPSC]
1575.description: (THIS BILL COMBINED IN CS/S1196 & S1222) Requires that coverage under a unit owner's policy for certain assessments include at least a minimum amount of loss assessment coverage. Provides an exemption for certain condominiums from installing a manual fire alarm system as required in the Life Safety Code if certain conditions are met. Revises the definition of the term "developer" to exclude a bulk assignee or bulk buyer, etc.

1576.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00340; Substituted HB 689 -SJ 00340; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 689 (Ch. 2010-8) -SJ 00340
1576.title: Negligence/Slip on Foreign Substance [SPSC]
1576.description: Provides that if a person slips and falls on a transitory foreign substance in a business establishment, the injured person must prove that the business establishment had actual or constructive knowledge of the condition and should have taken action to remedy it. Specifies that the provisions do not affect any common-law duty of care owed by a person or entity in possession or control of a business premises, etc.

1577.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
1577.title: Sewage Requirements in Monroe County
1577.description: Provides exceptions to requirements of the Department of Environmental Protection regarding minimum casing for injection wells used by facilities that have a specified design capacity. Provides requirements for an injection well used as a backup to a primary injection well, etc.

1578.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00931; Substituted HB 7019 -SJ 00931; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7019 (Ch. 2010-135) -SJ 00931
1578.title: Mortgage Guaranty TF/Financial Regulation Office [CPSC]
1578.description: Creates the Mortgage Guaranty Trust Fund within the Office of Financial Regulation. Provides for the administration of the trust fund and use of moneys therein. Requires that balances of funds in the trust fund at the end of a fiscal year remain in the trust fund. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

1581.title: Child Care Facilities/Licensing Standards [SPSC]
1581.description: Cites this act as the "John F. Serrano, Rachel Lou Napier, and Alexandra Ali Safety and Accountability Act." Provides minimum licensing requirements for window blinds and other window coverings. Provides for certain household children to be included in calculations regarding the capacity of licensed family day care homes and large family child care homes. Revises advertising requirements applicable to child care facilities, etc.

1582.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1582.title: Publications Distributed by Public Schools, Etc. [SPSC]
1582.description: Requires that any public K-12 school, community college, or state university include on the inside cover of each of its publications certain information concerning the production and distribution of that publication.

1583.last_action: Died in Conference Committee, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 2386 (Ch. 2010-151)
1583.title: Review/DMS/Florida Government Accountability Act [GPSC]
1583.description: Transfers certain programs and related trust funds from the Department of Management Services to other state agencies within the executive branch. Authorizes the Executive Office of the Governor to transfer funds and positions with the approval of the Legislative Budget Commission. Requests the interim assistance of the Division of Statutory Revision to prepare conforming legislation for the next regular session of the Legislature, etc.

1584.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1584.title: School Health Services Program [SPSC]
1584.description: Defines the term "school-based health center" for purposes of the School Health Services Act. Provides that such a center is a health care entity acting as an instrumentality of the state for purposes of certain limitations on liability.

1585.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1585.title: Public School Student Progression [SPSC]
1585.description: Provides a process by which the retention of a third grade student who exhibits a reading deficiency may be appealed. Provides for exemption from mandatory retention through successful appeal. Requires the Department of Education to establish an appeal process. Specifies circumstances recognized as justification for granting an appeal. Requires assessment and evaluation. Provides for reporting.

1586.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1586.title: Elections/Absentee Ballots [GPSC]
1586.description: Authorizes an elector to attain status as a permanent absentee voter. Specifies circumstances under which a request for an absentee ballot may be considered canceled.

1587.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1587.title: HIV Testing/County Detention Facilities/Inmates [SPSC]
1587.description: Requires the Department of Health to designate certain counties, if approved by the county's governing body, to participate in a program to test each inmate for HIV before the inmate is released if the inmate's HIV status is unknown. Provides that informed consent is not required for an HIV test of an inmate before the inmate's release from a municipal or county detention facility, etc.

1588.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1588.title: State Housing Trust Fund [WPSC]
1588.description: Removes a limitation on the amount of proceeds from the excise tax on documents which may be deposited into the trust fund.

1589.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1589.title: SSB/Governmental Effectiveness and Efficiency [GPSC]
1589.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to governmental effectiveness and efficiency.

1590.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5311 (Ch. 2010-161)
1590.title: Physician Workforce [SPSC]
1590.description: Repeals provisions relating to the program for graduate medical education innovations and the graduate medical education committee and report. Requires the DOH to coordinate and enhance activities regarding the reentry of retired military and other physicians into the physician workforce. Revises the standards for the Board of Medicine to issue a temporary certificate to certain physicians to practice medicine in areas of critical need, etc.

1592.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations
1592.title: Controlled Substances [SPSC]
1592.description: Revises the list of controlled substances in Schedules I, II, III, IV, and V. Provides that the salts, isomers, or salts of isomers are included within certain substances listed in Schedule III.

1593.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1593.title: School-entry Requirements/Vision Examinations [SPSC]
1593.description: Requires children who enter public or private schools in the state to present evidence of having received a comprehensive vision examination. Provides an exemption. Requires the imposition of a fee on the retail sale of nonprescription eyeglasses. Provides for the fee to be used by the Department of Health to assist parents in paying for school-entry comprehensive vision examinations, etc.

1594.title: International Banking Corporations [WPSC]
1594.description: Expands application of state banking laws to include certain international banking corporations. Prohibits construction to authorize international banking corporation or trust companies to conduct trust business under certain circumstances. Expands criteria under which the Office of Financial Regulation may take possession of certain business and property of certain international banking corporations, etc.

1595.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5 (Ch. 2010-230)
1595.title: Road Designations/Duval and St. Johns Counties [CPSC]
1595.description: Designates the Earl S. "Coach" Kitchings Avenue in Duval County. Designates the Coach Jermaine D. Hall Memorial Highway in Duval and St. Johns Counties. Directs the Department of Transportation to erect markers.

1597.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176), CS/CS/CS/SB 1196 (Ch. 2010-174)
1597.title: Condominiums and Multifamily Dwellings [CPSC]
1597.description: Provides an exemption, if certain conditions are met, from the requirement that certain condominiums install a manual fire alarm system as required in the Life Safety Code. Prohibits an authority having jurisdiction from requiring the completion of retrofitting of common areas with a sprinkler system before a specified date.

1598.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1598.title: Condominium and Homeowners' Associations [CPSC]
1598.description: Provides that a person acquiring title to a condominium by foreclosure or recorded deed is liable for certain additional unpaid expenses and assessments. Authorizes a homeowners' association to preserve or maintain the unit in a safe condition under certain circumstances. Requires that certain costs incurred by an association be deemed an individual assessment against the unit being foreclosed, etc.

1599.title: Acute Care Hospitals/Staffing
1599.description: Requires acute care hospitals to make information concerning staffing levels at the hospital available to the public upon request.

1600.title: Dangerous Dogs/Breed-specific Regulation [EPSC]
1600.description: Eliminates the prohibition of breed-specific local government regulation of dangerous dogs.

1601.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1601.title: School Nurse Services [SPSC]
1601.description: Cites this act as the "One School, One Nurse Act." Creates a specified provision relating to public-private partnerships for the provision of school nurse services. Provides duties of the State Surgeon General and the Commissioner of Education in publicizing the availability of matching funds and determining eligibility for such funds. Provides a process for a community to submit a proposal to receive matching funds, etc. APPROPRIATION: $75,000.

1602.title: Public Records [GPSC]
1602.description: Expands a public records exemption for specified personal information of the spouses and children of active and former law enforcement and investigatory personnel.
