Expands a public records exemption for specified personal information of firefighters and for their spouses and children. Provides for future legislative review and repeal of the exemptions under the OGSR Act. Provides a statement of public necessity.

1604.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1604.title: DCFS/Salary Bonus Payments [WPSC]
1604.description: Authorizes the Department of Children and Family Services to retain and reinvest federal performance incentive awards and recognize achievement through salary bonus payments under certain circumstances.

1605.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations
1605.title: Official Records/Electronic Documents [SPSC]
1605.description: Provides for the inclusion of an additional statute in the Uniform Real Property Electronic Recording Act. Delays the termination of the Electronic Recording Advisory Committee. Declares that certain electronic documents accepted for recordation are deemed validly recorded. Provides intent to clarify existing law. Provides for retroactive application.

1606.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1606.title: State Park Fees [EPSC]
1606.description: Authorizes the Division of Recreation and Parks of the DEP to waive or reduce certain state park fees for state residents 62 years of age or older.

1607.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1607.title: Racial Profiling [SPSC]
1607.description: Prescribes responses that the Attorney General may take upon the filing of a complaint against a law enforcement officer or agency which alleges racial profiling, etc.

1608.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1608.title: School Wellness and Physical Education Policies [SPSC]
1608.description: Revises each school district's requirement for reviewing its wellness and physical education policies. Provides specific guidelines for a school district's wellness and physical education policies with regard to nutrition education, physical activity, school-based activities, and nutritional guidelines for food and beverages sold or served on campus, etc.

1609.title: Pub. Rec./Medicaid and Public Assistance Fraud [GPSC]
1609.description: Creates a public records exemption for specified information held by the Medicaid and Public Assistance Fraud Strike Force. Creates a public meeting exemption for meetings of the Medicaid and Public Assistance Fraud Strike Force at which specified information is discussed. Provides for future legislative review and repeal of the exemptions under the Open Government Sunset Review Act. Provides a statement of public necessity.

1610.title: Supervised Visitation & Exchange Monitoring Prog. [SPSC]
1610.description: Adopts state standards for supervised visitation and exchange monitoring programs. Provides factors for the court or child-placing agency to consider when referring cases for supervised visitation or exchange monitoring. Authorizes said programs to conduct security background checks of employees and volunteers and criminal records checks through the FDLE, etc.

1611.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
1611.title: Prostate Cancer Awareness Program [SPSC]
1611.description: Revises the purpose, structure, and objectives of the Prostate Cancer Awareness Program within the University of Florida Prostate Disease Center. Authorizes said center to work with other organizations and institutions to create a systemic focus on increasing community education and awareness of prostate cancer. Requires said center to collaborate with the Department of Health to establish the UFPDC Prostate Cancer Task Force, etc.

1612.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
1612.title: Victim Advocate/Postsecondary Educ. Institute [SPSC]
1612.description: Requires that each postsecondary educational institution provide an advocate to assist students who are victims of violent crime. Requires that the advocate complete a specified number of hours in victim advocacy training and enlist the assistance of public and voluntary health, education, welfare, and rehabilitation agencies or groups and law enforcement agencies. Requires that an advocate be available on any campus that provides student housing, etc.

1613.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 1271 (Ch. 2010-225)
1613.title: Enforcement of Tolls [CPSC]
1613.description: Clarifies the mailing method to be used in providing notice following the issuance of a citation for failure to pay a toll. Authorizes any governmental entity, including the clerk of court, to provide specified data to the HSMV regarding outstanding violations for failure to pay tolls. Clarifies that failure to pay a toll does not result in the assessment of points against a person's driving record, etc.

1614.title: Public Assistance [SPSC]
1614.description: Revises terminology relating to the food stamp program and the WAGES Program to conform to current federal law.

1616.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1616.title: Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program [WPSC]
1616.description: Revises the number of instructional hours that are required for a school-year prekindergarten program delivered by a private kindergarten provider or a public school. Revises the number of instructional hours that are required in order for a student in such a program delivered by a public school or a private prekindergarten provider to be considered a full-time equivalent student in the Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program.

1617.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1617.title: Florida State Employees' Charitable Campaign [GPSC]
1617.description: Deletes the power of local steering committees to direct the distribution of undesignated funds. Requires such undesignated campaign funds to be shared proportionally by the participating charitable organizations based on the percentage of designations in each area.

1618.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 119 (Ch. 2010-92)
1618.title: Sexually Violent Predators [SPSC]
1618.description: Clarifies the definition of the term "sexually violent offense" to include a felony criminal act that has been determined beyond a reasonable doubt to have been sexually motivated. Enhances the penalty for loitering or prowling by certain offenders within a specified distance of certain places where children congregate. Prohibits certain actions toward a child at a public park or playground by certain offenders, etc.

1619.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1619.title: Employment of Children/Entertainment Industry [CPSC]
1619.description: Provides regulations for the employment of children in the entertainment industry. Provides responsibilities of employers and parents or legal guardians of such children. Provides duties of the Division of Regulation within the DBPR. Provides limitations on the working hours of child performers. Provides certification requirements and duties of teachers of child performers. Provides criteria for wage claims, etc.

1620.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
1620.title: Barbering [CPSC]
1620.description: Provides for the selection and placement of barbering interns. Requires a school of barbering or a barbering program to provide written notice to the Barbers' Board regarding the internship sponsor and the barbering intern. Authorizes the board to terminate an internship of a barbering intern or the sponsorship of an internship sponsor. Requires the board to give notice of termination, etc.

1621.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1621.title: State Lottery Revenues/Allocation and Expenditures [WPSC]
1621.description: Requires a portion of Powerball net revenues to be allocated to voluntary prekindergarten education programs. Provides for the use of funds.

1622.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1622.title: HIV Testing/Health Care/Routine Annual Examination [SPSC]
1622.description: Requires HIV testing to be offered as a routine part of a patient's annual physical examination. Requires a health care provider to provide the patient with certain information concerning HIV testing. Requires the Department of Health to adopt rules, etc.

1623.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1623.title: School-based AIDS Education [SPSC]
1623.description: Requires the DOE to award grants to public school districts to implement school-based AIDS education activities. Provides for the grant awards to be made from funds appropriated by the Legislature. Specifies requirements for grant proposals by school districts. Requires that the department consider specified factors in awarding grants. Requires each school district that receives a grant to file an annual report with the department.

1630.description: Creates an exemption from public records requirements for information that identifies a donor or prospective donor of a donation made for the benefit of a publicly owned performing arts center if the donor desires to remain anonymous. Provides for a student who attended a home education program to be eligible for a Florida Medallion Scholars award, etc.

Expresses legislative intent, etc.

Provides that the information reported by the institution is a public record. Provides for any reportable gift that is not properly disclosed to the DOR to be forfeited to the state, etc.

1855.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1855.title: SSB/Pre-K through 12 Education [SPSC]
1855.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to pre-K through 12 education.

1859.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
1859.title: Assisted Living Facilities [SPSC]
1859.description: Deletes the requirement for an assisted living facility to obtain an additional license in order to provide limited nursing services. Deletes the requirement for the AHCA to conduct quarterly monitoring visits of facilities that hold a license to provide extended congregate care services. Deletes the requirement for the DOEA to report annually on the status of and recommendations related to extended congregate care, etc.

1861.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1861.title: Mortgage Foreclosures [CPSC]
1861.description: Specifies a limited statute of limitations for certain deficiency judgments. Establishes the Florida Mortgage Foreclosure Diversion Program. Authorizes mortgagees to obtain an extension of the statute of limitations on mortgage deficiencies under certain circumstances. Authorizes mortgagees to offer mortgagors opportunities to participate in the program. Provides for continued participation in the program after certain deadlines, etc.

1862.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1862.title: Cardiology Services [SPSC]
1862.description: Requires emergency medical services providers to transport certain cardiac patients to the most appropriate facility and specify a facility preference. Requires medical directors of such providers to develop and implement certain protocols for assessment, treatment, and transportation of cardiac patients. Requires a local medical facility to notify the medical director of the local emergency medical services provider of its change in status, etc.

1865.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1865.title: SSB/Non-ad Valorem Assessments [WPSC]
1865.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to non-ad valorem assessments.

1866.last_action: Withdrawn from Finance and Tax; General Government Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means; Rules; Withdrawn prior to introduction
1866.title: SSB/Alcoholic Beverage Excise Tax [WPSC]
1866.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the alcoholic beverage excise tax.

1867.last_action: Withdrawn from Finance and Tax; General Government Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means; Rules; Withdrawn prior to introduction
1867.title: SSB/Unemployment Compensation Tax [WPSC]
1867.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the unemployment compensation tax.

1868.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1868.title: SSB/Ad Valorem Taxation [WPSC]
1868.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to ad valorem taxation.

1870.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1870.title: Pub. Rec./Title Insurance, Insurers, & Agents/DFS [CPSC]
1870.description: Exempts certain information relating to title insurance, title insurers, and title insurance agents from certain public records disclosure requirements. Exempts certain proceedings and records from public meetings and public records requirements. Provides for future review and repeal of the exemptions in this act under the OGSR Act. Provides a statement of public necessity.

1871.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1871.title: Title Insurance Regulatory Trust Fund/DFS [CPSC]
1871.description: Creates the Title Insurance Regulatory Trust Fund within the Division of Title Insurance of the Department of Financial Services. Provides for administration of the trust fund and use of moneys therein. Requires balances to remain in the trust fund. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

1872.last_action: Veto Message received (2010-C) -SJ 00004; Veto Message referred to Rules -SJ 00005
1872.title: Transportation Projects [CPSC]
1872.description: Directs the DOT to notify certain property owners and local governmental entities of certain proposed projects before finalizing the design of certain transportation projects. Provides a timeframe for notification. Requires the department to hold a public hearing and receive public input regarding the effects of the project on local business, etc.

1874.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1874.title: SSB/Excise Taxes [WPSC]
1874.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to excise taxes.

1875.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1875.title: SSB/Property Tax Administration [WPSC]
1875.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to property tax administration.

1876.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1876.title: SSB/Communications Services Tax [WPSC]
1876.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the communications services tax.

1877.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1877.title: SSB/Taxation [WPSC]
1877.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to taxation.

1878.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1878.title: SSB/Tax Administration [WPSC]
1878.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to tax administration.

1880.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1880.title: Property Protection/Bankruptcy/Other Proceedings [CPSC]
1880.description: Expands the list of property eligible for exemption by an individual debtor under the Bankruptcy Reform Act of 1978 to include alimony, support, or separate maintenance already received. Provides that child support is held in trust for any children for whom such support is intended and is not considered property of the recipient.

1881.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1881.title: Attorney Representation for Children [SPSC]
1881.description: Requires that the clerk of the court provide public records at no charge to an attorney appointed to represent a child. Adds the promotion and protection of legal rights to the list of protections provided to children. Requires the court to appoint an attorney for the child before involuntary placement of the child. Provides for the court appointment of an attorney or guardian ad litem for a child in delinquency proceedings, etc.

1885.last_action: Withdrawn from Finance and Tax; General Government Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means; Rules; Withdrawn prior to introduction
1885.title: SSB/Gross Receipts Tax [WPSC]
1885.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the gross receipts tax.

1889.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5 (Ch. 2010-230)
1889.title: State Road and Bridge Designations [CPSC]
1889.description: Designates Andrew J. Capeletti Memorial Bridge and Jose Regueiro Avenue in Miami-Dade County. Directs the Department of Transportation to erect suitable markers.

1890.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1890.title: Enforcement of Immigration Laws [GPSC]
1890.description: Cites this act as the "Florida Security and Immigration Compliance Act." Prohibits agencies from entering into a contract for contractual services with contractors not registered and participating in a federal work authorization program by a specified date. Provides procedures and requirements with respect to verification of lawful presence in the United States by an agency, etc.

1891.title: State Park Designations/Bob Graham/Jack Mashburn [EPSC]
1891.description: Designates the Bob Graham Grayton Beach State Park in Walton County. Designates the Jack Mashburn Marina within St. Andrew's State Park. Directs the Department of Environmental Protection to erect appropriate signs and markers.

1894.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1894.title: SSB/Documentary Stamp Tax [WPSC]
1894.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the documentary stamp tax.

1895.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1895.title: SSB/Corporate Income Tax [WPSC]
1895.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the corporate income tax.

1897.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1897.title: SSB/Tax on Transient Rentals [WPSC]
1897.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the tax on transient rentals.

1898.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1898.title: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease [SPSC]
1898.description: Creates the "Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Prevention and Education Act." Requires the DOH to establish a COPD prevention, education, screening, and diagnosis program. Requires the department to coordinate a statewide summit on COPD. Provides for the department to employ public awareness strategies regarding COPD. Provides powers and duties of the State Surgeon General with respect to securing funding to implement the act, etc.

1899.title: Agriculture/Florida Food Freedom Act [EPSC]
1899.description: Exempts certain food producers selling or delivering directly to the consumer from licensing requirements. Prohibits state and local governmental agencies from requiring licensure, certification, or inspection of such producers under certain circumstances. Provides that certain persons selling directly to the consumer are exempt from food permit requirements. Requires persons selling directly to the consumer to be trained and certified, etc.

1900.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1900.title: Public Retirement Plans [WPSC]
1900.description: Requires that a retirement system or plan include in its actuarial report a projection of the employer's annual required contributions and an experience study. Limits the benefits payable to a member of a retirement system or plan who has not attained 10 years of service by a certain date. Revises the calculations used for upgrading a special risk member's contributions for past service, etc.

1901.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1901.title: Saltwater Products Licenses/Residents 65 or Older [EPSC]
1901.description: Provides that specified residents are exempt from the annual fee for a saltwater products license.

1902.last_action: Withdrawn from Finance and Tax; Regulated Industries; General Government Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means; Rules; Withdrawn prior to introduction
1902.title: SSB/Alcoholic Beverage Licenses and Fees [WPSC]
1902.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to alcoholic beverage licenses and fees.

1903.last_action: Withdrawn from Finance and Tax; General Government Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means; Rules; Withdrawn prior to introduction
1903.title: Ad Valorem Taxation [WPSC]
1903.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to ad valorem taxation.

1904.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1904.title: SSB/Sales and Use Tax [WPSC]
1904.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the sales and use tax.

1905.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 01001; Substituted HB 7219 -SJ 01001; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7219 (Ch. 2010-142) -SJ 01001
1905.title: Internal Revenue Code Adoption/2010 [WPSC]
1905.description: Provides for the adoption of the 2010 version of the Internal Revenue Code. Provides exceptions. Provides for retroactive operation.

1906.last_action: Withdrawn from Finance and Tax; General Government Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means; Rules; Withdrawn prior to introduction
1906.title: SSB/Insurance Premium Tax [WPSC]
1906.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the insurance premium tax.

1908.title: Traffic Offenses [CPSC]
1908.description: Provides penalties for the commission of a noncriminal traffic infraction or certain other violations that cause or result in the serious injury of a motorcyclist, bicyclist, pedestrian, or person of other means of conveyance. Provides enhanced penalties for such violations that cause the death of such person. Provides that the act does not prohibit the person from being charged with, convicted of, or punished for any other violation of law, etc.

1909.title: Florida Endowment for Vocational Rehabilitation [EPSC]
1909.description: Removes a provision that requires the State Board of Administration to invest and reinvest moneys in the endowment fund for the Florida Endowment for Vocational Rehabilitation. Requires that a specified percent of the remainder of all civil penalties received by a county court pursuant to specified provisions be remitted to the Department of Revenue on a monthly basis for deposit in the endowment fund, etc.

1910.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1910.title: Capital Collateral Regional Counsel [SPSC]
1910.description: Requires that the Governor appoint each capital collateral regional counsel to a term of 4 years. Removes a provision that prohibited a person appointed as a capital collateral regional counsel from running for or accepting an appointment to any state office for a specified period after leaving that office.

1911.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1911.title: Preference in Award of State Contracts [EPSC]
1911.description: Expands provisions that authorize an agency, county, municipality, school district, or other political subdivision of the state to provide preferential consideration to a Florida business in awarding competitively bid contracts to purchase personal property under specified circumstances to include the purchase of construction services, etc.

1912.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1912.title: Campaign Finance [GPSC]
1912.description: Prohibits a local government, or a person acting on behalf of a local government, from making a specific appropriation or designated expenditure of moneys under the jurisdiction or control of the local government. Prohibits certain persons or groups from accepting such moneys for the purpose of certain political advertisements. Deletes an exception for certain electioneering communications, etc.

1913.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1913.title: Health Care Transition/Adolescents/Young Adults [SPSC]
1913.description: Establishes an office within the Division of Children's Medical Services Network in the DOH to implement a health care transition program for adolescents and young adults who have special health care needs. Requires the DOH to enter into contracts, contingent upon appropriations, with local health and transition services programs. Specifies the services that may be offered by local health and transition services programs, etc.

1914.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 01004; Substituted HB 1193 -SJ 01004; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 1193 (Ch. 2010-179) -SJ 01004
1914.title: Retirement/Special Risk Class/Qualifying Injury [WPSC]
1914.description: Cites this act as the "Adam Pierce Act." Revise the definition of "special risk member" to include certain members suffering a qualifying injury. Provides eligibility requirements for membership in the Special Risk Class for certain members suffering a qualifying injury. Provides medical certification requirements. Provides a definition. Prohibits the grant or creation of additional rights. Provides retroactive effect, etc.

1915.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1915.title: SSB/Enterprise Zone Tax Credits [WPSC]
1915.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to enterprise zone tax credits.

1918.last_action: Withdrawn from Finance and Tax; General Government Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means; Rules; Withdrawn prior to introduction
1918.title: Sales and Use Tax [WPSC]
1918.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the sales and use tax.

1919.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1919.title: Public Participation Plans [EPSC]
1919.description: Requires applications for comprehensive plan amendments or development orders to include a public participation plan. Specifies a required time for implementation of the plan. Specifies plan purposes and required plan information. Specifies that certain notice requirements are in addition to other notice requirements of law. Provides for continuing effect of certain local government ordinances, etc.

1920.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
1920.title: Solicitation of Funds/Nonprofit Organizations [GPSC]
1920.description: Transfers control of procedures for the solicitation of funds for nonprofit organizations from the DOACS to the Department of State. Requires that the Department of State submit a copy of an annual report containing certain information to the Secretary of State. Requires that the department provide certain materials to organizations seeking to register as nonprofit corporations, etc.

1922.last_action: Withdrawn from Commerce; Community Affairs; Finance and Tax; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
1922.title: Tax on Transient Accommodations [WPSC]
1922.description: Defines terms for the purpose of specifying how the tax on transient accommodations is calculated. Requires a person who operates transient accommodations to collect and pay the tax on transient accommodations to the DOR. Requires a person who operates transient accommodations to separately state the taxes charged on the transient accommodations on a receipt. Declares that the act is clarifying and remedial in nature, etc.

1926.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1926.title: Medicaid Fraud [SPSC]
1926.description: Requires that the Department of Health deny, revoke, suspend, or refuse to issue or renew a permit or certificate of certain applicants, permittees, or certificateholders that have been convicted of, or entered a plea of guilty or nolo contendere to, regardless of adjudication, a felony involving Medicaid fraud. Requires that the Office of Insurance Regulation revoke a certificate of authority of a health insurer for the same reason, etc.

1927.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
1927.title: Talent & Economic Advancement Matching Grant Prog. [SPSC]
1927.description: Establishes the Talent and Economic Advancement Matching Grant Program within the DOE for certain purposes. Provides for administration of the program by the Office of Student Financial Assistance. Authorizes businesses to identify certain talent needs and partner with certain schools to provide certain educational programs. Authorizes the state to appropriate moneys to match certain unmatched expenditures, etc.

1928.title: Foreign Law/Application [CPSC]
1928.description: Specifies the public policy of this state in granting comity to a decision rendered under any foreign law, legal code, or system. Provides for the construction of a waiver by a natural person of the person's constitutional rights. Specifies the public policy of this state for interpreting a contract, arbitration agreement, or other agreement providing a choice of venue or forum outside any state or territory of the United States, etc.

1929.last_action: Veto Message received (2010-C) -SJ 00004; Veto Message referred to Rules -SJ 00005
1929.title: Design Professionals [CPSC]
1929.description: Provides for limited liability for engineers, surveyors and mappers, architects, interior designers, and registered landscape architects as a result of construction defects resulting from the performance of a contract. Provides that, if a contract requires professional liability insurance, the contract may not limit the liability of the design professional inconsistent with the insurance requirements, etc.

1930.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
1930.title: Florida Bright Futures Scholarship Program [WPSC]
1930.description: Requires a student to reimburse the educational institution for award amounts received for certain courses dropped by the student or courses from which the student has withdrawn. Requires reimbursements to be refunded to the Department of Education. Requires an institution to notify the department and student of the amount due within a specified period.

1931.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
1931.title: Offenses Committed on Grounds of Religious Inst. [SPSC]
1931.description: Provides for the reclassification of the felony degree for a violation of the offense of burglary or theft when committed on the grounds of a religious institution.

1932.last_action: Died pending review, Rule 4.7(2), companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 5101 (Ch. 2010-154)
1932.title: Education/High-performing Teachers [WPSC]
1932.description: Cites this act as the "High-Performing Teacher Bonuses Act." Requires that each school district allocate 100 percent of the funds received for instruction for the International Baccalaureate Program, Advanced International Certificate of Education, and the Advanced Placement Program. Requires that such funds be expended solely for administrative costs associated with such programs and teachers' bonuses, etc.

1934.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00700; Substituted CS/HB 951 -SJ 00700; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 951 (Ch. 2010-62), CS/HB 7069 (Ch. 2010-114) -SJ 00700
1934.title: Department of Law Enforcement [SPSC]
1934.description: Requires certain reports to be submitted in an automated format. Revises provisions relating to the Criminal Justice Information Program under the Department of Law Enforcement. Requires the Criminal Justice Standards and Training Commission to adopt rules relating to the maintenance of officers who engage in those specialized areas found to present a high risk of harm to the officer or the public at large, etc.

1935.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00995; Amendment(s) adopted (925538, 849614, 815508, 587724, 342988) -SJ 00996; Substituted CS/HB 7157 -SJ 00996; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 109 (Ch. 2010-32), CS/HB 5801 (Ch. 2010-166), CS/HB 7157 (Ch. 2010-138), CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102), CS/CS/SB 1736 (Ch. 2010-90) -SJ 00996
1935.title: Department of Revenue [WPSC]
1935.description: Specifies the duration of liens securing the payment of unemployment compensation tax obligations. Provides that the tax on deeds and other instruments relating to real property does not apply to property sold pursuant to a short sale. Provides that an exemption from the communications services tax does not apply to transient public lodging establishments, etc.

1936.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1936.title: Violations of Tax Statutes/Criminal Penalties [WPSC]
1936.description: Imposes criminal penalties on a dealer who willfully fails to collect certain taxes or fees after notice of a duty to collect the taxes or fees by the DOR. Revises provisions imposing criminal penalties on a person who makes a false or fraudulent return with a willful intent to evade payment of taxes or fees. Provides criminal penalties for willfully failing to register as a dealer after notice from the DOR, etc.

1938.title: Jamming of Electronic Speed-measuring Devices [CPSC]
1938.description: Prohibits a vehicle from being equipped with any device that is designed for, or is capable of, jamming, scrambling, disabling, or otherwise interfering with a radar, laser, or any other electronic device used by a law enforcement agency to measure the speed of a moving vehicle. Authorizes a law enforcement officer to seize such a jamming device, etc.

1939.title: Rural Infrastructure Fund [CPSC]
1939.description: Revises provisions relating to rural infrastructure projects. Revises the percentage of total infrastructure project costs for which the OTTED may award grants. Authorizes the OTTED to award grants for a certain percentage of total infrastructure project costs for certain rural areas of critical economic concern. Requires that funds from the purchase of certain lands by the state or a state agency be appropriated to said fund.

1941.last_action: Withdrawn from Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities; Environmental Preservation and Conservation; Finance and Tax; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
1941.title: Solar Energy System Incentives Program [WPSC]
1941.description: Revise the expiration date for the Solar Energy System Incentives Program. Extends the period of time for which residents of the state are eligible to receive rebates for specified solar energy systems.

1942.title: Powers of Community Development Districts [EPSC]
1942.description: Revises general powers of community development districts. Revises special powers of community development districts.

1943.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1943.title: Florida Ports Investments [WPSC]
1943.description: Cites certain provisions as the "Florida Ports Investment Act." Creates the Florida Ports Investment Corporation. Provides port project funding criteria. Provides requirements for capital allocation and investments. Provides for tax credits against specified taxes. Provides limitations on the credit. Authorizes the corporation and the OTTED to charge certain fees, etc.

1944.title: Clerks of the Court [WPSC]
1944.description: Provides additional powers and duties of the Legislative Budget Commission. Revises and provides additional duties of the Florida Clerks of Court Operations Corporation relating to funding and budgets of the clerks of court. Revises budget procedures, requirements, criteria, and limitations for preparing budget request for funding court-related functions of the clerks of the court, etc.

1945.title: FRS/Special Risk Class/Court Deputies [WPSC]
1945.description: Redefines the term "special risk member". Revises criteria for membership in the special risk class to include court deputies. Provides legislative findings that the act fulfills an important state interest.

1946.last_action: Died pending reference review under Rule 4.7(2)
1946.title: Special Assessment for Law Enforcement Services [WPSC]
1946.description: Authorizes a municipality to impose a special assessment to fund the costs of providing law enforcement services. Makes the imposition of the assessment contingent upon adoption of an ordinance approved by the governing body of a municipality and a reduction in the municipality's ad valorem millage. Limits the maximum millage reduction required. Specifies the rolled-back rate for the calculation of a future increase in ad valorem millage.

1948.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
1948.title: Behavioral Health Services [SPSC]
1948.description: Exempts certain providers from participating in a community-based managing entity for purposes of providing mental health services or substance abuse prevention and treatment services.

1950.title: Admissions Tax/Educational Events [WPSC]
1950.description: Exempts from the tax admission charges to certain educational events.

1952.last_action: Died in Committee on General Government Appropriations
1952.title: Florida Agricultural Museum [EPSC]
1952.description: Repeals s. 570.901, F.S. relating to the museum. Amends specified provisions relating to direct-support organizations for the museum and certain other programs and definitions applicable to such provisions. Deletes provisions pertaining to the museum to conform to the repeal by the act of provisions establishing the museum.

1953.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1953.title: Bingo Games [CPSC]
1953.description: Authorizes electronic devices to be used for certain functions in the conduct of bingo games.

1954.title: Early Learning [CPSC]
1954.description: Deletes an obsolete reference to the repealed subsidized child care program. Replaces an obsolete reference to a repealed program with an updated reference to the school readiness program. Establishes the Gold Seal Quality Care program within the DCFS. Revises procedures for child care market rate reimbursement and child care grants. Revises provisions relating to statewide kindergarten screening and kindergarten readiness rates, etc.

1955.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
1955.title: High School Graduation [GPSC]
1955.description: Establishes the Florida National Guard Youth Challenge Program for the purpose of training and mentoring certain high school dropouts. Requires that the program include occupational or technical studies and physical training or applied health studies. Provides for a residential and postresidential component of the program. Provides for the DOE to authorize a district school board to award high school equivalency diplomas, etc.

1956.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
1956.title: Florida Keys Area [EPSC]
1956.description: Authorizes the issuance of bonds to be used to finance the cost of constructing sewage facilities in the Florida Keys Area. Revises legislative intent relating to the designation of the Florida Keys as an area of critical state concern. Revises compliance requirements for reviewing comprehensive plan amendments. Provides additional requirements for onsite sewage treatment and disposal systems in Monroe County, etc.

1957.title: Information Technology [WPSC]
1957.description: Revises the duties and responsibilities of the Agency for Enterprise Information Technology. Requires that the agency develop standards for information technology services. Specifies the contents of financial statements that must be provided by primary data centers. Requires that each data center submit to its board of trustees cost-reduction proposals and organizational plans, etc. APPROPRIATION: $300,000.

1959.title: Tax on Communications and Utility Services [WPSC]
1959.description: Decreases the rate at which the sales price of certain communications services are taxed. Requires that the State Board of Education make specified adjustments to the figures used by the board in determining the amount of bond debt that can be serviced by revenues derived from the gross receipts tax on utility services. Provides for the act to apply to bills for communications services dated on or after a certain date, etc.

1960.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
1960.title: SSB/Governmental Operations [WPSC]
1960.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to governmental operations.

1963.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
1963.title: State and Federal Relations [WPSC]
1963.description: Provides for the CFO, the Governor's Office of Federal Revenue Maximization, and the Legislative Committee on Intergovernmental Relations to have direct access to the staff of the Office of State-Federal Relations. Creates the Office of Federal Revenue Maximization within the Governor's Office of Policy and Budget. Requires that the office respond to federal grant opportunities and coordinate the use of federal funds in the state, etc.

1964.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1964.title: Arbitration Agreements/Medical Negligence Claims [SPSC]
1964.description: Provides that arbitration agreements written in conformity with the Florida Arbitration Code are consistent with the public policy of this state. Prohibits an arbitration agreement from restricting or abolishing any substantive or due process right or restricting in any way damages or remedies available to a patient or nursing home resident, etc.

1965.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation and Economic Development Appropriations
1965.title: Motor Vehicle Operation Fees [WPSC]
1965.description: Revises the service charge for each application that is handled in connection with the original issuance, duplicate issuance, or transfer of any license plate, mobile home sticker, or validation sticker or with the transfer or duplicate issuance of a registration certificate. Decreases the annual license taxes for the operation of certain vehicles. Revises the amount of the surcharge that is levied on each license tax, etc.

1966.last_action: Died in Committee on Health and Human Services Appropriations
1966.title: Medicaid Buy-in Program/Persons with Disabilities [WPSC]
1966.description: Provides for Medicaid eligibility for certain persons with disabilities under a Medicaid buy-in program, subject to specific federal authorization. Requires the DCFS to adopt rules for determining program eligibility. Directs the DOH to perform all disability determinations. Requires the AHCA to establish and administer the buy-in program and to seek amendments to specified Medicaid waivers for certain persons with disabilities.

1967.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1967.title: Reporting Illegal or Improper Homestead Exemptions [EPSC]
1967.description: Authorizes any person to report to his or her local property appraiser a possible homestead exemption violation under certain circumstances. Requires that the property appraiser pay a specified maximum reward to the reporting individual after the recovery of any back taxes or penalties by the property appraiser. Provides for the determination of the recipient of a reward if more than one resident reports a violation, etc.

1968.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax
1968.title: College and Career Transition Assistance Act [SPSC]
1968.description: Establishes a school-to-work program to be operated in any school, Department of Juvenile Justice facility, or charter school. Provides requirements for participation in the program. Creates an endowment fund within the Florida Endowment Foundation for Florida's Graduates. Creates the Florida Endowment Foundation for Florida's Graduates. Requires an annual audit report. Requires that the Department of Education adopt rules, etc.

1970.title: Employee Leasing Companies [CPSC]
1970.description: Deletes the requirement that an employee leasing company obtain approval of the Board of Employee Leasing Companies before changing the name or location of a company. Provides that board approval is not required before the purchase or acquisition of a company if a controlling person in the company is licensed. Provides that failure to timely pay a license renewal fee subjects the licensee to disciplinary action, etc.

1971.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1971.title: SSB/Insurance [CPSC]
1971.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to insurance.

1975.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1975.title: Water Quality/Nutrients/Surface Water [EPSC]
1975.description: Directs the DEP to contract with the National Academy of Science for an evaluation of issues related to the establishment of numeric nutrient criteria. Requires the DEP and the DOACS to evaluate the sources and quantities of nutrients in surface waters. Requires a report to the Governor and Legislature by a certain date. Provides for future expiration.

1976.title: Sovereignty of the State [SPSC]
1976.description: Provides legislative findings that certain actions by the federal government threaten the sovereignty of the state under the United States Constitution and the fiscal security of the state. Provides that the state is not bound by certain federal laws requiring the state to spend funds. Provides exceptions. Defines the term "insignificant fiscal impact." Requires the Attorney General to enforce certain rights of the state.

1977.title: Sovereign Immunity [SPSC]
1977.description: Increases the statutory limits on liability for tort claims against the state and its agencies and subdivisions. Provides for application of the act to claims arising on or after the effective date.

1978.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
1978.title: Malt Beverages [CPSC]
1978.description: Removes a provision limiting a vendor that brews malt beverages to the sale of the beverage to consumers only for consumption on the premises of the vendor or on a contiguous premises owned by the vendor. Removes a provision limiting the size of individual containers of malt beverages which may be sold or offered for sale by vendors at retail.

1979.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1979.title: SSB/Protection of Securities Investors [CPSC]
1979.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the protection of securities investors.

1980.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1980.title: SSB/Foreclosure [CPSC]
1980.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to foreclosure.

1981.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1981.title: SSB/Consumer Protection [CPSC]
1981.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to consumer protection.

1982.title: Public Record Exemptions/Financial Regulation [CPSC]
1982.description: Provides a public records exemption for information held by the Office of Financial Regulation pursuant to an investigation of consumer collection agencies. Provides for future repeal and legislative review of the exemption under the OGSR Act. Provides a statement of public necessity.

1985.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5 (Ch. 2010-230)
1985.title: Road and Bridge Designation [CPSC]
1985.description: Designates the Command Sergeant Major Gary Lee Littrell Medal of Honor Causeway and Bridge in Pinellas County. Directs the Department of Transportation to erect markers.

1986.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
1986.title: Platted Lots/Pilot Program [EPSC]
1986.description: Establishes a pilot program for the purpose of redeveloping antiquated subdivisions. Requires that the DCA administer the pilot program. Provides for the determination of density credits or units and for the transfer or sale of such credits or units. Requires the owner of a lot that receives density credits to execute a restrictive covenant. Requires that the OPPAGA submit a report to the Legislature by a specified date, etc.

1987.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
1987.title: Water Conservation [EPSC]
1987.description: Revises the components for a comprehensive statewide water conservation program. Specifies that the program includes the creation of a Conserve Florida Clearinghouse and a Conserve Florida Clearinghouse Guide by the DEP. Requires a public water supply utility that develops a goal-based water conservation plan to submit the plan to the appropriate WMD for approval. Provides standards for approval, etc.

1988.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
1988.title: Florida Kidcare Program [WPSC]
1988.description: Provides that children under the age of 1 may participate in the Medikids program. Provides that an eligible child who is a lawful immigrant may enroll in the Florida Kidcare program regardless of the child's date of entry. Authorizes Kidcare coverage for temporomandibular joint disease. Provides that Medicaid-eligible children are deemed eligible for 12 months of coverage regardless of any change in circumstances, etc.

1989.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00672; Substituted HB 661 -SJ 00672; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 661 (Ch. 2010-56) -SJ 00672
1989.title: Mortgage Guaranty Insurers/Surplus Requirements [CPSC]
1989.description: Authorizes the Commissioner of Insurance Regulation to permit a temporary exception to certain requirements under certain circumstances. Revises authority of the Office of Insurance Regulation to take action against a noncomplying insurer under certain circumstances.

1990.title: Consumer Debt Collection [CPSC]
1990.description: Requires a consumer debt collection agency to maintain records. Increases the administrative fine imposed against an out-of-state consumer debt collector that fails to register as required. Revises provisions relating to authorized activities of the Attorney General. Revises requirements for providing written notice of the assignment of debt. Revises prohibited acts with respect to consumer debt collection, etc.

1991.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1991.title: SSB/Department of Financial Services [CPSC]
1991.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Department of Financial Services.

1992.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1992.title: SSB/Regulation of Securities [CPSC]
1992.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the regulation of securities.

1993.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1993.title: SSB/Regulation of Financial Institutions [CPSC]
1993.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the regulation of financial institutions.

1994.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1994.title: SSB/Mortgage Fraud [CPSC]
1994.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to mortgage fraud.

1995.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1995.title: SSB/Public Record Exemptions [CPSC]
1995.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to public record exemptions.

1996.title: Enterprise Zone Economic Stimulus [WPSC]
1996.description: Renames the enterprise zone jobs credit as the enterprise zone job stimulus credit. Authorizes the enterprise zone job stimulus credit against the sales tax to be applied to new employees hired. Revises criteria for claiming the credit. Deletes the minimum threshold requirement for full-time jobs required to claim the credit. Amends a specified provision relating to rural enterprise zones, etc.

1997.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00857; Substituted CS/HB 889 -SJ 00857; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 889 (Ch. 2010-34), HB 5311 (Ch. 2010-161) -SJ 00857
1997.title: Biomedical and Social Research [SPSC]
1997.description: Repeals provisions relating to the Center for Health Technologies and the Florida Biomedical and Social Research Act. Deletes provisions and cross-references to conform. Repeals provisions relating to the Cervical Cancer Elimination Task Force and the Florida Cancer Council. Provides the goals for the William G. "Bill" Bankhead, Jr., and David Coley Cancer Research Program, etc.

1999.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
1999.title: Citizens Property Insurance Corporation [CPSC]
1999.description: Requires that the corporation achieve actuarially sound rates on or before a specified date. Requires that the corporation take certain actions to achieve actuarially sound rates. Requires that the corporation file a plan of withdrawal on or before a specified date if it does not achieve said rates by a specified deadline. Prohibits the OIR from having authority with respect to the corporation's rates, etc.

2000.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
2000.title: Municipal Police Pension Plans [WPSC]
2000.description: Allows premium tax revenues to be used to repay an advance from the municipality which is used to purchase an annuity to fund the accrued liabilities of the plan.

2001.last_action: Died in Committee on General Government Appropriations, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176)
2001.title: Property Insurance [CPSC]
2001.description: Decreases the maximum number of consecutive years that an insurer may use the same accountant or partner of an accounting firm for preparing its audited financial report. Requires insurers to provide a notice of a change in policy terms to a policyholder under certain circumstances. Requires an insurer to determine whether damage to a structure is consistent with sinkhole loss, etc.

2004.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2004.title: SSB/Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund [WPSC]
2004.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund.

2005.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2005.title: SSB/Money Services Businesses [CPSC]
2005.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to money services businesses.

2006.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00934; Substituted CS/CS/HB 1073 -SJ 00934; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1073 (Ch. 2010-224) -SJ 00934
2006.title: Individuals with Developmental Disabilities [SPSC]
2006.description: Revises the application procedures for the licensing of certain facilities that serve individuals with developmental disabilities. Requires that each school prepare an incident report within a specified period after each occasion of student restraint or seclusion. Requires that each school notify a student's parent or guardian if manual physical restraint or seclusion is used. Prohibits certain restraints and seclusion, etc.

2007.title: Cadmium in Children's Products [CPSC]
2007.description: Prohibits a person from using or applying cadmium in excess of a specified amount on any item of children's jewelry, toy, or child care article sold in this state. Provides an exception. Provides for a criminal penalty.

2008.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
2008.title: Public Records/DCFS/Foster Parents and Families [SPSC]
2008.description: Expands a public records exemption relating to licensed foster parents and their families to include records held by all agencies in addition to the DCFS. Provides for future review and repeal of the exemption under the OGSR Act. Provides a statement of public necessity.

2009.title: Electronic Filing/Administrative Hearings Division [GPSC]
2009.description: Provides procedures for filing petitions for benefits and other documents in worker's compensation benefits proceedings. Authorizes the Office of the Judges of Compensation Claims to adopt rules to implement electronic procedures. Requires a petitioner requesting an administrative hearing to include the petitioner's e-mail address. Requires an attorney to use electronic means when filing a document with said division, etc.

2010.title: Florida Tax Credit Scholarship Program [WPSC]
2010.description: Makes operation of the program contingent upon available funds. Revises certain eligibility criteria. Revises tax credit grant provisions. Specifies a tax credit cap. Provides for increasing the tax credit cap under certain circumstances. Provides for unused amounts of tax credits to be carried forward. Revises provisions governing the rescission of taxpayer tax credits. Authorizes DOR to adopt emergency rules, etc. APPROPRIATION: $140,494.

2012.title: SSB/Sovereign Immunity [SPSC]
2012.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to sovereign immunity.

2013.title: SSB/State Courts System [SPSC]
2013.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the state courts system.

2015.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2015.title: SSB/Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund [CPSC]
2015.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the Florida Hurricane Catastrophe Fund.

2017.title: Administrative Procedures [CPSC]
2017.description: Requires an agency's notice of rule development to indicate whether the rule may have an adverse impact on small businesses. Requires that the agency also notify the Small Business Regulatory Advisory Council if the rule may have an adverse impact. Revises provisions relating to an agency's response to a proposal by a substantially affected person for a lower cost regulatory alternative to a proposed rule, etc.

2018.last_action: Withdrawn from Health Regulation; Health and Human Services Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means -SJ 00635; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00635
2018.title: Medicaid Postpartum Benefits [WPSC]
2018.description: Provides for continuation of Medicaid coverage for women eligible for prenatal care benefits under certain circumstances and for a specified period postpartum. Requires the Agency for Health Care Administration to electronically enroll eligible women. Authorizes the AHCA to seek waiver authority.

2020.last_action: Withdrawn from Health Regulation; Health and Human Services Appropriations -SJ 00635; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00635
2020.title: Physical Therapy [SPSC]
2020.description: Provides the scope of practice for a physical therapist. Requires that an applicant for a license as a physical therapist must be a graduate of a school of physical therapy that has been approved by an accrediting agency approved and recognized by the Board of Physical Therapy Practice, which is not limited to the Commission on Recognition of Postsecondary Accreditation or the U.S. Department of Education, etc.

2021.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2021.title: SSB/Insurance Fraud [CPSC]
2021.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to insurance fraud.

2022.title: SSB/Civil Liability [SPSC]
2022.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to civil liability.

2023.title: SSB/State Judicial System [SPSC]
2023.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to the state judicial system.

2024.title: SSB/Family Law [SPSC]
2024.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to family law.

2025.title: SSB/Public Records and Public Meetings [SPSC]
2025.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to public records and public meetings.

2026.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00984; Amendment(s) adopted (803820) -SJ 00984; Substituted CS/CS/HB 965 -SJ 00984; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 965 (Ch. 2010-170) -SJ 00984
2026.title: Real Property Assessment/Imported Drywall [WPSC]
2026.description: Provides a definition. Requires property appraisers to adjust the assessed value of certain properties affected by imported drywall under certain circumstances. Provides for a nominal just value of $0 under certain circumstances. Specifies homestead property as damaged for certain purposes. Prohibits consideration of homestead property as abandoned under certain circumstances. Provides for future repeal unless reviewed and reenacted, etc.

2027.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2027.title: Illegal Aliens [SPSC]
2027.description: Prohibits a person, knowingly or with reckless disregard of the law, from transporting or moving an illegal alien, concealing or harboring an illegal alien, or encouraging or inducing an illegal alien to enter or reside in this state. Requires the Attorney General to negotiate with the U.S. Department of Homeland Security to designate law enforcement officers and others to act as qualified immigration officers, etc.

2028.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2028.title: Gift Certificates and Similar Credit Items [CPSC]
2028.description: Provides that a violation of provisions relating to the expiration date of a gift certificate or credit memo is a deceptive and unfair trade practice that violates the Florida Deceptive and Unfair Trade Practices Act and subjects the violator to the penalties and remedies of that act.

2030.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
2030.title: Sale of Electricity [EPSC]
2030.description: Revises the definition of the term "public utility" to include specified separate legal entities created pursuant to the Florida Interlocal Cooperation Act of 1969. Provides that provisions regulating public utilities apply to the sale of electricity by such separate legal entities.

2031.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00935; Substituted HB 7085 -SJ 00935; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7085 (Ch. 2010-116), CS/HB 551 (Ch. 2010-130) -SJ 00935
2031.title: OGSR/Commission on Ethics/Ethics and Public Trust [GPSC]
2031.description: Amends a specified provision which provides an exemption from public records requirements for complaints and related records held by the Commission on Ethics or a Commission on Ethics and Public Trust established by a county or municipality and an exemption from public meetings requirements for proceedings conducted by such commissions pursuant to a complaint or preliminary investigation, etc.

2032.title: Weights and Measures [EPSC]
2032.description: Revises the expiration date of provisions relating to permits for commercially operated or tested weights and measures instruments and devices.

2033.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
2033.title: Health Care/Legislators/Health Savings Account [WPSC]
2033.description: Requires that all health care policies and benefits for members of the Legislature be provided through a health savings account established and maintained by the Division of State Group Insurance of the Department of Management Services.

2035.last_action: Died in Committee on Rules, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 1047 (Ch. 2010-250)
2035.title: City of Clearwater/Pinellas County
2035.description: Provides for use of specified city-owned property for recreational and commercial working waterfronts. Provides for preservation of referendum requirement of use of certain city-owned property. Requires a referendum for lease, license, sale, or transfer of certain land and for any alteration to existing public land use map designation for such land, etc.

2037.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2037.title: Renal Disease/Insurance [CPSC]
2037.description: Prohibits an insurer that covers dialysis treatment for patients who have end-stage renal disease from requiring an insured to travel more than a certain number of minutes to obtain dialysis treatment or from requiring an insured to change to another dialysis provider. Prohibits an insurer that provides coverage for dialysis treatment from shifting the responsibility for reimbursement in coverage type to another payer, etc.

2039.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00837; Amendment(s) adopted (903594) -SJ 00837; Substituted HB 7079 -SJ 00837; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7079 (Ch. 2010-115), HB 7123 (Ch. 2010-42) -SJ 00837
2039.title: OGSR/Voters and Voter Registration/Signatures [GPSC]
2039.description: Amends provisions relating to an exemption from public records requirements for certain information regarding voters and voter registration and for signatures of voters and voter registration applicants. Creates said exemption for specified personal identifying information of stalking victims held by the Attorney General or contained in voter registration and voting records held by the supervisor of elections or the Department of State, etc.

2041.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5303 (Ch. 2010-157)
2041.title: Developmental Disabilities Savings Program [SPSC]
2041.description: Creates the Services for Children with Developmental Disabilities Task Force. Requires the task force to develop recommendations and a plan for the creation of, and enrollment in, the Developmental Disabilities Savings Program. Creates the Developmental Disabilities Savings Program. Provides requirements that must be met prior to implementation of the program. Provides for construction, etc.

2042.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2042.title: Audits of Pharmacy Records [WPSC]
2042.description: Revises requirements for the audit of Medicaid-related pharmacy records. Authorizes third-party payor and third-party administrator audits of pharmacies. Specifies that certain audit criteria apply to third-party claims submitted after a specified date. Prohibits certain accounting practices used for calculating the recoupment of claims, etc.

2043.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
2043.title: Agreements for Property Repairs/Reactive Drywall [CPSC]
2043.description: Authorizes certain persons or entities to agree to certain measures to effect repairs to improvements to real property due to problems arising from the use of reactive drywall. Prohibits a cause of action against certain persons or entities for damage to property arising from prior use of reactive drywall or from such repairs. Provides a definition.

2044.title: Motor Vehicle Load Weight Limits [CPSC]
2044.description: Requires specified scale tolerances to be applied to weight limits for vehicles on highways that are not in the Interstate Highway System. Provides that specified tolerances do not apply to cranes. Provides for determination of fines for violations of the total gross weight limits. Revises conditions under which vehicles in violation of specified gross or external bridge weight limits must be unloaded, etc.

2046.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
2046.title: Water Supply [EPSC]
2046.description: Creates specified provisions relating to water supply policy, planning, production, and funding. Provides for the powers and duties of water management district governing boards. Requires the DEP to develop the Florida water supply plan. Requires water management district governing boards to develop water supply plans for their respective regions. Provides for alternative water supply development, etc.

2047.title: Chief Financial Officer/Charts of Accounts [WPSC]
2047.description: Requires governmental and statutorily created entities to maintain their financial data in accordance with the requirements of the Chief Financial Officer by a certain date. Requires the Chief Financial Officer to adopt charts of accounts that meet certain requirements by a certain date. Requires a review and update of the charts of accounts. Requires the Chief Financial Officer to adopt certain procedures relating to the charts of accounts, etc.

2048.title: Management/Operation of Jury System/Circuit Court [SPSC]
2048.description: Authorizes the chief judge of a circuit court to assign certain duties to the court administrator which are otherwise assigned to the clerk of court by law. Authorizes the chief judge of a circuit court to designate the court administrator to perform certain duties relating to the selection of jurors if funding is received from any source for that purpose.

2050.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2050.title: Prevention of Obesity [SPSC]
2050.description: Authorizes the DOH to require certain food service establishments to display the number of calories in food items for sale. Provides immunity from liability under certain circumstances. Provides conditions under which such nutritional-information requirements may be superseded by federal law, rules, or regulations, etc.

2052.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
2052.title: Dept. of State/Fl. Government Accountability Act [GPSC]
2052.description: Reenacts a specified provision relating to the Division of Elections within the department.

2053.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation and Economic Development Appropriations
2053.title: Strategic Intermodal System Plan [CPSC]
2053.description: Removes provisions creating and providing duties of the Statewide Intermodal Transportation Advisory Council.

2054.title: Job Opportunities for Youth [WPSC]
2054.description: Provides legislative intent to support statewide vocational training and placement provided to at-risk youth through the Jobs for Florida's Graduates program. Requires that a proposal for funding a statewide summer program for youth employment be submitted to the Florida Endowment Foundation for Florida's Graduates. Revises the excise tax amount payable by manufacturers, distributors, and vendors of malt beverages, etc.

2055.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/HB 631 (Ch. 2010-198), CS/CS/HB 971 (Ch. 2010-223)
2055.title: Off-highway Vehicles/ROV [EPSC]
2055.description: Redefines the term "ROV" to include vehicles of an increased width and weight.

2056.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5305 (Ch. 2010-158)
2056.title: Child Welfare Contracts [SPSC]
2056.description: Limits state agency contract monitoring to once every 3 years if the contracted provider is subject to accreditation surveys by specified accreditation organizations. Allows the establishment of an Internet-based data warehouse to maintain the records of contract providers. Limits the DCFS to one contract monitoring of a child-caring or child-placing contract provider per year, etc.

2057.last_action: Read 3rd time -SJ 00883; Substituted CS/HB 1059 -SJ 00883; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 1059 (Ch. 2010-65) -SJ 00883
2057.title: Pub. Rec./Examination Techniques & Procedures/OFR [CPSC]
2057.description: Provides an exemption from public records requirements for information that would reveal examination techniques and procedures used by the Office of Financial Regulation pursuant to the Florida Securities and Investor Protection Act. Provides an exception to the exemption for other governmental entities having oversight or regulatory or law enforcement authority. Provides for future review and repeal of the exemption, etc.

2059.title: Adverse Possession [SPSC]
2059.description: Requires a person seeking property by adverse possession to use a uniform adverse possession return developed by the DOR. Requires that the person claiming adverse possession provide notice of the claim to the owner of record and provide proof of compliance with the notice requirement to the property appraiser, etc.

2061.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
2061.title: Mitigation Banks [EPSC]
2061.description: Requires that rules of the DEP and the water management districts relating to mitigation banks be consistent with federal regulations. Requires the DEP to adopt a uniform process for obtaining a formal assessment determination for potential mitigation bank establishment. Provides that a formal assessment determination is binding for a specified period and constitutes final agency action, etc.

2062.title: Florida Assisted Reproductive Technology Act [SPSC]
2062.description: Provides general requirements that an assisted reproductive technology agency must follow. Requires said agency to establish an escrow account for certain funds. Prescribes requirements for contracts for third-party reproductive services. Prohibits an agency from engaging in third-party reproductive services if the owner or operator of the agency has had any arrests, charges, or convictions related to certain crimes, etc.

2063.title: Foreclosure
2063.description: Requires that during foreclosure proceedings a landlord continue to hold money deposited or advanced by a tenant in a specified manner. Requires a landlord to disclose the existence of foreclosure proceedings to a prospective tenant. Exempts an agent of a landlord from liability for failing to notify prospective tenants of foreclosure proceedings under certain circumstances, etc.

2064.title: Independent Living Transition Services Program [SPSC]
2064.description: Requires the Auditor General to perform an operational audit of the independent living transition services program administered by the DCFS. Requires the OPPAGA to conduct an evaluation of the said program administered by the DCFS. Requires that the results of the audit and evaluation be reported to the Governor, the Legislature, and the Secretary of Children and Family Services.

2065.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 01009; Amendment(s) adopted (463018) -SJ 01009; Substituted CS/HB 907 -SJ 01009; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 907 (Ch. 2010-199) -SJ 01009
2065.title: Child Support Guidelines [SPSC]
2065.description: Requires all child support orders after a certain date to contain certain provisions. Creates a rebuttable presumption of census-level wages if information about earnings level is not provided. Provides for the calculation of the obligor parent's child support payment under certain circumstances. Revises the deviation factors that a court may consider when adjusting a parent's share of the child support award, etc.

2066.title: Government Liens [SPSC]
2066.description: Requires certain fines or liens to be recorded in order to constitute a property lien. Authorizes counties and municipalities to provide by ordinance that certain property conditions are code violations subject to enforcement actions. Specifies nonapplication of certain emergency repair action requirements to certain enforcement procedures. Authorizes appeal of recorded liens, etc.

2067.title: Florida Financial Management Information System [GPSC]
2067.description: Provides that the Financial Management Information Board is responsible for the system. Establishes the Agency for Enterprise Business Services within the DFS. Establishes the Enterprise Financial Business Operations Council to act in an advisory capacity to the agency. Provides for an Enterprise Financial Business Strategic Plan. Repeals a specified provision relating to the DOACS' exemption from using the state online procurement system, etc.

2068.title: Truth in Government Act/Legislature [SPSC]
2068.description: Eliminates the authority of members of a legislative committee to administer certain oaths and affirmations to witnesses. Requires that persons addressing a legislative committee take an oath or affirmation of truthfulness. Provides criminal penalties for certain false statements before a legislative committee. Authorizes the use of a signed appearance card in lieu of an oral oath or affirmation, etc.

2070.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
2070.title: Family Builders Program [SPSC]
2070.description: Repeals specified provisions relating to the Family Builders Program, to terminate the program. Deletes references to conform.

2071.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
2071.title: Faith- and Character-based Correctional Programs [SPSC]
2071.description: Provides requirements for faith- and character-based programs. Deletes provisions relating to funding. Revises requirements for participation. Deletes provisions relating to assignment of chaplains, etc.

2072.title: Charter Schools [SPSC]
2072.description: Revises requirements for providing financial statements to the sponsor of a charter school. Authorizes a governing body to oversee multiple charter schools. Provides requirements for designation as a high-performing charter school. Authorizes such a charter school to increase enrollment and receive capital outlay funds. Provides for the establishment of charter virtual schools, etc.

2073.title: Property Insurance Claims [CPSC]
2073.description: Provides statements that may be considered deceptive or misleading if made in any public adjuster's advertisement or solicitation. Requires that a disclaimer be included in any public adjuster's written advertisement. Requires certain persons who act on behalf of an insurer to provide notice to the insurer, claimant, public adjuster, or legal representative for an onsite inspection of the insured property, etc.

2074.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2074.title: Medicaid Rural County Pilot Project [SPSC]
2074.description: Authorizes the AHCA to seek a Medicaid pilot project waiver. Provides duties and responsibilities of the agency and the boards of county commissioners with respect to implementing the project. Provides conditions under which a rural county may provide health care if a federal health reform plan is adopted, etc.

2075.last_action: Died pending reference review under Rule 4.7(2)
2075.title: State Employment [GPSC]
2075.description: Provides directives to the Division of Statutory Revision. Revises provisions relating to the employment policy of the state. Revises the rulemaking authority of the DMS. Provides for agency audits to determine compliance with laws and rules. Revises provisions relating to educational opportunities for employees. Revises provisions relating to training employees. Revises provisions relating to equal employment opportunities, etc.

2076.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2076.title: Foreclosure Proceedings for Nonhomestead Property [CPSC]
2076.description: Creates the "Nonjudicial Foreclosure Act for Nonhomestead Properties." Specifies the application of the act to mortgages or other security interests. Specifies the application of principles of law and equity. Specifies the manner in which a secured creditor must give notice to a recipient. Specifies acts that constitute abandonment of a homestead property, etc.

2078.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
2078.title: Governmental Retirement Systems [WPSC]
2078.description: Clarifies that specified provisions, relating to the actuarial soundness of retirement systems, applies to all public employee retirement systems.
