Clarifies that the assets of a local retirement system may be invested like other public moneys available for investment by the State Board of Administration.

2080.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2080.title: Hospital Outpatient Services [WPSC]
2080.description: Authorizes the AHCA to pay for hospital outpatient services provided to Medicaid recipients under the direction of a licensed advanced registered nurse practitioner. Provides an exception to limits on payment for hospital outpatient services provided to Medicaid recipients for services provided in certain clinics.

2081.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2081.title: Interstate Health Insurance Policies [CPSC]
2081.description: Authorizes solicitation and sale of interstate health insurance policies in this state by certain persons. Provides a definition. Requires such policies and policy applications to contain a certain notice. Provides for application of certain provisions to certain insurers. Excludes interstate health insurance policies from certain requirements. Exempts such policies and applications from certain Florida Insurance Code provisions, etc.

2082.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
2082.title: Public Officials/Compensation/Bonuses [EPSC]
2082.description: Reduces the compensation of certain public officials for the 2010-2011 fiscal year. Prohibits the payment of bonuses to such persons. Provides for future legislative review.

2083.title: Legislature [GPSC]
2083.description: Fixes the date for convening the regular session of the Legislature in the year 2012.

2084.title: SSB/Apportionment and Redistricting [GPSC]
2084.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to apportionment and redistricting.

2085.title: SSB/Congressional Redistricting [GPSC]
2085.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to congressional redistricting.

2087.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
2087.title: Drinking Water [WPSC]
2087.description: Renames the Florida Water Pollution Control Financing Corporation as the Florida Water Pollution Control and Drinking Water Financing Corporation. Expands the jurisdiction of the corporation to include loans made from the drinking water state revolving loan fund. Revises the purposes for the Drinking Water Revolving Loan Trust Fund. Provides that the trust fund is exempt from the termination provisions of the State Constitution, etc.

2088.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2088.title: Health Care Facilities [SPSC]
2088.description: Redefines the term "accrediting organization" as used in specified provisions relating to hospitals and other licensed facilities, to include other accrediting organizations that have been approved by the Federal Government for purposes of the Medicare program. Redefines the term "wholesale distribution" as it relates to the sale, purchase, or trade of a prescription drug from certain eligible entities to a contract provider, etc.

2089.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
2089.title: Preference to Florida Businesses/Procurement [WPSC]
2089.description: Cites act as the "Buy Florida Act". Requires, rather than authorizes, an agency, county, municipality, school district, or other political subdivision of the state that is required to make purchases of personal property through competitive solicitation to award a preference to the lowest responsible and responsive vendor having a principal place of business within this state under specified circumstances, etc.

2090.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
2090.title: Math & Science Instructional Materials [WPSC]
2090.description: Creates the Florida Center for World Excellence in Mathematics and Science to provide for the review of mathematics and science instructional materials. Provides duties of the center to include recommendations to the Commissioner of Education of instructional materials for use in K-12 public schools beginning with the 2011-2012 school year. Provides for funding, etc.

2092.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
2092.title: FCAT/Concordant Scores [SPSC]
2092.description: Requires that any increase to a concordant score that meets the graduation requirement in lieu of a passing score on the FCAT be provided in law beginning with the 2010-2011 school year.

2093.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
2093.title: FCAT/Student Populations of Haitian Descent [SPSC]
2093.description: Recognizes the continuing, devastating, and far-reaching effects of the January 12, 2010, earthquake in Haiti. Provides that scores resulting from the administration of the FCAT during the 2009-2010 school year may not be considered for purposes of promotion, retention, or graduation in certain schools having a student population of at least 40 percent who are of Haitian descent, etc.

2094.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
2094.title: Public School Academy Programs [SPSC]
2094.description: Provides that public school choice options include academy programs in the school district. Deletes reference to the Opportunity Scholarship Program. Requires the DOE to develop a plan for the establishment of academy programs in public schools. Authorizes academy programs to participate in the Florida School Recognition Program, etc.

2095.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2095.title: Florida Hospital Patient Protection Act [SPSC]
2095.description: Provides minimum staffing level requirements for the ratio of direct care registered nurses to patients in a health care facility. Prohibits the imposition of mandatory overtime and certain other actions by a health care facility. Prohibits the use of video cameras or monitors by a health care facility as a substitute for the required level of care, etc.

2096.title: Money Laundering [SPSC]
2096.description: Defines the term "prosecuting authority" for purposes of the Florida RICO Act. Provides that the act be liberally construed to achieve the remedial purposes of curtailing racketeering activities and lessening the economic power of criminal organizations engaged in patterns of racketeering activities in this state. Prohibits a natural person from being licensed as a sole proprietorship or engaging in certain activities, etc.

2097.title: Code of Student Conduct [SPSC]
2097.description: Requires the district school board to include in the code of student conduct adopted by the board an explanation of the responsibilities of each student with regard to appropriate dress and respect for self and others, and the role that appropriate dress and respect for self and others has on an orderly learning environment. Provides disciplinary actions for students who violate the dress code, etc.

2098.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00951; Amendment(s) adopted (956108, 866150) -SJ 00951; Substituted CS/HB 7179 -SJ 00951; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7179 (Ch. 2010-139) -SJ 00951
2098.title: Qualifying Improvements To Real Property [WPSC]
2098.description: Authorizes a local government to levy non-ad valorem assessments to fund certain improvements. Authorizes a property owner to apply for funding and enter into a financing agreement with a local government to finance certain improvements. Authorizes a local government to collect moneys for such purposes through non-ad valorem assessments. Authorizes a local government to incur debt payable from revenues received from the improved property, etc.

2099.title: Metropolitan Planning Organizations [CPSC]
2099.description: Requires the designation of a metropolitan planning organization for each urbanized area of the state meeting a certain population threshold. Provides processes for the redesignation of an M.P.O. Requires that a metropolitan transportation planning process be continuous, cooperative, coordinated, and comprehensive. Specifies prevailing principles to be considered by an M.P.O. during the development of a transportation improvement program, etc.

2100.title: Summary Judgment [SPSC]
2100.description: Encourages the Supreme Court to adopt rules authorizing a party to appeal an order denying a motion for summary judgment.

2101.title: Department of State/Government Accountability Act [CPSC]
2101.description: Reenacts a specified provision relating to the establishment of the Department of State. Assigns various duties of the Executive Office of the Governor relating to notaries public to the department. Renames the State Library Council. Requires state agencies to furnish copies of state publications to the Library of Congress. Deletes provisions establishing The Grove Advisory Council, etc.

2102.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
2102.title: Transportation Corporations [CPSC]
2102.description: Removes provisions that provide for nonprofit corporations to act on behalf of the DOT to secure and obtain rights-of-way for transportation systems and to assist in the planning and design of such systems. Repeals specified provisions relating to the Florida Transportation Corporation Act, definition of terms used in the act, legislative findings and purpose, authorization of corporations, type and structure and income of corporation, etc.

2103.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
2103.title: Dependency Procedures [SPSC]
2103.description: Prohibits a child from being taken into custody unless there is an immediate threat to the health or safety of the child or pursuant to a court order that is based on certain findings. Provides for a trial on the issue of terminating parental rights. Requires that the report and recommendations of a citizen review panel be attached to a written order relating to a termination of parental rights, etc.

2104.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2104.title: Community Corrections [SPSC]
2104.description: Requires each public safety coordinating council to cooperate with the local offender advisory council when preparing the comprehensive public safety plan. Requires the creation of a local offender advisory council in each county or a combination thereof. Requires each public safety coordinating council to prepare, develop, and implement such a plan for the county or the geographic area represented by the county consortium, etc.

2105.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2105.title: Community Corrections Trust Fund/DOC [WPSC]
2105.description: Creates the Community Corrections Trust Fund within the Department of Corrections. Specifies the purpose of the trust fund. Provides a funding source for the trust fund. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

2106.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1073 (Ch. 2010-224)
2106.title: Agency for Persons with Disabilities [SPSC]
2106.description: Authorizes the agency to use information in the Department of Children and Family Services' central abuse hotline for licensure purposes. Requires facility staff to obtain training in detecting, reporting, and preventing abuse, neglect, exploitation, and sexual abuse. Revises the types of violations that may result in license denial, revocation, or suspension or the imposition of an administrative fine, etc.

2107.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
2107.title: Public Printing [GPSC]
2107.description: Provides that an agency may enter into an agreement with a private vendor for the private publication of public information materials under which the costs of publication will be borne in whole or in part by the vendor in return for the right of the vendor to include in the publication a safety message related to the subject matter of the publication, etc.

2108.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
2108.title: Cigarette Products of Nonsettling Manufacturers [WPSC]
2108.description: Imposes a fee on the sale, receipt, purchase, possession, consumption, handling, distribution, and use of nonsettling manufacturer cigarettes that are required to have a stamp affixed or stamp insignia applied to the package of cigarettes on which tax is otherwise required to be paid. Provides that the fee imposed is in addition to any other privilege, license, fee, or tax required or imposed by state law, etc.

2112.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2112.title: Maternal and Child Health [SPSC]
2112.description: Creates the "Florida Nurse Home Visitation Act." Establishes a nurse home visitation pilot program in specified areas. Requires local Healthy Start coalitions to administer the program. Provides duties of the Department of Health. Provides for administration and evaluation of the program. Requires the department to submit an annual report to the Governor and Legislature, etc.

2113.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 550 (Ch. 2010-205)
2113.title: Sewage Disposal Facilities [EPSC]
2113.description: Requires entities that divert wastewater from facilities discharging domestic wastewater through ocean outfalls to meet specified reuse requirements. Provides that such reuse contributes to the reuse requirement of the facilities originally accepting the flows.

2114.title: Educational Plant Surveys [WPSC]
2114.description: Authorizes an extension to a school district educational plant survey submission deadline. Provides requirements for the submission of a request for an extension to the Department of Education and requiring department approval. Provides restrictions on school district construction during the extension period. Requires the State Board of Education to adopt rules.

2116.last_action: Died in Committee on Rules, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 1485 (Ch. 2010-265)
2116.title: Public Transportation Commission/Hillsborough Co.
2116.description: Amends a specified provision relating to the Public Transportation Commission. Redefines the terms "basic life support ambulance" and "wrecker". Clarifies provisions.

2119.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2119.title: Hospice Care [SPSC]
2119.description: Authorizes a licensed hospice to provide care to a person who has a life-limiting illness but who is not admitted to a hospice program. Provides for such services to include the person's family. Clarifies that the act does not prohibit the provision of palliative care by other authorized providers or facilities. Provides that the act does not mandate or prescribe additional Medicaid coverage, etc.

2120.last_action: Died in Committee on Military Affairs and Domestic Security
2120.title: Illegal Immigration [GPSC]
2120.description: Prohibits restrictions on the reporting of certain immigration status information by public employees. Prohibits certain local governmental restrictions on communicating or cooperating with federal officials concerning a person's citizenship or immigration status.

2121.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
2121.title: Public Food Service Establishments [CPSC]
2121.description: Requires public food service establishments to serve sugar free substitutes for certain syrups and fruit preserves and provide notice to guests of the availability of such sugar free substitutes. Provides requirements for such notice.

2122.title: Animal Control or Cruelty Ordinances [EPSC]
2122.description: Requires a county or municipality enacting an ordinance relating to animal control or cruelty to impose a specified surcharge on the civil penalty for violations of the ordinance. Specifies use of the proceeds of the surcharge. Provides construction.

2124.title: Honey
2124.description: Exempts beekeepers who produce, bottle, and sell their own honey directly to consumers from the requirement to obtain a food permit. Requires the DOACS to establish a workgroup to develop best-management practices for bottling honey in a home environment, etc.

2125.last_action: Died in Committee on General Government Appropriations
2125.title: Florida's One-Stop Business Connect Act [CPSC]
2125.description: Requires the Governor to establish the One-Stop Business Workgroup. Authorizes the workgroup to consult with other agencies and use consultants. Provides requirements for the licensing portal plan to implement a technology solution for businesses and individuals to access state business licenses, certifications, and registrations, etc.

2126.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 971 (Ch. 2010-223)
2126.title: Window Sunscreening Exclusions [CPSC]
2126.description: Excludes vehicles operated by persons with certain medical conditions from certain restrictions. Excludes vehicles owned or leased by private investigative agencies or private investigators from certain restrictions. Provides rulemaking authority to the HSMV regarding sunscreening restrictions.

2127.last_action: Died in Senate, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152), HB 5705 (Ch. 2010-165)
2127.title: State Employees/Collective Bargaining [WPSC]
2127.description: Provides for the resolution of collective bargaining issues at impasse between the State of Florida and certified bargaining units of state employees.

2131.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
2131.title: SSB/State Financial Matters [WPSC]
2131.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to state financial matters.

2132.last_action: Withdrawn from Children, Families, and Elder Affairs; Education Pre-K - 12; Commerce; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means -SJ 00522; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00522
2132.title: Early Learning [SPSC]
2132.description: Provides for a type two transfer of the Office of Early Learning within the DOE and the child care facility licensing responsibilities of the DCFS to the Office of Early Learning within the Agency for Workforce Innovation. Conforms provisions and cross-references to changes made by the act. Provides for the continued validity of child care facility licenses and registrations issued under ch. 402, etc.

2134.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5201 (Ch. 2010-155)
2134.title: Resident Status for Tuition Purposes [SPSC]
2134.description: Revises residency requirements for certain dependent children. Revises requirements relating to proof of employment in the state. Provides for classification as residents for tuition purposes of certain individuals who have attended a Florida public high school and individuals who receive certain tuition exemptions or waivers, etc.

2136.last_action: Withdrawn from Agriculture; Governmental Oversight and Accountability; General Government Appropriations; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
2136.title: Private Investigative/Security/Repossession Svcs. [EPSC]
2136.description: Creates the Board of Investigation, Security, and Recovery within the DOACS. Provides for members of the board to be appointed by the Commissioner of Agriculture. Provides for the transfer of functions from the DOACS to the board. Provides for annual budget requests. Provides for an annual report to the Governor and Legislature. Deletes provisions relating to the Private Investigation, Recovery, and Security Advisory Council, etc.

2138.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
2138.title: Sustainable and Renewable Energy Policy TF/DEP [EPSC]
2138.description: Creates the Sustainable and Renewable Energy Policy Trust Fund within the Florida Energy Office. Specifies the purpose of the trust fund. Provides a funding source for the trust fund. Provides for the balance in the trust fund to be carried forward each year. Provides for the future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

2139.title: State Financial Information [WPSC]
2139.description: Requires the Auditor General to annually provide to the Legislature a list of school districts that have failed to comply with certain financial transparency requirements, as identified pursuant to audit. Requires the Office of Policy and Budget within the Executive Office of the Governor to maintain the state's financial data on the state website for a specified period, etc.

2140.title: Motor Vehicle Dealers [CPSC]
2140.description: Provides clarification regarding licensure renewal requirements. Requires the submission of an affidavit along with a license renewal application acknowledging that the provisions of the licensee's franchise agreements are consistent with the requirements of laws and rules.

2141.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2141.title: Detention by Licensed Security Officers [SPSC]
2141.description: Authorizes certain licensed security officers to detain certain individuals until the arrival of a law enforcement officer. Authorizes limited searches of certain persons when a licensed security officer has probable cause to believe that the person is armed with a dangerous weapon. Defines the term "probable cause" for the purpose of temporarily detaining a person suspected of having committed a crime, etc.

2142.last_action: Died in Committee on Regulated Industries
2142.title: Amusement Arcades [CPSC]
2142.description: Provides for the regulation and licensing of amusement arcades by the DOACS. Provides qualifications and for the issuance of licenses. Prohibits local governments from issuing local licenses or permits to unlicensed persons. Prohibits certain acts and provides penalties for violations. Provides for a gross receipts tax. Provides recordkeeping requirements. Prohibits certain activities by licensees, etc.

2143.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 951 (Ch. 2010-62), CS/HB 5401 (Ch. 2010-162), CS/HB 7069 (Ch. 2010-114)
2143.title: Background Screening [SPSC]
2143.description: Revises background screening requirements for the Guardian Ad Litem Program, mental health personnel, nursing home personnel, home health agency personnel, nurse registry personnel, and companions and homemakers. Provides background screening requirements for prescribed pediatric extended care centers. Revises provisions relating to the Criminal Justice Information Program under the FDLE, etc.

2144.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations
2144.title: Vehicle Crashes Involving Death [SPSC]
2144.description: Requires that a defendant arrested for leaving the scene of a crash involving death must be held in custody until brought before a judge for admittance to bail in certain circumstances.

2145.title: Motor Fuel Marketing Practices Act [CPSC]
2145.description: Repeals specified provisions relating to definitions to conform. Repeals s. 526.304, F.S., relating to unlawful predatory practices and exceptions thereto. Amends specified provision relating to unlawful discriminatory practices and exceptions. Repeals specified provision relating to exempt sales made by a refiner, etc.

2146.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
2146.title: New Markets Development Program [WPSC]
2146.description: Revises the definition of the term "qualified active low-income community business" for purposes of the New Markets Development Program Act.

2147.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
2147.title: State-approved Teacher Preparation Programs [SPSC]
2147.description: Specifies that the State Board of Education adopt rules that require certain students in state-approved teacher preparation programs to assist teachers with low-performing students in reading as part of certain field experiences.

2148.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2148.title: Public Deposits/Security [CPSC]
2148.description: Provides additional parameters for determining pledging levels for each qualified public depository. Provides a procedure by which a qualified public depository may become an electing public depository. Provides that such a depository may terminate its election upon written notice to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Authorizes the CFO to deny such revocation upon consideration of specified factors, etc.

2149.title: Transportation Funding [WPSC]
2149.description: Increases the percentage of state revenues deposited into the State Transportation Trust Fund to be committed by the DOT for public transportation projects.

2152.last_action: Died in Committee on Health and Human Services Appropriations
2152.title: Premarital Preparation [SPSC]
2152.description: Provides for the creation and revision of the Florida Marriage Handbook. Creates the Marriage Education Committee. Provides for membership on the committee. Specifies the content and authors for Parts A and B of the handbook. Requires the committee to be reconstituted once every 10 years for the purpose of reviewing and updating the content in the handbook. Requires the committee to submit a report to the Legislature by a specified date, etc.

2153.title: Liability Releases [SPSC]
2153.description: Redefines the term "nonspectators" to include a minor on whose behalf a natural guardian has signed a motorsport liability release. Provides that a motorsport liability release signed by a natural guardian on behalf of a minor participating in a sanctioned motorsports event is valid to the same extent as for other nonspectators, etc.

2154.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 7237 (Ch. 2010-78)
2154.title: State University System [SPSC]
2154.description: Revises the powers and duties of the Board of Governors relating to accountability. Requires that the board align the missions of each constituent university. Revises provisions that require a Florida college to provide notice of its intent to propose a baccalaureate degree program, etc.

2155.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
2155.title: Public-private Partnership Infrastructure Projects [WPSC]
2155.description: Provides for state agencies and local governments to receive or solicit proposals to enter into a public works infrastructure project agreement with a private entity, or a consortium of private entities, to build, operate, or finance a public works infrastructure project. Authorizes the private entity to impose user fees for the use of the infrastructure project by the public, etc.

2156.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2156.title: Parental Notice of Abortion [SPSC]
2156.description: Revises notice requirements relating to the termination of a pregnancy of a minor. Provides exceptions to the notice requirements. Revises procedure for judicial waiver of notice. Provides that in a hearing relating to waiving the requirement for parental notice, the court consider certain additional factors, including whether the minor's decision to terminate her pregnancy was due to undue influence. Requires mandatory reporting of child abuse, etc.

2157.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 971 (Ch. 2010-223)
2157.title: Vehicle Operation [CPSC]
2157.description: Redefines the term "electric personal assistive mobility device" to include additional devices for transporting one person. Authorizes local governments to regulate certain vehicles and other motorized devices operating on sidewalks. Exempts motorized wheelchairs from certain ordinances. Authorizes local governments to enact ordinances permitting the use of golf carts on sidewalks, etc.

2158.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00781; Substituted HB 1279 -SJ 00781; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 1279 (Ch. 2010-66) -SJ 00781
2158.title: Property Tax [WPSC]
2158.description: Creates an exception from the assessment of back taxes on property that was not assessed by a property appraiser.

2160.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/SB 1752 (Ch. 2010-147)
2160.title: Sales & Use Tax/Boat Sales [WPSC]
2160.description: Cites act as the "Florida Maritime Full Employment Act." Imposes a maximum limitation on the amount of tax collected on sales of boats in this state.

2161.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2161.title: Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Compact [CPSC]
2161.description: Creates the Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Commission. Provides responsibilities of the commission. Specifies the commission as an instrumentality of the compact states. Provides for venue. Specifies the powers of the commission. Provides for organization of the commission. Provides for membership, voting, and bylaws. Designates the Commissioner of the OIR as the representative of Florida on the commission, etc.

2162.last_action: Withdrawn from Regulated Industries; Banking and Insurance; Judiciary -SJ 00321; Withdrawn from further consideration, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 1196 (Ch. 2010-174) -SJ 00321
2162.title: Condominium Foreclosures [CPSC]
2162.description: Authorizes a condominium association to demand payment from tenants of future rents to the association in lieu of payment to the unit owner. Requires that coverage under a unit owner's policy for certain assessments include at least a minimum amount of loss assessment coverage. Requires that adequate property insurance be based upon the replacement cost of the property to be insured as determined by an independent appraisal or update of a prior appraisal, etc.

2163.last_action: Placed on Special Order Calendar; Read 2nd time -SJ 00701; Substituted HB 1581 -SJ 00701; Laid on Table, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 1581 (Ch. 2010-88) -SJ 00701
2163.title: Florida Atlantic Univ./Doctor of Medicine Program [WPSC]
2163.description: Authorizes a doctor of medicine degree program at Florida Atlantic University.

2164.title: Federal Grants TF/Department of Community Affairs [WPSC]
2164.description: Creates the Federal Grants Trust Fund within the Department of Community Affairs. Provides for sources of funds and purposes. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

2165.title: Hospital Liens
2165.description: Provides that a hospital is entitled to a lien on the recovery of damages from a tortfeasor who caused or contributed to the illness or injury of a patient. Specifies methods to resolve disputes between the hospital and patient concerning the amount of the hospital's charges and whether the amount of the patient's attorney's fees and costs apportioned to the hospital produce an equitable result, etc.

2166.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
2166.title: Public Officers [WPSC]
2166.description: Prohibits severance pay for nonelected public officers except under specified circumstances. Prohibits certain limitations on discussing an employment dispute or settlement.

2167.last_action: Withdrawn from Community Affairs; Education Pre-K - 12; Governmental Oversight and Accountability; Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means -SJ 00635; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00635
2167.title: Florida Retirement System/Credible Service Years [WPSC]
2167.description: Redefines the term "average final compensation" to reduce the number of years of credible service used to calculate such compensation. Conforms a provision relating to the calculation of the monthly normal retirement benefit.

2168.title: Regional Transportation [CPSC]
2168.description: Creates the Northeast Florida Regional Transportation Study Commission. Provides for the Jacksonville Transportation Authority to staff the commission. Provides for funding of the commission. Provides for the commission to make available to the public its meeting minutes, reports, and recommendations and publish its reports and recommendations electronically, etc.

2169.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1073 (Ch. 2010-224)
2169.title: Education of Children with Disabilities [SPSC]
2169.description: Cites this act as the "Disabilities in Education Act." Requires minimum training for child care personnel to include the identification and care of children with developmental disabilities. Revises requirements for student eligibility to participate in the John M. McKay Scholarships for Students with Disabilities Program. Requires regional autism centers to provide certain support for serving children with developmental disabilities, etc.

2170.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation and Economic Development Appropriations
2170.title: Space Business Investment & Financial Services TF [CPSC]
2170.description: Creates said trust fund within the OTTED in the Executive Office of the Governor. Provides the purpose of the fund. Provides sources of funds. Provides uses for the fund. Provides for the balance in the trust fund to be carried forward at the end of each fiscal year. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

2172.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
2172.title: Workforce [CPSC]
2172.description: Requires that job orders placed with the state's job bank system for the purpose of hiring certain nonagricultural workers under a federal temporary visa program remain active for a specified period. Requires a job order to be posted within the area of intended employment, etc.

2173.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
2173.title: Auditory-oral Education Programs [SPSC]
2173.description: Provides that a child who is deaf and enrolled in a recognized auditory-oral program at a school certified by a nationally recognized certifying body of auditory-oral programs or at a private school in which the supervisor and the majority of staff are certified as Listening and Spoken Language Specialists may continue attending such school and complete the development of listening and spoken language skills if specified criteria are met, etc.

2175.title: Guardianship and Protective Proceedings [SPSC]
2175.description: Creates the Uniform Adult Guardianship and Protective Proceedings Jurisdiction Act. Provides that, for the purpose of applying the act, a court of this state may treat a foreign country as if it were a state. Provides that the act provides the exclusive jurisdictional basis for a court of this state to appoint a guardian or issue a protective order for an adult, etc.

2176.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
2176.title: Department of Children and Family Services [SPSC]
2176.description: Authorizes the department to establish circuits and regions headed by circuit administrators and regional directors. Changes the name of the department to the "Department of Children and Families." Deletes provisions relating to the program directors for mental health and substance abuse, the service districts, child protection workers, the membership of community alliances, and the prototype region, etc.

2177.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
2177.title: Public Officers & Employees/Code of Ethics [GPSC]
2177.description: Redefines the terms "business entity," "candidate," and "gift" as they relate to the code of ethics for public officers and employees. Provides standards of conduct for such officers and employees of state agencies with regard to improper influence in the performance of official duties. Prohibits a public official from appointing, employing, or promoting a relative for a position in an agency in which the official is a member of the collegial body, etc.

2178.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 551 (Ch. 2010-130), HB 7085 (Ch. 2010-116)
2178.title: Pub. Rec./Code of Ethics/Commission on Ethics [GPSC]
2178.description: Provides an exemption from public records requirements for a determination by the Commission on Ethics regarding an information or a referral of an alleged violation of the Code of Ethics for Public Officers and Employees. Provides an exemption from public meetings requirements for any proceeding conducted by the commission or a local Commission on Ethics and Public Trust pursuant to such information or referral, etc.

2179.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
2179.title: State Employee Benefits [WPSC]
2179.description: Prohibits separate benefit plans and different levels of state contributions for employees exempt from career service. Provides an exception for State University System employees. Subjects premium levels necessary for full funding of the state group health insurance program to certain requirements.

2181.title: Corporate Income Taxes [WPSC]
2181.description: Limits deductions of certain intangible expenses, licensing fees, and management fees paid by a taxpayer to a related entity. Creates exceptions to the limitations on deductions. Limits the number of times certain items may be added or subtracted from taxable income. Provides that the failure of a taxpayer to add certain amounts to a taxpayer's income or provide complete information in a tax return is negligence, etc.

2182.last_action: Withdrawn from Health Regulation; Banking and Insurance; Health and Human Services Appropriations -SJ 00635; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00635
2182.title: Hospital-based Physicians [SPSC]
2182.description: Prohibits a licensed facility from employing a hospital-based physician or group of hospital-based physicians or entering into a contract with such physicians unless those physicians are under contract with each health insurer that has contracted with the licensed facility to provide medical services, etc.

2183.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
2183.title: Regulation of Vessels [EPSC]
2183.description: Removes restrictions on county and municipality regulation of certain non-live-aboard vessels not in navigation.

2184.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2184.title: Colorectal Cancer Screening Insurance Coverage [CPSC]
2184.description: Requires certain health insurance policies, HMO contracts, health insurance programs, group arrangements, and managed health care delivery entities providing coverage to state residents to provide coverage for certain colorectal cancer examinations and laboratory tests for colorectal cancer. Requires coverage of certain evidence-based screening strategies. Prohibits certain deductible or coinsurance requirements, etc.

2185.last_action: Died in Committee on Rules, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 1247 (Ch. 2010-259)
2185.title: Hillsborough County/Children's Museum of Tampa
2185.description: Authorizes the Division of Alcoholic Beverages and Tobacco of the DBPR to issue an alcoholic beverage license to the Children's Museum of Tampa, Inc., to use within the museum's building and on its grounds. Provides that the license may be used only for special events. Authorizes transfer and provides for subsequent reversion of the license under certain circumstances, etc.

2187.title: Wireless Communications Devices in Motor Vehicles [CPSC]
2187.description: Prohibits reading, writing, or using a wireless communications device for text messaging while driving a motor vehicle. Provides exceptions. Prohibits the use of a wireless telephone while driving a motor vehicle unless the telephone is designed and used for hands-free talking and listening. Prohibits operators of school buses or other public transportation vehicles from operating such vehicles while using a wireless telephone, etc.

2188.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2188.title: Sellers of Travel [CPSC]
2188.description: Provides that exemptions do not apply to sellers of travel of specified services to terrorist nations. Provides a definition. Provides for application of the act.

2189.title: Entities Doing Business With Iran/Restrictions [GPSC]
2189.description: Prohibits the state from entering into, awarding, or renewing a contract or purchasing agreement for commodities or contractual services with, or receiving or soliciting proposals for the acquisition of commodities or contractual services from, any business entity doing business with Iran. Provides an exception for the State Board of Administration. Provides for the cessation of such prohibition under specified circumstances, etc.

2190.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2190.title: Evidence of Crimes [SPSC]
2190.description: Provides that governmental entities are required to maintain physical evidence for potential DNA testing only for serious crimes. Provides that only the portion of a piece of evidence that is likely to contain biological evidence must be retained and other portions of that piece of evidence may be disposed of when the physical evidence is of such a size, bulk, or physical character as to render retention impracticable, etc.

2191.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
2191.title: Impact Fees [EPSC]
2191.description: Authorizes counties, municipalities, and special districts to exempt certain affordable housing from payment of impact fees under certain circumstances.

2192.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2192.title: Criminal Conduct [SPSC]
2192.description: Defines the term "mental injury." Exempts constitutionally protected acts from prohibitions on child abuse, aggravated child abuse, and neglect. Redefines the term "crime" for purposes of crime victim compensation to include additional forms of injury, etc.

2193.last_action: Died in Committee on Military Affairs and Domestic Security
2193.title: Emergency Volunteer Health Practitioners Act [GPSC]
2193.description: Cites this part as the "Uniform Emergency Volunteer Practitioners Act." Provides for the regulation of specified health services by the Division of Emergency Management of the DCA, in cooperation with the DOH, the AHCA, and the Board of Veterinary Medicine, while an emergency declaration is in effect. Provides limitations on civil liability for volunteer health practitioners, etc.

2195.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2195.title: Medical Home Pilot Project [WPSC]
2195.description: Requires the AHCA to establish such a pilot project. Provides for the organization of medical home networks. Requires the Secretary of Health Care Administration to appoint a task force to develop and implement the project. Provides for enrollment of Medipass beneficiaries. Requires the agency to collaborate with the OIR to encourage licensed insurers to incorporate the principles of the medical home network in insurance plans, etc.

2196.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
2196.title: Financial Emergencies [EPSC]
2196.description: Requires a plan of a county or municipality to improve the efficiency, accountability, and coordination of the delivery of local government services to include a structural and services consolidation plan if the county or municipality is subject to review and oversight by the Governor, etc.

2198.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2198.title: Criminal Proceedings/Prejudice and Improper Bias [SPSC]
2198.description: Creates the "Judicial Fair Play Act." Requires prosecutors to investigate all evidence relating to defendants and provide exculpatory evidence to the defense. Provides that the failure of a prosecutor to provide such evidence to the defense is evidence of prejudice and improper bias. Provides for the prosecution of prosecutors and judges for prejudice and improper bias in a circuit designated by rule of the Supreme Court, etc.

2200.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2200.title: Correctional Probation Officers [WPSC]
2200.description: Revises the definition of the term "emergency rescue or public safety worker" to include correctional probation officers in provisions relating to certain communicable diseases suffered in the line of duty. Revises provisions relating to death benefits to include correctional probation officers.

2201.title: Civil Citations/Minor's Nonjudicial Arrest Record [SPSC]
2201.description: Requires the expungement of the nonjudicial arrest record of a minor who successfully completes a civil citation program. Requires the Department of Law Enforcement to expunge the nonjudicial record of the arrest of a minor who successfully completes a civil citation program. Sets forth the conditions that apply in order for the department to expunge the record. Authorizes the department to charge a processing fee.

2202.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
2202.title: Model Ordinance For Fertilizer Use [EPSC]
2202.description: Revises a reference to the Model Ordinance for Florida-Friendly Fertilizer Use on Urban Landscapes. Revises the criteria for a local government's adoption of more stringent standards.

2204.title: Sales and Use Tax/Collection and Administration [WPSC]
2204.description: Authorizes the DOR to contract to develop and implement the Internet Sales Tax Automated Revenue Tracking program as a system for collecting and administering sales and use taxes. Requires a report to the Governor and Legislature. Provides for disclosure of information under the program. Provides a penalty. Provides for reducing the rate of the state sales and use tax under certain revenue certification circumstances, etc.

2206.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5311 (Ch. 2010-161)
2206.title: Medical Devices [SPSC]
2206.description: Requires certain entities to notify local emergency services medical directors of the locations of automated external defibrillators. Revises the list of exemptions from the requirement that certain persons engaged in the manufacture, repackaging, or assembly of medical devices hold a device manufacturer permit, etc.

2207.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
2207.title: Grade Level Assignment Assessments/DOE [SPSC]
2207.description: Requires that the DOE adopt assessments for grade level assignment of a student who attended a private school or home school and who is transferring to or enrolling in public school. Requires that the assessments be based upon state-adopted grade level standards. Requires that parents allow for their child to be assessed regardless of the date of enrollment during the school year, etc.

2208.title: Offense of Sexting [SPSC]
2208.description: Provides that a minor commits the offense of sexting if he or she knowingly uses a computer, or any other device capable of electronic data transmission or distribution, to transmit or distribute to another minor any photograph or video of himself or herself which depicts nudity and is harmful to minors. Provides noncriminal and criminal penalties, etc.

2209.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
2209.title: Doctor of Dental Medicine Degree Program/FAMU [WPSC]
2209.description: Authorizes a program for a doctor of dental medicine degree at Florida Agricultural and Mechanical University.

2210.title: Regional Workforce Boards/Employment Eligibility [CPSC]
2210.description: Requires each regional workforce board to verify the employment eligibility of any job applicant who is referred to an employer. Requires the use of certain specified federal verification processes. Requires that the board issue a certificate of such verification. Clarifies that such verification does not release the employer from certain obligations regarding the employment of authorized persons.

2211.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2211.title: Criminal Prosecution of Juveniles [SPSC]
2211.description: Provides additional circumstances for the direct filing of charges against certain juveniles. Provides criteria for determining when a case against a juvenile should be recommended to the court to be transferred for criminal prosecution. Provides criteria for consideration of a child's request to an adult court to return a criminal case to the juvenile justice system.

2212.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
2212.title: Electric Utilities [EPSC]
2212.description: Requires electric utilities to annually report to the PSC the name, title, and salary of each executive officer receiving a salary above a certain amount. Defines the term "executive officer." Requires the report to include information for a person who was replaced during the year of the report.

2213.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
2213.title: Tax Credits [CPSC]
2213.description: Revises the priority of tax credits that may be taken against the corporate income tax or the franchise tax. Authorizes aerospace-sector jobs tax credits and tuition reimbursement tax credits. Authorizes a tax credit to aerospace businesses based on the salary or tuition reimbursed to certain employees. Prohibits a business from claiming an aerospace-sector jobs tax credit and a tuition reimbursement tax credit for the same employee, etc.

2215.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
2215.title: Advanced Clean Energy Development Tax Credit [EPSC]
2215.description: Authorizes a business to receive the advanced clean energy development tax credit for a project to conduct clean energy research in development within the territory of the John F. Kennedy Space Center. Provides that only one business may receive the tax credit. Provides for Space Florida to issue an order certifying that the business is qualified to receive the tax credit, etc.

2216.title: Group Insurance for Public Employees [SPSC]
2216.description: Requires that school districts procure certain types of insurance through interlocal agreements. Requires that each school district in this state enter into a specified type of interlocal agreement and establish the School District Insurance Consortium. Requires that the consortium be governed by a board of directors consisting of a specified number of members. Requires that the DMS provide technical services to the consortium, etc.

2217.title: Traffic Regulations To Assist Blind Persons [CPSC]
2217.description: Increases the penalty imposed against an unauthorized person who carries a raised white cane on a public roadway. Increases the penalty imposed for failing to stop and yield to a blind person attempting to cross a roadway. Reenacts a specified provision relating to the disposition of civil penalties, to incorporate the amendment made by this act to s. 318.18, F.S., in a reference thereto.

2218.title: Handbill Distribution [SPSC]
2218.description: Provides additional penalties for the offense of unlawfully distributing handbills in a public lodging establishment. Specifies that certain items used in committing such offense are subject to seizure and forfeiture under the Florida Contraband Forfeiture Act, etc.

2219.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2219.title: Health Care Regulation [SPSC]
2219.description: Revises provisions relating to the requirement for certain medical facilities to maintain an internal risk management program and submit adverse incident reports. Specifies the duties and responsibilities for the home health agency administrator, director of nursing, nurses, therapists, home health aides, and certified nursing assistants. Revises provisions relating to home health service agreements, plans of care, and the supervision of services, etc.

2220.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2220.title: Juvenile Proceedings/Use of Restraints/Isolation [SPSC]
2220.description: Requires the DJJ to adopt rules governing the procedures that may be used to restrain a child upon his or her arrival at the courthouse. Prohibits the use of instruments of restraint on a child after the child arrives at the courthouse except in specified circumstances. Prohibits subjecting a child to extended periods of isolation. Conforms a cross-reference.

2221.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
2221.title: Public Schools/Instruction/Conflict-resolution [SPSC]
2221.description: Requires that the character-development program for kindergarten through grade 12 include conflict-resolution management.

2223.title: Paintball Guns and Markers [CPSC]
2223.description: Defines the terms "paintball gun" and "paintball marker." Prohibits a person from carrying a paintball gun or paintball marker in a vehicle on a highway. Provides specified exceptions. Provides that the act does not apply to a commercial paintball field, range, or course when passengers are transported to and from designated player areas. Provides that a violation of the act is a first-degree misdemeanor.

2224.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2224.title: Smoking In Vehicles/Minor Passengers [CPSC]
2224.description: Provides for enhanced penalties for any moving or nonmoving violation committed by a person driving or in control of a motor vehicle while a person in the vehicle is smoking when a minor is in the vehicle, regardless of whether the vehicle is in operation or parked. Provides that enforcement must only be a secondary action when the driver of the motor vehicle has been detained for another violation of specified provisions, etc.

2225.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
2225.title: Alternative Energy Resources Study [EPSC]
2225.description: Requires the Century Commission for a Sustainable Florida to contract with a professional organization to study an alternative energy policy for the state and develop a renewable energy and economic development investment plan. Sets forth the subjects to be studied by the contracting organization. Requires that such organization submit a final report to the Governor, the President of the Senate, and the Speaker of the House of Representatives, etc.

2226.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
2226.title: Local Government Comprehensive Plans [EPSC]
2226.description: Exempts certain municipalities from certain capital improvements element and schedule update requirements and certain comprehensive plan amendment prohibitions under certain circumstances. Exempts certain municipalities from certain water supply element requirements for future land use principles and guidelines. Revises a municipal revenue criterion relating to annual financial audit requirements, etc.

2227.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2227.title: Grade K-12 Schools/Locker Rooms [SPSC]
2227.description: Requires that locker rooms in K-12 schools be locked when not in use by students or other authorized persons and be directly supervised by faculty or staff when in use by students. Provides fines for violations. Provides for the use of any fines that are collected.

2228.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
2228.title: Water Management District Governing Boards [EPSC]
2228.description: Establishes a water management district governing board nominating commission. Requires the Executive Office of the Governor to provide administrative support to the commission and to adopt rules. Requires governing boards to obtain legislative authorization for acquisition costs and professional service procurement costs in excess of specified amounts, etc.

2230.title: Actions Against Public Officers/Employees/Agents [SPSC]
2230.description: Authorizes counties, municipalities, political subdivisions, and agencies of the state which have been excluded from participation in the Insurance Risk Management Trust Fund to require their officers, employees, and agents to make payments of certain judgments under certain circumstances, etc.

2231.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
2231.title: Forensic Mental Health [SPSC]
2231.description: Provides additional responsibilities for certain contractors of the DCFS. Provides for involuntary outpatient treatment plans that require patients to take all prescribed medications in certain circumstances. Provides for the creation of a forensic mental health probation and parole program. Authorizes the chief judge of each circuit to establish a mental health court. Requires that the OPPAGA perform a study of the forensic mental health system, etc.

2233.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1073 (Ch. 2010-224)
2233.title: Students with Disabilities in Public Schools [SPSC]
2233.description: Requires that manual physical restraint, mechanical restraint, and seclusion be used in an emergency or as part of a comprehensive behavior intervention plan developed by a certified behavior analyst and approved by an individual education plan team under certain circumstances. Provides restrictions on the use of such restraints and seclusion. Prohibits the use of such restraints and seclusion by school personnel who are not certified or trained, etc.

2234.last_action: Died on Calendar, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 2176 (Ch. 2010-175)
2234.title: Warranty Associations [CPSC]
2234.description: Provides penalties for certain licensure violations. Prohibits service agreement companies from issuing certain deceptive advertisements, operating without a subsisting license, or remitting premiums to a person other than the obligated service agreement company. Deletes a requirement that certain service agreement forms be approved by the OIR of the Financial Services Commission, etc.

2235.last_action: Died in Committee on Finance and Tax, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 1237 (Ch. 2010-132), CS/CS/SB 998 (Ch. 2010-122)
2235.title: Estate Tax [WPSC]
2235.description: Cites act as the "Florida Taxpayers Protection Act." Imposes a retaliatory tax on property of a nonresident decedent when the nonresident's state of domicile imposes inheritance, estate, or other death taxes on Florida residents. Authorizes a court to construe the terms of certain wills to define the respective shares or determine beneficiaries under certain circumstances. Provides for nonapplication to certain dispositions, etc.

2236.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
2236.title: Regulation of State Lands & Oil and Gas Resources [EPSC]
2236.description: Provides for the Board of Trustees of the Internal Improvement Trust Fund to accept and award bids for oil and gas leases on submerged lands underlying the territorial waters of the state. Provides for easements over sovereign submerged lands for the construction, installation, and maintenance of structures relating to the production of oil, gas, or other petroleum products, etc.

2237.title: Public Records/Proceedings to Determine Incapacity [SPSC]
2237.description: Creates an exemption from public records requirements for reports of examining committee members in proceedings to determine incapacity. Provides for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption. Provides a statement of public necessity.

2238.title: Adult Guardianship [SPSC]
2238.description: Redesignates part II of ch. 744, F.S., as "Venue and Jurisdiction." Provides purposes for and construction of jurisdictional provisions. Provides for treatment of foreign countries for specified purposes. Requires that factual information included in a petition alleging incapacity not include any information that is confidential or for which the alleged incapacitated person maintains a right to privacy, etc.

2239.title: Public Records/Petitions to Determine Incapacity [SPSC]
2239.description: Creates an exemption from public records requirements for petitions to determine incapacity. Provides for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption. Provides a statement of public necessity.

2240.last_action: Died in Committee on Ethics and Elections
2240.title: Florida Commission on Ethics [GPSC]
2240.description: Authorizes the Commission on Ethics to initiate on its own volition an investigation of an alleged violation of the code of ethics and of any other breach of the public trust. Increases the civil penalty that may be imposed on public officers, employees, and others for violating the code of ethics and for any other breach of the public trust, etc.

2241.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
2241.title: Municipal Electric Utilities [EPSC]
2241.description: Revises the definition of the term "public utility" to include certain municipal electric utilities for a specified minimum period. Provides that said utilities are not exempt from specified provisions regulating public utilities. Provides that the Florida Public Service Commission has the authority to enforce the provisions of the act. Provides rulemaking authority.

2242.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance
2242.title: Attorney's Fees/Workers' Compensation Cases [CPSC]
2242.description: Provides that the finder of fact and law is not bound by provisions of state law relating to the provision of indemnity or medical benefits for employment-related accidents or injuries when awarding attorney's fees in cases involving first responders. Requires that the finder of fact and law consider certain factors when awarding attorney's fees in such cases. Provides a statement of important state interest.

2243.title: State Judicial System [SPSC]
2243.description: Construes application of the common and statute laws of England to this state. Requires the Supreme Court to develop a plan for certain civics promotion and judicial branch education purposes. Requires the Auditor General and the OPPAGA to conduct biennial full audit reviews and examinations of the state courts system and the Judicial Qualifications Commission, etc.

2245.title: Circuit Courts [SPSC]
2245.description: Creates a division of unified family court within each circuit court to coordinate or consolidate cases affecting a single family. Creates a division of teen court and a division of drug and mental health court within each circuit court. Requires counties to fund treatment-based drug court programs.

2246.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
2246.title: Florida Bright Futures Scholarship Program [SPSC]
2246.description: Revises the Florida Bright Futures Scholarship Program beginning with initial awards to students for the 2011 fall term. Provides that, for students receiving initial awards beginning with the 2011 fall term, said scholarship program shall consist of five levels of awards. Provides that the tuition differential shall be included in the calculation of such scholarship program award amounts, etc.

2247.last_action: Died in Committee on Communications, Energy, and Public Utilities
2247.title: Energy Economic Zones [WPSC]
2247.description: Requires the DCA to include in its report on the Energy Economic Zone Pilot Program information relating to incentives available under the program. Exempts certain building materials used in the construction or rehabilitation of energy-efficient structures from the tax on sales, use, and other transactions. Creates an energy economic zone jobs tax credit. Creates the energy economic zone pilot program property tax credit, etc.

2249.last_action: Died in Committee on Higher Education
2249.title: Athletic Coaches and Directors/Diversity in Hiring [SPSC]
2249.description: Defines the term "minority applicant." Requires each state university or Florida college to interview one or more qualified minority applicants when hiring a head athletic coach or an athletic director. Provides an exception. Provides for a defense. Authorizes the State Board of Education and the Board of Governors to adopt rules.

2250.last_action: Died in Committee on Transportation, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/HB 399 (Ch. 2010-86)
2250.title: Motor Vehicle Licenses [CPSC]
2250.description: Provides for a voluntary checkoff on motor vehicle registration applications to permit contributions to Ronald McDonald House. Provides for a voluntary checkoff on driver's license applications to permit contributions to Ronald McDonald House. Provides that such contributions are not considered income of a revenue nature for purposes of a service charge.

2251.last_action: Died in Committee on Health and Human Services Appropriations
2251.title: Homelessness [CPSC]
2251.description: Requires the motor vehicle registration form and registration renewal form, the driver license application form, and the driver license application form for renewal issuance or renewal extension to include an option to make a voluntary contribution to aid the homeless. Requires lead agencies for local homeless assistance continuums of care to track, monitor, and report on assisted families for a specified period of time, etc.

2252.title: Fiscal Stability TF/State Courts System [SPSC]
2252.description: Creates the Fiscal Stability Trust Fund within the state courts system to be administered by the Supreme Court. Provides for the administration of the trust fund and the use of trust fund moneys. Requires balances to remain in the trust fund at the end of the fiscal year. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

2253.last_action: Withdrawn from Governmental Oversight and Accountability; General Government Appropriations -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176) -SJ 00268
2253.title: Energy Efficiency [GPSC]
2253.description: Requires that the DMS consider the energy efficiency of all materials used in the construction, alteration, repair, or rebuilding of a building or facility owned or operated by a state agency. Requires that the DMS adopt rules requiring that all buildings and facilities owned by state agencies use high-efficiency lamps when replacing an existing lamp or installing a new lamp, etc.

2255.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs
2255.title: Water Resource Protection [EPSC]
2255.description: Directs counties and municipalities, in cooperation with water management districts, to conduct an evaluation of primary water resources. Authorizes counties and municipalities to use funds collected for water and sewage utility usage to help finance the protection of such resources. Authorizes water management districts to expend funds received from counties and municipalities to protect water resources, etc.

2257.last_action: Died in Committee on Policy & Steering Committee on Ways and Means
2257.title: SSB/Banking and Insurance [WPSC]
2257.description: Expresses the legislative intent to revise laws relating to banking and insurance.

2260.title: Helen Gordon Davis Equal Pay Protection Act [CPSC]
2260.description: Recognizes the importance of the AWI and the Commission on Human Relations in ensuring equal pay. Requires the AWI to conduct studies and provide information to employers, labor organizations, and the public concerning the means available to eliminate pay disparities between men and women. Creates the Governor's Recognition Award for Pay Equity in the Workplace, etc.

2261.last_action: Died in Committee on Environmental Preservation and Conservation
2261.title: Aquatic Preserves [EPSC]
2261.description: Revises provisions relating to the boundaries of aquatic preserves. Declares described state-owned submerged lands in specified counties as aquatic preserves. Creates the Nature Coast Aquatic Preserve. Describes the boundaries thereof. Clarifies an exemption from such dedication for certain lands.

2262.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs
2262.title: Child Welfare [SPSC]
2262.description: Provides that the circuit court has exclusive jurisdiction over a petition for an injunction to prevent child abuse. Requires the DCFS to conduct a juvenile delinquency records check and an out-of-state criminal history records check, if that state allows the release of such records, of certain persons before placement of a child. Establishes the Child Safety Assessment Workgroup for the purpose of developing a safety assessment process, etc.

2263.last_action: Died in Committee on Children, Families, and Elder Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 7069 (Ch. 2010-114), SB 1166 (Ch. 2010-193), CS/CS/SB 1412 (Ch. 2010-102)
2263.title: Mental Health [SPSC]
2263.description: Revises provisions relating to the Florida Mental Health Act, to substitute the term "individual" for the terms "person," "patient," or "client." Deletes certain background screening requirements and exemptions for certain mental health professionals. Specifies that only governmental facilities may serve as receiving and treatment facilities. Authorizes a public facility to request the transfer of an individual to a private facility, etc.

2264.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12 Appropriations
2264.title: District School Costs Study [SPSC]
2264.description: Requires the Department of Education to contract with an out-of-state postsecondary educational institution to conduct a study to analyze Florida's district cost differential amenities index and to develop a cost-of-education index. Requires a report and submission of the report to the Legislature and the Governor.

2266.last_action: Died in Committee on Community Affairs, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/CS/HB 663 (Ch. 2010-176)
2266.title: Florida Building Commission [EPSC]
2266.description: Requires that the DCA adopt rules addressing the performance of its designee and contractors. Provides an exception from approval and insignia requirements for custom or one-of-a-kind prototype manufactured buildings. Revises provisions relating to the recertification of manufactured buildings. Revises provisions requiring that certain buildings have an approved operational carbon monoxide alarm, etc.

2267.title: International Development Relief/Haiti [CPSC]
2267.description: Requires the OTTED to contract with the state's international volunteer corps to provide certain relief activities for the people of Haiti. Requires that such activities be conducted by volunteers with certain qualifications. Directs the international volunteer corps to raise public and private funding to support such activities. Authorizes the international volunteer corps to establish certain partnerships and build long-term relationships, etc. APPROPRIATION: $2,000,000.

2268.title: Appropriations
2268.description: Provides moneys for the annual period beginning July 1, 2010, and ending June 30, 2011, to pay salaries, and other expenses, capital outlay - buildings, and other improvements, and for other specified purposes of the various agencies of state government. APPROPRIATION: $68,629,480,943.

2269.last_action: Died in Senate, companion bill(s) passed, see HB 5001 (Ch. 2010-152), HB 5003 (Ch. 2010-153)
2269.title: Implementing 2010-2011 General Appropriations Act
2269.description: Provides legislative intent. Delays the expiration of provisions providing for the Legislative Budget Commission to review and approve recommendations by the Governor for fixed capital outlay projects funded by grants awarded from the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009. Amends a specified provision relating to the state group insurance program. Provides that the annual salary of the members of the Legislature be reduced by 7 percent, etc.

2270.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal Justice
2270.title: Child Pornography [SPSC]
2270.description: Revises the definition of "child pornography" to include visual depictions in which it appears that a minor is engaging in sexual conduct. Provides that proof of the identity of a minor is not required. Provides that it is unlawful for any person to knowingly sell, promote, solicit, purchase, or distribute child pornography. Provides penalties, etc.

2272.title: Traffic Infraction Detectors or Cameras [CPSC]
2272.description: Preempts to the state the regulation of the use of such devices to enforce certain traffic laws.

2273.last_action: Died in Committee on Criminal and Civil Justice Appropriations
2273.title: Inmates [SPSC]
2273.description: Requires that the DOC develop and implement a substance abuse reentry program to provide a mechanism by which an eligible, nonviolent offender who has received a conditional split sentence may be transferred into the community through a transitional process. Provides eligibility criteria for the substance abuse reentry program. Authorizes the department to develop performance-based contracts to supply services to said program, etc.

2274.last_action: Died in Committee on Governmental Oversight and Accountability
2274.title: Outsourcing of Services & Activities By the State [GPSC]
2274.description: Requires a contract for a proposed outsourcing by the state to prohibit a contractor from authorizing an automatic increase in the salaries or benefits of its employees. Requires a contract for a proposed outsourcing by the state to require the contractor to submit a written request to an agency for an increase in certain employee's salaries or benefits, etc.

2275.last_action: Died in Committee on Health and Human Services Appropriations
2275.title: Children/Out-of-home Placement/Psychotropic Meds [SPSC]
2275.description: Requires the provision of a comprehensive mental health treatment plan. Prescribes duties for the DCFS. Requires that a guardian ad litem be appointed by the court to represent a child in the custody of the DCFS who is prescribed a psychotropic medication. Provides for psychiatric evaluation of the child. Requires that express and informed consent and assent be obtained from a child or the child's parent or guardian, etc.

2277.last_action: CS combines this bill with SB 2272 -SJ 00552; CS by Criminal Justice; YEAS 5 NAYS 0 -SJ 00552; Original bill laid on Table, refer to combined CS/CS/SB 2272 (Ch. 2010-211) -SJ 00552
2277.title: Pain Management [SPSC]
2277.description: (THIS BILL IS COMBINED IN CS/CS/S2272 & CS/S2722) Provides that pain-management clinics are business establishments that are required to be registered with the DOH. Requires all privately owned pain-management clinics, or offices that primarily engage in the treatment of pain by prescribing or dispensing controlled substance medications or by employing a physician who is primarily engaged in the same, to register with DOH, etc.

2278.last_action: Died in Committee on Banking and Insurance, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/CS/SB 2086 (Ch. 2010-127)
2278.title: Financial Services [CPSC]
2278.description: Revises the duties of the Division of Consumer Services within the DFS relating to the OIR. Specifies that complaints relating to sales and finance must be submitted to the OFR. Requires consumer collection agencies to be licensed instead of registered. Authorizes the office to disapprove the use of certain names for a consumer collection agency. Revises provisions relating to consumer complaints about a consumer collection agency, etc.

2279.title: Small Businesses [CPSC]
2279.description: Authorizes small businesses to submit bids, proposals, and replies for portions of bundled contracts. Authorizes agencies to award separate contracts for portions of a bundled contract under certain circumstances. Requires agencies to award a specified percentage of contracts to small businesses. Requires the Florida Small Business Advocate to submit an annual report on small business participation in contracting, etc.

2280.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2280.title: Office of Minority Health [SPSC]
2280.description: Provides legislative intent. Provides the duties of the Office of Minority Health. Requires the office to submit an annual report to the Governor and Legislature. Requires consideration of minority health issues and race in state policy and planning. Provides for responsibility and coordination.

2281.last_action: Withdrawn from Higher Education; Children, Families, and Elder Affairs; Higher Education Appropriations -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
2281.title: Florida Vocational College [SPSC]
2281.description: Establishes the Florida Vocational College in Weston, Florida, as a public residential postsecondary school for certain students with developmental disabilities. Provides that the school shall be funded through the DOE. Requires the school to comply with laws and rules applicable to state agencies unless otherwise provided by law. Requires personnel screening and security background investigation, etc.

2282.last_action: Withdrawn from Higher Education; Governmental Oversight and Accountability; Higher Education Appropriations; Rules -SJ 00268; Withdrawn from further consideration -SJ 00268
2282.title: Pub. Rec./Florida Vocational College [SPSC]
2282.description: Provides an exemption from public records requirements for criminal records, private investigator findings, and information from reference checks obtained by the Florida Vocational College for determining the moral character of employees of the college. Provides for review and repeal of the exemption. Provides a statement of public necessity.

2283.title: Workers' Compensation Joint Underwriting Assoc. [CPSC]
2283.description: Deletes an obsolete transitional requirement for certain policies of the Florida Workers' Compensation Joint Underwriting Association.

2284.last_action: Died in Committee on Education Pre-K - 12
2284.title: Pub. Rec./Instructional Assessments [WPSC]
2284.description: Expands a public records exemption for specified instructional assessments to include the tests required for high school graduation and end-of-course assessments developed or acquired by local school districts. Provides for future legislative review and repeal of the exemption under the Open Government Sunset Review Act. Provides a statement of public necessity.

2285.title: Nonbinding Statewide Advisory Referendum [SPSC]
2285.description: Requires that a question regarding a balanced federal budget be printed on the ballot and submitted to the voters in the 2010 general election.

2286.last_action: Died in Committee on Health Regulation
2286.title: Tobacco Use Prevention [SPSC]
2286.description: Amends a provision relating to the Comprehensive Statewide Tobacco Education and Use Prevention Program. Requires program components to include efforts to educate youth and their parents about tobacco use. Requires that the State Surgeon General, or his or her designee, serve on the Tobacco Education and Use Prevention Advisory Council. Provides that grants awarded are funds intended to benefit the state and are not purchases of commodities, etc.

2289.title: Citrus County [EPSC]
2289.description: Provides for codification of special laws relating to the Citrus County Hospital Board, an independent special district in Citrus County. Codifies, amends, and reenacts chapter 99-442, Laws of Florida, as amended, as the "Citrus County Hospital and Medical Nursing and Convalescent Home Act." Authorizes the board to enter into a lease or contract with a not-for-profit corporation for the purpose of operating and managing the hospital, etc.
