2290.title: East Lake Tarpon Community/Pinellas County [EPSC]
2290.description: Provides requirements for the municipal annexation of the East Lake Tarpon Community. Requires a referendum of the electors within the community prior to such annexation. Describes the community boundaries. Clarifies that the act does not prohibit voluntary annexation.

2291.last_action: Died in Committee on Rules, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/HB 1487 (Ch. 2010-266)
2291.title: Spring Lake Improvement District/Highlands County
2291.description: Deletes obsolete language and language inconsistent with or repetitive of general law. Deletes obsolete district powers and provides additional district powers including mosquito control, fire and emergency services, construction and maintenance of school facilities, and enforcement of deed restrictions. Provides for applicability of general laws, etc.

2293.title: Pinellas Park WMD Authority/Pinellas County
2293.description: Reduces the ad valorem millage cap, subject to a referendum. Specifies that the authority is housed within the City of Pinellas Park for administrative purposes. Increases and revises membership of the authority. Increases the term for each member. Deletes provisions requiring a secretary and treasurer to be elected and the treasurer to post a surety bond. Deletes other provisions to conform to changes made by the act, etc.

2294.title: Unincorporated Area/Development/Pasco County
2294.description: Authorizes a person developing residential or commercial property within the unincorporated area of Pasco County to connect water, wastewater, and stormwater pipes, valves, and fixtures to pipes installed and operated by the county under certain specified circumstances. Provides that any connection to the water, wastewater, or stormwater systems of the county is subject to the utility ordinances of the county.

2295.title: Solid Waste Collection Services/Pasco County
2295.description: Provides that any deed restrictions affecting real property located in the county which require persons in single-family homes to use specific solid waste collection services are void and unenforceable. Provides exceptions. Provides for the county commission to establish exclusive solid waste collection franchises.

2296.title: City of Tampa/Hillsborough County
2296.description: Revises the General Employees' Pension Plan for the City of Tampa. Provides that all employee contributions to the pension fund after a certain date are mandatory and that the city shall pay such contributions to the fund on behalf of the employee. Allows DROP members the opportunity to elect an investment option, as determined by the board of trustees, to be applied to the participant's account for the plan year entering the DROP program, etc.

2299.title: Pinellas County [EPSC]
2299.description: Provides requirements for the municipal annexation of the Lealman Community. Requires a referendum of the electors within the community prior to such annexation. Provides for future expiration of such requirement. Describes the community boundaries.

2301.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1484 (Ch. 2010-144)
2301.title: Federal Grants Trust Fund/DFS [WPSC]
2301.description: Creates the Federal Grants Trust Fund within the Department of Financial Services. Provides for the purpose of the trust fund and sources of funds. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

2302.last_action: Died in Messages, companion bill(s) passed, see CS/CS/SB 1484 (Ch. 2010-144)
2302.title: Grants and Donations Trust Fund/DFS [WPSC]
2302.description: Creates the Grants and Donations Trust Fund within the Department of Financial Services. Provides for the purpose of the trust fund and sources of funds. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

2303.title: Operating Trust Fund/ Dept. of Financial Services [WPSC]
2303.description: Creates the Operating Trust Fund within the Department of Financial Services. Provides for the purpose of the trust fund and sources of funds. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

2304.title: Administrative TF/Executive Office of the Governor [WPSC]
2304.description: Creates the Administrative Trust Fund within the Executive Office of the Governor. Provides for the purpose of the trust fund and sources of funds. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

2305.title: Operating Trust Fund/Executive Office of Governor [WPSC]
2305.description: Creates the Operating Trust fund within the Executive Office of the Governor. Provides for the purpose of the trust fund and sources of funds. Provides for future review and termination or re-creation of the trust fund.

2314.title: City of Parkland/Broward County
2314.description: Extends and enlarges the corporate limits of the City of Parkland to include specified unincorporated lands within such corporate limits. Provides for an effective date of annexation. Provides for governance of the annexed area. Provides for the transfer of public roads and rights-of-way. Provides applicability to candidacies for municipal office. Provides for preservation of existing contracts.

2315.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Military Affairs and Domestic Security (SB 618)
2315.title: OGSR/Domestic Security Oversight Council
2315.description: Repeals a specified provision relating to an exemption from public records and public meetings requirements for those portions of meetings of the Domestic Security Oversight Council, including records thereof, at which active criminal investigative or intelligence information is discussed, etc.

2316.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Health Regulation (SB 920)
2316.title: OGSR/State Child Abuse Death Review Committee
2316.description: Repeals specified provision relating to an exemption from public records and public meetings requirements for information held by the State Child Abuse Death Review Committee or a local panel or committee which reveals the identity of household members of a deceased child, and for portions of meetings at which such confidential and exempt information is discussed. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act, etc.

2318.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Children, Families, and Elder Affairs (SB 888)
2318.title: OGSR/Information Held by Guardians Ad Litem
2318.description: Amends a specified provision relating to an exemption from public records requirements for information held by guardians ad litem. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act. Deletes provisions providing for repeal of the exemption.

2319.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Children, Families, and Elder Affairs (SB 886)
2319.title: OGSR/Insurance Claim Data Exchange Information
2319.description: Repeals a specified provision relating to an exemption from public records requirements for information from the insurance claim data exchange which is provided by the Department of Revenue. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act. Deletes provisions providing for repeal of the exemption.

2320.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Children, Families, and Elder Affairs (SB 884)
2320.title: OGSR/Domestic Violence Fatality Review Team
2320.description: Repeals specified provision relating to an exemption from public records and public meetings requirements for information held by a domestic violence fatality review team and for portions of meetings of a review team at which confidential or exempt information is discussed. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act. Deletes provisions providing for repeal of the exemption.

2321.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Children, Families, and Elder Affairs (SB 882)
2321.title: OGSR/Address Confidentiality/Domestic Violence
2321.description: Repeals specified provision relating to an exemption from public records requirements for information in the Address Confidentiality Program for Victims of Domestic Violence under s. 741.465, F.S. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act. Deletes provisions providing for repeal of the exemption.

2322.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Judiciary (SB 1198)
2322.title: OGSR/Identification of a Minor
2322.description: Amends specified provision relating to a public records exemption for information contained in court files which identifies a minor petitioning for a waiver of the notice requirements contained in the Parental Notice of Abortion Act. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act, etc.

2323.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Judiciary (SB 1200)
2323.title: OGSR/Identifying Information/Guardians Ad Litem
2323.description: Amends specified provision relating to a public records exemption for identifying information of current or former guardians ad litem. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act. Expands the public records exemption to include the names and locations of schools and day care facilities attended by the children of current or former guardians ad litem, etc.

2325.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Finance and Tax (SB 1410)
2325.title: Assessment of Residential Property
2325.description: Defines the term "renewable energy source device." Prohibits a property appraiser from considering the installation and operation of a renewable energy source device in determining the assessed value of residential property. Deletes the definition of the terms "renewable energy source device" and "device" for purposes of ch. 196, F.S., relating to property tax exemptions, etc.

2327.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Finance and Tax (SB 1378)
2327.title: Assessment of Lands Used for Conservation Purposes
2327.description: Provides for certain lands that are convenanted for use for conservation purposes to be assessed for ad valorem taxation in the same manner as lands used for outdoor recreational or park purposes. Redefines the term "covenant." Defines the term "conservation purposes." Specifies the information that must be included in a covenant. Requires covenants to be notarized, etc.

2330.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Transportation (SB 1304)
2330.title: Enforcement of Tolls
2330.description: Clarifies the mailing method to be used in providing notice following the issuance of a citation for failure to pay a toll. Provides that receipt of the citation rather than its mailing constitutes notification. Authorizes any governmental entity, including the clerk of the court, to provide specified data to the HSMV regarding outstanding violations for failure to pay tolls, etc.

2331.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Military Affairs and Domestic Security (SB 1404)
2331.title: Veterans' Suicide Prevention
2331.description: Directs the FDVA, in partnership with the Statewide Office for Suicide Prevention and the Division of Community Colleges, to establish the veterans' suicide prevention pilot project subject to the availability of funding. Specifies the purpose of the project. Provides project requirements. Requires an evaluation report for the Governor and Legislature. Revises the membership of the Suicide Prevention Coordinating Council, etc.

2332.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Children, Families, and Elder Affairs (SB 1674)
2332.title: Dependency Proceedings
2332.description: Requires an adoption entity to intervene in certain dependency cases if a parent executes a consent for placement of a child with the adoption entity.

2333.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Higher Education (SB 1676)
2333.title: OGSR/Commission for Independent Education
2333.description: Amends a provision relating to an exemption from public records requirements for investigatory records held by the Commission for Independent Education and an exemption from public meetings requirements for portions of meetings of a probable cause panel convened by the commission. Saves the exemptions from repeal under the Open Government Sunset Review Act. Removes the scheduled repeal of the exemptions.

2334.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Higher Education (SB 1678)
2334.title: OGSR/Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute
2334.description: Repeals a provision relating to an exemption from public records requirements for certain records held by the H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute. Saves the exemption from repeal under the Open Government Sunset Review Act. Removes the scheduled repeal of the exemption.

2335.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Banking and Insurance (SB 1660)
2335.title: OGSR/Funeral, Cemetery, & Consumer Services Board
2335.description: Amends a provision relating to certain meetings of and records held by the Board of Funeral, Cemetery, and Consumer Services within the Department of Financial Services. Revises exemptions from public meetings requirements for meetings of the board at which licensure examination questions or answers are discussed and for meetings of the board's probable cause panel. Provides recordkeeping requirements for such meetings, etc.

2336.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Banking and Insurance (SB 1658)
2336.title: OGSR/Hurricane Loss Projection Methodology/OIR
2336.description: Amends a provision relating to an exemption from public records requirements for trade secrets submitted by private companies to the Florida Commission on Hurricane Loss Projection Methodology, the Office of Insurance Regulation, or the consumer advocate and an exemption from public meetings requirements for portions of meetings or rate proceedings wherein trade secrets are discussed, etc.

2337.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Banking and Insurance (SB 1662)
2337.title: OGSR/Florida Self-Insurers Guaranty Association
2337.description: Repeals a provision relating to an exemption from public records requirements for certain records of the Florida Self-Insurers Guaranty Association, Incorporated, and an exemption from public meetings requirements for certain meetings of the association's board of directors or a subcommittee of the board. Saves the exemptions from repeal under the Open Government Sunset Review Act. Deletes provisions that provide for repeal of the exemptions.

2338.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Children, Families, and Elder Affairs (SB 2246)
2338.title: Child Support Guidelines
2338.description: Provides principles for implementing the support guidelines schedule. Requires that census information be used if information about earnings level in the community is not available. Provides that the burden of proof is on the party seeking to impute income to the other party. Revises the guidelines schedule. Provides for the consideration and adjustment of multiple child support orders, etc.

2339.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Commerce (SB 1856)
2339.title: Qualified Target Industry Tax Refund Program
2339.description: Provides legislative findings and declarations for the tax refund program for qualified target industry businesses. Revises the definitions of terms applicable to the program. Revises the criteria for the OTTED and Enterprise Florida, Inc., to use in identifying target industries. Conforms cross-references to changes made by the act. Deletes ad valorem taxes from the types of taxes that may be refunded under the program, etc.

2340.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Health Regulation (SB 1818)
2340.title: Blood Establishments
2340.description: Prohibits local governments from restricting access to public facilities or infrastructure for certain activities based on whether a blood establishment is operating as a for-profit organization or not-for-profit organization. Prohibits a blood establishment from considering whether certain customers are operating as a for-profit organization or not-for-profit organization when determining prices for selling blood or blood components, etc.

2341.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Banking and Insurance (SB 1664)
2341.title: OGSR/Hurricane Loss/Associated Exposure Data
2341.description: Amends specified provision relating to an exemption from public records requirements for reports of hurricane loss data and associated exposure data that are specific to a particular insurance company. Requires the Florida International University center to annually publish a report summarizing loss data and associated exposure data collected from residential property insurers and licensed rating and advisory organizations, etc.

2342.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Banking and Insurance (SB 1702)
2342.title: Consumer Credit Protection
2342.description: Expands the authority of the Attorney General to take action against out-of-state consumer debt collectors. Provides that a violation of provisions relating to consumer debt collectors is a violation of the Florida Deceptive and Unfair Trade Practices Act. Prohibits a credit counseling organization from engaging in certain additional specified acts, etc.

2343.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Commerce (SB 2330)
2343.title: Dept. of State/Fl. Government Accountability Act
2343.description: Reenacts a specified provision relating to the Division of Corporations within the department.

2346.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Judiciary (SB 2240)
2346.title: Assisted Reproductive Technology
2346.description: Creates the "Florida Assisted Reproductive Technology Act." Conforms a cross-reference to changes made by the act. Corrects a cross-reference. Provides definitions. Provides general requirements that an assisted reproductive technology agency must follow. Requires an assisted reproductive technology agency to establish an escrow account for certain funds, etc.

2347.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Education Pre-K - 12 (SB 2144)
2347.title: OGSR/Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program
2347.description: Amends a specified provision relating to an exemption from public records requirements for the individual records of a child enrolled in the Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program which are held by an early learning coalition, the AWI, or a Voluntary Prekindergarten Education Program provider, including assessment data, health data, records of teacher observations, and personal I.D. information of the enrolled child, etc.

2348.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Children, Families, and Elder Affairs (SB 2244)
2348.title: Independent Living Transition Services
2348.description: Requires the Auditor General to perform an operational audit of the independent living transition services program administered by the DCFS. Requires the OPPAGA to conduct an evaluation of the independent living transition services program administered by the DCFS. Requires that the results of the audit and evaluation be reported to the Governor, the Legislature, and the Secretary of Children and Family Services.

2350.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Ethics and Elections (SB 2188)
2350.title: OGSR/Voters/Voter Registration
2350.description: Amends a specified provision relating to an exemption from public records requirements for certain information regarding voters and voter registration and for signatures of voters and voter registration applicants. Saves the exemption from repeal under the OGSR Act. Repeals a specified provision which provides for repeal of the exemption.

2351.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Ethics and Elections (SB 2170)
2351.title: OGSR/Commission on Ethics/Ethics and Public Trust
2351.description: Amends a specified provision relating to an exemption from the public records and public meetings requirements for complaints and related records in the custody of and proceedings conducted by the Commission on Ethics or a Commission on Ethics and Public Trust established by a county or municipality. Reorganizes provisions. Saves the exemption from repeal under the Open Government Sunset Review Act, etc.

2352.last_action: Submit as committee bill by Governmental Oversight and Accountability (SB 2124)
2352.title: Electronic Filing/Administrative Hearings Division
2352.description: Provides procedures for filing petitions for benefits and other documents in worker's compensation benefits proceedings. Authorizes the Office of the Judges of Compensation Claims to adopt rules to implement electronic procedures. Requires a petitioner requesting an administrative hearing to include the petitioner's e-mail address. Requires an attorney to use electronic means when filing a document with said division, etc.

2361.title: Black History Month
2361.description: Recognizes February 2010 as "Black History Month" in Florida.

2364.last_action: Introduced -SJ 00311; Read 2nd time -SJ 00312; Adopted; companion bill(s) passed, see HR 9051 (Adopted) -SJ 00312
2364.title: Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc.
2364.description: Acknowledges the invaluable contributions Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc., has made to the people of Florida, and recognizes March 21-23, 2010, as "The 16th Annual Delta Days at the Florida Capitol."

2365.title: Fathers
2365.description: Expresses affection for and gratitude to all fathers.

2366.title: Mothers
2366.description: Expresses gratitude and affection to all mothers.

2367.last_action: Died, not introduced, companion bill(s) passed, see HR 9019 (Adopted)
2367.title: Budd Bell Day
2367.description: Recognizes June 16, 2010, as "Bud Bell Day" in the State of Florida.

2368.title: Fibromyalgia Awareness Day
2368.description: Recognizes May 12, 2010, as "Fibromyalgia Awareness Day" in Florida.

2370.title: Prostate Cancer Awareness Month
2370.description: Recognizes September 2010 as "Prostate Cancer Awareness Month."

2371.title: Workers' Memorial Day
2371.description: Recognizes April 28, 2010, as "Workers' Memorial Day" in Florida.

2372.title: Hillsborough Area Regional Transit
2372.description: Recognizes Hillsborough Area Regional Transit for its designation as Florida's best public transit system.

2373.title: Pensacola Junior College
2373.description: Recognizes the students, faculty, staff, and alumni of Pensacola Junior College as they celebrate its 60th Anniversary as an institution of higher learning in Florida.

2375.title: Chronic Kidney Disease Awareness Day
2375.description: Recognizes March 11, 2010, as "Chronic Kidney Awareness Day."

2376.title: Minority Cancer Awareness Week
2376.description: Recognizes the week of April 18-24, 2010, as "Minority Cancer Awareness Week" in the State of Florida.

2377.title: Florida's Farmworkers
2377.description: Expresses support for the Coalition of Immokalee Workers and the Student/Farmworker Alliance in their efforts to raise awareness of the working conditions of Florida's farmworkers.

2378.last_action: Introduced -SJ 00253; Read 2nd time -SJ 00254; Adopted; companion bill(s) passed, see HR 9015 (Adopted) -SJ 00254
2378.title: Florida Sigma Zeta Day
2378.description: Recognizes March 16, 2010, as "Florida Sigma Zeta Day" at the Capitol.

2380.title: Massage Therapy Legislative Awareness Days
2380.description: Recognizes March 23 and 24, 2010, as "Massage Therapy Legislative Awareness Days."

2381.title: Landscape Architecture Month
2381.description: Recognizes April 2010 as "Landscape Architecture Month" in Florida.

2382.title: Phillis Oeters/Miami-Dade County
2382.description: Recognizes Phillis Oeters for her leadership and service to the community in Miami-Dade County.

2383.title: Associated Industries of Florida/90th Anniversary
2383.description: Recognizes Associated Industries of Florida on the occasion of its 90th Anniversary.

2384.last_action: Introduced -SJ 00326; Read 2nd time -SJ 00327; Adopted; companion bill(s) passed, see HR 9013 (Adopted) -SJ 00327
2384.title: Mote Marine Laboratory/55th Anniversary
2384.description: Recognizes Mote Marine Laboratory on the occasion of its 55th Anniversary.

2387.title: Sexual Orientation or HIV/AIDS Status
2387.description: Condemns any law, rule, or policy that punishes any person based on sexual orientation or HIV/AIDS status.

2389.title: Palm Beach County Day/March 3, 2010
2389.description: Recognizes March 3, 2010, as "Palm Beach County Day" in Florida.

2391.last_action: Died, not introduced, companion bill(s) passed, see HR 9129 (Adopted)
2391.title: Recreational Vehicle and Camping Month/June 2010
2391.description: Recognizes June 2010 as "Recreational Vehicle and Camping Month" in Florida.

2392.title: Florida Legal Services Attorneys and Staff
2392.description: Honors the attorneys and staff of Florida Legal Services and recognizes their dedication and commitment to representing vulnerable Floridians in the civil justice system.

2393.last_action: Died, not introduced, companion bill(s) passed, see HR 9033 (Adopted)
2393.title: Safe Haven for Newborns/February 2010
2393.description: Recognizes February 2010 as Safe Haven for Newborns Month in Florida and commends the Gloria M. Silverio Foundation for its efforts on behalf of newborns.

2394.title: Senator James E. "Jim" King, Jr., Committee Room
2394.description: Recognizes the outstanding public service and extraordinary kindness of Senator James E. "Jim" King, Jr., and designates Room 401 in the Senate Office Building the "James E. 'Jim' King, Jr., Committee Room."

2395.title: Donate Life Month/April 2010
2395.description: Recognizes April 2010 as "Donate Life Month" in Florida.

2396.title: Honorable Emiliano Jose "E.J." Salcines, Jr.
